gvmXdhkRvz0X7gmOZrU2kw.text: I took some friends from out of town here and overall it was a good experience. They forgot eggs in my egg burrito but everyone else seemed to enjoy their food! Good quality and the price is what you'd expect for nearby downtown restaurant. The place is small but has a wonderful outdoor patio option and the menu doesn't have too much to chose from but the options they do offer are pretty delish! Cute little coffee station you can pick up your coffee from. I had the espresso.. the coffee quality was ok. A bit sour for my taste but overall not bad.

CHcZXfMvVgQD6W0t2RtOSA.text: Well if your looking to bring a group or family DON'T! You order from a small menu first pay and sit wherever.  It is clean quaint has a contemporary look. This place is nice for a college student or two people in a hurry. The food was okay but nothing off the charts! The coffee is put in thermal pumps you get yourself I was not too jazzed up about that  being that I seen a review for top 10 Phoenix breakfast spots. The cashier guy was a little snooty when I asked a question stated its right there pick two of those choices. The manager did come buy ask if it was okay, but who wants to complain when your trying to visit with old friends. The staff was nice who delivered our order. I ordered the chorizo benidict which looked good but they left all the grease on my plate! Will not be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Benidict

l0A9HYaSolAicdjD5WuAoQ.text: Second time to Vovomeena- and another excellent breakfast. The cold brew coffee at the front has me believing that they would do pour over coffee, but alas, I was wrong. Just drip coffee. I will move this to 5 stars... If you do pour over coffee :)   Breakfast was great- Mexican Benedict: poached egg over chorizo and a corn cake. Delicious!!!  Will Definately be back again for breakfast.

0mgK9sAAVJZ3IzXZBhNdNA.text: Absolutely delicious breakfast, and some unique choices on the menu as well. Not just your typical eggs and toast kind of place.   I went with 2 friends- I got the Johnny Cakes which were phenomenal, and a huge portion too. It came with 2 sausage links and fresh strawberries on top, a side of the most incredible homemade rice pudding I've ever tasted, with syrup on the side. Soooo good! My friends got the Pain Perdu and the French toast. I love how they do the cold drip coffee as well and U can see the drip system up on the wall.   The line moved quick (you order at the register and then they give you a number and you wait at a table). Also they do not permit you to hold a table while your party goes up and orders and that's something they enforce. You choose your table only after ordering. They bring the food out to you. Service was great as well. Will definitely be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Upper left moving clockwise-Pain Perdu, French toast, Johnny cakes, scrambled eggs
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Johnny Cakes with sausage and homemade rice pudding

-ed6pbdMKuQh1tYRyVOniw.text: Vovomeena is hands down one of the best Breakfast spots in the Valley! I've had moments where I'm dreaming about breakfast there the following morning...I promise it's that good! The biscuits and gravy are probably the best thing on the menu, followed by the Orchard French toast. (Ok I admit, I often get a Portuguese donut on the side because #treatyoself) The waits are often not too bad, even when the line seems out the door, once you get to the register and order, you grab your drinks, grab a table and then the food comes out super quick.

vZljBGAxzzvE4SEd3SgVFA.text: This place is AWESOME!!! I have no ties to this place.  We have been try lots of new places lately and striking out all over the place so it was great to find VOVOMEENA today.   Highly recommend you try it!

CsmYtC2HsxFnpn2Od7GGVA.text: Pricey, but great food, customer service is a bit cold and uninterested but otherwise just fine.

fo638RO6jIgiws9lEQqllw.text: Good brunch spot in Phoenix!  Went during the weekday, so it wasn't crowded at all. There is parking on both sides of the building, and it's plentiful.   Inside has a nice, relaxing ambiance to it. Again, it wasn't crowded when we went, but I can imagine it may not be as relaxing if it got really busy inside. I must also say that the restroom was really nice, which is always a plus.  The service was fine. Nothing to complain about there.  The food was good. The menu is small, but at the same time has a good selection to choose from if that makes sense. We had the johnnycakes with turkey sausage and the blackstone scramble with flour tortilla. The johnnycakes were really good. Love that corn in them. The sweet rice was also a great side with that. The turkey sausage was a little dry, but had a nice spice to it. The scramble was solid. The pork shoulder was cooked nicely and was a perfect size for the scramble. The prices were also very reasonable for the portions.  Overall, good spot to grab some breakfast/brunch. Reasonable prices, solid food, generous portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. blackstone scramble
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. johnnycakes!

fCSSQAkWNIQXSY6s48V0uQ.text: I work in the area and this restaurant is my go-to for fresh breakfast/brunch. Atmosphere is perfect for a bite to eat with friends, co-workers, even clients.   Staff is friendly and food is always consistently amazing. Truly a hidden gem in Phoenix.

v8ydchXvw4MhaLVroDtb8Q.text: This is by far one of my favorite downtown hipster vibe restaurants for breakfast. Affordable and delicious with large portions. The turkey sausage links are a little dry, but the Portuguese donuts and pain breaky are amazing. It's a sweet spot during the cooler months to just sit outside and enjoy the delicious food and coffee. Great concept, great food.

6TK1yOMC7DUDOtfSlzANqg.text: Me and my husband went on a Saturday morning around 930ish AM and it was little busy. From outside, it is a pretty small place, walking in one can smell the wonderful aromas coming from the restaurant, they have small outdoor seating here, not good for summer months with the way temperature has been, there is no mist or fans out there. Upon entering the restaurant, there is a sign to take the menu and order and manager will seat you. We ordered the special for that day, which was Steak Rancheros. My husband loved the special, for me not so much. The salsa on the steak was very good. Their coffee was great. Their servers were really good and polite. The man at the register was very impatient and just wanted to be done and move on to next person. We told him that this was our first time coming, what do you recommend, he did not have anything to say. So we asked him again, what do you think about the special? he said- "it's good!". That is how we made our choice, we did not want to hold the line. My husband ordered Orange juice, which is nothing spectacular, it has the taste of a regular grocery store juice. I ordered waffle as extra and it was okay. When it came, it looked like it was already sitting for a while. I have posted the same pics with and without flash. They do not have much sitting area inside, their high tables and chairs are very uncomfortable to sit in. I am not sure what all the hype is about, or may we just ended up coming on the wrong day. I have no desire to go out of my way to visit this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak Ranchero with Salsa

TM62q0CJ19qBI3fVOs7c2w.text: My friend and I stopped by here for brunch based on their Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed! I highly recommend the Mexican Benedict! The people there was super friendly! We're visiting from NY/NJ and we're asking for recommendations and everyone was so helpful! Thanks for a great meal and the recommendations!

qq59ieQktRrixY5ZiyENxg.text: Fantastic!  Found this place on Yelp for my first meal in town and the daily special breakfast quesadilla blew me away.  So tasty.  I'm from the south so I don't know much but I know these guys and gals know their stuff!  Ingredients, flavors, and texture on point. So good!

1nOuUQv8ZuAYEjQyoCTE_w.text: The food was better this time so I'm happy I gave it another chance.  I had eggs, bacon and biscuit.  Skipped the spuds. Food was tasty.  Bacon has a nice flavor. The brewed coffee is hot with good flavor, oddly enough that is not always the case.  I marked it down to 3 for the poor customer relations on the part of the cashier and blaring music..  That man needs to learn not to look so grumpy.  He assumed I and my friend were on one tab and seemed to take offence when I corrected him and asked to pay only my bill.  Took him forever to fix it, looking grumpy the whole time.  It was unpleasant.  Please turn down the music!

y0E_s0xwCBNBtAHXhBgFsA.text: It was hard to go back to Starbucks on Monday morning after drinking the Japanese cold brew here. I got the flight o' 3 and all of them were smooth and complex and resulted in a nice pleasantly sustained caffeine buzz. My wife got the Blackstone scramble and I got the Mexican Benedict, both were amazing, and the kids loved the pancakes and waffles. It was a little pricey for breakfast($70ish with tip for 2adults/2kids), but the food was definitely worth the price. Great spot to spend a leisurely Sunday morning with family. We will be back.

x-htmLAxB_ZkIkAD1nq-7g.text: Great food and atmosphere! The coffee bar is also a nice touch. I had the Mexican eggs benedict and it was phenomenal! Fast and friendly service as well. Will definitely be back!

L4PbX0uiPCyTWzxbZpWcxw.text: Eggs Benedict where over cooked but they made them right, pulled pork is NOT Pulled Pork it's the ends of a Dried Out Ham slice, eggs on pulled pork were over cooked as well! Potatoes were half cooked and half burnt, not sure why??? Muffins and Coffee where excellent!

u60OIHkzYQXw-Ae3K3K8qQ.text: This was an awesome little "find" for breakfast. The Mexican Benedict for sure next time. All of the breakfast choices were amazing, I couldn't decide. I ended up having the classic biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs, SERIOUSLY the best! No disappointments there! It's so hard to find a GOOD QUALITY independent eatery! We drove out from Surprise.......totally worth the drive. It's unfortunate we're surrounded by people who find the standard Denny's, IHOP, Mimi's, Village Inn, Waffle House and Cracker Barrel good food.  EXCELLENT!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. COLD pressed coffee too!

SBa6mCBt95tTpKCkGk-gSQ.text: This place is a gem close to downtown Phoenix. Saw the stars and reviews and had to check it out. It was awesome. If you want am incredible breakfast or brunch this is the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simply Amazing

wQ7alry_GlsUl-mpxw-IOw.text: First time here! Amazing food and coffee. This coffee was legit! I've come back several times now... won't mention how many visits.  Food is worth the wait. You will not be disappointed. It does get really busy so go in early.

eSVcj5zDeWgJ0aAhOT2T2w.text: Excellent food! You wait in line FIRST, order at the counter, find a seat, and the food is brought to you. On weekends the line gets pretty long, but it goes pretty quickly.  Everything I've tried has been very good.

dl5nWKnKbDA66RM6LPTHPg.text: Vovomeena has great food and a friendly staff. The food is very reasonably priced for the quality.

_Ufkbfq6dTR_oNgzMe0g1w.text: Pretty dang good. This place is a hidden hole in the wall. Firstly, the orange juice is bomb. It's a stupid thing to comment on, but do not underestimate a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice. Also, take their advice, the biscuits and gravy are phenomenal. It's what dreams are made of. Will definitely have to bring some friends here to try it out also. Thanks guys!

MhoXJJ0OUD8qoUw4eVIH3g.text: Stellar food. Yummm & sooo creative. Had the corn cakes (pancakes). Sooo good. Bacon is flavorful. Top notch ingredients. Eat here!

GHYnZg773PYJo-PbDg-Usw.text: FREAKING DELICIOUS! 3 Sisters omelette is lil nothing I've had before. A must try. Also the Mexican Benedict with Chorizo on Sopes, aaaaamazing. This kitchen has it down! Plus the lovely manager is extremely personable and all service well timed. Efficient, nicely  designed ambience, for breakfast/lunch, outside or in, easy parking, gorgeous bathrooms with delightfully scented candles and of course incredible food with new flavors that will knock your socks off! A must go, totally awesome. THANKS!

BiMiQ-M8O9MBXhqPHQMfpA.text: Strike 1 - Being out of the 'jug-o'coffee'/pitcher of iced coffee, I had to order 3 separate coffees for my group and it was definitely pricier. I was expecting the server to offer a comparable price for the 3 coffees since the restaurant made an excuse about the "pitchers not being delivered" but I guess my expectations were too high. This left a bitter taste in my mouth (not in the good coffee way), and there's also no refill. Since I run on caffeine, there just wasn't enough there to wake me up.   Strike 2 - I ordered the blackstone scramble, and the eggs tasted absolutely bland. I'm always looking for a kick in my breakfast to help me wake up (sensing a theme here?)...it just didn't hit that note for me despite the delicious description on the menu.  I should not need to drown my food in tabasco for flavor.   Strike 3 - I can see the ordering system working to improve efficiency, but in this case, since there were no designated waiters, there was no motivation to assist/clean tables. I didn't see many patrons leaving tip, and this just creates a no win situation on both sides.  And I'm out

9DBMaat2tftsvROHeYhMrA.text: I am hard to impress when it comes to breakfast.  The food was alright, nothing to write home about.  You won't find crispy potatoes and the pancakes are thin and soggy.  We tried the donut and it tasted of the dirty oil it was fried in. Everything else was average. The ambience is fresh and casual.  You order at a counter, receive a number and take a seat.  I wouldn't come out of my way to eat here, but if I found myself here through friends, I wouldn't object.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mornin&#39; Moonshine....cold brewed coffee flight.

rLOEXN5e0HnmOsGFmE0YSw.text: Great bfast, a little bit pricey. Its hard to find a seat over the weekends but the food is really good.

H3mLEyJpNX-JlXclMWCcVQ.text: Absolutely one of the best breakfasts I have ever had, regardless of location. The biscuits and gravy are perfect; hearty white sausage gravy that isn't gloppy, excellent biscuit and exactly-cooked egg to your style. Everything else on the menu looks just as phenomenal, don't think you can make a poor choice here. Bonus: even when busy, their system of seating makes things quick.

CMHJe0CGJD9oqddYCj14IA.text: Wow! Just WOW!! You need to try this place. If you love breakfast at all, you need Vovomeena in your life. For your first trip I HIGHLY recommend trying the B.M.O.C. It sounds weird (I mean a pork chop on a waffle with an egg?) but it will change your life. For the better. And their infused coffee, delish. Or if plain ole joe is more up your alley, they have bottomless cups of freshly brewed local beans. Also, they use Schrieners sausage. Nuff said. Oh and the people there are awesome! Super nice, welcoming, make you feel like a regular even if it's your first time!   In summation, go to Vovomeena. You will thank me.

PxAaAKMimeYnX2tisAMMtA.text: French Toast is amazing.  Actually everything here is from the coffee to entrees.

oprjdEGVy-dmWTiI20YOhw.text: For a quick, gourmet breakfast this place is the spot! I had the apple and mascarpone stuffed french toast and it was just as delicious as it sounds! The food and atmosphere is definately in with the hipster crowd right down to the 19th century hair cuts some of the staff was sportin'.    They do not serve alcohol but they had a coffee and tea bar for those looking for caffiene fix.    The only downfall was that it was very crowded and hard to find a seat.  When you did find a seat you had individuals standing around either looking for their seat, the menu, or in line to order.  However if their only downfall is that they are too busy then I guess they are doing something right!  Will definately be back!

Zpp6HQUQ3SKFv8qUwuaEcQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and great service. Highly recommend to all az foodies out there :D

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7YSH6vUgiynotZh_s5FSMg.text: The menu is honest and clear: no substitutions. That being said, I couldn't help it. My heart wanted the one omelette option on the menu to be a chorizo omelette instead of a potato omelette. When I asked for the change, the portly hipster behind the counter gave me that look. The one that says, "dude, we're so popular right now we don't have to give you anything."  He told me they aren't able to change a thing. I ordered the waffle, bacon, and potoatoes, with a side of scrambled eggs. The waffle wasn't my favorite kind (I prefer one that's crunchy on the outside and soft and delicious on the inside). This waffle was just soft, like a pancake. The eggs were typical. Not fluffy air goodness, like I always hope eggs will be. Bacon was limp and fatty.  Sometimes I feel like a breakfast spot like this gets its high ratings mostly because it tries very hard to be unique and trendy, less than because the food is actually delicious. But I'll be honest: I've never craved a pork chop in my breakfast, and this place isn't changing my mind on that front.   If you're wanting pancakes and the like (basically dessert) then you're going to love their options here. But c'mon, you could go to a million hip places in the valley that offer a carb-rich, sugar filled pancake and be thrilled. The real posers of breakfast are revealed in how they do the non-carb options. Sorry Vovomeena. For me, you're nothing more than a hipster poser. Great coffee though.

MjtORBb3ILm2qhEoBmyRmw.text: Totally surprised by this place. Having just moved here not too long ago I had to find the best French toast spots. DID NOT disappoint. I'm currently waiting to invite people and go again. I probably can't tell you enough how good it was. Everyone in my party of 4 was highly impressed and wouldn't stop raving about the food all day. Kinda weird walking in but plenty of help once you're in. Take a look at the menu and anything you pick you'll be satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My breakfast. Already looking forward to the next time

9mtkMtW3SQiiA5UuJrx9ag.text: Awesome food and great people watching! Last time my pork chop was a little too salty but still super tender from the brine. Also wish they had an iced coffee option that I didn't have to make myself and maybe some flavor options.

RZGExrTSWIJeFKQgkQWFtg.text: Quaint atmosphere, definitely a spot that you could easily pass up but after reviewing other Yelpers I'm glad that we stopped by. The food was fantastic with unique twists to some favorites. Space is limited inside so get there early otherwise they have a small dining section outside in the courtyard.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu (delicious banana bread) with whiskey caramel sauce and fried pork sausage
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scrambled eggs with crisp bacon and fried potatoes
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and Gravy

NP00p6v458DI1MgA-xFuUA.text: The food tastes great but if you have small children it's a nightmare! You have to stand in line to order food, then wait for a table to become available as it's a small establishment that's quite busy. For adults it's great, with small kids... never again!

2hAb1Za1kt2iCkYZKqTxBA.text: Delicious, fast service and amazing staff You can order at the counter and pick your own table. The food is fresh, clean and tasty. Their coffee latte is really well prepared too. Really liked this place and hopefully I can stop by again when I'm in the area.

0Ya0xo8MQjfvJiKXrkj1Zw.text: Food was fantastic!!! This is a hole in the wall place kind of hidden as the entrance is in a small parking lot-no signage on street but a must go! Service was great. They appear to be about different and unique coffee yet the coffee was in self serve dispensers-not my fave but again our good was unique and yummy!

Unh9bHnBKZtZ9VSPfgDYCQ.text: Food here was really good. I could not decide as the menu had lots of really creative and delicious sounding dishes.  I ended up getting the benedict and really enjoyed it. Boyfriend got Spanish tortilla and I enjoyed several bites of that as well. I would come back if in the area.

srQ2OIHTtwOwTP4a6j2x6A.text: I really hate to write this but the Mexican benedict meal made me sick... really sick.  First, the pros:  - Clean setting. - Great vibe. - Lots of people. - Friendly staff. - Great looking pics on Yelp.  Based on all the pics on Yelp, I decided to order the Mexican benedict. The chorizo sold me. When it arrived, I started to indulge in the dish and thought to myself that, "this isn't as good as I was hoping." No big deal... I still liked the place and the vibe. The reviews were good and when I'm back in the area, I'll try something else. I'm not one to want to waste food so I finished my plate and started to go about my day. Again, no big deal.    As soon as I got into the parking lot, I started to feel weird. Maybe a little gassy... that happens, right? I just burped it along as my buddy and I were headed to play a round of golf. I'm still a little gassy on the first hole (not even an hour after eating). Then it hits me on the third hole. Not to be too graphic, but it was coming out of both ends and all I can taste coming up was the chorizo.  It's been a few days and my tummy is still a little unsettling from this meal.  I'm not writing this to tell you not to go there because clearly people have enjoyed their experiences but I will be very hard pressed to give this place another shot.

D0mEJ25Bm2zYUzZf1CwlwA.text: Great little breakfast place in central Phoenix with a unique menu that doesn't break the bank.  I've had the Banging Pocket and the Mexican Bennedict, and both were excellent.  The pocket has a good flavor mix with the cheese and sausage and it's more than filling.  The Mexican Benedict had great texture to the muffin on the bottom, good balance to the chorizo, and a sauce that complemented everything.  Overall both dishes have a lot of flavor without overwhelming you and it gave me the impression that I'd like most things on their menu.  Clean place, friendly staff, and at that time of day they are the only shop open so parking isn't a problem.  They have a nice patio and access to ice water refills.  They server soda in cans which is a bummer but that's just my OCD.  Good place for families, singles, pretty much people of all ages.

vk_Dz_K5vJPhYCi-01O4eg.text: Great place for breakfast. Everything I've ever had here is good. My favorite is the Mexican Benedict. The corned-beef hash special today was wonderful. You order at the counter, get a number, and the food is delivered, always quickly, to your table. The small kitchen is extremely efficient, and the front-house workers, including the owner, are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant also houses a small coffee stand with excellent cold-brew percolating through giant glass beakers overhead.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back entrance

CXHOK_yLsQO5iFJIljoRig.text: My friends and I came here for the first time on Sunday and let me tell you, this place is sooo good! I ordered the Mexican Benedict which had chorizo and a side of potatoes and it was made perfectly. My friend got the savory crepe which she really liked too and that came with a side of greens.   All in all I really enjoyed the restaurant and environment. The staff was extremely friendly too. On a side note, it would be better if they served mimosas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5ptP6fMGyIsp518oxTorPw.text: This place is dope. I had the Banging Pocket and it was fresh, cooked right, and very filling. Neat place to stop in and get some good food. Loved it.

0dfqPqNCtuM9JwTRy-FDqg.text: Had a good experience at this restaurant. Food was well presented and fast. I got the Tortilla Espanol and was underwhelmed with it. It wasn't bad but definitely could have been more flavorful. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. I really liked the coffee bar though.. Would recommend this place for anyone who likes the "aesthetic" breakfast joint.

BDNnuznpUx30GOXhpa5IVg.text: I had breakfast at Vovomeena this morning with a friend. When a server came to our table to deliver my breakfast order, the plate she carried was not what I'd ordered. I waited for another 5-10 minutes with no breakfast, then asked a server to check on my order. Shortly the manager (?) came out and apologized for the mistake, said my order would be out in less than a minute, and handed me cash for what I'd paid for the meal saying he wanted to make it right. An apology would have been sufficient. He went the extra mile to give me a refund.   My breakfast was great, as usual, and I was very impressed with the way they quickly remedied their mistake. When mistakes happen, and they will, how a business handles them makes the difference between great service and lousy service. Vovomeena provides GREAT service.

IEN7RhTsNSWl3coHV8Hxfg.text: pretty good breakfast plate. Wished my blackstone plate came with potatoes but I'll ask for that next time.

kJc1ULZEzaeb5Y2IeulFqg.text: The food was very good but the cafeteria style service was not worth the 35 dollars for a breakfast for two. They should at least have someone walking around with a coffee pot for refills, especially if asking for tips.

TSZaVyvK55rdWmCUJafLUQ.text: I was visiting my family in Phoenix and we all decided on Vovomeena for breakfast on my last morning there. You line up to order breakfast first and then you are seated. I loved the decor and the relaxed atmosphere.   I decided on the Mexican Benedict and the cold brew sampler. The Mexican Benedict was absolutely delicious with the chorizo on top of the sopes and the potatoes were well seasoned and fluffy. Definitely a must try breakfast item of theirs! I can now understand why it is one of their most popular dishes. I loved the idea of a cold brew sampler in order to try the different flavors they offered. All three flavors I tried: the Black and Tan, peppermint mocha, and orange peel ginger were some of the most flavorful cold brews I've had.   I cannot wait to visit Vovomeena again and try the other breakfast items on their menu! It is a must for breakfast in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute cold brew sampler
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mexican Benedict was delicious!

7AV-clw-KFyH9YB9Ya5tCA.text: Mexican benedict is a must try. The side of potatoes were crispy and delicious as well. Looking forward to trying out the other menu items here.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican benedict

nXBCnCGv368f3kWLYhrlwg.text: This spot got our morning off to a GREAT start! You grab a menu and look at it while in line, but the options are so many you won't know when you get to the register. Thanks to all of the great yelp photos, the winner of my "tournament of decision" was the Mexican Benedict.  From there, I was able to step to the side to order an iced mocha before sitting down wherever we wanted. I think this is a great wrinkle because the food comes out quick and seats for most in line are available, like clock work. NO one was standing around waiting for a seat even though the line was to the door when w got there.  The Mexican Benedict was amazing, with a spicy chorizo along with the usual. I found myself savoring every bite, and the flavor was consistent.   The manager was warm and informative to everyone eating, and we felt so enjoyable while we ate good food. Such a smooth and pleasant time before the day had turned epic.   This is a great place to fuel up with good quality food and brunch energy!   Well done, Phoenix!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican benny

YgQzKMKHv6fw_-u4l4wdgg.text: It's always a good sign when you want to order everything on the menu...  I was a little annoyed at first for having to wait in line to order, but once I got the menu, I was thankful for the extra time to decide what I wanted (I needed it).   b.m.o.c.: honestly, I don't even like pork or pork chops, but this sounded worthwhile and I'm really glad I went with it. the porkchop was delicious af and went super well with the waffle and poached eggs. It was kind of like an eggs benedict but with a better quality meat and carb substitute. They could probably top it with hollandaise and make it work tbh. I want it again...and again...  orchard french toast: challah? a million times yes. and the grated apple? actually might be the best french toast dish I've ever had. I'm surprised I finished 80% of both of these plates tbh. I was full the rest of the day.  cold brew flight: I learned afterwards you can actually pick which coffee options you want, which I wish I had known beforehand. everything I got was still good but also all kind of tasted more or less the same. I wish I could go back already and try the other options!  my favorite thing about this place was actually the decor. everything is super cute and photo-worthy. I love the signage and the coffee lab wall art. even the framed art prints in the bathroom were adorable.   congrats on winning brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. cold brew menu
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. coffee art
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. bathroom art

f7bnn_7Es9lZyNK0JFGqhw.text: This place was really cute. The only thing I didn't like is that it was not handicap accessible. We literally bumped in to everything but I understand the place is small. The food was good. We ordered the 3 sisters omelette and the Johnny cakes. Johnny cakes tasted like cornbread and it was pretty good all around except for the rice. Not much of a horchata person and that's what it reminded me of. The omelette was perfect, no complaints there. Coffee was great! There was a cute coffee bar inside. Had little jars with sugar cubes, loved it. It almost made me add one to my coffee and I don't even put sugar in my coffee! I will recommend this place. Thanks again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uqAJb3-XkIdPxLvGBQ-dTw.text: This is a cute order and seat yourself type restaurant. I wanted a basic breakfast that included eggs, bacon and potatoes but my friends chose this place. I didn't see what I wanted on the menu but they made it for me anyway. So thank you! It was good. I forget what my 2 friends ordered but we all liked our food. Well one had a breakfast burrito but can't remember the other order.

eaBo4FogWbRuXrunMEhw-A.text: Came to AZ for a quick vacay and was looking for good brunch spots. This place definitely did not disappoint! Customer service and food was great!

rif85148CA9NYEyyzkSAwQ.text: We were visiting from out of town and our hotel was nearby. We were craving breakfast food and happened upon this place. The pancakes were to die for. We ordered some to go the next day so we could take some on our drive. Next time we are in town we will definitely be returning to this place. Great service and delicious food.

c0Ruhfh-33gAQoknss7WmA.text: Great spot. We came at 10am on a Friday so there was plenty of seating. The owner/manager maybe came to me and asked if I'd been in before, gave me a menu and said to order at the counter when I was ready. I waited for my friend and we ordered our plates along with orange juice.  Food came out fairly quick and everything looked fresh and good. I got the Wilcox Avenue breakfast, which included two eggs, spuds, biscuit and choice of meat (which I declined). I also got a Portuguese donut which came with jam and was tasty. I enjoyed my meal and it was filling and affordable. My friend got the Pawtucket West and her two pancakes were ginormous. She also liked her choices and the juice was refreshing. Definitely recommend this spot, great service as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wilcox avenue
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Portuguese donut

_ys4Ofwt7FKwayO9efKC8g.text: Wow! Had the biscuits and gravy with a side of sausage. Food came out fast and was AMAZING. Some of the best I've ever had and I'm a native Texan. Can't wait to come back and try some more of their menu. Whole menu looks delicious.   Oh and coffee is great too!!!

CNvciwbjNQxMiSaLvdhu8A.text: Went with 3 other people, once we figured out the ordering process, we were good.  Food was great, service was very friendly and professional, we will be back!

dFGT5p-4agLVaD17pVASEg.text: I had heard numerous good things about this place and finally took a day off work so I could stop by during a weekday morning. Since it was a weekday, it wasn't very busy. The parking was difficult to find, but there was plenty of parking once I figured it out. I was looking forward to trying a flight of their Japanese Cold Brew but unfortunately the guy who normally does it wasn't working that day. Instead, I tried an iced coffee. It was very good with the right balance of sweet and strong. To eat, I ordered the biscuits & gravy -  buttermilk biscuits, white sausage gravy, and two eggs on top. My husband ordered the Mexican Benedict - poached eggs, chorizo, hollandaise sauce on an English muffin with fried potatoes. After ordering and paying inside, we sat outside on the cute patio. Our food was delivered rather quickly. My biscuits and gravy dish was very good. The sausage gravy was very flavorful and the biscuits were very fluffy and tender. My husband's dish was also very tasty - the chorizo being the star of the plate. Overall, everything we tried was very good and would recommend others to try as well. Their pain perdu - a bread pudding French toast - looks and sounds delicious. I'll definitely be back to try a few other items.

2bv9PcTy3MdpefrkNihsdg.text: My fam bam and I had breakfast here this morning. The atmosphere and service was top notch. Their Orchard French Toast was delish! I definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Orchard French Toast. A bit on the sweet side, but absolutely delish and worth it!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They have bomb blueberry muffins!

wtDobGU6uEITsADeyxgO9g.text: Awesome. The staff and management was so helpful. The coffee bar was excellent. And the choices were unique, perfectly prepared and delicious. Highly recommend. Both unique and delicious. Tough combination to offer nowadays. Will be back!

o-fYbJMZDsOUJVZ_wFgwpQ.text: great neighborhood spot! Friendly, accommodating staff and food is consistently good.

mEB7NZTEVVrJ0JiDsT5zew.text: This is such a cute breakfast spot. The pancakes and French toast was amazing. The service was very quick and they were so sweet. The servings are enormous, so plan on taking leftovers home if you eat here! Overall we will be coming back.

CieAO8m8JwdG7GVHf20fHw.text: I love their brunch and their coffee. The food is very unique and it never disappoints. The ambience is "Downtown Phoenix cool."  The place isn't very big but they have a nice sitting area outside.

_J1atm6sQue2bRhvshL2ig.text: Had the amazing Mexican eggs Benedict! I never would have thought to replace the English muffin with a sope, so creative and tasty. The ice coffee was delectable. Thanks Yelpers for helping me decide

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican eggs Benedict

7q8aVdLoWQeZFF5ALCuJzA.text: Adorable restaurant with great atmosphere. The food is affordable and well made. I wasn't particularly blown away by my breakfast but I will go back to try something else on the menu. Parking is a bit of a challenge but it's a perfectly fine place to have breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Average breakfast. Just okay. Not amazing,.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really good scrambled eggs and delicious orange juice. Wish the bacon  was thicker. The pancakes were ok.

JEMTBRjVibsdcg47NYFP4w.text: Food was ok. I forgot the name of what I had but it had bread and some chipotle sauce in it. My husband just had some basic eggs with peppers and a tortilla. Went early on a Saturday morning and I just loved the vibe. Made me feel like they can pass for a place somewhere in Cali. For us it was a one time visit. We don't regret it though. It was nice

VufbNon5t95nZ6XY1Ubw8w.text: My first time here, and definitely not my last! I ordered the Pain Perdu (bread pudding French toast) and sausage link and they were delicious. This dish is very sweet and more like a dessert than a breakfast, but nonetheless great. Nice ambiance, friendly staff, and a well oiled machine with their effective operation (food order/seating/cleanup).

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu

tjNq7yVjqiJx6iIe0opFNQ.text: A cute local breakfast/coffee place. I really enjoyed my Mexican Benedict. My kids gave two thumbs up for the 3 sisters omelette and the kids meal. You order at the counter and pay then take a number to your table. We got our food quickly which was good because we were hungry. Yum.

34PKMPhaPnd3W51rRycAuw.text: Food was out quick but somehow 5 minutes into eating me and my friend who both ordered different dishes started to feel sick...dont know what it was but it tasted good while it lasted.

3fvAY0uvO7wWyQrUxOO_XQ.text: Yummy!!! If I could do 4 and a half I would! I had a Mexican Benedict with hot coffee, the boyfriend had waffles, bacon and potatoes. Only thing that was just okay were the potatoes.. I think they should use Yukon potatoes. This is also dog friendly, I'll make sure to bring my little baby next time This restaurant is for sure is in my top 5 for brunch

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

T1KkrSprPrmOY2z-IUNJfA.text: Super efficient counter service, friendly and helpful staff, and a unique delicious menu

UpJXVgQFNU35JmOc81_K0w.text: This is my second time here and I am in love officially. Both times I've been here I considered getting the b.m.o.c and each time I opted for something else and each time I regretted it. The two times I went, the person I was with got the b.m.o.c. and I end up eating almost half of it. So good. The perfect dish for a salty sweet craving. The pork chop is more or less a thick piece of ham and the smokey flavor and brine soaks into the waffle. Amazing. The pain perdu is good too but it is all sweet and I do prefer a savory flavor. This last time I had the Johnnycakes which were good but once the b.m.o.c was placed on the other side of the table, I completely forgot about them. They did have fresh corn and a mild Chile flavor. They cut easily but trying to fork them to your mouth was ridiculous. They fell apart really easily. The prickly pear syrup was good and mildly sweet. I love Vovomeena!

YEFebaxmghdlw2LCpkcvyA.text: This place is pretty good. Menu is not overwhelmingly complicated. Pretty tasty food, but the coffee is much better. If you are a fan of coffee, definitely the place to go.

n7xrXjde485lhqrFY1VvTw.text: Had brunch with a co-worker here today. Food was delicious and flavorful. Excellent for brunch. Mexican Egg Benedict was phenomenal! Their espresso machine was broken but the Japanese Cold Brews were nice and strong. You get to add your own sugars and creamers to your taste at the bar area.  We told the barista it was our first time dining there and he gave us a quick tour and break down of the restaurant. So, you grab a menu and when you're ready, place your order at the register. If you order coffee or tea you pick it up at the bar. You get to pick your own seats and they'll bring your food out to you.  Although quaint, the place has a very unique look; comfortable but sophisticated. There's also a patio sitting area if you chose to sit outdoors. The employees were kind and helpful when we asked about their recommendations. They were also attentive in offering/providing condiments/extras and clearing our table.   Definitely going back, definitely a new favorite!

f-TGArpWr2Eo8VMARio47A.text: The orchard French toast are seriously outrageous!! The restaurant itself is super clean and their staff is beyond friendly. It was pretty busy when we went but it was worth the wait!

KSw19TBKCDo7aAss3o2W0A.text: As a RI native I was very excited to find this menu online. This place is awesome!  It is definitely worth checking out for breakfast.

ALBHLdm_Cso6ywzdVLW-pA.text: Being away from family on Easter isn't always easy.  Missing the home cooked goodness and the niece and nephews hunting eggs.  So I was thankful for my two sistas from other mistas for joining me for brunch.  This place is super cute and absolutely delish! I ordered the Mexican Benedict.  Sopes instead of bread...chorizo, cilantro and a lovely poached egg with hollandaise sauce! Served with their spuds...I added their arugula salad and dropped that on top of the benedict...perfection!    This place is great! I know we will be back and I'll definitely have the banana bread pudding french toast my friend got...that ish was off the chain!

fzpucg-jW__yeg3ilybArA.text: i was fairly unimpressed with the blackstone scramble. pretty tasteless and i didn't even want to finish it. i really liked my cappuccino, though, and the lil sugar cubes they have. i also wasn't a fan of the whole ordering setup where you have to line up to order, take a number, wait for your drinks if you ordered one and then get seated??? weird imo.

RQiIiMf96zbM1zywAxjNHQ.text: Unbelievably delicious.  Amazing menu selection, out of this world coffee, best service ever. What a hidden gem. Sitting outside on the lovely patio today, sipping a latte, ejoying the spring breeze, waiting for Mexican eggs Benedict,  yum!  My 3rd time here, will keep comi back. Friends & fam I sent this way, twice, have also loved it. Can't recommend enough!

dRKQzSqO8EtqtT7b6xluXg.text: The b.m.o.c was really good. This breakfast was different , fresh, and innovative. Enjoyed it. This place is legit!

hMhz_YWAZMwG2TjTTXYeUA.text: Great brunch menu! The weather is so beautiful in phoenix right now sitting outside for brunch is perfect.   .....They were out of the banana bread pudding French toast so I had an traditional breakfast which was still delicious. I will be back for the French toast sooner than later.

0G7CAN6BxFJnpm8TuXjmpg.text: I landed in Phoenix at 6am, and we were looking for something near downtown.....  We found this place and it was AMAZING!!!  I agree with some of the other reviewers that the lack of servers is strange at first, but it totally works out.    I had a hard time with the menu because everything looked so good.  I ended up with one of the egg options and a delicious buttermilk biscuit.  My wife got the Challah French Toast with apples.  Both were excellent and reasonably priced.  We will visit again for sure.    Lastly, the owner/ manager bussed our table, asked us how the food was, and thanked us for coming in.  This really topped off our breakfast nicely.

OjMbJA0wsNT4wWNhrwDPKw.text: This place is awesome it serves good food, memories of home with awesome decor loved every bite. Will be on a mission to try every plate :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The guy behind the guy
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy

AIUl8eLJX4MFh0ep_kMRkA.text: Good experience at Vovomeena. Hubby had johnnycakes - bacon and sweet rice get 5 stars. Prickly pear syrup was too sweet. I had the special which the kind host made gluten free and switched out the cheese to something not so spicy. It was delicious. The staff was very friendly and gracious. We are looking forward to returning. Vovomeena is the closest thing we have experienced to Marche (for our Nashville friends).

fovYg16LNCnPkhQTT5jDcQ.text: Tried this place for the first time based on the good reviews and enjoying Tuck Shop, however this was a pretty epic fail   We arrive at the restaurant and were told by the barista how the menu and ordering works, and we placed our order of the mandatory BMOC and the grillades, and supplemented that with a Coconut Macaroon (not the French hard shell style) that looked good at the counter. We ordered hot green tea and a cappa  The macaroon was mainly coconut with very little cake to it, which was fun for a bit or two, then was one note and disappointing...which was a common theme  The tea came in a regular bag (which was a little bit disappointing for a place that touts their coffee, you would think tea would be more than an afterthought, and then the cappa - which ended up being an espresso covering in foam in a full sized coffee mug. It was clear the barista had no idea what they were doing, I am sure there is a name for espresso doted with foam but it was not in the right cup nor was it what I ordered - that was disappointing. They seem to specialized in cold brew and had 5 or 6 of them going, so maybe that is all they are good at, it certainly isn't making a milk based coffee drink  The food looked good upon coming out however and the first bite of the BMOC was pretty good, the waffle with syrup and apples was done properly and the pork chop was a good piece of meat, the egg was cooked well. The issue was that it was unbalanced when the components were eaten seperatly and one note when eaten together. The pork chop was salty and a bit oversmoked, so for a bite or two it was great, then it was boring.  The grillades was pretty poor all the way around, the biscuit's were not very good and the meat was simple pressed ground beef and it was overly salty, the gravy was not that appealing, a pretty poor rif on traditional biscuit's and gravy  about 1/3rd of the way through the meal we decided we were wasting calories and it was time to go  If you want a great waffle and pork chop - Matt's Big Breakfast is pretty amazing upon comparison - I had wanted to try this place to give it a comparison, and it really makes Matt's stand out, simplicity done well is very hard and they do it there, not so much at Vovomeena

EjWQVLDgFzH6jyYPE_KpNg.text: Thank you vovo! Everything I've tried is delicious. The manager here is wonderful and really wants to make sure every customer is 100% happy with their food and experience. The kind of customer service I experienced here today makes me want to come here more often. And I will! Thank you!

f0CKmXx3gvdpIKmVSlaBEQ.text: No breakfast comes close to filling up my boyfriend then Vovomeena's BMOC. At around $10, how can one go wrong? A waffle, pork chop, 2 eggs, little cinnamon with apples and a Portuguese donut to top it all off. He can't wait to go back for seconds on Sunday. Order was called in and ready within mins. Workers were friendly and courteous, definitely a plus especially for such a busy place.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC $10

x4TAIyD6ICBx_DN1trfvoA.text: $30 for breakfast for two...  No table service.  Order at the counter, find a seat and they'll bring the food out to you.    We had the BMOC - this was supposed to have a "massive smoked pork chop"  but really it was a thick piece of brined pork that was over brined: too salty and had the texture of lunch meat.  We were excited to try the famous portuguese donut, too bad it tasted greasy like cold fried fair food.  Ugh.  The best part of the breakfast was the savory crepe.  It was tender and cooked perfectly.  The chicken and scrambled egg filling was a bit flat though.  I did order it without the fontina cheese, perhaps that was supposed to carry the dish?  Each ingredient should stand on its own, and they didn't.    There are way too many other places that have GREAT breakfasts.  Try Melrose Kitchen on 7th Ave/Indian School instead. chilaquiles, huevos rancheros, and bottomless flavored lemonades.  Breakfast for two closer to $20.

WeZ2Srr1U6mrjLhaihKhCA.text: I tried their biscuits and gravy, I had been hesitant to try it at first.  Needless to say I was rewarded with what I consider to be the valley's best biscuits and gravy hands down.  My wife and I and big fans of this place, they have great food.

UbgbvzrJXkT3--4hxG5VLg.text: Food was average. Wifes omelet had a distinct flour or corn meal taste. The biscuits are dry and hard. Manager was not very responsive when asked about the funny tasting omlet. Better places for breakfast if you are looking for food quality.

0UjSA40LypOIGaVBOs7rdA.text: First thing as you walk in the Japanese brewing method quickly catches your eye, the service is outstanding and the food is beyond delicious. I myself chose the the three sister omelet and a flight of the house infused coffee. Please don't sell yourself shot, buy the flight. If your definitely looking for a great local spot with local brewed coffee this is the place for you, atmosphere here is great and will not be disappointed with anything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front entrance

q_Csc1-1mkkP5ABsDE-AmQ.text: A great place for breakfast. Minus one star for the coffee not being that great. I had the johnnycakes, which were quite delicious and filling; a great way to start the day. The cappuccino I got was sub-par. Lots of natural light and you can sit outside too.

ApqAP1g7uRia_1Z5RxqW1w.text: We have been here two times now and both times the service has been so amazing! The food is wonderful, we each tried something new every time. The manager is so personable and makes an effort to come talk with us and check up on things. Even the customers are all very friendly and I feel very comfortable here.

Or6nsrN77FU8S7suOsSoBw.text: I love this place. I have come 6-7 times since living (near) Phoenix and have brought several friends here who have all enjoyed it. I always look forward to a visit here. I recommend trying their cold brew sampler if you are into trying delicious coffee with infused flavor that doesn't taste artificially sweet. My favorite flavor is the vanilla bean and cocoa nibs or the plain one. Super delicious and smooth. I always enjoy my dishes but my favorite is the bread pudding (pain de perdu, I think) which is consistently delicious.

2O6FFtQAAfypHtZDVyhxbw.text: Absolutely delicious food and coffee. Highly recommend the johnnycakes and add on the donut. You probably won't eat for the rest of the day, but it is worth it. Limited seating. Outdoor patio is cozy. Coffee flight is fun and unique.

bN8Kyt9zrTAxH_osVrETUQ.text: Yeah, it sucks that they don't allow substitutions. I'm not going to argue that.  But the food is quality, and the choices are not your standard breakfast-joint fare. Come here because it is something different, not because you want the usual!

GcD1oPHjn4LBp-aq4A1UZA.text: Delicious.  I have been wanting to try this place for a while now and I'm happy I had the opportunity.  Price range was very downtown Phoenix hipster but I was willing to fork up my cash for the ambience and good food.  Ordered the Mexican Benedict.  Your typical Benedict, except it included chorizo and was served on sopes.  It was pretty good!  The side of potatoes was a little lackluster.  Also, ordered the flight of cold brew.  I'm usually a big fan of cold brew but didn't enjoy their flavors as much as I thought I would.  I like the subtle notes in the coffee, the infused flavors didn't do much for me. But still interesting to try!  The Portuguese doughnut was amazing and completely worth it.  Would eat again.  All in all, cute little spot for brunch.

P2op-9i46DaEuYPd-leElg.text: I love breakfast and I love this place. Most of their meals have a spicy kick. I'm quite a wimp when it comes to hot food and I can definitely handle it. It's just perfect.  Tried the classic egg sandwich and the bread is to die for. Also tried the Mexican Benedicts .. favorite! Coffee is good, and pastries look delicious.

4SrDHFsI93nk_pjZ_l7P_Q.text: Now this is breakfast! Just landed in Phoenix and my family and me were so hungry. Peanuts on the plane are cool, but I need some substance. And substance did I get. Looked to my trusty Yelpers for a place near the hotel and this was the first place to come up. Didn't even bother to look at the menu, Siri, tell me where to go.   When we arrived, we had to park in a tiny lot, where cars circle in hopes for a spot to open. Luckily, someone was leaving as we were coming. Inside is super cute with seating inside and shaded seating outside. Here you grab a menu, order, then seat yourself. Menus are on the wall, we had a time finding them. Everything had a name that I'm not used to reading. On a whim, I ordered Johnnycakes, which was 2 corn & chile cakes, sweet rice, syrup, and potatoes.  No egg and no meat, the guy put extra potatoes. Ok, sir, you're cool and already know me!  My family placed their orders and we all waited patiently. All the plates came out relatively close to one another and we dug in. Now, looking from the outside, you would not guess at all what you were about to bite into, but it was a pleasant surprise. It was literally corn & chile! With the syrup and sweet rice it was just too delicious. The cakes were a good size, too. And there were strawberries on top. My. Goodness. I couldn't stop. Then to the potatoes ,which were perfectly crispy some bites. I was in breakfast heaven, and I'm not a big fan unless is basic. But this blew all the other breakfasts out of the orange juice! My family really enjoyed theirs too as their plates were empty. I couldn't finish all of mine, I think the extra spuds got me, since I finished those.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Johnnycakes no meat, no egg

cBJl9MrnNsEZQl6KGLsQWg.text: Fantastic place for dogs! There is a semi-enclosed outdoor area and the staff happily brought my dog a water dish.   This restaurant has a personal take on breakfast standards, my favorite was the eggs benedict served on sopes. Biscuits and gravy were generous and hearty. The portuguese donuts have a daunting amount of sugar on them but it's actually just the right amount to survive a 105 afternoon in Phoenix.  The care they take with each dish is obvious and appreciated.

suK6kOhOZBuI8CFEnRQ6rw.text: I had a nice experience as a first-time guest. I ordered the standard breakfast, called the Wilcox Avenue, with eggs, yummy potatoes, turkey sausage and wheat toast. It was all delicious (the coffee is great, too!) except for the sausage, which had a really gross texture and appearance and a weird taste. Stay away from that option. I've never seen turkey sausage that looked like that. All in all, though, a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The weird sausage is to the left.

UnFb9FJsHgEs0hLSlutu2g.text: Love this midtown spot. Great breakfast (and parking is better at this time anyway!)I've the Mexican Eggs Benedict and the patio during the cool weather.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican eggs Benedict

irL6yPeDmGh-5CZ3mT_5Dg.text: OMG this is the best brunch place in town ! I love the atmosphere and the food. The biscuits and gravy are the best. Highly addictive but isn't most food. Definitely recommend

dHIax93yN77USUSWyzk51A.text: I was downtown on a Sunday morning and found Vovomeena on Yelp when searching for a late breakfast and coffee after delivering some photographs to a gallery.  I really appreciated how their menu was not huge. I like places that pick a few things and do them well. That certainly turned out to be the case. The Mexican Benedict was absolutely delicious. What fantastic texture and flavor!  The coffee is excellent and the environment is charming and warm. Seating was a little tight but I found a spot before my food was ready. It was a little too cold and wet for a patio spot that day, but the patio does offer additional seating for the other 99% of Arizona's weather.  Parking can also be a challenge because the one lot serves many different businesses in the same complex. Arrive early and be ready to circle the lot a few times, or park off site and walk off some of those calories ahead of time.  I'll definitely be stopping by Vovomeena again, and recommending it to my friends!

nOk81yzI6mDIeZPEqPH3Sw.text: Went to this place because it looked pretty cool from yelp pictures, so I wanted to try it out!   I LOVED the Mexican Benedict. It was great tasting even though it was a little tough to eat. I love chorizo and that was some good chorizo. Overall for my breakfast I give it a 10/10   Tortilla Espanola was what my boyfriend ordered and I really loved the arugula salad and sausage! The potato&egg Spanish omelette was not for me but I think if you love cheese and eggs you may love it?!   Overall a pretty cool place, pricey, but if I'm ever craving a Mexican Benedict I'll head over.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xpT52Tsuxx95bNgFA5qFDw.text: You will not be disappointed. I have been coming here for years.  I had the smoked pork-shoulder scramble and subbed sopes for bread, as I am allergic to gluten. It tasted homemade! Delicious flavors. My friend had the Mexican Benedict which he reviewed as "one of the best Benedicts I've had."  My other friend had the Wilcox (more of standard breakfast), and she loved it!!!  It didn't taste like anything was frozen-- fresh and delicious!  Tip: Get the Portuguese Donut and the cold brew coffee.

26W_-SfJ9FFvlaKNTawUog.text: Run Almost like the "Soup Nazi" but if you follow the rules of ordering, seating, and placing your number in the right place, great food follows.  Had the biscuits and gravy.  Can't loose with this.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T6dm_mmRWB6LaIe0FjIWiA.text: This is a go to the cash register and order then go to your table with a number kind of place. Usually busy, but the line goes quickly!  The tortilla espanola (egg, potato, onion frittata with a side of arugula salad and breakfast meat) is my go to order. Delicious, healthy, and filling. Has a really nice tomato based sauce on top. Everything else I have gotten is also good.  Any coffee drink here is amazing. The drip is self serve. The Japanese style cold brew is delicate yet strong and has a nice floral note. If you want to learn more about it, just ask one of the baristas, they are a wealth of information!

rFowss5sW2t-JkXaavB30A.text: Breakfast at Vovomeena is good, big and either comforting or perhaps a little overwhelming. I've eaten there many times and take family and friends there because they are always delighted. You move down a short line ordering your food while watching the cooks prepare it, pay at end and go to the self-serve coffee bar. There are a couple varieties of coffee including decaf in thermal coffee carafes along with various creamers and sweeteners. You refill yourself. The breakfast entrees are hearty by any measure. You should try Vovomeena

-CdN92u-D98UAAj21qsnVQ.text: AMAZING! Came on a Saturday morning, the atmosphere right when you walk in is very urban, but comforting. The food was amazing, you order first then sit down and they will bring the food out to you. The owner greeted us and helped us find seating. Food was wonderful, I cannot recommend dining in enough. We were also able to get out coffee to go, which was also wonderful. If you are contemplating something in the menu, ask the staff, the are knowledgeable about the food and ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee and breakfast!

QsDhhGOlY5lJFi2FhHoFGQ.text: I'm from Las Vegas where there are fabulous restaurants and great food. When I travel I search this out. This is my 2nd time to Vovomeena and they don't disappoint. I had the b.m.o.c - big man on campus and it was delicious! Freshly made waffle with a sweet yet a little spicey syrup. Pork chop on top with 2 eggs any way you want them. I had scrambled and they were light and fluffy. A Portuguese doughnut on the side. Breakfast heaven! This is my spot whenever I'm in the Phoenix area. Thank you and my tastebuds thank you!

nqXq1Aj9O4BTQ33shtfLJQ.text: I've been wanting to try Vovomeena for a while now, and finally got to a few weeks ago with my brother. He was a bit apprehensive to take "little sister's advice" on where to go eat, but I know he liked it -- even though he won't tell me so. Lol.  My brother and I were both wanting a breakfast burrito, but since it was a Saturday, we had to choose something else (they only serve the breakfast burrito during the week). I opted for The Banging Pocket (mostly because that's what the guy at the counter recommended) and my brother got the Tortilla Espanola. I also ordered a latte, my brother ordered the cold brew. Now I'm not much of a fan of cold brew typically, but theirs is amazing! They infuse the cold brew with different flavors so it mixes it up a bit; it's not your normal cold brew, I can promise you that!   Since it was a beautiful Saturday morning and not too hot out, we sat outside sipping our coffee while the food was prepared. It didn't take long for the food to come out though, which was surprising considering they were busy (thanks for being awesome kitchen staff!) The Banging Pocket was, well quite bangin' -- extremely flavorful with the mix of scrambled eggs, Schreiner's banger sausage and smoked gouda (my fave!), with a side of roasted potatoes on the side. Definitely hit the spot with me. My brother devoured the Tortilla Espanola, and said it was amazing (the clean plate would've told me that, though, hehe).   I loved the atmosphere, the food, and the absolutely kind and informative staff at Vovomeena. I just wish it wasn't so far from me. I will definitely drive out here again soon though. It's so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Banging Pocket with &#34;spuds&#34; 10.21.17
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Latte 10.21.17

9bYkJnRlFOkzP43l6rJ8Sw.text: Fun atmosphere and awesome food!!! I enjoyed the orchard French toast, very tasty with a fresh twist of julienned apples on top! My honey had their breakfast burrito special with chorizo...tons of flavor!  We'll be back to work our way through their menu which is chalked full of classics with a refreshing modern twist!!!

ck87OkoGoVsTrJxn4VqXeQ.text: Incredible people.  Incredible food.  Incredible service.  Unique menu that somehow feels like old familiar favorites.   Cold brewed Japanese coffee is another standout here.   The overall vibe is of a welcoming neighborhood breakfast place with a lot of great items on the menu and fantastic customer service.  Highly recommended.

0RMMUndm9tMMtOA4zvuWFw.text: I was excited to try a new breakfast restaurant on Mother's Day because that's my jam. When I have time to meet up with friends, it's always for breakfast and we need another location to give us a break from Snooze. I agree with a previous post about the lack of signage for those using Google Maps. We pulled into the parking lot feeling a bit confused. Once we found the restaurant enterance around the corner, my husband went up to order for all 6 of us as to not crowd the cashier, and the kids and I found a table that a previous group had just left. As we were walking toward it, the manager abruptly told us that we couldn't seat ourselves and had to wait to order first. I explained that my husband just did as he was walking over with the number but that didn't change his condescending demeanor. He had us step aside while he cleaned and separated the tables into 2-tops again. After asking us how many, he then went right back over to the tables and put them right back to the same configuration. Really????  Other than this negative, unwelcoming  manager who gave no response to any "thank-yous", the food was great and the coffee bar was as well. I'm not sure how, or why this person has a managerial position but I hope he one day finds happiness elsewhere. We all deserve that.  Update: I received an email from the manager after this post which in itself, was impressive. It's always a good indication that they care about the business and the customers it serves. Perhaps my interpretation was unfair. Like i said, the food was great and that's what really matters to me so I'll definitely be back.

gk0K1qHHVPfAYF_4MU8jyA.text: I always enjoy coming here for breakfast or brunch. Their cold brew is the best, not bitter, just right. Don't forget to try to the Portuguese Donuts!

wk8iI4xxAk4PLxULJvH6VQ.text: Amazing food!!! The Mexican Benedict tasted just like a tamale and the coffee was so good. I loved the laid back atmosphere and the waiters were so sweet. If you are downtown, this place is a must-eat restaurant

nSTRZ6sxPqCRIWIwsP-mWA.text: This place is really good and different at the same time. I'm not from the area but if I was I would definitely be a regular

EjRdLDRUfmvn9SDF7WTzmw.text: Kind of an interesting vibe in here... Asian mixed with nautical theme? The coffee was really not great, but I got the breakfast sandwich and it was pretty good. We tried the savory crepes as well which I didn't like as much. The man at the register who greeted us was very, very nice, and it didn't take us too long to get our food. They have a nice patio space outside.

lgYhaE8wFeX5-7__0PsFkg.text: It's been over a year since my last rating, and we still come here 1-2x a week.. sometimes more, and sometimes we stop in just for a coffee to go. :)   If the cold brew float is available, be sure to try it.  The combination of cold brew and gelato is incredible.    I still love the Banging Pocket.. also during the weekdays they have an amazing pita they call the Palmcroft which is scrambled eggs, gouda, turkey and bacon.  The tortilla espanola is so good and one of my favorite comfort foods.    We eat mostly gluten free now (my better half has to for his health) and it's very easy to do here.  Skip the pita or toast and there's easily over a half dozen things on the menu you can have.    Great food, great staff - this is our favorite breakfast place!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cold brew float

pQnVldFzxBywVWH5npFp2A.text: Everything was so damn good. My husband order the banging pocket and said "I'm so full, but it's so good I can't stop eating it." Be prepared for a bit of a wait. Very dog friendly!

svQWf3QqwBnWR_pPxSDusA.text: After having missed a particular Vovomeena special posted on Facebook twice I was finally able to secure a taste for myself!  The Pumpkin Spice Pancakes special included scrambled eggs and two links of Schreiner's sausage.  I applied my Five Star offer of $2 off $10  which basically paid for my OJ:)  Before diving in, I Immediately, packed up the bottom of two pancakes, with 5 of the 10 pecans and a touch of the pumpkin spice butter, mmmm!  The sausage was top notch too, even though I'm not really into sausage. And of course, the eggs were made to order.  The pancakes had a balanced sweetness to it, not overly sugary, which made me happy.  Tastebuds were definitely happy with breakfast this morning!  Vovomeena remains a local gem for breakfast and brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So glad the special came with eggs and a protein option (sausage or bacon).
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Finally, after missing out on the Pumpkin Spice Pancake special, I made it in today!:)
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Behind the scenes

MTsarTIMilyRRhhHNM3AXg.text: The egg benedict is so delicious with distinct cheese on top. Good English muffin too.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

W9NR5n9hP7jYPXw7bwbx5w.text: This is my new favorite breakfast place. The food is creative and very high quality. I've had the breakfast sandwich and the sausage pita and loved them both. The place also has a cool vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banging pita
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast.

fTBqljAR1AbR6mYcy26w5Q.text: Really great customer service. Their food is great but just not a whole lot of selections. The place has a decent hip vibe and would love to come again. Their food prices is a bit pricey but worth the atmosphere, service and taste. Will come again but it's hard to choose with such limited options.

nfaRpB2HJkY7oGUeX-WMEg.text: Saying that the food is mediocre is being generous to this place that pretends to be trendy and pretty much fails. Over priced and SO not with it

SirvsbUANGxwdgraYOIn_Q.text: We went here to try something new and are so glad we did!  Food was excellent!  Atmosphere is eclectic but comfortable and inviting.  Super clean and staff is friendly and helpful.  Will definitely be back!!

pL-WmKHGHh3Pg41omfaAuQ.text: Stopped in today for brunch after keeping an eye out for months. Came in with the intention of eating the Mexican eggs Benedict & the pan perdue but went with the special Apple Cinnamon  crepe & the Jenny instead. Food was incredibly delicious, especially the crepe (first time ever trying one but it was sweet & savory & fresh. Only knocking it down a star because those two dishes put me out 34$ with a tip and it wasn't SUPER filling. Nonetheless I will be back for the pan perdue & B&G.

JzNtPi65nh8e_OTJEZzegQ.text: It's a cool little place. The food is mostly good and the service is decent. I wasn't super impressed by the donut but the waffle is pretty yummy. Their seating policy isn't great and that's one of the reasons we don't go here more often.

YTrkCObtdQ2vMHF8W1MEkw.text: Cool little place. Food is good. Service is good. Cashier' default answer is "no".   So far, my customer experience is that "you cannot have onion in your eggs unless you order the omelet with onions mushrooms and avocado."   I have the biscuits and gravy. Biscuits are average, gravy is ok and very meaty.  I won't be back.

McCQVqH7VtdzYnCbiwvXdw.text: Came in for breakfast ordered their Benedict and I thought it was absolutely terrible the owner of the restaurant looked at me like I was crazy cuz he said so many people love it he then gave me an order of biscuits and gravy which I will say were absolutely amazing I did like those my girlfriend ordered some type of corn pancakes and they were very good as well the coffee was nice and strong and honestly we beat the crowds so I can't complain too much it was a great stop on our way back to California

olOnVn3khs6fgZ-02mFjeg.text: Went this morning took my mother, we were on a search for a great breakfast near the downtown area. This place didn't disappoint. Great service and awesome menu and coffee! We got the Cinnamon apple French toast with marscapone cheese and the Tortilla Espanola. Amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon apple French toast with Marscapone cheese
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla Espanola, Spanish style egg and potato pie with roasted spicy tomatoes underneath and arugula with a lemon olive oil vinaigrette.

ulh-EJsrk8cifGonlWP-VQ.text: GLUTEN-FREE FRIENDLY! Oh, and delicious.   It was my first visit and the guy at the register (possibly the owner? manager?) pointed out at least 4 dishes that were either totally gluten free or could be adjusted. I went with the Mexican Benedict and I was pleasantly surprised with how crunchy the sopes turned out to be. The chorizo was delicious and the poached eggs were perfect. The potatoes could have had some crunch and/or seasoning, but... obviously not a deal breaker since I still cleaned my plate.   The possible owner/manager also walked by and asked each table about their meal. I know a lot of places do that, but it seemed really genuine here.  I know they have fancy coffee here, but I just got a regular ol' cup. Loved that they had raw sugar cubes. I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict -- gluten free friendly.

LP09mUDjtnXGYT8Lmss6sg.text: Hard to find at first but once we got there, I loved it. There's a parking lot in back of the restaurant but it gets jammed up quickly at lunchtime. They have seating inside and a patio connected to the restaurant and then a shared patio (Chipotle, salad place and a poke place in the same space) with extra seating.  I ordered the johnnycakes that came with crispy potatoes and a small side of sweet rice pudding along with a watermelon infused tea. The cakes were a mix of sweet/salty as they've got tiny pieces of corn and chile in them but strawberries on top and maple syrup to pour over if you'd like. I'm used to small, chunky cakes but these were HUGE! I couldn't even finish all of the food I received so a total bang for your buck!  The guys who run the space were great, super service focus and in an area with so many choices, I'd make this mine again and again!

ZDEb36Zr16wmRsMihxN-Ow.text: Very yummy breakfast...love the atmosphere and the location. I'll stop by next time I'm in the area.

kgBMpXla6k8bLcb85HEqFw.text: PROS Tasty brunch! We were fans of the thick cut porkchop and crispy waffle, and the Mexican benedict.  Right amount of spices and seasoning Patio seating for dog people Service and manager were attentive and courteous   CONS The flow for  brunch is awkward, it's counter service so you order the food but then the manager seats you.  Space is very narrow Have to get your own coffee  Overall, I recommend this place for a brunch. Easier if it's a small group since seating can be a little more competitive than what I would like it to be. We are East Valley people so will only dine here if we have events or errands in downtown.

m9vEFseuXYeYGKKTBHH0Zw.text: I LOVE this place! I just wish I lived closer so I could go more often.  I went on a weekday after picking up a friend from the airport.  I had the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had and my friend had amazing pancakes that are so delicious, you could eat them plain without any syrup or fruit!  My only issue was that the self-serve coffee wasn't hot anymore.  However that was back in November and we were there around 11 am.  They also have neat Japanese cold-press (or drip?)coffee setup that my barista friend was excited about.

XM4Ac7hcC--Wa0M7eHKTpw.text: Awesome breakfast.  Fast service. Great coffee.  Love the location.  Daily specials! What else do you need for a great local breakfast experience?  Maybe a hot date....

HCGZz8rmKCNWdrsYYu4KVw.text: This is by far my favorite breakfast spot in Phoenix. Every time I have family or friends visiting, I take them here and they love it. My savory recommendation is the Mexican Benedict. It's a fabulous balance of creamy hollandaise sauce and kicky chorizo. Also, the potatoes on the side are phenomenal. A sweet dish I can't recommend enough is the Pain Perdu. It's banana bread pudding french toast covered in a whiskey caramel sauce and bananas. This is the stuff dreams are made of. Additionally, there's hardly ever a wait. Even when there is, I think the most I've waited is 20 minutes.

zST5jb9EMUU7HspbS5JTdw.text: stopped in Phoenix on the way to California and this is seriously the best breakfast place I've ever been to in the whole U.S!!! I had the 3 sister omelet with spuds and man oh man was it delicious. They have fresh orange juice and perfectly made coffee!!

ETmcy6M6W3nNY1bAemAFbA.text: First time here was amazing! Three sister omelette was best I have ever had!! And I love good food! Every thing was a plus: the food, the service, the staff, short wait time for food on a really busy morning, and they have a barista for delicious coffee drinks.  My new breakfast spot.

i-IeFxR1OZbb2AVwyW68hA.text: Excellent service. Here from OC to see Ohio State- New Year's Day. There are open today! Great cold brew coffee. Fantastic breakfast and they have kids meal too. Thank you- I love my coffees.

yAsLOJZE15L0L_LKJbThlw.text: Definitely going back again!  I got the Mexican Benedict which was awesome.  Wanting to try the Pain Perdue next time.  It looked delicious.  My friend had the banging pocket which was also excellent.  Service was okay which is why I didn't give the full 5.  I ordered coffee and a water and they just handed me a mug and didn't instruct me where the coffee or water was.  One of the food runners seemed a little stuck up and annoyed to answer questions.  Overall a good experience though.  It's fast casual so you don't really need to rely on the service as much.

6gxkEn-8Lkz22SwejGEYvA.text: Always fast a friendly. The bangin pocket and tortilla espanola are amazing! The patio is nice for kids!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orchard French toast, Wilcox and kids pancake and bacon
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banging pocket
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banging pocket

khPs2hV3qlatKITkT0OisQ.text: Came here a while ago when my friend worked here!! The restaurant is so adorable and the patio is beautiful. I went back in November when it was really nice weather out so the patio was packed already.   The food was so delicious. You just walk up to the counter and order, and then they bring your food to you. I got the johnnycake and they were amazing! It was a huge plate of food...so it's a good deal for the price. The pancakes were huge, and you get a couple of sides. I remember having this rice pudding with golden raisins that was really good.

F-JAziImolmvvS8kx3TT-w.text: The slightly overpriced Mexican Benedict definitely fulfilled every tastebud craving. The portion was just right, and I ate it all without feeling overwhelmed afterwards. The service was good and the ambient was great!! Good music. Perfect decor. Quite satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

yOc_mNlPvte-lxoKuUeNhA.text: This is our favorite neighborhood restaurant! We come here far too often. The service has always been personable and the food is always a great way to wake up!

HnIR-wgsPAv7rZOotD3Fqw.text: First off, the seating here is super confusing. It is not clear what you should do when you enter and no employee helped direct us what to do.  It was cramped and awkward as it was very busy and we did not know where to stand before and after ordering our food, we were basically hovering over the people trying to eat around us. After we got our food, it was not worth the wait.  It was lukewarm/cold, lacking sauce, potatoes were undercooked and under seasoned.  The bread was dry and flavorless. To top it all off, it was expensive.

j0JxvnjJ_yRV2LlQh-TGSA.text: I just passed through Phoenix on a road trip with a friend and we stopped here for brunch.
