I had a banana bread French toast dish with whiskey caramel, it was delicious (though overly sweet). Their bacon was another big up. My friend got the pork chop, I tried a bit and it was excellent. I'll definitely come again if I ever pass through.  Edit: Came through a second time and got a black bean and corn egg casserole (three sisters I think). I was equally impressed this time around, though it seemed that the bacon was not the same as what they used the last time. While the bacon wasn't quite as amazing as the last time, it was still perfectly cooked.

CCBzxsjDqBlJbmZeXskfgA.text: This new breakfast/brunch place from the Tuck Shop owners is the lone gem in a row of typical chain restaurants at the SE corner of McDowell and 7th Avenue. By coincidence, I ended up eating here three Sundays in a row. So, I've been able to sample a variety of entrees from their menu--which isn't all your typical eggs and bacon. That's a good thing in this case. My favorite so far is their Tortilla Espanola_ the perfect texture and combination of potato and egg with a brava sauce. They also offer Portuguese donuts. They are OK. They are like funnel cakes but seem to be made from a lot more egg. The set-up is pretty in and out. You look at the menu and line up to place your order. If you order a beverage, you move over to the coffee bar after paying for your order.   Besides the scrumptious menu, I love the decor. They have space on the patio and a bike rack. Inside, there are floor-to-ceiling ropes smartly placed between people dining and people lining up to make their orders. I also like the hanging shelves of glass bottles behind the coffee bar. The brick and industrial materials gives the place a modern and simple feel.  I recommend getting there before 11 a.m. That's about when it starts getting pretty crowded. There is no signage out front so it's easy to miss. Parking is accessible on 7th Avenue, just south of McDowell.

Vv7d7Jm3ayVNZzFY5pvudg.text: kinda weird at first go up order wait in line then get a table. very good and different breakfast then what I'm use to! would give a 5 star but have to get up and get your own water or any other beverage for that matter. Would definitely go again tho!

ggvKe-HbP443YoyLrodcIQ.text: I've eaten here once; I got their food to go once; and I walked out without eating once. My first visit was odd. I ordered the staff recommended Mexican eggs Benedict. The plate was way overpowered buy the taste of chili. Chili for breakfast is not appealing nor tasty.         For the takeout "I went back to give them a second chance" I ordered scrambled eggs, sausage, and tators. It was good.           Then came my final visit. I arrived on a weekend with four family members including my wife. When we came in my wife sat at a table while I went up to order (it's weird but you order at a counter NO servers here). While I was waiting to order a manager or staff member went over to my wife and told her that she "couldn't squat at tables, that the tables turn over fast and that she could only sit down after ordering". Odd right? My wife got up feeling unconformable, told me what happened and we left.          To be honest their food isn't that good. I just wanted desperately to find a breakfast place to go to regularly. Phoenix is missing good breakfast places.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vovomeena entrance

1XOqqkrQ0HfMxuAsKPRVqg.text: The outside patio is relaxingly gorgeous in the mornings (though maybe it won't be so much during June, July and August).   The interior was very modern and cozy. The had a display of vacuum coffee makers, which I thought was really cool-- I'm pretty sure the employee I talked to about them made them. The coffee bar is off to the side and is nicely setup.  Had the eggs benedict-- it was southwestern style. Ridiculously good. Boyfriend and I are eggs benedict fiends.  I remember all these other goodies on their menu I wanted to try-- will return for a second round!

yfGMM70E0UL4iqF8LsbhaQ.text: This restaurant came highly recommended to us and we were hugely disappointed. Be forewarned there are no substitutions in the menu. Service was not good. Very overpriced for the food so they need to offer more; maybe biscuits with the meal. You have to buy them individually. Now to our food, I ordered my eggs over medium and the yolks had been broken and overcooked to the point of being burnt - they should not have been served.  I ordered bangers and they were not bangers just some kind of sausage. Biscuits were hard and overcooked. Because of our bad service we were offered a free meal but we will not be back. The food is just not that good.

MnpABUY85mF9PSfWuJjlWg.text: Had breakfast here this morning, and while there are still some kinks to be worked out, it was overall a very pleasant way to start the day. I had already stopped in a few times since they opened for coffee on the way to work, so I already knew the staff is friendly and courteous. This was confirmed today when, on their first really busy Sunday, the kitchen was backed up and the wait for food was long (we waited over 30 minutes for ours to come out, and even then it came out in waves).   Both our server and the (owner? manager?) made a point to stop at our table and thank us for our patience as they experienced their first busy weekend. Hey, I don't mind waiting too much if it's obviously something the management is aware of and trying to fix. I'm sure it will be smoother next time.   The food was excellent and lives up to the standards expected from the folks at Tuck Shop. We went with the boxty, two donuts, sauteed potatoes, a pancake (1 is very large and fluffy), and an egg/cheese omelet.   Critiques: 1)The menu specifically states "no substitutions" for breakfasts. However, I was told when I ordered that if I didn't want a side of meat, they would deduct the charge for it. So apparently, they are not as inflexible as they seem, but I wish I had known that while I was frantically trying to compose a breakfast that didn't include meat.   2)Because of the above-mentioned "rule", the logical solution is to order from the (small) a la carte section at the bottom, which is what my husband did. It would be nice if they would ask if you want everything to come out on the same plate rather than trying to fit a separate plate for 1 pancake, potatoes, 1 omelette, and donuts on the table when it was really all one meal. We ended up doing it ourselves at the table and handing 3 empty plates back to the server.   3)Order the donuts. If you like things that are amazing, then don't miss these. OK, that wasn't a critique. I just couldn't wait to mention these little puffs of funnel-cake heaven.  4)Hey! Vovomeena! There are a lot of vegetarians in the world, and we want to give you money to make our food. We're not asking you to change your world-view or anything, but just a little acknowledgement that not everyone wants a "choice of meat" on every single menu item. You guys are pretty light on the fruit and vegetable side of things, and no, fried potatoes don't count. And how about some other options besides cheese in the omelette? Please?   5)If you are an inflexible vegan, there is absolutely nothing you can eat here. Except maybe the potatoes, but I bet they're sauteed in butter. You can, however, enjoy a tasty soy latte and pout while your friends enjoy their food. But then again, you're vegan; you're used to this. (sigh)  I will eat here again. I promise to add a star next time if either the wait time or the non-meat options are improved...I will even think about adding TWO stars if both of those requests are heeded.

uO-PlPW078WkybHFJhdVsw.text: What a find! Had the orchard french toast husband had the biscuits and gravy. No wait and quick food times. very quaint interior. Staff was very friendly. Glad we found this place.

TbpxsxdJgx0Ash5poZTo8g.text: The food here is completely overrated. Do NOT order the savory crepes, the chicken has a weird taste to it. The French toast was good, but again, nothing too special about it. The staff was very nice, but unfortunately the food is not worth the wait.

k8PtkP6xYbsOSL-_xxAiYQ.text: Great experience,super fast service. My wife and I saw this restaurant on Check Please Arizona last night. Very quiet and quaint place and Super good food and a good serving size as well. If you are a light eater you my want share.

NojzkOuDyOGk8pQlqRhcag.text: The Banging Pocket is by far one of the best breakfast items in Phoenix. No joke. I get cravings for it. That smoked gouda, man. It makes all the difference.

OKO8aSvNXmyrYCYrPSDwaA.text: Vovomeena is really good. I've gotten their "giant stack of assorted delicious" item a couple of times now, and it features eggs, meats, and even a portugese donut. Oh, and a pork chop. There's a lot going on.  I wish that they were a bit more flexible with the menu. They're very clear about no substitutions, which they're doing in an attempt to ramp up the "fast service" style that they're aiming for, but it rules out a few menu options for me I'd otherwise be really excited to try, and that's a bit of a bummer.  The service was really good the first time we went. The second time, we had a hiccup where my meal had gotten lost in the ether, so I didn't get to eat until after my entire party was pretty well done with their food. But mistakes occasionally happen, so no real love lost.  Overall, it's pretty damn tasty, and a fun experience. And TONS of food. Worth swinging by.

38858lVK-6j8KPMLJAqbOQ.text: They have done it again.  Great concept, great food, great building, great staff, and pricing is just right.    If you are looking to break the Corporate Food Chain monotony of 7th Ave and McDowell then Vovomeena is where to go.  Delicious local food and excellent coffee selections.  I can not pick a favorite on the menu, but can say that everything will be sure to not disappoint, so you are safe to close your eyes, point, and try it.

2ffSuApqRuPWimPMqP_Q9w.text: Great little breakfast/brunch place with cool chairs and ropes hanging from the ceilings.  We got the Pain Perdu with sausage and a coconut macaroon.  I thought the main dish was a bit too thick and heavy, though my girlfriend liked it.  Neither of us thought much of the sausages. The macaroon was fine, but felt a bit under-cooked.

AiDvc_tYk6VXagrA2NwPfg.text: I had the 3 sisters omelette and my girlfriend had the savory crepes. The omelette was nicely done and the corn added a nice flavor to it. The bacon was crisp and well seasoned and not too salty. The crepes were also delicious.

qbseCeoaUWH8YzRx3JDD4A.text: I agree with the other reviewers who are reluctant to give a good review because they don't want this place getting "too" popular and crowded. However, I had such a positive first experience that I must spread the good news.  This place is unique and a welcome addition to the other cookie cutter restaurants @ 7th Ave & McDowell. The menu is also unique and a refreshing change from the typical breakfast fare offered at most other places. The ambiance is modern, and comfortable. The portions are plentiful and I had no chance of leaving the restaurant hungry because the chef skimped on anything. I will definitely be returning to this restaurant with friends.

sp41HhbN6Zf9S9PEfVfPyg.text: Had brunch there today with my husband and daughter.  Would they come back?  Most definitely not.  Would I come back?  Maybe, in a year or two assuming they stay in business.    Would I encourage people to try this place?  Yes, but on a leisurely day, and not when you want to impress or be impressed.     The space is pleasant: ample outside seating, high ceilings, narrow hall running east west with plenty of light coming in from both ends.  They have a limited but ample menu with items that conceptually sound delicious.  (You know, like Tuck and Astor House.)  After more than 40 minutes of waiting, we had: 1.  boxty (grated apple & potato pancakes, honey mascarpone, choice of meat).  The grated apple is not cooked into the pancakes but put on top.  Honey mascarpone was sickeningly sweet, and pancakes were peppery -- weird combination.  I picked sausage as my meat choice but it wasn't served with my boxty.  I asked the server "Was I supposed to get sausage with my boxty?"  She responded, "I don't know, were you?"   I showed her the menu and the sausages were brought out shortly; but response was borderline rude and at best it showed she didn't know the menu which had 12 items on it.    2.  johnnycakes (corn and chiles, stack of three, sweet rice & fruit, choice of meat).  This might have been the best item from the three that we ordered.  The pancakes were beautifully browned; like fluffy cornbread.  But something was missing to tie the flavors of the pancakes, sausage, sweet rice & fruit together.  Maybe syrup?  Maybe a butter chile sauce?  But the sweet rice needs to go.  3.  piperrada (fry up of pork shoulder, green & red peppers, tomato, onion, two eggs on top).  The number one ingredient in the entree description was barely there.  Hubby did the rude thing of picking his food apart right after it came, maybe because he was not happy that his first two picks (grillades and mexican benedict) were not available.  Table manners aside, when he removed the two eggs from the top of the pile, the underneath was mostly red and green peppers and onions.  If you pieced together the pork shoulder pieces like a jigsaw puzzle, it might have ended up being the size of a small bacon strip.  Tomatoes were also missing.  Two separate people asked if everything was going ok and my hubby told both of them that he was not happy about the pork shoulder.  But nothing was offered, no substitution, no refund, nada.    I don't remember the last time my husband complained in a restaurant.   That is usually my gig, and even I don't often do it.  Today I had a feeling any complaints would fall on deaf ears. We had to wait quite a while for a food and during that time  I saw several customers going to the counter making non-positive gesticulations and being met with a response that I could lip read as "So sorry."  I also saw four very frustrated cooks who spent quite a bit of time looking at the ticket items while very little food was coming out of the kitchen.    We felt bad for everyone:  the cooks, the owners, the patrons, and us.  Such a downer for a brunch.   From our table, I ate the most food in hopes of eventually understanding the concept from each dish.  (If it matters, I wear size 0 pants and am not prone to just eating anything and everything.)   In the end, while my daughter looked at me in disdain, I told her I just needed the calories to make up for the effort in getting there, for the wait, and for the money spent.  Supporting local businesses is a must, but it shouldn't be painful. I think Vovomeena could be good someday if it works out its kinks.  But I'll wait a long while before I risk another downer of a brunch again.

1V6TB7HdVGCb6x7V-TFx8A.text: Food was tasteless.  Potatoes came to the table looking like a soggy mess.  I asked the manager if he could bring out crispy potatoes.  He told me that NO, he could not, because the potatoes were "pre-made".   I am sorry, but any restaurant that is unable to throw some potatoes in a pan and crisp them up is no place for us.  We ate one bite of the other items we ordered, were very disappointed, and left.

88E_WA0h3xL7dSD7MJ3r0g.text: See the blog for more:  With Aileen and I arriving nearly simultaneously we entered the crisp new space only to be greeted at the front seating area by a pair of baristas standing before the Japanese Cold Brew contraptions and with everyone bright and smiling we were invited to take a seat anywhere we like, eventually settling on a four-top in front of the open kitchen.  Greeted next by our server, a delightful young woman named Hedda, and then by the restaurant's manager it was explained to us that the method of operation was to grab a menu and then order at the counter while coffee is done self-serve and with that in mind we perused the menu and the restaurant's interior before making our selections.  With the space largely empty at such an early hour (but later to fill to capacity as I sat studying till 9:30) we both admired the cozy industrial/shabby chic interior and with The Shins and Minus the Bear amongst the morning soundtrack the restaurant was lively but not loud, though a small group on the outdoor patio seemed to be having quite a good (boisterous) time.  Chatting as we waited it would not be long before the food arrived and purported to have overordered I personally thought everything looked just right when our table was filled - particularly as I sipped on my third cup of the Vovomeena's bold and intensely earthy brew.  Taking notes from various culinary traditions including the Deep South, England, Ireland, Portugal, and more our meal started with a simple buttermilk biscuit topped with salted butter and paired with a side of strawberry rhubarb jam.  With a light crisp to the exterior while the interior crumb was moist and rife with lightly sour notes I partook in the top half of the biscuit while my friend enjoyed the bottom and although good on its own the addition of the jam was definitely more my style.  Moving next to the one dish I'd probably not have ordered if I were visiting on my own, the "Banging Pocket" with Shreiner's Banger, Scrambled eggs, and smoked gouda wrapped in a pita was actually quite good, though largely due to the use of quality ingredients more than anything particularly done with them as the pocket of pillowy bread featured a nice balance of fluffy eggs, spicy sausage, and just enough cheese to make it 'stick.'  Neglecting the "griddled spuds" on the side largely because I found them a bit too greasy I will note they were quite tender and well complimented by the salt, pepper, and onions.  Noting my propensity for sweet over savory at breakfast it was not until Hedda described the "Boxty" that we decided to order it and while it too was just a bit greasy the overall effect of the hot and crisp potatoes juxtaposed against the sour shredded apple and creamy but sweet mascarpone was quite nice.  A sort of sweet meets savory hash brown served with choice of meat I personally would have preferred to see the bacon, also Schreiner's, more thoroughly cooked but that is just a matter of personal preference as the quality of the meat was quite impressive either way.  For the next choice - the most expensive on the menu with good reason - the B.M.O.C. would prove every bit as good as its description would have you to believe.  Beginning at its base with a crispy waffle lightly tinged with vanilla notes and plenty of butter then subsequently topped with apples cooked down in maple syrup, a smoked pork chop, two poached eggs, and finally a crunchy Portuguese donut it would be hard to call this plate anything but gluttonous...or delicious.  In a dish where any number of elements could have shined, what truly set this dish apart for me was actually the chop - a smoky and savory slab of meat that was easily cut with a butter knife and fork and nicely matched by the intense sweetness of the rest of the plate.  Better than the famous "chop and chick" at Matt's and less expensive (without the line) this will, and should, become the restaurant's signature in my opinion.  Moving last to the "dessert for breakfast" item that had originally drawn me into Vovomeena the day the menu was first published, the pain perdu was simply exceptional.  Featuring dense banana bread rendered into a custard style bread pudding and subsequently sliced to be fried up on the grill this was everything I want from bread pudding - crisp and caramelized on the exterior, soft and dense within, and topped with bold "whiskey caramel" sauce plus ripe bananas that push the dish ever-so-close to "too sweet" while still keeping things in check, particularly when matched with the Schriener's Sausage.  At $6.95 you'd be hard pressed to find a better breakfast dish in town and having sampled my fair share of bread puddings I'd put this iteration in my top ten.

4tb6FvdYBWN3xq-ftQWw4Q.text: How about Vovo ya-dont-mean-it  or My best guess at how Vovo used to cook but that was a long time ago and I don't remember!  I'll tell you what, the name implies Portuguese food but having grown up on it, this is the farthest thing from it and a huge disappointment!   Obviously the people who have given it a high rating have never experienced a GREAT Portuguese breakfast and have been fooled into thinking a luke warm grease drenched not fully cooked lump of batter is a donut or treat in the traditional style of cooking..... NOT!!!  I asked the server if they have Linguica which is a traditional Portuguese sausage and he said he thought they had it once but no..... I'm not sure he knew what I was talking about. ..... Vovo-no-idea!   We all commented on one common denominator of each of our pretty tasteless orders....... The eggs!!!   Real or Powdered (reconstituted) ..... either way, just not very good.  I ordered Blackstone Scramble.  I expected what I read, "Pork Shoulder" and seriously folks, it paled in comparison to a Denny's Denver omelet..... it was a very strange thin finely chopped ham colored meat.... very odd.  I do not see this restaurant lasting.......  This is Phoenix and what we have come to know about eating out there is that, "If it is going to make it, it has to be consistently good"  There are sooo many restaurants there and sooo much competition amongst them that this place is not going to last.  The seating is horrible not to mention Stupid.....  I get the first come first serve thing but we were told to just hold on and not get excited because we would get a great seat...... It never happened and we were three people assigned to a two person table that we couldn't get all the plates on and on the patio between two doors causing us to be brushed up against by every server and patron........    The inside has a neat trendy look and feel but I need more than that in order to appreciate it as an actual eating establishment.  Oh, the coffee was good...... I'll up it a star!  Forgettable!

FceiIHTTobJYnnaZVfN41Q.text: Excellent and creative menu across the board.  Not epic or life-changing, and maybe not even indelibly memorable, but excellent.  4 stars!

xhqDzMeDHa_41tnGkfQk6Q.text: Awesome!  The food is always hot and fresh. I would eat here daily if I could...  Can't wait to explore more items on the menu. I would give 5 stars if it wasn't counter service and if it was easier to get a table.

I44juU_3H3imnpB8XMf5AQ.text: The waffle I had was delicious. Even though I wasn't able to substitute the spuds for something else, I was still left impressed. I want to bring all of my closest friends and family to this place. I'll be at this same spot next Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!

6yRb_zmosLJhIYEU3zzcvw.text: Me and my husband both really loved our iced coffees!!  Thank you for a great cup of cold brew and a yummy iced mocha, we will be back for sure!! I love the atmosphere and I can tell your passionate about the quality of each individual drink you make.

X7Grk1T4UoYui-BGVx8kpQ.text: We had the Tortilla Espanola and it was delicious! Recommend getting it with the pork sausage. Staff was very friendly and attentive; restaurant has a relaxed atmosphere. Coffee was great! Would definitely return.

KnFHNN8nUohhUYHfGfAL6Q.text: Service was terrible.  We waited in line forever, and then when we got our food, I received mine expediently, and then my companions didn't get theirs for over 20 minutes.  We did talk with the manager and their food was comp'ed, so that redeemed the situation slightly.  I was also unimpressed with their selection.  Every menu should have something vegan or something that can be made vegan to accommodate those who choose to not consume animal products.  I see two other reviewers highlighted this as an issue.    I'm giving it two stars instead of one because the coffee was good and they had almond milk and stevia for it...although there was no counterspace to make your coffee (for those of us not getting something fancier than just a cup o' joe).

Vq-AJVMSIQEZX2Q9yr6j4w.text: We tried Vovoveema for a second time, especially since it's so close to us, and it was an awesome dining experience. We tried a variety of menu options including the crepes, challah bread and the pita-burrito (the name escapes me!) everything was fresh and flavorful, we sat outside which was lovely and the manager was exceptionally friendly, stopping by everyone's table to say hello and make sure they were happy with their order.The flair and variety made it so whatever mood you were in there was bound to be something on the menu that would hit the spot ;) We will definitely be going again!

CM9A-Yhc38eQMyB9qhw9TA.text: I have been searching for a great little place that's not too out of the way to just sit and relax for quite some time now. Vovomeena is one of the best in Phoenix. Not to mention, the food and coffee were beyond ordinary. They were something to brag about.  The service was excellent and I am now going to be a regular here.  Perfect.

jyq5Ne-XbcpwBkVcvnyEQA.text: First time customer, it has a nice atmosphere, kind of hidden. The Pawtucket west I had was delicious and I recommend. I would've took a pic, but I ate it too fast. Will return again...

yZF5v--00vmljVMB79GZ2g.text: I was here last week and finally made a yelp account because this place has one of the best customer service that I have seen.   First, my food order was made wrong, so I boxed it to take home (several hundred miles away) and they literally went all out to make it right, but I had to leave to start my journey home. Back home, family enjoyed the chicken fijata pita. So I would say, it would be a good food to take home.   Second, wow, the customer service is amazing. Everyone was super nice and accommodating. I would totally visit here again.  Lastly, this place made my Phoenix trip worth it. I would recommend this place for breakfast and to try out, because they have the most awesome customer service I have seen.   So give it a try and judge for yourself.   Happy breakfasting.

LZCk29w5QcWlgwgYZvxsdA.text: Amazing breakfast burrito and friendly staff! Perfect brunch on the patio and unlimited coffee. Highly recommend!

w8grikbKjSqa6pfjNeOY7A.text: The service was great. Every single person who worked here was nice and helpful.  The location right off the 10 was extremely convenient.  The food was good, a bit eccentric, but different and fun. I wasn't a big fan of the mocha but my mom liked her coffee. The beans were roasted in Cave Creek. You grab a menu when you come in and then jump in line and place your order and then pay at the counter then find a table and they bring you your food and take your dishes away when you are finished. It's very well run. I had the biscuits and gravy and my mom had the Mexican eggs Benedict. I'm from Chicago and only like Chicago style sausage, so I wasn't a big fan of the sausage in either, but it's a chorizo so it's different.  Those two meals and the coffee and mocha plus two orange juices was $40, so a bit pricey, but good.  It filled us both up.

jup0FhY6cNOMuGqOMo85Aw.text: Such a cool little place.   I'm not from Arizona so I accidentally drove past the place twice (the entrance isn't on the direct main road).  The staff was friendly and the guy at the counter seem to genuinely enjoy answering questions.  The ice coffee is strong and the flight is a fun way to try new flavors that you wouldn't find at any ordinary coffee chain.  I ordered the Mexican Benedict and the flavor was amazing. I like that it was ground chorizo and not just a patty. It was so filling and a large portion for being Eggs Benedict.

B5X7X6nM3rC5fnwERjXeBg.text: My husband and I were looking for a cool place to have brunch! And we found this small hip place! Its a gem! The food and coffee were great! The portion was very generous!   -the drinks should be serve first before the food though- just a thought

l9yxSHLdQGnbg4KDqRskcw.text: Wow every weekend vovomeena gets lots of love from all the locals from the valley.   Every one is so nice and attentive.  The food is amazing good. Try the 3 sisters is delicious  good.

62f5c-s62tgjVSE8mtKoVg.text: I ordered the Mexican Benedict and my friend ordered the Breakfast Sandwich, and both of them were amazing!!! The Mexican Benedict is definitely my favorite. This is a great spot for breakfast/brunch!!!

Y4Blgc6apSHD6UYKaiG1Vw.text: One word to describe this place amazing  it's definitely a hidden gem there cappuccino is to die for  the orchard French toast was amazing and my husband enjoyed his blackstone   scramble as well I'd say if I could give a single note bigger french toast servings only because it was so damn good and I'm a fat ass can we get a extra toast upgrade lol will definitely be back  for more

TMxb_tH42Pw1-htBoEJUuQ.text: Tortilla Espanola is amazing. Great service. Comfortable atmosphere. Great coffee!!! Also the location is perfect! Definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great breakfast and coffee

IGGzgOLzplbIxqLJduXDlg.text: From the outside this place is difficult to distinguish as a restaurant, I thought it was a woman's clothing boutique forever. We waited in line to order, it went fairly quick for a busy weekend brunch rush. The kitchen is open so you can see where all of the magic happens =-) I ordered the 3 sisters omelet and it was very interesting. A lot of flavors I would not traditionally put together but actually worked really well. My husband got the banging pocket and enjoyed his as well. They have a separate coffee station if you just need a pick me up. Reasonable prices and cute hipster little place to check out if you have not already.

g8Io3hITlmk8GsmECFPl1Q.text: How is this place so highly rated. I could barely finish what I ordered. The eggs are inedible and everything else was incredibly salty. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing?

6d_RQ5WtyknI9KmrEqx3cw.text: Best breakfast in Phoenix!  From hearty to sweet, they've got you covered. Biscuits & gravy!  Yum. French toast!  Yum.

Kv-FFZDqBpw-ImEbWZJ00w.text: Trendy, snug place. Generally when I've been there, there's a line to order, but it's okay! You're greeted in line with a menu by a Host. Then after you place your order at counter, the Host will seat you with your number. Then bam!, food comes out. I got the bacon breakfast sandwich and boy did they deliver on the bacon!

_sVSN2oZadQ2yboHvVzE4g.text: I don't know why, it took me longer time to get the food, but the food overall is great! Coffee is okay. (Not that excellent.) Environment is quiet and lovely.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9E86vIC7i7nPpDCtjaFJag.text: (Lyrics - Lady Gaga - Paparazzi)  I'm your biggest fan I'll follow you until you feed me Vovo-Vovomeena  Bo Bites, there's no other foodie-star You know that I'll be there Vovo-Vovomeena  Promise I'll be kind But I won't stop until I start to dine Vovo you'll be famous Yelp you down until you feed me Vovo-Vovomeena  Vovo Vroom-na!  This place has my heart!  Granted, very hipster-ish, but I can look past that.  I cam here with some friends on a Saturday.  The place was hip and popping with and urban funk.  With an open kitchen cooking up a storm and a barista counter for your coffee.  You need to order at in a line and pick your seating after.  I was looking at the menu; very traditional american breakfast, but with funky modern twist.  I went for the b.m.o.c, Waffles with a pork chop atop and apple maple syrup and finished with an over easy egg with a side of Portuguese donut.  It was sweet and savory at the same time while the oozy egg gave it a smooth texture to every bite.    Service overall was welcoming and quick.  I didn't get a chance to order and coffee, but definitely and next time for me and Bo Bites recommendation! - Enjoy!

v3zqQVlluFPUkGWQ8S-J-Q.text: WOW!! Honestly one of the best cafe-type places i've ever been. The staff is super friendly, the food is great, and the sweet tea is AMAZING. Make sure you try the potatoes and mango iced tea. I was on vacation from Minnesota and we went here for breakfast every single day (4 days in a row). The manager even noticed we were frequent customers and wrote us a coupon for 1/2 off our next meals. I wish I could bring this restaurant back home with me!! If I could rate over 5 stars I would.

IOWL95_J-0N5dUXVBnFyNA.text: Good food. If you're looking for a full service place his won't be for you but it's delicious and worth the wait.

ZYmfFO2VBk1gO9qIYxvaLw.text: Unique food option. Kind of expensive and I wouldn't consider these healthy food options but it sure was delicious. They also have cold press coffee that is really good.

gUtnfNS3YByocDN2txiJiw.text: Mmmmm Vovomeena! This place is for sure a go to for me! I LOVE their breakfast, small menu, but everything I have had is amazing. My favorite is their breakfast sandwich. This place is cute and has a good atmosphere. You can tell they put care into everything they put out. Whenever anyone asks me of good places to go for breakfast this is always a go to for me. The only thing that would make this place better is if they had a bar! Ahaha. Great coffee too! Definitely a must try if you haven't been.

IE_3LSLnhyo2Fg0wPn7VnA.text: Great breakfast joint!  Small and intimate. Coffee brewing apparatus is like breaking bad!

lAHBSyl9ZTpv2tGMTGyClg.text: So I finally got here. I think I was expecting wonderful greatness because of the hype. What I got was good. Nothing really wrong with that. The food was good. I had pancakes with sausage and eggs. The employees were pleasant. The seating is cramped. The door on the East side of the restaurant could use some tinting as the sun hit the windshield of a car and was very bright.  3.5 and I would go again if that was someone else's choice.

mmseE31XAmCLxEED9z5PBA.text: The food was fantastic. We split the B.M.O.C and there was more than enough food.  I can't wait to try the Johnny cakes. The coffee was not hot and my cup had lipstick stained on the rim. It happens. The people were exceptional.

l6r1S8Xf6uSlR4CmE93_QQ.text: Ordered the B.M.O.C.. Found this place via @azfoodie's awesome Insta. The dish was a good balance between sweet and salty; a kicked up version of a ham with the added benefit of bbq grill flavor and smoke. Delicious. Comes atop a beautifully made waffle and apple compote, with two eggs (made your way. Mine were a perfect over medium) on top.  They chose a quasi-fast casual dining model, so you pay first and receive your order via server. Ambience is great for foodies, like myself, who enjoy taking photos of everything, and the service was very responsive, efficient and cordial.

DuvGkaWovU2EsOrOusTCEQ.text: A little cramped, but overall good. Service was top notch and good was tasty. The pain perdu and the Portuguese donuts we're amazing!!! A little snafu with the order, but corrected in a nice/friendly manner.

w5M5AjUmFzOzVii7oP4OHg.text: Came here for a lunch meeting. Pretty close to downtown and my office, wasn't too difficult to find. The parking here though is a bit hard to find - you may end up needing to park next door. I had to park in Zoe's kitchen because parking lot was full.   I ordered the tortilla espanola with the sausage. The food arrived pretty fast! The tortilla espanola was interesting - first time having it. It had a soft spongy texture - looked like savory cake! The sausage was good, and the salad that came with it was a little greasy for me. Not sure what they put on it but overall the entire dish was good.   Definitely recommend for brunch in youre in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JIbW_G6sKS72Ekx2ZlF_7Q.text: Located off of 7th ave and McDowell, this new and trendy place in the Phoenix area is definitely a place to check out. Menus are located right by where the cooks are. You can browse through it, but you don't place your order until you get to the cashier and then your party is seated. If you place any coffee orders, you pick it up at a separate counter to the left of the cash register. My party of 6 were immediately seated and coffee was promptly made. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating with our larger party. Our food took less than 20min and was brought out to our table. Food ranged from an omelette, to a breakfast sandwich, and a tortilla espanola. Overall, food was good maybe lacked just slight seasoning on the tortilla espanola, and the additional Portuguese donuts were delicious. The venue itself is pretty awesome and I highly recommend checking out!

LPH9qBq3yIpJxegkedqc7g.text: I found this place on yelp for its casual dining and good food.  I love this type of place for it's fast food ordering and the food comes out fast.  It makes for a quick dining experience.  When we arrived, there were menus really to pick up and ordering was at the counter.  We received our drinks first and a number so they could bring our food to our table.  The food was simple, hearty, healthy, and good.  I had their breakfast crepe and it came with a side of arugula salad in a vinaigrette dressing.  I had some potatoes from my friend's dish and they were so good.  One side of the potato wedge was crisped and it was like eating a hearty French fry.  They even have Japanese drip cold brew.  We were in and out within 30 minutes and plenty of time to explore the city after.

NudRfdKSJfUQ7a_1jqB9yg.text: Saturday morning trip downtown PHX and our tummies were hungry, hungry for great food at that.  If anyone were to ask me about Vovomeena I would describe them in one word: consistent.  Consistency for years and years of us coming here, I took a photo on IG in May of 2013 and since then they've only improved!   If you want a party in your mouth, dine here.  If you're timid on trying new things, don't dine here.  They specialize in dishes you won't see anywhere else and the menu proves that!  I highly recommend VOvomeena if you are ready to take breakfast up a notch!

aNQ_u2M8lFL0O4ej_547iQ.text: Not the best brunch spot. The Mexican Benedict was mediocre at best and the cakes they came on were hard and over cooked. The French toast was decent. Service was average too.

P-B57K4wfQHsBixHvDB22w.text: Super cool eclectic little breakfast spot. A little tough to find especially the front door! Now that I know, next time will be easy.  I ordered the 3 sisters omelette. Delish! Very good and not greasy. I also had with it, options were bacon or potatoes, the bacon. My only complaint would be that they didn't offer egg whites nor the potatoes And bacon. Oh well. It was still plenty of food and really good.  The coffee??? Let me just say, wow! Right up my alley. Strong, robust and Very smooth. I'm not sure what brand, but super good. Didn't make my stomach nauseous as some do.  I assume the owner, or one of them, was going table to table checking on things. Very accommodating. Nice touch.  If you're looking for something different for breakfast, give this place a try.

6IIQ1L4RkEF3RJ-qzfR71A.text: Dropped by Vovomeena on a weekday to grab some delicious brunch fixings with a friend. Parking was pretty easy and we were able to get in and order right away which was great! You put in your order at the counter, walk over to the coffee bar if you got a coffee drink, and then sit down with your number and wait for your food to come out.   I was in a super french toast mood so I went with the orchard french toast and of course got a side of the spuds. I also grabbed a japanese cold brew because come on, you can't pass up on coffee. Now in terms of the food, the french toast was deeelicious. Sweet without being too overwhelming and definitely a good portion for the price. Man the spuds were so good, they almost overshadowed the main dish! They were really well seasoned and tasted great by themselves and with hot sauce! The japanese cold brew didn't really meet my expectations, but I'll probably try out a different coffee drink when I'm there next time.   Service was great and the food was delicious so I can definitely see myself dropping by again!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spuds!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orchard french toast!

WyNtVx-ZMhbjdr34Aa-r2A.text: Just got off the plane and this was our first stop.  Holy moly was this freakin' delish.  7 of us ate.  EVERYONE was happy from age 8 to 70.  Do not miss the Mexican Benedict.  I will be dreaming about the meal and the coffee for months!

DfTOJoD_3S4TFAqMmg-n9A.text: Food is good but better to go on weekdays than weekends. I ordered the biscuits and gravy very delicious. My date ordered the potatoes and they are homemade with links.

Tmlxj02C465fj0zTv4L7EQ.text: I really wanted to like this place after reading all the reviews, but unfortunately I just didn't like it. I got the black stone scramble and it was very very bland. And for the $10+ I paid, I felt I could have just made it myself at home. Don't get me wrong, the restaurant is very cleanly and the staff superb. The open kitchen is a nice touch as well.

fJI_bpu3elbHhcwbUQeI_w.text: Tried this place today based on the reviews. The service was excellent , hence the four stars. The pain Perdu was delicious but the other food was just ok. The blackstone scramble had a different taste, probably due to the pork shoulder, not that it was bad we just didn't like it. The ordering system worked just fine, grab a menu, order, then they seat you. Nice concept

A9Id0W6_0wIIEzPmMg-4vQ.text: HOLY COW! GO PEOPLE GO!  This place is amazing, AH-mazing! I still couldn't believe that it took me this long to find and try this place out. The food here is unbelievably delicious. I have the Mexican benedict and my fiance had the orchard french toast. Wow! It was so worth the drive. Both dishes were outstanding. There were no wait when we went but I'm sure breakfast hours must be packed. Service was okay, nothing bad.   I recommend going around noon or so. It helps with parking and there's no line. I can't wait to go back again when I'm in phoenix.   YUM!

Xl4A9wt9CWRw5sYhVbdHNg.text: My friend and I decided to try this little Phoenix breakfast spot!! I ordered French toast banana pudding !! It was absolutely delicious it was like eating dessert !!! I really don't love French toast but wanted to try it . I'm soo glad I did it was moist and very tasty . Service was friendly to . The only caveat is it's parking can be congested since it shares it with other restaurants but who cares right? When the food is that good!!! I will try it again maybe try a different dish.

Hj0gRc_--loYWXnn5IHUww.text: This small coffee shop was amazing. Great customer service, good vibes and great coffee! I also ate brunch here and the food was delicious. Little on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for. Parking was a little annoying, but we made it work.   I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a quick bite and some caffeine in a clean, quiet environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

n8YF3qcaK_CjftlQkWcC1g.text: If I could give 12 stars on the Moonshine Cold Brew alone....I would, and hard.    This gold establishment takes cold brew coffee to a whole new realm of  "MORE Sir, YUSS'PLEASE!"  Mouthwatering and mind-bending combinations like chocolate-basil and lavender-mint fresh flavors IN MY CRISP COLD BREW???     Clearly, the fella behind these masterful concoctions deserves a nobel peace prize and about 64 high-fives for his exquisitely crafted cardiovascular-zapping efforts.       Me:      *Sip*   *makes O-face* The Scientist:     Creme? Me:     No thank you, she's perfect.  *Golf clap*  The food....maybe later, I'm so gushin'on the Moonshine my food is going to get cold :)

zCwJ77kCaJ0DKCWW14F8bg.text: Small, local breakfast eatery.  Needed a breakfast fix after a long trip.  Where else to turn, but to my fellow Yelpers.  It is a little hidden from the street, but an excellent find.   Vovomeena has no pretenses.  Pick a menu, order at the counter/cashier, get a number and wait.  If you don't know the drill you might feel a bit lost at first.   The small outdoors dining area is quaint and shared with other businesses.  The morning dine time was quiet and peaceful.   Ordered the Johnny Cakes.  These are 2 large corn 'pancakes'.  Fresh corn and green chiles are dotted throughout, with strawberries on top.  Crispy on the outside, moist and flavorful inside.  A definite recommendation.  These are served with sweet rice and a choice of bacon and sausage.  The sausage had a good bite with plenty of texture.  Nice. The rice seemed like an afterthought, but was tasty nonetheless.   Overall a good dining experience and recommended for a delicious meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Johnny cakes w/ green chile

VkipJTLwrkCsnDl2Jj29kQ.text: Brunch porn. Soft yolk dripping all over the place...ohh baby. This place is amazing and the cold drip coffee is to die. The menu is small but mighty. Very cute little spot that looks like the inside of an instagram. I love coming here on Saturday mornings for a quick bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The French Toast is to die for.

Eym-aNM7vCipZMGQ_ckSdg.text: My friend wanted to take me to breakfast and when she mentioned the place I was thrilled to try it out, being from out of town and judging by the reviews it was worth the try.  The interior was beautiful. I absolutely loved the decor, it was simple and clean. Even the bathroom was designed well. You order your food first and then seat yourself at a table. Beware of large brunch crowds.   The food alone was wonderful. The meals were perfection and prepared with the slightest simple yet effective touch. What really drew me to the place was the flight of cold brew, what a genius idea!! We ordered a mexican benedict and a BOMC. The benedict was exactly what I expected, its presentation was great and the chorizo definitely gave off it's mexican flavor. The BOMC was spectacular. The portion is enough for two and easily one of my favorite dishes, even though I haven't tried anything else.....it was just that good. The pork chop was tender and wasn't too seasoned so the pork flavor alone was enlightening. The waffle was a perfect sweetness and my eggs were as good as scrambled eggs can be. The portuguese donut it was paired with was cute, light and powdered with sugar. I didn't have much of it because I was already extremely full from the dish, which was bittersweet. I had a iced latte with vanilla and it was great, smooth and sweet. We also had the flight which will get you to that coffee high. I can't remember the names of the brews but the jalapeno one was interesting, though wouldn't be my first choice.  I would recommend the restaurant to any breakfast or coffee aficionado. If I'm ever in the area again I would love to stop by. I hope to try some of their other establishments if ever the opportunity arose.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple, effective and great decor in the bathroom
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict, BOMC w a flight of 3 cold brews.

KPEWXnK_s6dIs_98PQ5hTg.text: LOVE this place. Everything we've tried (tortilla Espanola, banging pocket, johnnycakes, savory crepe, and the Providence) were all excellent. The coffee is fantastic. The flow for counter service is a little confusing on the first visit, but on our most-recent trip, the guy at the coffee bar was doing a great job directing traffic and explaining the process to the first-timers with confused expressions. The breakfast sausage is the best around; it tastes like it's cooked in the rendered fat from a slow-roasted pork shoulder--layer upon layer of porky deliciousness that gets Vovomeena a fifth star.

MVL5OT1lHHyRNuRALpHEqg.text: I'm from Rhode Island so the minute I saw the menu I started laughing. I also called my grandmother vovo - so I immediately felt like I had to try to this place. I mean, Portuguese donuts? Say no more. YUM! They have a delicious breakfast selection. I just had the coffee and a donut today - but we are going back this weekend for the breakfast. The staff is friendly and the decor is wicked awesome (Inside Rhodey joke). I just wish they served Portuguese linguisa sausage. :0)

RdVU2pKZmRCKfefjmG24eg.text: I'll give it a five star! First the place, very unique, nice art work outside the building. Second, the people that work there are very nice. The person in charge or the owner? (not sure who checked on us on how we're doing.) But thanks for checking on us. Third, the food was fantastic! We got the b.m.o.c and the blackstone scramble and i cannot pass the opportunity to try the japanese cold brew coffee, i got the flight o'-  black tea, orange peel & ginger, lemon & jalapeno. It was very unique! The downside was they ran out of hollandaise sauce for the mexican benedict that's why we ordered blackstone scramble instead. I will come back for sure!

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. B.m.o.c -smoked pork chop on top of a waffle with 2 eggs and portuguese donut tower. I died.

iHOKUKW25pL-b0IyTE4s2w.text: When a midweek brunch can bring back fond nostalgia of flavors from a childhood you never had, it's a big win. First, let's talk Mornin' Moonshine, shall we? Truly a stellar coffee product that is created with care and precision that you can taste. It's as artful as it is delicious.   I knew it was more than I could eat, but I had to order the b.m.o.c., which is a waffle topped with a pork chop and eggs. This dish is also garnished with a Portuguese donut. My husband ordered the savory crepes, which were topped with a red pepper sauce that replaces ketchup in my book.   Truly satisfying, tasty and the service was top-notch despite the order-at-the-counter-and-pick-a-seat setup.

SUv00ornc4cDrrv1Vj9WlA.text: It's no surprise this place is rated as high as it is. Another cool spot in PHX. Had the b.m.o.c. and it was pretty incredible. The combination of a fried egg over a smoked pork chop on top of a waffle was f'ing amazing.

l6t87BWowzGRdbm2NLrPyg.text: Got my family addicted to this place. It's the only place they want to brunch.  Happiness is a cold brew.  I love their cardamom flavored one,  they have plain and other flavors too every day.  I've had their whole menu and I love everything.

8XKN3RxGajAHAuTPB8ijfw.text: GREAT spot for breakfast and coffee! WE decided to try something new in the area, and Vovomeena is about the only place we haven't tried yet. I'm SUPER glad we tried it, as we'll probably be back this coming weekend. The menu is very simple, straight forward and to the point. they have close to 10 different menu items, a mix of omelettes, meats and breakfast dishes. I went with the Biscuits and Gravy with over easy eggs and a Vanilla latte. Wifey had this omellette with feta and a ton of veggies. My daughter went with the kids pancake and eggs, HUGE pancake that was easily enough for her to share with her daddy haha The sausage gravy was the perfect consistency, and the biscuits were done just right. Wifey LOVED her omelette as well. Teh coffee was also done just perfect. All in all, just a great meal at a cool little spot. we'll for sure be back!

_Ypl3igaFMSJ_Ionlrjung.text: Quite possibly my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix.  Working my way through the menu. Don't count out any specials. Love the outdoor patio, flies, not so much. My 1st breakfast was the Mexican Benedict, today it's the special, Portuguese scramble, eggs w/linguica, peppers & potatoes. Very filling!!

OLAoviSOZTtIGMVQWFcXcA.text: We love this place, and go there at least once a week, sometimes twice. It helps that we live walking distance away. Fantastic selection of very interesting and well done breakfast dishes, and wonderful Japanese style cold brewed iced coffee.   They have a dog friendly patio around the back, where the waitstaff bring our dogs water in dog bowls without even asking for it.   Even more impressive is the service. We were there today (Sunday) and the place was very busy. My wife ordered her favorite, apple and potato boxty. Some time after we ordered, but before we got served, they ran out of boxty. Kai, the manager, came over and offered her anything else on the menu. And then he did something I had only heard about from my parents, about how fine restaurants used to be run. He comped BOTH our meals in apology for running out of my wife's favorite. I thought this kind of service had gone the way of the dodo. I was blown away.

ahO8-M67zPglMUZujuq6PA.text: The best coffee I've ever had!! I also had the French toast w honey, marscapone cheese and grated apple. So delicious and the atmosphere is trendy and everyone working there was so friendly

d-zUsc6qhXYBdqiNNth-kQ.text: Interesting place.  I have been here a few times, generally because there is nowhere else to go.  The food is good (but weird and not in a way that you would brag to your friends) and the prices a little too high.    It's just okay but I like that I can sit outside and it is cozy and quiet.   Shout-out to Ryan and the vegan woman from Astor House -- you guys are the best.

OpiA6lNlRYHoC4CH78824A.text: I love the indie restaurants that fill up old buildings and provide a delicious meal in a warm, inviting space.  Brunch at Vovomeena was also enough to fill me up for the whole day.    Two of us had a BMOC and a pain perdu.  It was a nice combo, hearty, savory, sweet.  The BMOC's tender waffle is a counterpoint to all of the other goodness that smothers it while the smoked pork chop is in small pieces to make the eating easier.  Pain perdu is a luscious excuse to eat bread pudding for a meal!  Ask for the syrups and sauces on the side so that you can customize your sugar rush.  The ginger morning moonshine was good, but I'll probably pass on the next trip and there will be another visit in the plans soon.

WZFVWcjytaJnIRdDv-kjlw.text: This was my first time here this morning. I must say this was the best food ever! Good selection of food, the portions are huge!  Staff friendly. I will definitely be going back

94_9LcXLU5SLrFGtbwxJOw.text: Staff are friendly and they have great costumer  service. Food is great not greasy. The place is clean and has good ambiance. Their waffle and Mexican egg Benedict are my favorite, very tasty.

8en7jc6IL9Mucyb12tZfVw.text: I came here for the first time and I must say that the place was very clean and ultra cool! There are lots of healthy options when it comes to you for your choices. SzXDCKlJ4z0CCu14YX6MmQ.text: Cold brew coffee was good but I hated the donuts. I was expecting malasadas like I had in Hawaii, but they were nothing like it. AND they were served room temp!  SO disappointed! 1 star for the donuts and 4 for the coffee.

WLJI7aR4jhQnjX0-J2i5FA.text: Met one of my girlfriends for brunch on a Wednesday. It wasn't busy at all but the service was lackluster.   Whenever I go to a new spot, especially one with such great reviews, I'm eager to talk to the staff about their favorite dishes and drinks. When I approached them with my typical excitement and list of menu questions, they showed minimal interest and had dull responses. I even asked for recommendations and the cashier wasn't very enthusiastic about any of the items really. A Portuguese donut sounded interesting so I asked how they were and I was told they are, "just eh." Wow! I couldn't even believe it but I didn't order one because of it.   As a coffee addict I was pretty excited about the cold brew flight - but disappointed with all three flavors. They just weren't for me :( I'm not one to complain but I asked if I could just have a hot coffee instead. What was nice was one of the waitstaff refunded me the difference in price, even though I didn't ask to be. Even still, he just sort of awkwardly walked up to my table, handed me cash, mumbled that it was for the difference in price, and walked away. Not sure if I just caught the restaurant on an odd day or something but my entire service experience was just really was strange.   Both my friend's meal and my own tasted just okay. Nothing special about it. Pretty bummed because I was excited to find a new, cool brunch spot. On to the next one!

Ozn25ORxLo6-L53MVWwASQ.text: What a fun place. Delicious coffee!!  The decor is spontaneously surreptitious and valiant. I liked the rope decor and the folks there were friendly. I had the enormous pancakes which were as cakey as a cake can be. My son, Pogo, had the biscuits and eggs which he described as "voluminous" and "good". My wife enjoyed the veggie burrito which I tried and loved it!  Really good place and delish! Highly recommend this little gem in a gem of a town.

d2GYFT1NdzDKIhO3a8MGow.text: This is a solid breakfast joint for sure. The Johnny cakes were delicious, highly recommend it. They are corn based with bits of fresh corn with a hint of chili. They aren't spicy and have a really great complex flavor. We also ordered the waffle with eggs and a bacon. All were solid. You order at the register, take a number, and seat yourself.

vZ4dO4N6cZsvzMiUXuDgHg.text: This place overall has a good vibe and the food is different but really good. It can be a little pricey but your paying for the quality of the food. As you wait in line you can watch them make fresh food from scratch. Recommend it if you're looking to try something new and open to modernized Mexican food.

R4gp0N50MFr73-5K1yqq0A.text: Breakfast is delish! So awesome, it's really hard to find parking. The first time my kids and I went, line was out the door, but was worth the wait.

sOZZ_Vjc9NIg0vnyWnDYhA.text: I love this place, fresh delicious food. It is soooo good. They were friendly, and the service was really fast!!! Eat here, you won't be disappointed!!!

sn00dE0Yl5ZUmqed1aVrNQ.text: Yummy breakfast that is quicker than most sit down places. You walk in and the place is bustling on a weekday. I had the chorizo Benedict and it was good. Everyone else in my group enjoyed their breakfast and were all satisfied with the speed and quality. Will be back when in the Phoenix area

w8Vos5gD_JZrLSOn8vUF1g.text: We went for breakfast on Sunday morning, and managed to beat the rush. The decor is fun, albeit totally hipster. There's a great little patio which you'll totally find me on, once the weather isn't so damn miserable. The menu is small, but mighty, and there are oodles of things we want to go back to try.   Now, I realise that I'm one of the few less-than-four-star reviews, but I have good reason! I would have given this place 5 stars, had it not been for two things that made me knock off a couple stars.   But first, let me start with the really good stuff: the food. In general. We got the Johnnycakes and the Mexican Benedict to share. The star was the johnnycakes. They sounded interesting, but neither of us were prepared for the incredible flavours. The cakes themselves are actually pretty savory, with whole kernels of corn, and green chilis. They've got texture, and a little bit of a kick, and by themselves are so good. Pair them with arroz con leche, strawberries, and syrup, and you've got a flavour combination that is enough to wake up any pallette! I made sure to get some of the cake (with syrup), some of the arroz con leche, and a strawberry on to my fork... wow. Just wow. Green chilis and maple syrup are not a combination I would have imagined being tasty, but damn! The savory with the sweet was just the right balance. And the bacon it came with was thick-cut and damn good.   The Mexican Benedict was pretty great, too. The chorizo was the real deal! But, here's where I took off a star... the eggs were overcooked. You can't have eggs benedict with overcooked eggs. The yolks weren't runny, which is the best part! Solid yolks were a total disappointment. I had to take a star off. I was so looking forward to runny yolks, mixed in with the chorizo. The potatoes also contributed to my removing a star or two... they were just blah. Nothing special. Not a lot of flavour. Compared to the flavour of the johnnycakes and the chorizo, I expected something a little more interesting, even if they are "just potatoes". Not a lot of seasoning, and I think they may have been cooked with onions, only one small sliver of onion made it on to my plate with the potatoes. Boo.   The other reason I took off a star: the coffee. They're all about their Japanese cold brew stuff. My lady friend LOVES cold brew coffee, and ordered a coffee float, with vanilla bean gelato. Mind you, the cold brew was one of the main reasons we went there. Sadly, her coffee was so bitter it was practically undrinkable. I'm not a fan of coffee, but even I could tell it was way more bitter than it should have been, when I tasted it. So that was extremely disappointing.   We'll be back, and I may give the benedict another go, but this time if the eggs are overcooked, I'll be sending it back. Yes, I'll be that dude. Same with the coffee. I'd love to see them do something to amp up the eggs, especially since the rest of their food has so much going for it. It's sad to see the potatoes fall flat. We are excited to try the other things on the menu... it's just a shame that the things we were most looking forward to fell kind of flat.   But those johhnycakes though!!!

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

_7dMVaK1e3Ze7YW4OMroOw.text: Never would have found this place if not for yelp and holy freaking moley the biscuits n gravy are on the flavour train!!!! I will not eat biscuits n gravy anywhere else cause what's the point after eating theirs, the cold brew coffee was also the best I have had (nitro excluded) worth a stop just for the coffee! Boomshockalacka!!!!

fWSEZZo1voYHkrwGTUojAg.text: You will receive everything, expected. This establishment is warmly operated from beginning to end. Will return again and also bring extended family. These recipes are delicious to seasoned travelers and to eat at home families.The normal annoying pits of service found elsewhere are no where here!

XpvN_XKYk0QmBQ5pRCXYNQ.text: Excellent local breakfast/brunch cuisine and coffee. Friendly management, plenty of seating.

fCE2OsF5H6-4-chVBeA5dg.text: Phoenix is literally littered with restaurants.  With a pizza places opening up on every bloody corner saturating the market with tomato sauce and charred crusts, to concept restaurants taking over the world, there seems to be a new "hang out" brewery or up and coming hot spot on every corner.  I have been coming to Phoenix now for 6 years back and forth and have tried a multitude of the culinary prowess here in the land of cactus and hipsters mixed with pretentious yoga moms who talk incessantly about their new diets and fired trainers.  It seems unlikely that the boom is ever going to end.  Frankly its a bit daunting and pretty stinkin hard to keep up with them all opening and closing.  But......it is good to know that there are a few places that seem to never loose their food edge.  I apparently stumbled on one today.  Vovomeena is a quaint, ugh...what a stupid word quaint, little gem of of 7th Ave and McDowell tucked behind some of the more annoying chain spots that surround it.  You have to get a menu first and decide what you want before you sit down, which I think is brilliant as it only makes me want to punch the jerk faces in the nostrils when they walk into a small spot with their whole family and their stupid dog in a bag and plop down just to "save" their seat.  You people deserve to wait.  You are no more important than the people who are going along with the restaurants rules and regs to keep the flow.    Once you decide off their beautifully minimal menu of about 12 or so items you make you way to the counter, order, grab your number and THEN sit down.  The service is also minimal.  I happen to like that.  They take your order, bring you your food and leave you the hell alone.  They ask if you need anything else and go away.  You are left to get your own coffee and water, which is right around the corner basically from anywhere you are sitting, unless on the patio.  Again I like that.  It cuts down on all the hoopla and stupid speak which, truthfully, unless you are obsessed with yourself, you don't really want to talk about anyway ESPECIALLY AT BREAKFAST!!  I drank to much last night and I want food, good food and coffee and some bloody peace and quiet, so thank you staff.  Not to say they lack anything as they will hop right to if you do, but you are pretty much left to fend.  I ordered the waffle and pork chop with poached eggs and a perfectly crisp beignet plopped right on top.  Whoa doggy it was delicious, every last bite, because I destroyed it like fat kid at Christmas.  I wanted to high five the cooks but they were busy so I gave a verbal "brilliant" to the one who was eyeballing me to see if I liked his food.  Seriously people this place is really quality.  My normal haunt is Matt's Big Breakfast or Dicks Hideaway but I have officially got a new fave in the valley.  Thank you FOH Staff and Kitchen of Vovomeena, I will be back to try the rest of the menu and bring my appetite for more of you yummy goodness.  Cheers.

rgX_iwmWLiLNSvr5ZcZZwA.text: Wow! This place is fantastic...the food, the staff and the indoor outdoor seating options are great. We generally have a rule that when visiting a new city, we don't eat at the same place twice...but rules were made to be broken!  We had the b.m.o.c., the Mexican Benedict and the banger pocket. The b.m.o.c. Pork chop was moist and tender, the waffle light and crisp and the accompanying prickly pear syrup was a perfect finish. The Mexican Benedict was equally delicious with flavorful chorizo, perfectly poached eggs and a very good hollandaise to top it off, all on a crisp sope. The banger pocket was good and a hearty portion. Of the three is wasn't our favorite, but if we were hung over it probably would have been!  Get a jug of Morning Moonshine and a cream cheese muffin if you need something before your meal arrives, which on this morning our food arrived quickly and hot.  The staff was also attentive, friendly and engaging. If you are in Phoenix, this is a must eat stop.

QZW3N2WD96REgxs_nGb0xA.text: Stopped here with my sis on the way back from the airport. Nice quaint little place. The food wasn't spectacular but nice options and definitely a better experience than the local chains like IHOP and Denny's. A little pricey would be my only complaint - $38 for 2 breakfasts and a coffee drink. Still it's definitely worth trying.

hTmx_rOoOD4kDbuwosSIXQ.text: I went here a few months ago during a cross country road trip and I must say this was one of the best places that we stopped by. The blackstone scramble was SO GOOD and it made you that good full where you're not contemplating life afterwards. The vibe there is very homey and cozy, perfect for brunch! MY bf got the bmoc which he enjoyed, although I think my blackstone scramble blew his meal out of the water :)

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC - 7/10
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackstone Scramble - SOOOOO GOOD!!!

dMOZYmB5brPJYnoCHFmL1A.text: I got the french toast and a Japanese cold brew. Cold brew was AMAZING. French toast was a little deflated, but great flavor.

6nbXn9tKhVzH2pqeRU46eg.text: Vovomeena having amazing breakfast and was the best breakfast that I have in my vacation to Tuscon, Phoenix & Sedona.  My parents normally have a traditional chinese breakfast and they love the food here too.  The  pain perdu - a bread pudding French toast - looks and tasted delicious as posted by many Yelpers and I agree.  I also order the Mexican Benedict and was really good.  I really wanted to swing back again before my trip was over but unfortunately I was not able to make it.  The sausages was good meat.  Ordering  & Seating can get confusing for newbie : So here is a recap (please click helpful)   1) There is a front (Bigger parking lot) & back entrances (smaller parking lot - you see the coffee barrister & the restroom if you enter thru here - go to front to order.). 2) Don't get a seat ,  you have to "ORDER FIRST" before you get seated ( The ordering is near the front entrance ) 3) After you order and paid you get a NUMBER. 4) You take that NUMBER and get on another line by the wall  across from the coffee barrister This is where the manager will find seats for you. 5) The process seem to be okay as I was able to get at seat 10 mins after I order and paid. 6) After I got seated , I probably got my food in another 8-10 mins.     For the great food, I feel okay for this process.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get on line to order and pay before you get seated
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain perdu
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

0mI0NEC69AFZNIJT_yyf9w.text: I've been wanting to try Vovomeena for some time, but I never go downtown. My husband and I stayed overnight at the Westin downtown for his company's holiday party and I knew it was fate that I would finally get to try it. I figured it would be busy, but it seems that they have an efficient system for seating guests after they've placed their orders. The breakfast was delicious and hopefully we'll get a chance to go back again soon!

JsV9avcrIcLTFkPchm8riw.text: The only bad thing to say about Vovomeena is the long lines I often encounter, which is because they are such a great breakfast spot. I highly recommend Vovomeena to people who are looking for unique brunch/breakfast fare and are tired of the same meals that is offered everywhere else.

wkrJB5rz1XdYf3KNj6oE7A.text: I don't know if the Yelposphere knows this, but there are things called "sopes" or "picaditas" and they're basically thick ass tortillas and Vovomeena serves them as a base to their chorizo benedict and I am truly dead. I have died from deliciousness.   On another note, the manager has been there since inception and he was super great and attentive throughout our brekky. Go here!

xNX1WtQ1JcgZNHiy_HSjHQ.text: Great customer service and excellent food  genuinely enjoyed our first time! We were greeted upon arrival and asked if it was our first time. A kind gentleman then walked us to the menus area showed us the ordering process and helped us with our choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NtcjNIMNIRShMzgyCN064g.text: Went here for a nice, fairly quiet meal; enjoyed my banger wrap.  Two different people came by to ask how the meal was and I was told they recycle the plastic cups, YEA!!  Wish every place did that...  My only disappointment was the potatoes; the thickly cut pieces tended to be dry and not crispy enough for me.  I would suggest they slice them a bit thinner.

Yze_44LexvqV5d2JTldAlw.text: First time here, found this place looking through yelp. By the looks of the pictures the food looked great but once tasting it, it was really good my partner and i will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V1C_q29F60H7eUPLsaoCFg.text: This restaurant is my favorite for french toast days.  They have an Orchard French Toast that has fresh slivers of green apple and a sauce you could die for.  Delicious!  But don't go on Sundays cause that's when I am there and I need the table.

ZwgF8BnKMTeovhKjd7MozA.text: So delicious! Loved the orchard French toast and my son had biscuits and gravy. Coffee was very good. Staff was kind and helpful. Loved the decor and vibe. This will be at the top of the list next time I'm in Phoenix.

0AnI_tsJLQi6bBNmnk-s3w.text: This is my second visit and trying a different plate each time. Everything I have ordered is amazing !  This visit was the Mexican Benedict. This dish was so delicious and good size portions. To drink I got a cold drip coffee which is very good. Overall I'll keep visiting to try a new dish!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AJ_mwAF2lUfPMTwqk3v-hw.text: My boyfriend & I was visiting Phoenix for the weekend and saw this adorable gem on yelp. With all the positive reviews, we decided to give it a try. I got the Tortilla Espanola & he got the pork chop with waffles. & Let me tell you... this place lives up to all those good yelp reviews! I am so in love with the flavors of both dishes & the waffle was amazingly soft. I wish I lived closer to here so that I can visit this place more often :'(

NwCKj5JIHr2gueicJdnT_g.text: Another incredible experience at this locally owned eatery!  From the impeccable service, food and decor to the unique fresh menu items!  I love this place and have for years!  Thank you so much!

b7i9d1ZrpDZdb-CB7mz2Kg.text: Found this place on Yelp. It is back in the corner of an area with small businesses so be sure to drive towards the end. Great menu. Quite unique. I had the Mexican Eggs Benedict and my buddy had the Blackstone Scramble. Clean plates afterward. They offer outdoor seating as well. Highly recommend.

dkJHbckfGF56GKedOc4o5A.text: We had a fantastic brunch here and I'm so looking forward to coming back and working my way through the rest of the menu! We tried the biscuits and gravy and French toast- so many dishes looked incredible!  Everyone who we encountered working there was so friendly, looking forward to a return visit*

vdfrZONdR4JotIH2NhdUoA.text: Fantastic brunch spot! We chose this place at random for our group of 3 to grab brunch on a Sunday around noon. It was busy but we got a table within 5 minutes of ordering. Everyone loved the food! My husband had biscuits and gravy - he said it was incredible, he just wished the portion was bigger (much smaller than your typical biscuit & gravy portion). I had the bangin' pocket (essentially a breakfast burrito, but in a pita). It was delicious, and great portion size. Wish I would have tried their coffee. I can't wait to return!

mslbxiMsHv3AtoAWRLafwA.text: Vovomeena lived up to the hype.  I had been eyeballing their menu for some time and was really looking forward to trying the pain perdu (banana bread pudding French toast) and WOW, it was awesome. The only issue I had was that I wanted more and more.  The family all enjoyed their meals and had no complaints to note. I would definitely go back in hopes the cooks make a mistake and make my portion twice the size.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing!!!!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yoKLuNKD-xzJ3oGc5zopww.text: This place is great. Worth a try. Recommend not looking at yelp and just ordering what you find interesting

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banging pocket... It&#39;s a nice breakfast pocket. Foods great I just wish I ordered something no unique.

IVc5sCQGJUjwLkRmXs-GnA.text: I stopped here for breakfast at 6:30 am when they opened yesterday and the place had the prettiest decor! The food was great I had the Mexican eggs benedict. It was amazing, too bad I couldnt finish it all. My dining companion had the waffle that was amazing, as well. I had my first cold pressed coffee that was out of this world. I will for sure be back.

lXEZ_vYQRmzQvqHY-8cqpA.text: Big portions.   Enough to share.   Unique taste combinations.   BMOC was tender and the waffle was great.   I liked how you order and pay self serve beverages.     Will come back to try different dishes

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-i2bVZiyOiaaEJNXIY7OLQ.text: The breakfast was great, good quality and quantity of food, relaxing atmosphere. The ice coffee was perfect for this hot morning.

pT2l88ddW_woQj7MEdYmrQ.text: This has been our best breakfast we've had since we move here from Pennsylvania. I had the biscuits and gravy. The biscuit was the size of my hand and the gravy is the best I've had. We will be back to try the rest of the menu.

6RYTWBi4f_b1OG5rvUMlYw.text: Loved the food. A-little more pricey than the regular breakfast but the flavors are definitely worth it. Service was outstanding. Thank you so much for starting Sunday off so well.

gRgmi7Vsl0QMqZ76bzgbPQ.text: Try the banging pocket with extra Gouda per recommendation of one of the waiters. Good ambient and friendly staffs.

E3pFD4Ng0AYhWQr9J7fBow.text: The B.M.O.C  with large pork chops was grilled to perfection. Really like the charbroiled taste.  I will definitely come back to try some of the other items on the menu. It's sort of a 70" s theme.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The  owner

qnZnEWmTSCHPH4k8FQHMEA.text: Stopped in for a mid-morning breakfast and was absolutely delighted with my choice. I enjoyed the Johnnycakes (corn & chiles) with sweet rice and fried potatoes. The Johnnycakes were tender, crispy, and oh-so flavorful. The prickly pear maple syrup was smashing drenching the salty cakes. The sweet rice was like a breakfast rice & raisins dish and meshed perfectly with the savory cakes. The potatoes were crispy on the outside, cooked through within and flavored with crispy little onion slivers. The weather has become perfect for enjoying a meal outdoors - go for it!!

luTAW_WGbd0KE8lpdbnDWQ.text: Went for breakfast... It was very good. I also got a Portuguese doughnut, which to me was like a fluffier funnel cake, SO DELICIOUS! I can't wait to go back and try more menu items. The service was great, very friendly workers.

rW7c19Ga9DR9aJ96Wx1_FQ.text: I really liked this place.  I got the BMOC and enjoyed it for the most part.  I think the promise of a big porkchop got me thinking of a regular grilled pork chop, but this was cured like ham.... so it was essentially a big chop of ham.  It was still tasty... and I probably should have expected ham for brunch instead of a regular seasoned porkchop.... but yeah.  Aside from that minor, brief disappointment, the meal was filling and good.    One of my friends got a french toast dish... totally sweet and delicious... and probably best as a dessert.  Another friend got the mexican benedict dish which was quite flavorful.    The flight of coffee samplers were interesting... especially the lemon/jalepeno coffee.    Nothing life-changingly amazing, but a very solid brunch place.

43Lxt_M_R3szQM2Kk1OIhw.text: This was the best breakfast place I have encountered by far. The food was out of my world. It had the best authentic flavors, quality ingredients, and spectacular ingredients to enhance the savory food together as a whole.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 sister omelet. 3 eggs, feta cheese, moz, zuc, black beans, corn, choice of spuds or meat. I got the turkey sausage. SAVORY
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain perdu. -so moist and full of flavors to die for. Best savory entree by far.

tCN3Ml8mVM8d95z0jeYy3A.text: Came here with a group of 4 for breakfast. The most popular items were the biscuits and gravy, 3 sisters omelet, and Mexican Benedict. The banger pocket was just ok. Good outdoor seating and unlimited coffee!

I-ULoWlhdy-N98g8PQn_Ow.text: Amazing breakfast. The food is really good. Definitely a spot I'll be going back to. And I don't even care for breakfast.
