photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orchid French toast. Yum

KTGnQCvf2-X3y8Xiw4tpAQ.text: Busy little brunch place in Central Phoenix.  Portions are HUGE.  Great food and coffee!  Will definitely be coming back!

DR6aG03QgIptrDqHHWL-5g.text: Wow! I had a great breakfast! The BMOC. Who would've thought that a pork chop would pair so well with a waffle? It was tied together perfectly with apple compote and maple syrup. Topped with two eggs sunny side up, it was the perfect combination of savory and sweet. I was pleasantly surprised that the pork chop was smoked,  which really made it pop! On the side was a warm Portuguese donut, which is like a fritter, only less dense and sprinkled with powdered sugar. Although very oily, it was sweet and delicious. The coffee was excellent, roasted locally in Cave Creek.   The atmosphere of the restaurant was modern and traditional fused together. It's small, but well lit, and family friendly. I was intrigued by the walk up format and the tiny front kitchen. It is a wonder that they work so efficiently and quickly there. The service was fast and friendly. The prices were good, nothing more than $12, and the majority of the small menu breakfast entrees were $8-9. A great value.  I do believe I've found my new favorite breakfast diner!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC

QfbSc29KSUOCXkX2YoPOQQ.text: This is a good spot. Very tasty breakfasts. The guys at the counter is alway very nice to me and is very informative about the menu selections.  Speaking of the menu. The food here alone would have gotten this review 5 stars. This menu is a mixture of southwestern Midwestern American classics. I give the food 6 stars.   The problem is signage. You have no idea where to end and where to begin in there. Am I supposed to order coffee here? My meal here? I'm confused. The process  layout gets 2 stars.   Overall this is a quality restaurant.

ngq6z-PKxfNRARlydcI3xQ.text: The Mexican omelette is pretty good. It is a little spicy so be aware of that. The bread is also a little different unlike normal Eggs Benedict. Hubby got the pancakes and bacon and it was also very good typical diner pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

FDm5v7eT9lU2f3tt2r7AUQ.text: Our family loves to have our Sunday breakfast here. Classic cafe style, with excellent food and coffee is superb. Any option on the menu I've chosen has been delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Racing her pops to the Pancakes*

OQSuPr_5Gv7Y7Jc7Dw3EBg.text: My favorite breakfast spot by far. Vovo has an intriguing ambiance and a creative menu. The food is always excellent and the iced coffee rules over all others. Don't go during prime breakfast hours or you risk having a disappointing experience; it gets waaay busier than it's queuing model has the capacity to handle.   Many favor matt's big breakfast over vovo, but I don't get it; matt's is boring by comparison.

Xer50xAk75q9zhIh9w_m0Q.text: Well, I gave Vovomeena another shot and I'm glad I did. From the very beginning the customer service was pleasant and attentive. The restaurant was bustling with smiling people enjoying their meals. I tried the pawtucket west: two LARGE fluffy and yummy tasting pancakes with choice of meat, (I had bacon) and skillet potatoes. My hubby had the BMOC: which was beautifully done and tasty: waffle, pork chop, eggs and a freshly made donut on top. I had this coffee, they seem to specialize in, and it was really good, really. Sometimes we have to give places another chance, I'm glad I did for Vovomeena. (Random: the decor everywhere is well done and intriguing, even in the restroom. hahaha).

aXRPQ8YN1dBboUCqd8B2iw.text: Small place with amazing food and even better coffee.  Can be busy at times, but worth the wait for sure.  If traveling through Phoenix this is definitely a place to try at least once, you won't be disappointed.

iTbaEiAGeV3tymzW0uh5Vw.text: What can I say? The food was delicious. The service is friendly and efficient. The atmosphere is comfortable, positive, and relaxed.  It is a little on the pricey side with most of the entrees in the $12.00 range for breakfast.  With that being said, the biscuits and gravy is to die for!    The food is always fresh, full of flavor, complemented by a cozy environment.

IT13-QpRm7VACIRVUi9o7A.text: Such a fun place. Casual atmosphere and great food. I loved the coffee tasting! Very fun and unique flavors.

5YH26NVbrEbsR06QYGld5A.text: Finally made it to this little gem that is on the corner of 7th Ave and McDowell.  Wow, it was so good!  I would call this counter service, you order at the register than take your table.  After that your food is brought to you and everything else is just like a regular restaurant.  The menu is made up of the normal breakfast and brunch items and then the other items are things that you normally wouldn't think of but of boy, did they sure look and smell good when they went by us.  Our party had the famous biscuits and gravy -YUMMY; Blackstone Scramble - YUMMY and then the Banging Pocket - YUMMY!!  Next time I'm getting the Pain Perdu because it looked and smelled so good.  The service is top notch and everything was very clean.  They have indoor and outdoor seating available and dogs are welcomed on the patio. I would highly recommend Vovomeena for breakfast/brunch.

xJJTOItCeFB--IPk9nSBKw.text: If you blink or sneeze while looking for this place on the south east corner of Mcdowell and 7th Ave. you will miss it. You grab a menu prior to being seated, get in line to order with the cashier. Once you pay, you'll be given a number, then you can sit at a table.  I had the pancakes, with sausage and two eggs. Delicious!! The syrup is so tasty. You serve your own coffee but juice can be grabbed right before paying. No servers to wait on you, they just bring out your food and you aren't bothered again. It's a bit loud due to poor acoustics and folks chattering. I do not recommend bringing kids, more of an adult restaurant.

XyCFwBTfTsOKkPN7mOop3A.text: I was really impressed with the speed at which the food came out. It was hot and very delicious. The prices are good and the staff is friendly.

Qwc3HrZ5Iy5XNcuIGRX6XA.text: I've been raving about this place, letting everyone know to come to this little neighborhood breakfast gem.  It is behind some restaurants, but a great find. It catches your eye when you see a line out the door!    As you go to order, food is being prepared right in front of you.   I ordered what people talk about, the Pain Perdu.  The thing that stuck out for me was the Whiskey caramel sauce!  It covers the banana bread pudding french toast and is accompanied with two thick slices of bacon.  It is topped with slices of fresh banana.    Some very comforting dishes if you are in the mood for something sweet or down right tasty they have it all.  Also ordered was the mexican benedict.  It was made with deliciously poached eggs, having a mix chorizo, tomato, onion, it had memorable flavor.   Reasonable breakfast prices with tasty selections.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu with whiskey sauce
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect poached eggs
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. In line to order

SehRySAJvjB4y3QHSIx07A.text: 5 stars for a yummy breakfast, great atmosphere and fabulous coffee!  My husband and I were pretty hungry as were looking for more of a brunch option around 11ish on a Tuesday. And this place had some awesome reviews on Yelp, and it did not disappoint!  I ordered the egg and bacon sandwich on a croissant with home fries and my husband ordered the biscuits and gravy. We both ordered a coffee each. After ordering you food/drink at the register, the coffee station is was located next to the register with hot coffee (decaf as well) and they also featured a Japanese cold brewing area, which was very interesting to watch against the coffee bar wall.  After ordering, everything is self serve. Also for any coffee snubs, they also offering lump sugar, either raw or white. As well as, various milks for your coffee. Also have a water area with cups.  Our meal was so delicious, just want we wanted! The vibe was laid back and the atmosphere was hip. They also had outdoor seating. Next time, I'd love to try the pain perdu.

H_TXc5hbZLrWI5sfikdlGA.text: Had breakfast this morning and it was good as always had the Johnny cakes and sausage and potatoes all was amazing

5zH7qYgj_BTI-FcjcU3TvQ.text: Based on the reviews I was expecting A LOT more. We ordered the Mexican Benedict and the pork shoulder with eggs and tortilla.  I ate the Mexican Benedict, it was good. I prefer my Benedict to be a little more flavorful and to have more hollandaise.   If we make it back here we will have to try the bread pudding French toast... it sounds delicious.

9T2XlReCO5bWj9EwjkwfXw.text: There was so many things I wanted to try on the menu but I ended up getting the orchard French toast which was super delicious. I can't wait to go back and try more.

kC1aoP-78zq-0-JcwIBzcQ.text: The bmoc was okay. The only good about this place is the smoked pork. Waffles were soaked in syrup so very sweet. The donut is the most failed part of this. Doesn't taste fresh. However the smoked pork was tender and juicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cvCEw61_d78zryw49tgTrQ.text: The service here is super fast! They have a great system set up. You order your food, get a number, go to the drink counter to claim your drink and wait for the manager to seat you afterwards. It is free seating though so you can easily have someone in your party find a table while you order. The food was good. I love their potatoes, very flavorful. Its a mexican/latin breakfast joint. The chamomile tea was disappointing because it was sweet..chamomile tea is not meant to be sweet/I did not get a disclaimer that it was sweetened. I got the mexican benedict which was good.

6tZFJw_Cl2dCmQX601AUoQ.text: I have been here about 4 times.   Originally I was excited about their eclectic menu and decor, but now things are just not adding up for me.    My eggs were over cooked, dry and bland, while the potatoes are thick, not cooked enough and starchy (others may enjoy this).   I also am weary of standing in line to order, then another line for drinks, then another line for a table.  I sat outside and while I was being attacked by flies and not enjoying their iced tea which to me is do bitter it tastes like coffee got blended into it, I realized that the tables are so narrow that I couldn't read a magazine while eating my food.    I wondered was I just being a cranky pants that needed more caffiene or was the original hope and promise that I was enticed by just not working for me at vovomeena.   I think you can tell what I landed upon.  Sorry vovomeena.

y8QWxlnrQ5j2YI_p29lg1w.text: It was ok nothing special. Mine was rather bland (tortilla espanola). Coffee was a little strong for my likening as well.   It was new to try however. The process of ordering I have never done.

97Ov1MaUJ4Ug6v-Gq__YXQ.text: The best place in Phoenix for breakfast. It's this tiny little spot with kitschy decor, fresh flowers on every table and great food at reasonable prices. Best staff, too. There aren't enough good things to say about this place. Self serve coffee bar  and everything prepared fresh every day. I love it.

ljpaS6iLOBYdcxcHF_NEJw.text: I left a review for this place and saved it in draft mode after having a unpleasant experience here last year. The service was bad and the food just wasn't good. After taking my mom to Matt's during her visit here, I told her about this place since I had heard so many good things about it.  I ordered the B.M.O.C., my son had the biscuit & gravy & the pain perdu and my mom had the Pawtucket West, none of us were pleased, my eggs arrived cold and when I asked that it be placed in the microwave to warm up a helper stated "we don't have a microwave here" and walked off....needless to say I was refunded my money back for my meal while my mother & son opted to deal with what they had and not complain.  I originally came home and wrote a yelp review to which I was contacted by the owner and offered the opportunity to come back and have breakfast on him in an attempt to change my perception of this place. I agreed, and THOUGHT I saved my review in draft mode for an update of the original review in addition to the new one, but apparently I did not because it's gone. Anywho, although my firm is located less than a mile from here and my son attends the art school across the street, I have never felt the need to come back for that comp meal.   So I guess it's safe to just leave my 2 stars (which is only 2 because of the owner) and keep it moving. I will state that although the helper guy was extremely rude, the owner was very nice and accommodating and did everything in his power to appease me.

cUzVi_FaS99dhyPtqaICqw.text: We found this place on Yelp. It was off the beaten path from the convention center. When in cities for conventions, I like to venture to more local spots for good food. This place didn't disappoint.   I really liked the food here. I wouldn't eat here often because most of the food was on the heavier side, but it was really good. If you want pancakes, this place has really good ones.  They also have freshly squeezed orange juice.   The food came out fairly quickly.   Definitely go here for good breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great patio breakfast
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I don&#39;t often eat pancakes, but this pancake was very good. The potatoes were good too.

S9aVeEt0ICPLaQ3MaJftaA.text: Vovomeena is not for non-meat eaters. The menu is limited and offers little flexibility for vegetarians. Also, they have no fish or avocado on the menu. The tortilla was over cooked and bland, and was definitely not Spanish as suggested in the menu.   Vovomeena is also not for folks expecting decent customer service. If you're a disabled woman asking for a glass of water, then don't be surprised if you're asked to head to the water cooler and help yourself - "I don't bring water to the customers. Customers do it themselves"   Overall, extremely disappointed and would recommend to stay away!

GXrbKjTtk4L4AMIxTzJ8SA.text: Couple of things...  1.) Probably the best breakfast food I have had in a long time. Albeit, uber sinful, it was very delicious. I would give five stars, but...  2.) They could stand to figure out their seating situation. The seating is organized like a Carl Jr's (ordering food, get a number, then sit). This causes table chaos, because people come in, scope out a spot, then a representative from the table places the order. I call shenanigans, because my wife and I had to order than wait, then literally run to the first available table.   As we finished up, the line grew out the door, and I felt bad for the poor suckers who were going to give Vovomeena their cash, then have to stand and wait for a table to open up.   We were sure to let the manager know this problem, but not sure what's in store for their future.

RKexa8JxWSaYJBfdvM--iA.text: The coffee is so good it doesn't need sugar.  The orchard French toast is so good it doesn't need syrup.  Nice staff, food served quickly.  Great place.

_tRTTHNpeDRGcqyIrzMEBw.text: I'll set another scene for you...in a strange city and foodie breakfast tendencies kick in...Yelpers recommend Vovomeena!  Score!  The most difficult part was choosing savory or sweet.  I had the caramelized banana pudding French toast.  Wonderful!  Coffee, good and strong and they had almond milk.  The bacon was also super-lean.  Yum.  My comrades had the sopes with egg and chorizo and the chicken crepes and loved them both.  Bought some cold coffee with cardamom to go.  Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delish.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great YELP find!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0QJOJvSZCiKw0dXbIvzLMA.text: Really great breakfast! And equally important, the service (all off the employees) were so nice and helpful! I had the b.m.o.c. and my husband had the biscuits and gravy. We both got coffee and a cinnamon roll to go. Very satisfying meal and experience!   We will definitely be back!

9w7XKxHJIfvtgxOoolJmvg.text: Unfortunately, I was not a fan of the Mexican Benedict. The chorizo was very greasy and the sopes were stale. I was missing a perfectly toasted, crispy English muffin to soak up my poached eggs. My eggs were perfect but my friend's eggs were overcooked with hard-boiled yolks. I also sampled stale biscuits and gravy. Honestly, KFC has better biscuits. Maybe it was just an off day.   I DID enjoy the outdoor patio and order-at-the-counter/seat yourself nature of the place. Very causal place to hang out with friends over food and coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JqtnA8lhriJvZIPFpnJzGg.text: A nice experience. It was fun to watch the cooks while you stage to order. The online menu is a little hard to see but the mystery drew us in. Fresh, filling and flavorful. Pet friendly patio. If you feel they are too busy - put your brakes on and find your patience button. It is worth it!!! Tip: Some people ask questions when they order and that can cause a brief delay.  You'll have the same space and time.

MZ3sTApT5f5b1jVF-lRQBw.text: Oh. Em. Vee.   This was delicious. New favorite breakfast place obsession has commenced with this lovely little gem. Recommend the Savory Crepes (perfect amount of saucy goodness + cheese + egg) and the johnnycakes. Going to try the three sisters strata next.

FDdE8aSLhj8Le1kaFTAKbQ.text: Get the biscuits and gravy. It was the best I've ever had. It was worth the 20 minute line and then some. I'd stand in line for 2 hours foe that if it meant I could have it again.

e9DfF5NG02TNT_GLZzWnow.text: Doesn't quite crack the 'exquisite' barrier for me, but they've got it figured out. It's super tasty and manages to have a unique flavor. I had the weekday egg and veggie burrito with their chunky mild red sauce on the side. I'd eat here again, for sure.

PrC9sxPkhy_xRnC-93mn4g.text: Great food!  Very nice atmosphere. Pleasantly surprised by their unique menu. They also honor active duty service members and give a military discount. Highly recommended.  Will definitely revisit if I am ever in the area again.

HqqJSbt7xrd-SxkiGEFqVQ.text: Mexican Benedict!!!! It's a must everything about it is perfect!! I have gotten it twice delish!!!

Sf4Cc4q8FYBWXNcnr8ieTQ.text: I've been meaning to come in since I had my bday dinner at How do you Roll? Finally made it in with the fam!   I was super excited to try the Japanese cold brew. We had heard awesome things and boy, it did not disappoint! We had a flight of 3 different kinds - lemon jalapeno, med, and ginger cardamom. They were all delicious. The first one you could really taste the lemon, not so much the jalapeno, the med was nice and bold, and the ginger cardamom was my FAV. Nice and spicy.  Note: cold brew has MORE caffeine in it!  For food we got the BMOC and the Pain Perdu. Both were excellent. The pork on the BMOC was nice and moist and smoky. The Portuguese donut was fluffy and not too sweet. Pain Perdu is just SINFUL. Banana bread pudding French toast with whiskey caramel sauce?! Oh you must. You'll gain 5 lbs but you just have to do it.  My only gripe is that both dishes were swimming in sauce. It was too much. My waffle was soggy on the BMOC because it was drowning in syrup. And it whiskey caramel sauce is so rich, they could really just drizzle it on there and it would suffice. Next time I will order the syrup and sauce on the side! I suggest you do the same.  Overall, really good experience. Customer service was warm and friendly. Mostly hipster crowd but there were families there too so we felt totally comfortable as well. Will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight of Japanese cold brew

e2zsHwbFAamcFlN6w_Foug.text: My hubby and I have a standing ritual of having Sunday brunch together. This week we decided to go to the independent standout, on what I call "chain restaurant row" on 7th Ave and McDowell. And for those who live in South Phoenix/Laveen area, like we do, the trip took us an easy 15 minute drive in Sunday traffic to downtown. If you are going for Sunday breakfast, being an early riser has it's advantages. I recommend going between the hours of 8:30 and 10:30 am. We arrived at 10:15am and witnessed the place fill up quickly at 10:30am. We entered the restaurant from the 7th Ave parking lot. Vovomeena's has an entrance via the patio. When you enter from the patio, it's a bit confusing orientation. To the right you will see the kitchen and that's where you start by grabbing a menu off the wall, stand in line, and place/pay your order at the cashier. They will give you a number and the server brings the food to the table when ready. I recommend looking over the menu online prior to your visit, because frankly, I imagine this process to be backed up when the place is crowded by the newbies trying to decide what they want to eat -- there isn't much space to move, so the pressure is on. I noted there were quite a few family with kids. While my husband and I have a son, we were on a "date brunch" so we chose to sit AWAY from the families :) I do imagine the patio - during nice whether - to be a perfect spot to have a family breakfast so don't be afraid to bring them along. But let's get to the food! Vovomeena's serves up such creative concoctions vovomeena.com/menu.html I enjoyed the "Johnnycakes", described on the menu as two chile corn hotcakes, prickly pear maple syrup, served with a side of sweet rice, and choice of meat. Layman translation: sweet corn tamale (with chile) pancakes, rice pudding, and either bacon or schreiner sausage. I loved my meal - but was not a fan of the prickly pear maple syrup (so much that my husband was reminded of a scene from the Tom Hanks movie "Big" when he chews and spits out his food.) On our next visit, I look forward to trying the "Mexican Benedict" , poached eggs, hollandaise sauce, served on sopes. This is the kind of interesting culinary twists you can expect to see on the menu. There is plenty on the menu to keep me entertained and no negative experience to be critical of. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. johnnycakes

oCg260KGSicC6Wjo1KqaMg.text: It has been way too long since I've been impressed by a meal at a restaurant. It seems that lately if I go out to eat I leave feeling unsatisfied and that I could have made the food better, quicker and for way less cash myself than what I just experienced dining out. Enter Vovomeena!   This place knocked my socks off! Wow! Great atmosphere, good music, friendly staff and the place is so clean and comfortable (even the bathrooms here are relaxing and beautiful). And talk about the menu! Johnnycakes oh my! Corn and chili pancakes with prickly pear maple syrup- what?!!! DELICIOUS! And the coffee from Morning Moonshine, a roaster I'll admit I'd never heard of before but am SO glad I've discovered! That's coming from a Portland, Oregon food capital foodie but thank goodness my mom lives in Phoenix and I can count on visiting Vovomeena each time I'm in town. Granted I have only tried the breakfast here (after all it is the best meal of the day is it not?) but I'm certain if you chose anything from the menu it would not disappoint. I highly recommend grabbing a meal and cup of joe here.

nWz4WYKr6tb-qw4-oKwnKQ.text: I ordered the blackstone scramble and my brother ordered the pain Peru. The blackstone was good but the tortilla was dry and crackly. Potatoes were cool and tasted like they were cooked hours before we got there and were just barely warmed up for us. Coffee was meh and so was the tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good coffee

lrJDVu7l37fPUFX5nt3aDw.text: Great atmosphere and people. Smaller location so make sure you come early to get a good spot! Had the chorizo sopes which were a tad on the spicier side. Other than that great overall experience. Price was reasonable for downtown Phoenix.

BrMBCfXJFT0y_v7tgAKGXw.text: This is a great little gem. The atmosphere seems a little chaotic at first, but they have a great system in which you order, then line up near the coffee bar and the staff finds your table. We went Sunday morning and it was packed, but the system just worked. The coffee is excellent. We ordered the Spanish tortilla and a burrito, both of which were fantastic. Huge portions. If you are a light eater you could easily split any plate. There's lots of local art, natural light, and attentive management.

boR5_widtNcA0-C7T9xttw.text: The food is great. The rest was really confusing. There isn't anywhere to stand to figure out what you want to eat (because you have to order before sitting). The person who took our order left us mid-sentence for a solid two minutes without explanation. Getting seated felt like we were inconveniencing them. Your food is delivered but you have to go to another counter to get your coffee. And we were sat in a location where other patrons and staff kept walking into our chairs. The whole experience was stressful lol I might be inclined to go again if it were midweek and we were the only ones in there but that's not realistic. So they certainly went out of my life with a bang.

RWFJ2BbeMTzSEifxWa_M4A.text: Get the BMOC! Great breakfast spot with Portuguese influence, which is hard to find. The BMOC is just a big mess of all the best breakfast stuff...topped with a Portuguese donut. The best. My only knock on the place (which I admit is super picky) is they serve coffee in a paper cup. Coffee in a ceramic mug makes the meal just a bit nicer. Still one of my favorite brunch spots.

XxIrsmRLzliTHw41CE_HDA.text: The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had. The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had.  The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had.  The best biscuits and gravy I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wow.

MqTPx2tvg8EFHn0lu92qgA.text: The line was packed when I arrived so I was expecting a long wait time for my food. To my surprise, the food came out fairly quickly.   At this restaurant, you order first, and then you wait in another line for the manager to seat you. It is not self-seating. Also, I liked how there is an open space by the kitchen for you to see the chief and line cooks. The cooks work so hard; I wish I could just tip them personally.  Favorite Banding pocket - Schreiner's banger, 2 scrambled eggs, smoked gouda in pita bread with spuds.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla española (left) and blackstone (right)

TP1qeJ2quTsOB9aMnqjvpQ.text: Great little spot! Found this place through reviews and the wifey and I were in the neighborhood. Very friendly staff, clean, great coffee and decent food. I had the pork shoulder scramble and it was definitely good but lacked just a little more taste. Overall though great spot to check out. I overheard some other eaters say it's always packed...worth to check it out

-jPbs6s1bgXGvLN3uwxd4A.text: I love everything on their menu. The 3 sisters inlet is my favorite but I if you get the spuds, you need to ask for them to be extra crispy. The bangin pocket is also amazing but I'd like to see it with some vegetables or avocado in the mix although the Gouda is a nice touch. Worth every penny. The serving sizes are also good.

sl1EpywC_hL2EeC86bDc0Q.text: Wow, wow, wow!!! The biscuits and gravy are like no other.  So much flavor!!  All manners out the window, they are lick your plate GREAT!  Nice staff, clean, and reasonable!  Yum!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy - YUM!!!

opVfXm3EohvPMdBamuyZDg.text: Absolutely scrumptious. I went Saturday at 9am, there was no line, and I could find a seat quickly. I ordered the iced tea and the b.m.o.c. which is a waffle topped with a pork chop topped with 2 eggs any style topped with a donut and all drizzled in a sweet apple syrup. The iced tea came out immediately and the food shortly after. Great flavors, quickly service, and very cute atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. b.m.o.c. - there&#39;s a pork chop hidden underneath the over easy eggs

En_1lFbP2h2rU8oJBXENGw.text: This is a must try restaurant.  The variety of food choices and the quality is superb.  I had their BMOC. A generous pork chop on top of a waffle with scrambled eggs and a Portuguese doughnut. Who knew it could be so good?  They have a coffee bar with a nice selection , raw sugar, almond milk and Italian sweet cream, etc...   The bathroom was super clean as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The remains of my BMOC.

KKbZwjAyvLHPlKiscjW6nA.text: Oh man! I just finished my food and I am stuffed! I came here with a big group of friends, so I got to try a lot of different plates and they were all great!  I tried: Mexican Benedict, three sisters omelet, savory crepes, orchard French toast, and the chicken and waffles. Everything had it own distinct flavor combos that worked really well together. I really liked the savory crepes with the arugula salad! The chicken and waffles was massive! And delicious. The Mexican Benedict was chorizo on a masa cake mmmmmmmm. I'm significantly fatter now.  When you come in and order at the counter and then they seat you. We came in on a Saturday at 10 and only waited maybe 20-30 min for everything, which for tasty brunch on a weekend is great!  Lastly, they have 2 gender neutral bathrooms that are super nice. Great job! Highly recommended!!

pHdJmvfFP7PRlCVHZTDNVQ.text: Found a breakfast/brunch near my Airbnb and it was a great found. I ordered tortilla espanola and it was absolutely delicious. The staff is extremely friendly, and the food is served to the table. It does not occupy a huge space, but the restaurant is nicely organized with plenty of seating. It might be a bit crowded during busy hours. There are entrance in front and behind the restaurant with limited parking spots. The coffee tasted a bit burnt. Other than that, I like the unique dishes from the restaurant and great in taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla Espanola

4bqn3bhq7oXeahbX4bNiVw.text: Grab a menu and stand in line to order. After you order you can take a seat & they'll bring your food to you. Cute spot to have coffee, breakfast or brunch.  I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I liked their little coffee bar. It looked like a nice selection.   The menu looked good, and I ordered a potato omelette it comes with your choice of sausage, or bacon I chose sausage. I wish the meal would've been good, but it was bland.   Parking is either right off McDowell which is behind the building, or you can park on the other side off 7th Ave.   They have patio seating, or indoor. They close early afternoon so make sure & check hours.   I may try it out again & order something sweet next time. Enjoy the pics

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menus
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee bar

03RsVULl55V1xgQ9Mf9Euw.text: This is a good place to have breakfast or brunch , I been coming to this place for years and every time gets better .      They have the all timers favorite and also they make seasonal dish , also what I like is the owners are always attentive and try to squeeze you asap , I would recommend the sausages, Mexican Benedict's , pain perdu, tortilla espanola and b.m.o.c. .

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menú
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pawtucket west
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict&#39;s

RXeGoW5n8TZpYlUmvVLd_Q.text: Fantastic food. wow. We had the pain perdu and savory crepes.  Could not be more satisfied as a foodie. Lattes were perfect too. No food puc we ate it too fast. Thanks, will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4ldqhhG3kRgr6pdgy6K8cg.text: My boyfriend and I have been to Vovomeena at least a half a dozen times in the past year and a half or so. I think the food is really good, he LOVES the BMOC and the Mexican Benedict is delicious.  HOWEVER, we have repeatedly had just NOT GOOD customer service, at times verging on terrible. The  usual manager is generally rude and seems strangely arrogant. This morning was the last straw. I ordered the orange and ginger cold brew that I always get, but this time it tasted extremely OFF. I drank about a quarter of the glass thinking that maybe it was just in my head but decided that it most definitely tasted like mold. I even had my friend try it to see what she thought and she immediately spat it out it was so terrible. I told the manager and he gave me a different drink, but I told him that I was adamant there was mold in that coffee container and he just didn't seem that concerned. To me serving a moldy drink to a customer is a pretty huge deal.... after this last time dining here I just can't overlook the bad things for the good anymore.

lL6ox7sS22lxhr9MMtRuuA.text: Short menu but unique selections. Do not sit outside (7am) fair amount of flies to bother you, not a knock on the restaurant just the outside seating area which is really nice & shaded. The man that took my order was a little robotic & not very friendly. I mentioned it was my first time, usually the person will respond with a pleasant "hello" & "welcome" with a few recommendations about the menu or favorites. No worries though. The FOOD; had the corn cakes (pancakes) with sausage & cinnamon rice(Mexican style). They are terrific & large. Coffee is serve yourself & you must order b4 sitting. Lol Nice place & I am glad I found it on Yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prickly pear syrup with corn cakes.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn cakes with prickly pear syrup. Mmmmm

sKhls7f0yYEygDM7q3SY3w.text: Yum! My boyfriend and I came here while on a very short trip to Phoenix. We came on a Saturday morning. We expected it to be busier but we only had to wait about 5 minutes to order! We were seated after we ordered, our coffee came up right away and our food was done about 10 minutes later.   I had the vanilla pod cold brew and it was divine. The latte was also great.   We ordered the banging pocket and savory crepes. Both were delicious, but I gotta say, those crepes... man. So good! Very pleased with this choice.   The vibe here is good. It felt hip without trying too hard. Overall great experience. Would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ra9yR1L3sA12w_0_SGffcg.text: Wanted to like this place. The staff are awesome. The food came out fast. Just don't enjoy cafeteria style restaurants. The food was decent - just not my cup of tea. Love the idea but spent too many years eating in dining halls and want a sit down wait on me type of restaurant.

PLnMf28SJ_mS6NqtCgLeXQ.text: Came in for breakfast on a work trip. I got the BMOC, my wife got the Pain Perdu, and we both got coffee. I was surprised at how busy the restaurant was on a Thursday after 9AM, but I guess that speaks to the quality of the place. The meal was fantastic - the pork chop and eggs on the BMOC were perfectly cooked and the light and airy waffle contrasted nicely. If I would have ordered again, and if I had unlimited calories, I would have gotten the Pain Perdu - it is banana bread French toast with a whiskey caramel sauce, so I don't think much more needs to be said. Quick service and an attentive staff made this a fantastic breakfast. The next time I am in Phoenix, I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC

PJuCuCSJw2Yb2PjgcJG7LA.text: Last stop before heading back to California, great breakfast spot. It wasn't busy on a Sunday morning.   Mexican Benedict is great, it was filling as well.  Get it with coffee.   Another great Yelp recommendation, thank you. Definitely a great breakfast to try when you're in the area. It's a small spot but the service is great and fast too.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

XXwsUyzvJhxKZ-4Ku4E9Pw.text: The Johhnycakes.  They shall live in my heart and soul as long as I breathe, their remembrance sustaining me in dark hours.  Seriously good food here, folks.  Portions are pretty sizable, too.  Nice vibe to the place, and the people were friendly.  We got three breakfast items and shared all three.  It was a pig out, but we eat austerely when not on vacation, and this was our first cheat meal of our trip.  It was a great start.  We're coming back.

mX6UcZmJSt_rReW-RP9iUA.text: Drake (non-vegan): I got the Mexican Benedict, which was pretty dang delicious. I had a lot of trouble picking something as a lot of the menu looks good, but I was very satisfied with what I got.  Ally (vegan): There are no formal vegan items on the menu. However, thanks to the chef who came out to greet us, I ordered the Blackstone Scramble without the meat and eggs with a substitute of potatoes. Delicious and super filling!   It's a smaller restaurant with a hole in the wall feel. When you walk in you have to order your food at the register and afterwards they seat you. No issues there, just different. It's a bit pricey but the quality of food matches the price point, so good if you're looking for a bit nicer of a spot to have breakfast or brunch. Right as we finished eating the line was almost at the door so it might be a good idea to call and ask how busy they are before coming.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

B7LOsGm2MpRkzvJ9gbVgwQ.text: Amazing food that will fill you up for hours! Coffee is very delicious as well. I had the wilcox avenue and mocha latte. Delicious!!!!!

OISVnVVsVA2N21aEAfnDVg.text: Really enjoyed going to this place. The staff were all friendly and professional. So nice to go to a place where they connect with their patrons.   We got the award winning banana French toast. It was super rich and sweet. If you like sweet this one is perfect. It's pretty much like dessert. The bacon we got with it was yummy, thick cut and perfect for the sweet combo.   The coffee was also spot on. They have the Japanese drip system which was just the perfect jolt for the morning.   I liked the decor of the place and the natural light coming in. And they have an awesome mural at one if he entrances.   Looking forward to going back to trying more of their interesting food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside entrance
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute little section for a larger group
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Japanese drop iced coffee. Super smooth.

jG2Y0iZ40Ccgxw6orkP2xg.text: Flew into PHX and stopped here for a super awesome breakfast before heading to Sedona. I enjoyed the biscuits and gravy with a delicious cappuccino (pictured). Nice outdoor seating, too.  Highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

C_R9MKS8dPn8CbyeBbupwg.text: It's been almost a month since my trip Vovomeena, and wish it weren't 2,000 Miles away from me. I wake up most mornings craving their pain perdu, and can't wait to eat it again on my next spring training trip. If you enjoy French toast and bananas you'll love this dish! All the other items I tried from my friends were excellent, and Vovomeena has the best coffee you'll find in any breakfast restaurant. You'll fall in love with their Japanese cold brew coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pDgqjfNO9Y6UIflzKVh9AQ.text: Went here yesterday for breakfast. I got the b.m.o.c. As a recommendation along with a caffe latte and a cinnamon roll. The b.m.o.c. Was a good combination with he sweet component balancing out the savory. The pork shoulder was a little bit salty for my taste and the eggs were prepared well. The coffee was pretty good as well (I like a place that serves latte art :) ). The service was phenomenal. The employees were super prompt and polite and definitely friendly. Overall I would return to try out other menu items :)

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caffe latte
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. B.m.o.c.

9rqmYB7B8dnrYHm187rZqQ.text: Really liked this place. Food was delicious and relatively quick even though it's super busy. I recommend getting the BMOC and/or Mexican Benedict.   Didn't get a chance to try their coffee but looks like they had some good options. Will have to try next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC aka pork chop on a waffle

vPhBSozzv6ELehAkzj80Rg.text: Came here on vacation and we were extremely happy with the breakfast and coffee. Wife got the Mexican Benedict and it was amazing. The chorizo and potatoes were perfect. I got the Johnnycakes, which were made with corn + chiles. DELICIOUS. Ice coffee was on point and everyone was super nice. Lovely place. If we come to Phoenix again we will make a point to come back. A+++

26eI4d5PT_RfJu1z9pOCXg.text: My husband and I like to try different restaurants on Sunday mornings for breakfast. Saw this place online when i googled breakfast restaurants near me. We had never heard about it before. We were surprised when we got there and saw how busy it was. The sign in the restaurant gave the directive to look at a menu and order first. The customer pays, then waits to get seated and served. Everything went very smoothly and my husband and I were very pleased. The food was delicious! The beverages were self-service (coffee, water, etc.) The staff were all very friendly. Even though it was very busy, with this operation, we really didn't have to wait very long. We would definitely recommend this place to others and will add it to our list of best breakfast places to eat in Phoenix!

suSaJi_WaoZwFl1D5DbCJQ.text: I really wanted to try the chicken and waffles but it was only part of the special menu. :((........so instead I got the Pawtucket West and the waffle was crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside. It came with scrambled eggs and two slices of bacon. I thought it was reasonably priced considering the location and how nice it was inside.

wz6R611axvpKsUOx9IZr3w.text: Amazing and interesting breakfast place. This place has a warm and inviting atmosphere.  The menu is awesome with more upscale and gourmet items not usually found at their reasonable prices. They make their own cold brew in hour glass type cold brew machines in full display.

JiGYf4BVkdZ0c80RNluQxg.text: I told the manager I have gluten and dairy allergies before ordering and he recommended a couple options I could do. I ended up ordering the Mexican Benedict with no tortilla. They bring me my plate with my food on top of, you guessed it, tortillas. Because it was on my food, I couldn't eat anything except the potatoes and left the actual dish untouched. Waste of $13.00 on breakfast - who knew listening to someone's order was so difficult?

suwy8UGGCy9FwMSr7UMPHA.text: I can't believe this place serves tortilla espanola! Its one of my favorite dishes from traveling in Spain but it's too simple for American dining (just eggs and potato). Served along side an arugala salad and their homemade papas bravas sauce (not actual papas bravas sauce but a tasty slightly spicy tomato sauce). It was a fabulous find on my vacation,  wish I could eat here more than once.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla espanola w/papas bravas sauce on the side.

IF2TNKaa1THbESxHiNgBtQ.text: I had the pain perdu, which is a banana bread pudding French toast and it was AMAZING. It's more of a dessert than a breakfast item, but nonetheless, it was worth the price. Their coffee is very strong and if you just get plain old coffee, it is bottomless, which for an avid coffee drinker like myself, is definitely a win-win. The service was awesome, and their manager came and checked on me twice even though you don't have a server, which I thought was icing on the cake. It's a quiet enough place to do some work, and by being able to order at the counter instead of having a server, there isn't this huge pressure to leave so the server can make more money. Will definitely return to try the cold brew flight!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

W_ovLQNAGvqdRQdtLB-OGw.text: Eclectic menu and 15 hour cold brews make this place unique and tasty, which combines to make it special. I ordered the Johnnycakes, which are pancakes made with corn and Chile with pear-maple syrup. They were delicious- not spicy from the Chile and definitely savory vs. a normal pancake. They were a little heavy (I could only eat 1.5), so don't expect to want lunch. People I was with all ordered Mexican Benedict's. At first I had food envy as they looked sooooo good (they put egg and meat on sopes instead of English muffins), but after tasting both, I got the better breakfast. Finally, coffee, as described by many other Yelp reviewers, was pretty darn good. The 15 hour cold brews process doubles the caffeine and cuts the bitterness, but, as a traditionalist, I still got the regular coffee. It was great, and I had four cups. This is worth the stop for the experience, uniqueness and overall good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 15 hour cold brew process. Mmm.

UltUD_mmng_t1RKGm0DxQw.text: There was a long line to order but thankfully it went by pretty quick. The food was great. They had a pretty cool iced coffee sampler.

4hcB-jA_NIbEP07MNEqkrQ.text: Quick service. Great food!  Even though the line was long, it moved along very efficiently.

wxcyNGqi0GRKTc5iujyuUA.text: Ordered the Mexican Benedict and boy was it tasty! The sopes soak up the sauce from the chorizo and the meal has just enough spice. Side of potatoes were really nicely cooked too.  Love the location because the parking lot doesn't get too packed and the restaurant is very quaint. Would come back in a heartbeat next time I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z1X2Omcj_uHEVqhaBswLFw.text: So delicious! My daughter was saying that she wished she would have found this place sooner since now she has moved back to CA.

kRQMy4Jr0poN0HyREdZeVg.text: Favorite brunch in town! The staff is super hospitable and genuine. We (my man and I) visit all the time because it's just so good! The food quality consistently great, the prices are reasonable, there's never a long wait for food or seating either. It's over the counter service. Admittedly, the first time I came in my friends ticket got lost and she never got her food but as soon as the manager realized what happened he told us the truth, gave her a refund and offered to have the food come out ASAP. Unfortunately, we were on a time crunch but he gave he gave her basically and IOU (still on top of the refund) which is just an extra step that really meant a lot to us. We've obviously been back a lot since!

LVIOnx0-aLbVxTNMItGIfA.text: I loved the atmosphere. The food was good. To me, it was American with a Mexican twist to it. I would go again.

zJkqGocC82mVrYn_szN59w.text: Excellent Food, and Service to match. Great Value for the dollar. Short wait time for food as you pre order and pay. When order is complete a server delivers your food to your table. We enjoyed dining out on the patio, very nice space. Will definitely return.

62CYTwcM8bun-UYeWKyvnw.text: Seems like a great little breakfast hangout. I tried the Piperrada (pork, bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, and eggs). This was a good breakfast - everything was tasty and seemed like good quality ingredients.  I've heard good things about their pancakes, and I'm definitely interested in trying out several other items on the menu, so I can see myself coming back often.

w6hxiF5LWpuKhxzehW0hHg.text: This place has amazing breakfast food! I have tried something different every time and have loved every bite of it all. Their Portuguese donuts dipped in their strawberry jam is out of this world. You definitely have to try this place out. It's pretty busy on Saturdays, but if you go early enough on Sunday you can beat the crowd. They had these ooey gooey butter bars and they were amazing, but I haven't seen them in a while, so that's my only complaint.

VBd-OSlDCg7pysqQDl-tzw.text: We went here kinda buying into the yelp hype and we were slightly let down. The coffee was fantastic and strong. The food was just alright but I may be spoiled comparing it to other places around town. I tried the bmoc some crepes dish and the Mexican Benedict and all were tasty just not really my cup of tea. I would say the chorizo on the biscuit with a poached egg tasted the best of everything I tried. The service was great and the atmosphere was trendy and hip. This would be a good place to take someone new on a breakfast date. I may give it another shot later down the road and update my review but as of right now I think the stars fit the place.

Bc6N9kIOfDVbT7ir18NGeA.text: Wonderful breakfast place with delicious, unique dishes and great service. The savory crepes are amazing!!  I really can't say enough about them. The manager clearly cares about guests and makes sure they enjoy the meal. Good coffee, too!

hkwaED5cTiIuR_k7FUHZDA.text: I went to Vovomeena with the BF last weekend to have breakfast. The place is cute, small, but not cramped. The style is modern. You come in and order at a counter and then seat yourself, which is nice. I got the Mexican eggs benedict. It was rich and heavy, but had good flavor. It is chorizo on top of a thick corn cake of sorts...then topped with eggs and hollandaise. I think I probably gained at least a pound from this meal. The only problem with the food was the potatoes were somewhat bland. Thankfully, the serving size was huge so I didn't miss having the potatoes.

-4GNgB2rVrPXkMKddh0rEw.text: Stopped in for breakfast with some girlfriends last Saturday after reading so many great reviews, we were not disappointed! The cold brew was life changing and we all enjoyed our meals. Very cute spot, great to see a small business thriving amongst large chain restaurants. We arrived just before 9am and that was perfect timing, this place fills up! All staff were friendly and helpful and the patio is dog friendly. I will definitely be coming back! :)

QaQ8j6PKM5E8waRgp4UiWg.text: We were driving across country and wanted to have a great breakfast. We found Vovomeena in Phoenix - a small boutique breakfast cafe. The decor is contemporary and warm - the coffee is fantastic - piping hot and fresh - the food is artisinal and the menu is well conceived.  There are so many delicious sounding items that we agonized over to what to get. My companion settled upon the biscuits and gravy which he found to be spicy and wonderfully herbal and delicious. The person who took my order was kind enough to give me some a la carte items - so I had the waffle with handmade turkey sausage and two lovely poached eggs on a big white plate. Everything was tasty - with the minor exception that my dish was warm and not hot. The host who made a point of talking to all of the guests came by our table and we talked about the temperature of the food - he graciously offered to change it out and I declined. Everyone there was warm and hospitable. The name of the cafe is based on the Portuguese word for grandmother - and the sense of warmth and family and tradition and breakfast is all wonderfully present in this little place.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Wc6KjrLCr4aDl0mYMe30Ow.text: What can I say about this place..AWESOME! The food is so freaking good there is nothing i haven't tried that I didn't like, it can get pretty packed but it is definitely worth the wait, reasonably priced. I guarantee you won't be disappointed.

6gsBTyLqIu5vYS9y8wEa5A.text: I really appreciate places like these, where they put a lot of thought and creativity in their foods. I wish I could give it a higher star rating, but I have to be honest. I tried it on two different occasions because I always want to give a place a review after at least visiting it twice. The food is well done and thought out, but maybe the execution is bad or they are trying to doing too much.   The first time actually was a while ago, since I am not usually at this area of town at all. I tried the BMOC which is their signature dish or most popular. While I admit it is very impressive looking, it is very difficult to eat. The pork chop is just so dominating and so salty, that it takes several tries until you can find a right balance. I understand what they are going for, since a lot of other places are always trying to balance this sweet-salty flavors. It is almost impossible to balance and sometimes it comes out bland, because the flavors don't compliment but cancels each other out. I do like complex flavors but I like consistent well define flavors where every bite is the same. It was kind of a let down  The second time, I tried the grillades, which is their take on biscuit and gravy. The beef was nice and tender small pieces, but the sauce was too spicy(heat wise). All I could taste was the heat, it again just dominated everything. I also think that everything is in the details in the dish, the biscuit was dry and chewy and had a weird artificial flavor to it. I had a side of potatoes which were done well , but was cold, I could not believe that they would do that at a place like this. This is a self serve type of place, so as far as service is concerned it is what you expect.   Lastly I really would have given this place a 2 star for its food, but I raised it to 3 star because they were trying to be different and the quality and thoughtfulness of the food is good, just  the execution does not work here.

pa8QSIjrDVdkwVVFKgoQDA.text: This is the hipsterest place I've been to, I think, ever. And I yelp a lot and consider myself a bit of a food hipster. I think I'm taking off the star because I felt almost uncomfortable eating there, like I might stain or break some piece of art or antique children that was made by the blind albino children of Nepal (but only the ones named Frank). Can a space be *too* atmospheric? I didn't think so... but I appear to have been proven wrong.  The breakfast was great, though, I had the grillades. Nice, rich, buttery biscuits, delicious peppery gravy, and chunks of very tender beef. Only ding was that they could do scrambled, over easy/medium/hard or sunny side up - nothing else. That covers 96% of the requests out there, but hey, I'm a food hipster, right? I like my eggs basted.

r-dRujy9dmiItt6m-rFX1Q.text: The main reason why I wanted to try this place was for the reviews... and I expected so much more.  It was a Saturday when I went around 10 am and the line was ridiculously long. This is a self serve place, you have to wait in line to order food, then you have to look for a place to sit (very uncomfortable when the place is full, and its tiny too! ), you get your own coffee and refills. The food was not so great, and lacked a lot of seasoning and flavor. The main thing that bothered me was the lack of accommodation of substitutes for their menu. I eat egg whites, and when I was asked how I wanted my eggs cooked, I said egg whites. The guy gave me this frustrated look and weird stare, and told me with attitude " No, you can't get egg whites, we don't do egg whites"  Oh, and they also don't do any sides, you want pancakes? be prepared to pay over $10 for another meal.  Rude customer service, poor food choices/accommodations, and terrible coffee. I've had better breakfast and better experience else where and better tasting coffee too. I will not be returning here, not a fan of overpriced self serve places.

eXu9MkEEwlwe8OrOTi99Sg.text: The food was great as well as the cold brew.  The reason for 4 stars is the less than friendly staff. No one was out right rude, but only 1-2 staff actually even smiled. I also am not a really big fan of the order at the counter and seat yourself concept. But I had the Johnny Cakes and was extremely happy. My husband has the Mexican Eggs Benedict and said it was quite tasty.

8AwiTx8MyhRKr3T6GGsOog.text: This breakfast place is adorable on the inside and tucked away. The food was AMAZING and the service was even better! It was busy when we arrived but the wait after we ordered was short! We will definitely be going back! Order the 'banging pocket'. Absolutely the best breakfast place in Phoenix!  Can't wait to go back!

4a6nnpvLUpSkX04KMyP56w.text: We are in town for spring training and this morning I was looking for a nice breakfast spot. I actually found Vovomeena mentioned in an online article listing the five best breakfast spots in Phoenix. We drove up and found quick parking and noticed that they were a fast casual restaurant in that you line up, order at the counter and seat yourself with a number to wait for your food to come out. This actually works very well for this restaurant in that they have a fairly small but eclectic menu (no substitutions please). We got there right in time as we only had one couple ahead of us in line and as we waited I saw an order of their biscuits and gravy get served up. My mind was made up, biscuits it would be. I chased it with their Japanese style ice coffee. The food came out quickly and it was delicious. The gravy had a rich peppery taste to it complimented by the big chunks of sausage generously smothered over a delicious split biscuit. As we ate the line at the counter grew to extend itself out the door. Now for those of you thinking that fast casual means little to no service, Vovomeena will prove you wrong. The food was brought out by a friendly food runner and as we were wrapping up our meal, I believe it was the manger, stopped by to ask us about our experience and chatted with us a while, answering my question about the name of the place. Meena being the nickname of the owners grandmother and Vovo being short for grandmother in Portuguese. It was an awesome breakfast and I would highly recommend it.

DJnZjCK3iAxHooaLqYgbnw.text: There food was delicious, try the banana french toast with whiskey caramel. It seems as if they are still getting organized, I'd love to try it again in a few weeks. I had to wait for coffee in the coffee line, was told to wait in the brunch line, and then move back over to the coffee line... Overall food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The food was amazing...

kTnJ_oVwU4pRYkIkYaeKRg.text: The french toast, waffles, omelets, the orange juice, the employees, the coffee, and the set up. All top notch! Probably the best french toast I've ever had. If you go, get the orange juice. Nothing better than freshly squeezed juice with your French toast, waffles, or omelets!

V0r63pKk-8dc0B_tGyB0qQ.text: Ate here yesterday with a friend for breakfast.  They had good friendly service and the food was very good also. I tried the Mexican Benedict and was impressed, It was original and had good flavor. My friend and I both really liked the potatoes they serve here, they were really good.  They serve a very good cup of coffee as well. Parking can be annoying in this location but I went at an off time so I got a good space without any problems. It can be crowded at the rush times as there are many places right together.   Overall I was very impressed and want to go back and try some of the other items on the menu.

nJlcPkcF35AbwXzOfyMB-Q.text: The manager Kai was amazing, made sure we enjoyed are breakfast and the staff is friendly. The food was great and the bacon was delightful!!

QY6bMeQp5mafsj2BGSO96A.text: I was in Phoenix recently for the WWE Royal Rumble. To kill some time that morning, my friend introduced me to Portlandia on his iPad in our wretched hotel room. Around 11AM, we were hungry and ready to check out, so we consulted Yelp for brunch options and settled on Vovomeena.  Upon arrival, I wasn't sure if I was still in Phoenix, or somehow had been transported into a Portlandia sketch. As others have noted, it's THAT hipster. A "flight" of Japanese cold brewed coffee - really? Even more amusing was the proud barista describing the cold brew process and the different coffees. And I have no idea how he could tell the different coffees apart ... it's easy with a flight of beers, but coffee all pretty much looks the same. But after pinching myself and realizing I was still in Phoenix, I went for the flight of cold brews. (When in Rome ... err ... Phoenix, right?)  The food options were equally hipster, with a selection of a dozen or so breakfast/brunch offerings featuring fresh, locally sourced food. The only thing NOT hipster about the food are the prices. I typically expect places like this to be a bit pricy, but Vovomeena is a VERY good value. Most of the selections are in the $7-9 range. I ordered the most expensive selection - the b.m.o.c. It featues a smoked pork chop, waffle, two eggs, and a "Portuguese Donut Tower" (basically a funnel cake) for $9.95. My friend got the "pain perdu" - banana bread pudding french toast with a caramel glaze and choice of meat for $7.50. Both portions were ample, and everything was delicious.   And even though this is counter service, the service was great. I joke about the barista, but the kid (he looked like he was 17) was really nice and knowledgeable. It reminded me of talking to a brewer (or beer nerd) at a brewpub - he had that level of knowledge. And when I went back for a 16 oz cold coffee after I finished my flight, he admitted he accidentally made an extra flight, and asked if me and my friend wanted it. Thanks dude! Needless to say, between 1 1/2 flights and the 16 oz coffee, I was amply caffeinated for the day.   Of all the places we went to in Phoenix, this was my favorite by far. I doubt if I ever will be back in Phoenix ... but if I do, Vovomeena is a must stop for me.

WkTHDuTMN9kNkZ8vPr_VTw.text: Truly excellent breakfast. Unique and traditional dishes all cooked to perfection. The Tortilla Espanola is divine and the BMOC is as hearty as you can get. Superb coffee bar as well. Inexpensive for the portions. Will be frequenting this establishment for breakfast going forward. So glad we gave it a try today. I had to go straight home and lay down afterwards, so filling, so satisfied. Totally earned the 5 star rating.

9eAaORlUjkWnYbLGmwoUEw.text: I was excited when this breakfast restaurant opened up in my neighborhood as I love to go out for breakfast almost everyday.  I have eaten there 3 times now but I only order 1 thing on the menu which I do enjoy quite a bit because their other items are a little unusual for me.  I went to eat there again yesterday and I was very sorry to see they have removed all side items off their menu. So I cannot order an omelet or 2 scrambles eggs with bacon, or a side of toast. Its one of the nine items or nothing. That does not work for me so that is why i have given this restaurant 3 stars. I hope they reconsider offering the basic breakfast items or I will probably not be back.

mBWWGfvI9cNHAROe2IkB-g.text: Perfect local spot!  I've been hoping for something locally owned that strays away from the same chain offerings to be found elsewhere and was not disappointed.  (5)The service was exceptionally friendly from the greeting to the ordering.  Even the bussing of the table was done with a smile.  The owner/manager checked with us several times to make sure everything was ok.  We went early enough that there was no wait and the food was served within 10 min.  (4)We ordered the boxty and the piperrada with iced Japanese Brew.  I agree with Michael U that the boxty was a tiny bit greasy, but the sweet savory flavor with the added texture of apple crunch was a great mouthful.  The crunchy thick bacon on the side was perfect! The piperrada had good flavor.   I was hoping the pork shoulder would be slow cooked and shredded, but it seemed more like a chopped cured ham type flavor/consistency.   Thanks Vovomeena for a great early breakfast.  Will be coming back until we try every menu item, especially can't wait to taste the portuguese donuts someone else raved about!

BTO6TA7LiJ2C3UEkRqiY2w.text: This place was suggested, and I'm glad it was. The food was amazing and so was the atmosphere. The menu is short and simple. Tried the Mexican benedict. It was love at first bite.

ykvykoiVAY2Rq_PkGU_gsw.text: Really like their spin on breakfast.  Dishes are a little more adventurous then your typical breakfast fare, which is why I like them.  Food is cooked well.  I love the Johhnny Cakes for breakfast and the warm rice pudding it comes with.

mQ8Say44UkZlCM6Y-QoZZw.text: This is the spot for breakfast or brunch. Highly recommended

6lx_ejRoW6UEhBjRfi9_Dw.text: I ordered the Mexican eggs benedict and it was decent. The sopes which replaced the traditional English breakfast muffin were kind of tough and super dense. Maybe they were just overlooked. The chorizo filling was ok, with a bit of a kick in spice. The eggs were poached just fine, but they apparently didn't drain them enough before they were placed on top because there was water on top of the chorizo that spilled out when I cut into the egg benedict. The one redeeming point was the iced cold brew coffee. It was very smooth.

8ZBgGfyVTt2XYHzUo8vh2Q.text: I've enjoyed breakfast twice so far this year. I'm gluten-free, and both times I ordered grits with the Wilcox Avenue (two egg, sausage and potato plate.) The food is delicious. The first time the grits came smothered in butter. The second visit, I ordered them dry, with a side of maple syrup. I order hot tea and appreciate the bevy of milks and sweeteners. It's best to arrive early to ensure a table. The staff is so attentive and polite.

EHWIC7ogJIVFf_mDc7xgRQ.text: Cold coffee, cold donut, flies EVERYWHERE, biscuit was hard as a rock, plate was so loaded with gravy it engulfed the egg on top, items listed on the menu that staff had to apologize are not "yet" available, patio seating so 1 person is directly in the sun, and one's in the shade, I won't be back, very poor experience.

VWfeDbiOQyc9Bba5EC_lKA.text: They have an awesome brunch menu. Stomach gravitated towards the Johnnycakes, which hit the spot. Nice outdoor seating in the shade. Really friendly staff and management too!

pk3VlLFdFYblFmamHs3vHQ.text: Great breakfast fast and delicious. Would highly recommend; was a great  breakfast at a good price.

qA1QWlMPOmbWQtS4fpbCGA.text: Can't believe all the other chain clones in this little strip mall are busy when Vovomeena is often relatively calm.  The food is unique and luxurious, the coffee is some of the best around (bottomless cup on the drip variety), the baristas are bad ass, the place is beautiful and interesting, and the prices are not much more than what you'd pay for a fast food meal.  But I guess if you'd rather go to Jersey Mike's (tm), the Habit (tm), Chipotle (tm), etc. etc., knock yourself out.  I'll be here, fat and happy!

QignPZe7qPzVaYpWiIRfpw.text: Best breakfast place in Phoenix! Good prices and every dish is delicious. The atmosphere really makes it special. They have fresh flowers on the tables and even a candle burning in the neatly decorated restroom. Definitely better than any chain breakfast restaurants around.

paCCfGOar-HzT0r2tbrP3A.text: Excellent food at this out of the way place. Portions  very large and fresh. I want to try everything on the menu. Plan to go back every weekend until I've tried all menu items. Coffee was also delicious and friendly servers

QmHfVkV6JzjTpUfZ65Q9dQ.text: Great little casual, urban hip restaurant with inspired, hand crafted food. Went there for Sunday breakfast & was very satisfied with the tasty crepes with chicken and swiss chard. Funky twist on crepes & pretty healthy. (A welcome departure from bacon & eggs.) Homemade salsa & sausages unusual. Impressive selection of coffees & cold coffee is properly brewed "Japanese style," not just poured over ice. Nice patio seating. Good vibe!

bf6a3m8hFhy2lSynW87PZQ.text: 3 visit - first 2 were great / last visit, 3 plates had to be returned ---cold food / might be new cooks / mgmt. did take care of issue . . . .will return . . . .for better results . . .

IH_s4Ps8Pr0qUT-SdxNUmA.text: This is one of my favorite places in town. The kitchen is clean, the staff is friendly, the food and coffee taste fresh and delicious. What more do you need? I have been here with quite a few other people, and they all have seemed to enjoy it as much as I do.

xWcVMTXKKXT5T-O-EeEbCA.text: we gave this hip phx spot for breakfast yesterday i had the piperrada satueed vegies with pork shoulder and two eggs i asked for my eggs poached med. unfortunitly they were as hard as rocks the pork was a little dry for my taste my wife had banging pocket which she enjoyed and i tasted as well i thought it was quite tasty service was good and polite the clientele was a young urban mix ...how did i get so old???

oCSSgAt1J7ydbVQaIC_Rbg.text: Okay, so we are in Phoenix to pick up  breakfast with our guest who is leaving that day and we are on our way from Peoria, AZ to take her to the airport  and we want her to have the Matt's Big Breakfast experience and..........yep, you guessed it, 40 minute line to wait in, so we fell into this place..........thanks to other yelp users who rated this high and nearby.  Well, we are here to tell you, this should be the place they are standing in line for, it's that good.  From the moment you walk in and notice the delectable dishes on the tables of the customers, you know you've stepped into something very unique for the palate.  Then, you pick up a menu and you know you aren't in Kansas anymore...........the names of the dishes are different, the ingredients are different, the choices are creative, and about the best coffee I've tasted.  It looks like a factory, but it delivers like nonconformity.  What to have?  we tried the chorizo benedict, the savory crepes, and the grilladas and if we had tummy room, we would have tried more.  Sufficeth it to say, we won't be standing in line for Matt's next time ---- we'll set our sights and our gps to this place!  Well done, vovomeena!

vkOSZ8Q83_01rwXKOqctTw.text: Pricey, but good. I had a homemade biscuit along with their homemade strawberry jam, and it was delicious. My husband loved their banana pudding french toast. The service is mediocre and they don't allow substitutions.

a0idLWmoQauwiQ0BYZrtEg.text: I went there for the first time and I have to admit it was pretty good. I had the Pain Perdue and it was delicious. It could have used a lil more sauce, but it was good! This place is kind of hidden and can easily be overlooked. Its definitely a must try place!!

DqVobG4tsnq4qtT5XILzqg.text: Amazing food and atmosphere with a friendly staff. A little small on the inside but it's still really cute.

7-tRVLahDdpfe_UIRlqGwA.text: Five stars for sure and can't wait to come back and try something new! Came here on a Saturday morning and the line was out the door but it honestly didn't take too long. Maybe 15-20 min to order. We sat down and got our food really fast there. As you're in line to order you're right outside the kitchen do you can see how fast they're working and getting all these dishes together. They know what they're doing! I got the Mexican Benedict because I saw everyone talking about it here on Yelp. Let me tell you, I was not disappointed!! Perfect portion size and the flavor was so good!! My husband got the banana pudding French toast, the name on the menu was something different, don't remember what it was but his dish was just as good! So much flavor in every single bite. Everything was bomb, can't wait to come back and try something else on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict and banana pudding French toast

qy_MHmKAsvqqrJ6YoV4woQ.text: The food hasn't been very impressive. However, they have the most amazing cold brew which you can get a "jug of" for $12 or so and fills up 4 full glasses of cold brew. They have a walk up and order line, and from there you are seated and your food comes within 10 min- which is SO refreshing for a breakfast place, which can sometimes take 2 hours to get through. That said, 4stars!

-_U01GAm_cC8QhSOFWcS1Q.text: If your looking for something a little different for breakfast/brunch, this is it. All of their dishes have a slightly different twist to them and everything I have tried there so far has been delicious.

eIt8eErsmvKi1f0MLrC2sg.text: THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACE IN THE VALLEY, hands down!    I've tried almost everything on their menu.  There's nothing I didn't like.  The only negative thing I can say is that seating (self-seating in this place) can be a little difficult and annoying during busy times, not fun when you have kid/s in tow.  Even more annoying is seeing people lingering over their completed meals and empty cups of coffee, chatting away like they have nothing else to do all day, while there are people waiting for a table to open up.  Not Vovomeena's fault, but the seating issue has factored into my decisions when I find myself wanting to eat here late morning on a weekend.   Anyway, the food is great, the staff is great (I LOVE YOU KAI !!!)  Eat here.  Eat here often.  You won't be sorry!

_M2TcHvINSL_wN0LV-W4yA.text: Have to try this place out. Is refreshing to find authentic dishes and a cool place to hang out. The service is really good, and you'll want to try every dish on the menu. Coffee is superb as well.

xXAWTIA4PLEjSwxZv_NXhg.text: My favorite meal of the day is breakfast.   Today was my first time at Vovomeena and I was so impressed. The entire experience was amazing!  The atmosphere is just great. Very chic ambiance, nice art, wood detail on the wall....Loved it.   The service was great as well. Everyone was really nice and helpful.   The food, I must say was my favorite part. I had Savory Crapes and I will dream about them tonight. They were amazing. My boyfriend had BMOC and he was really happy with his order as well.   This place is just one more reason for me to love breakfast even more so.   I am so glad we found this place and mostly glad we live in the coolest part of Phoenix that is full of cool new local places like this one.   Thanks Vovomeena and thank you Mid/Central Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Highly recommending Vovomeena. He had BMOC and she had Savory Crapes.

Yb1eXLaj9LdJpaelIT6DYg.text: Fun little spot for breakfast or brunch with some inventive twists on the typical brunch fare. Had the bangers and eggs which was tasty and filling. The savory crepes which my friend had will be next on my list. Stand in line to order and then seat yourself format is ideal for when everybody can't make up their mind at the same time. It was on the noisy side inside at 10 am on Sunday so we ate outside which was lovely. All in all a fun and relaxing brunch date with friends. Definitely recommend.

8QM3uYWON70MLbBNLFh0Sw.text: Can my review consist only of row after row of heart emojis?  No? Darn. Alright then.  Oh Vovomeena. I came for the coffee, I stayed for the breakfast. I saw the cold brew flights on yelp so this easily became a weekend destination. Unfortunately I work most weekend mornings but finally had the opportunity to stop by this previous weekend.  I ordered the waffle with bacon and potatoes. You have NO idea how happy I am that there is a place that offers a breakfast dish with no eggs. I'm not the biggest breakfast fan (because I despise eggs), and unless you feel the same way you don't realize how they are in just about every breakfast dish. Aaaannnyyyyyway, my waffle was awesome (with strawberry jam because I can't stand maple syrup either) and my bacon and potatoes were good too. Got a Portugese donut, because duh, and I was super full after that.  My cold brew flight was good. They use Roastery of Cave Creek coffee which is excellent coffee. This flight consisted of the Black & Tan (a Roc2 roast), vanilla coco-something (vanilla bean and cocoa nibs), and lemon jalapeno. The first two, yes. The last one....not for me. We chatted with the barista when we were leaving about the brewing system they use, as well as espresso drinks. He was very knowledgable and came across somewhat passionate about coffee.  The only downside was that on a Saturday morning, it was a little difficult to relax while eating. It gets pretty crowded and they are quick to clear your table after you have taken your last bite. Service is quick though, and we had no issue getting a table.  We'll be back, for sure.

oKsUwI-fZuegk3sIDYtegQ.text: I'm so glad to have a fun neighborhood spot to go to for brunch! We came here on Saturday morning. We must have arrived with a big wave of people, because there were about 8 people in line waiting to order food in front of us. (FYI - this was rare, the rest of the time we were there, there wasn't more than 3 or 4 people waiting in line) We didn't mind waiting because we got time to look over the menu and look around at the decor. The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere - modern, yet rustic? The only thing that concerned me was that when you wait in line you stand at a shoulder-height counter overlooking the kitchen and there was no protective glass shield. I felt like a misplaced sneeze could've contaminated all the food being prepped on the line!  Our food came out in exactly 20 minutes. For having 8 orders in front of us, I thought that was good time. The portions were generous. I ordered the BMOC and had to take half of my pork chop home (...but I am a girl and I don't eat that much). The food was pretty awesome. The pork chop was tender, the apple sauce (kind of like apple pie filling) they drizzled on top was sweet but not TOO sweet. My only gripe was that they placed the porkchop on top of my waffle and covered the whole thing in apple sauce so my waffle wasn't as crispy as I would've liked. if I ordered it again I would ask for the waffle on the side, maybe on a separate plate.  My friend ordered the Banging Pocket, which he loved. I tried a bite and it was really good! What put it over the top was the salsa that came in a little side cup. I've had many salsas before but there was something really special about this stuff! Very flavorful, kind of tasted like they used roasted tomatoes or something because it had a very deep and rich flavor. He did not have any leftovers to take home.  With all of the interesting choices on the menu, we could come back here several times and not get bored. I also love that you can bring your dog on their outside patio :)  Edited to add that the service was very friendly.
