When we walked in they explained to us how it works (order food at counter, food served at your table) and everyone else was also helpful too.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the coffee bar
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the banging pocket (background) and bmoc (foreground)

zA1oWqhvLt5KfXfP0nFBhw.text: Best breakfast in downtown!!! I have eaten at Vovomeena several times and have never been disappointed with my meal. I recommend their breakfast sandwich and pancakes, so good!!! Vovomeena is a counter restaurant that does a great job at managing their tables so you don't have to feel anxious about finding a place to eat your tasty meal. They provide fast service and staff are friendly and attentive. Highly recommended.

zr_uqleXSXPaQnzs3s4PwQ.text: Great coffee if you like cold brew and fast yet delicious food.    I had the banging pocket which was a delicious pita stuffed with eggs, awesome Schreiner's sausage, and smoked gouda.  I also tried the Tortilla Espanola which is a great take on the traditional Spanish omelet.  In Spain, tortilla = omelet so don't expect any circular discs of cooked masa.  The Portuguese donuts are tasty treats as well.  Basically, they're fried dough with powdered sugar on top.  Simple and yummy.    The line moved quickly and the food came out rapidly and accurately.  The price is fair as you can have a very hearty breakfast for two with coffee for about $25-$30.  There's patio seating or plenty of tables on the interior.  If in the 7th Ave area, this is a great breakfast/brunch spot.

BtH4TmSVNxBwsxr7mean5A.text: I wasn't fond of this place and I probably won't return. The pics look good but the food was just ok. The coffee was overpriced, if I wanted to pay $5 for an iced coffee id go to Starbucks. We ordered the Mexicans Benedict, which sounded good but wasn't great. The chorizo was just ok and the sopa wasn't as tasty as I'd had hoped. I wish there was more hollaindaise sauce. I couldn't even taste it. The eggs were cooked well, which is a plus. Also, there were ANTS crawling all over our table - yes, we sat inside. We found at least 5 ants through out our meal. Dirty dirty

t6pql9OeQKFpg8dwGGThzg.text: So disappointed, the papa espanola wasn't what I expected and the salsa it was topped with was just roasted tomoatoes, I thought it would have some spice to it. The arugula was really plain, not even a salad.  The kids had the tiny, baby pancakes with a piece of bacon.  Nothing impressed me unfortunately and again, this must have been a time I picked the wrong thing from the menu considering how others are raving.......not a place I'm willing to visit again based on the proportions and the taste.  Also, the place was really packed, so be prepared to wait or eat outside.

_mla90f4JH13sFc1kK4VKQ.text: Second time here....the biscuits and gravy are to die for, but if you don't like spicy maybe ask for easy gravy. Came in today and devoured the pancakes (Primrose Hill). Coffee is good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Order first then find your table of choice to sit at.

-tuYraA11YRsTiOQ6PPcLQ.text: Excellent service, food and coffee/latte were delicious.  Had the French toast and chorizo hollonadaise, both pretty good. Staff is super friendly. Would highly recommend.

tDh3DWKfpVv-vW5Pw123LQ.text: This is for the coffee only, the coffee here although iced and created via a Japanese method, it did not taste smooth and was slightly bitter as compared to other cold brews I have had.

_pixLgccMiLqB7mo7HV7LQ.text: If you have not been here.... it is a must try! We ordered like four different entrees and each one was delicious. This is my new brunch place.

K9jhms4XfErGi8bCymQtEg.text: I ordered the BMOC and it was good. The food was fresh and tasted like it was made with great ingredients. The staff also friendly and attentive.

RNOvPH5bd1j1TfthHWLcvA.text: I wonder why I never stopped into this place considering I've walked by it so many times after leaving Chipotle or Zoyo. The food and service here is great, I ordered the pancakes with eggs and turkey sausage. The food came out quick and was delicious. It's hard to find a good pancake but these were delicious. I can't wait to go back and try the chorizo eggs Benedict!

_ayVXrW0Q3gaArZ3wtXApw.text: Cute little brunch spot that I'd love to come to with girl friends. You order before seating yourself, they have their own little coffee bar where you can see how they brew the Japanese drip coffee.   While paying for the meal I noticed some $20 bills in their tip jar so expected a lot. Was sadly disappointed by the three meals that my family shared. The coffee was delicious, the potatoes were delicious....annnnd thats about it. Willing to give the place another chance though!

zAIilZ0zOtx23bFQ0ul59w.text: Very good food. Had the b.m.c.o. Comes layered with waffle on the bottom covered with apple-maple syrup. Much better than regular maple syrup. The next layer is the best part it was the smoked pork chop grilled to perfection and fork tender. The scrambled eggs on top got the smoke flavor too. Yummy. The other meal ordered was the Wilcox avenue. Scrambled eggs, bacon and wheat toast. All good. Cold brewed coffee is not bitter. Will be back for sure. Counter service very friendly.

3utNLfiee_BzMs1PvNTsZQ.text: Wow! What a hidden gem! The food is unique and absolutely delicious! I'll be back for sure! I had my heart set on a breakfast burrito.. Try the bangin pocket. Holy cow.. Delicious!

8FpLUu42U6m4gfqayVU4SA.text: The service was great and the food was amazing. Stopped by here for breakfast on a Wednesday morning. There was seating due to the flow of patrons in spite of it being packed. The host quickly attended to us upon walking in to give us a quick how to on ordering at the register and self-seating. The menu had a small but perfect amount of selections. It was difficult to choose because each dish was unique and sounded delish. The burrito had a fresh taste - and I typically do not like burritos.  I'm going back for another for sure. The side of potatoes were perfectly cooked - some had a crisp to them.  The Johnny cakes were amazing! The corn and the overall texture/flavor was on point. Kudos to the chef for the creativity and palette. The decor is modern eclectic with a relaxed friendly vibe. This place is a must!

huu50x0VtS6u6GuBHgLF_Q.text: I fear that this place is going to get out of hand very shortly.  Please people keep to Matt's Big Breakfast and Over Easy keep the crowds away.    Ok Ok I can't be selfish but I wish I could this place is awesome.    Everything from the Japanese cold brew coffee to the espresso's to the amazing food.  I have had the pain perdu which is bannana bread french toast fresh bannanas sliced on top and a whiskey caramel sauce on top and the savory crepes with chicken and egg inside and a homemade sauce over the top.  Both dishes were AMAZING I will for sure go back just for those, but will have to try the rest of the menu first.    I am very greatful I have Monday and Tuesday's off to avoid the weekend crowds because I am sure they will be starting very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio seating and community table

sawD_ZvqPmwsSIUFIbFMmw.text: I'm so excited about the latest restaurant opening from the folks that created Tuck Shop. Vovomeena is a perfect addition to the 7th Avenue and McDowell corner, which is mostly occupied by chain restaurants. They serve up incredible Japanese cold brew coffee, which makes me wonder if I can ever go back to a plain ol' Starbucks drip. The coffee has great, bold flavor and not bitterness. They have a few varieties and even offer a coffee flight.  The star of the menu is the B.M.O.C. It's a Man Vs. Food-kind of dish -- Schreiner'ssmoked pork chop, waffle two eggs and a Portuguese donut tower with apple-maple syrup. And yes it can be finished in one sitting. The 3 Sister Strata -- a egg and cheese casserole, with zucchini, black beans and corn, is delicious, hearty, yet light. It comes with a side of meat, bacon or sausage, both of which come from Schreiner's Fine Sausages on 7th Street. I love that they source local ingredients, from meat to coffee.   I'm eyeing the Pain Perdu --banana bread pudding french toast --for my next visit or maybe the johnnycakes, made with corn and chili. You really can't go wrong with this menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wilcox Avenue
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 Sister&#39;s Strata

-42jKmRKerXReUu87GkGjw.text: My girlfriend and I Love Vovomeena. Despite a very casual ordering process, the coffee and food are always impressive!   Very hipster decor but it doesn't take away from the relaxed, breakfast/brunch vibes.   We get Johnnycakes almost every time we eat here. One of my favorite and most unique breakfasts in Phoenix. I could eat this every day. The warm rice pudding on the side is a nice touch. Always enjoy the japanese cold brew but the regular brewed and espresso drinks have also been great. The menu and space is small but there is nothing to not love about this place.

qN7WN1gLDgadrE-GFXK1ww.text: This is a beautiful little restaurant. I had the pleasure of meeting Jessica Ruiz, the Front-Gal and co owner of Vovomeena, Tuck Shop and Aster House. This gal is super cool, very inspirational and extremely positive. BTW loved the boots.  I learned more today from their coffee guru's about their craft coffee. Japanese Cold Brew. The process is like an IV drip into grounds, a 12 hour process with no heat. This is old Japanese style coffee making. They have a flight of three available light, medium and bold. Three different beans for each. I remember two of the three beans are Ethiopian and Honduras. This was an excellent iced coffee with pure flavors.  My meal was Corn Jonniecake Flapjacks with a side of sweet rice which looked like a pudding, fresh fruit on top and a couple strips of bacon. $7. A delicious breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Japanese Cold Drip

NV7r6Dds96KZEuqmPNxbfQ.text: One word....Delicious!! The Pain Perdue was amazing..so light and fluffy for what looked like going to be a dense banana brownie covered in syrup...and the sausage had a little kick that evened out the sweetness. And the Morning Moonshine was great with a little almond milk.  My boyfriend had the Orchard French Toast which was also delicious and the biscuits and gravy smelled so good.     The place was also super cute. And the guys work behind the counter were really nice. I don't  go downtown much but if I am down there again around breakfast definitely going to be a stop. Great job guys

jLnPn1RA5ulj4BEMRW4xrQ.text: We've become regulars and love it here :) Always consistent with food quality and service. Coffee is delish. Great brunch spot

9RyI7v4ShgVTOi5wKSuM7A.text: The best brunch in Phoenix. BMOC was amazing and full of great flavor!  It took less than 10 mins until our freshly cooked meal was ready in front of us, from the time we walked in the door. Best pork chop ever!!!!

KGTVcWiew5dgJX0ldYaRqw.text: The food here is phenomenal!!! Service is GREAT, very prompt and friendly. Definitely coming back here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orchard French toast

XfvgXLSf96S9ObAVb1xgMA.text: Really?!? How have I not reviewed you, Vovomeena? This is my go-to brunch place. I just love it. The decor is perfection. The food is delightful. The biscuits are DIVINE. Do yourself a favor and go here ASAP.

IwawV8SgcGM73hHoTMXDBg.text: Eclectic and trendy ambiance with delicious choices. It's the place to introduce a friend to and enjoy a brunch that offers more than the "same old" options.

8Qokr3G9uLGFOd7NdJoJbw.text: Excellent restaurant all around. The coffee tastes so fresh. I had the banana pudding French toast with caramel sauce on top and bacon on the side. That's one of the best breakfast meals I have ever had. Love the way the atmosphere flows through the restaurant. Just a terrific place to go to.

R7-xxG1h9RquaveFgfAuZw.text: Reviews is based on the Savory Crepe and Bangin Pocket.  Atmosphere - the wood decor was unique  and love the outdoor patio   Food - both dishes were super yummy and filling   The latte was also very amazing...for sure better than Starbucks   The manager and staffs were professional and friendly.  If I live around here I would come often esp the weekends!

hAqoGe2dw8xILcisZ_0ULQ.text: My husband and I ate breakfast here while visiting in Phoenix on Wednesday, May 18th. This place is so quaint. The menu is creative and interesting. We ordered a blackstone scramble, a pain perdu with two iced cold brew coffees. Our total was a little under $30 but it was worth every penny. The pork shoulder in the scramble was savory and the french toast was sweet so it was a perfect combination. The coffee was great to boot! We'll be back again.

H_skdDFYxQnibJjG3ZdJew.text: The cold press Japanese iced coffee was delightful and the biscuits and gravy was tasty and not too salty which I often find with this dish.  The sausage may have been turkey but I'm not sure.  The Mexican Benedict is good the first few bites but the fat/greasy in the chorizo over powers the dish and soaks the sopes.   Perhaps less chorizo could improve this dish but The flavor was acceptable and the potatoes were a nice pair.  The breakfast potatoes were Cooked well and seasoned perfectly.   I enjoyed the decor, coffee bar and the service was well above average.     I will visit again for lunch next time.

W1YhU0wKQednXCXUNl_Dkw.text: A quick stop on the way to the airport yielded two very satisfied and happy customers. Mexican Benedict was perfect to split between us. Service was fast, and very friendly. Coffee was well above average. Environment puts this place to the 5 stars. My only regret, not being able to try other menu options. We watched some doses come out of the kitchen with our eyes wide and impressed.

RX1ZeovqGxtkWQ74p1DA0A.text: Looking for a good breakfast after I dropped my kids off for school  Went on Yelp and wanted to try something new.  The choice was easy to try Vovomeena when I saw Johnnycakes on the menu.  This is a must for any Rhode Islander that has moved away!  The menu had a few references to my rhode Island upbringing.  Great atmosphere when you walk in - neighborhood place and very comfortable.  The cold drip coffee is unique and has great flavor - I went for the iced decaf today and will get again.  Now for the food - I ordered the Johnnycakes (corn pancakes) light and flavorful with real corn inside adding to the texture of the pancake.  I tried it with a piece of bacon and sausage - both very good.  The twist on the pate was the sweet rice - what a compliment to the johnnycakes. The prickly pear maple syrup compliments it very well.  I will be back and back and back again - thank you!

Oexx7dbZQpSIwpWn9fJWCg.text: This has become one of my favorite local spots for brunch. Nothing on their menu has ever disappointed me! One must definitely try the Mexican benedict and the BMOC. The service is great and the staff is always super nice. Sometimes the place can get crowded and it's kind of small, but nonetheless this place is worth trying.

kaslcaBf9we61rsTRyX6yA.text: Came here for breakfast last Saturday morning. We ordered the Wilcox Ave and Pawtucket west.  The coffee is pretty good, we just had the regular coffee bit they've got quite a selection of brews. The food was great, well priced, and you get a lot of food for what you pay. I recommend getting the sausage, it tasted like it was cooked over an open flame and its taste reminded me of camping :)

iDCQzkx8vfBm_OJjhy10fQ.text: We were looking for a place to eat brunch when we first got to Phoenix, and this place was PERFECT. The food was good and the staff was very friendly. You have the option of sitting inside or out on the patio.

KwV20jPlO8KKGJ3RuuTmFg.text: The Blackstone Scramble is amazing - the pork is incredibly flavorful and the portions abundant. Perfect spot to meet friends and relax on a Saturday morning.

HO7PtozctQJ4WqOqDwLGXg.text: This place rules! I can still taste the banana bread pudding french toast...so good! Great brunch spot with great Japanese cold brew coffee.

E2-1EvhUwU3PrY9DTSaoiw.text: Absolutely excellent food. The biscuits and gravy were incredible. I can't wait to come back!

Ed1LCpoFlfeR6XdX2vfX_A.text: I'll start by saying we had a terrible time our first time here.  All too often these days when someone makes a mistake they refuse to fix it.  Vovomeena and the manger Kai did just the opposite.  They made it right by offering two complimentary meals.  We returned, we had great service, amazing food (biscuits and gravy + pain perdu) and will certainly be back again.

eszf0G-gDrhRXFj17qvaCw.text: Awesome breakfast. Every time we go the breakfast I get something different and iris delicious. The biscuits and gravy are awesome. I had the bmoc which was awesome as well. My wife loves French toast and the pain perdu hits the spot. You really need the banana though cause otherwise it's too rich. The food is awesome but the coffee is a lil much. They really sell the cold brew but I wish they upped their game for all coffee.

tItyZ08DdKCwQEjNkdupNw.text: Great breakfast. You must try Mexican Eggs Benedict ! Sopes are authentic as is chorizo!

kagDEzunFB9HMlgvL9P9_A.text: The food was "fine" but not worth the price or the service. A couple of smiling faces amongst staff, but we could have done without the snootiness. Breakfast is a competitive game, your money is better spent elsewhere.

HD0vJgaY-Dd_8s0NMNHglA.text: Best breakfast spot in Phx / Scottsdale. Normally, there's only 1-2 two things on a menu that grab your eye. However, here there's always 5-6 things my wife and I have to decide over. Probably prefer the Mexican benedict the most. Actually, the only thing that disappoints is the Portugese donut that Howard raved about. Almost don't want to post this as concerned it will just be more popular. Nice kids menu options as well.

TO8wECSbnwGkWO2TQBW5-A.text: I had the savory crepes, which were outstanding! The hubby had the banging pocket, which looked impressive but the pita bread was too soggy for him. I, on the other hand, actually liked them!

WU8cMkq7YuAlziXaPsRNrA.text: Food is great, the tortilla espanola could be improved, it's one of Spain's most popular dishes, yet so simple and it doesn't need to be over elaborated, 5 ingredients: Potatoes, eggs, onions, salt and olive oil, how can you go wrong? They need just a little of a fifth ingredient; passion. Service is confusing, if you sit at a table they move you because you have to order first, it throws people off and it gets annoying, I left my stuff at a table and they sat someone at that table, I understand the rule, but I guess I really don't like that one. Having said that, it's a great spot; different!

g6v1dW7_Ni2LQC6UOsktFw.text: They have local coffe that is awesome! The Service is really fast and the food is yummy. Im not really a breakfast person but the food was fresh good. I think my favorite this is the coffee and the homeaid jam for the toast. Awesome cute place.

rkyqIALeRQnxQRLAruoWJw.text: Yo this is my jam.  Favorite place to eat breakfast never am disappointed. High quality ingredients bomb coffee.  Always get the omelet cause it's straight fire. Add a donut for extra happiness.

j-4fjfbCU1O8zsGTfDb_kw.text: Great concept in downtown phoenix. They have a separate coffee bar for people who want to order and run. The dining room is open and airy. The food was top notch, home-style cooking. I will return.

fn3o5a0_KVBeWKjd3p0nEg.text: Outstanding breakfast burrito and Americanos. I will make this my only stop if I am in the area. Fresh cooked (not microwaved), fresh vegetables and eggs. Good portions and fantastic flavor. Please do try it, as I want this local spot to stay open for ever.  I even stop by for a mid-day Americanos because they are soo smooth and the barista pulls the shots just right. Keep it Local!

TobGX9OO_4IsSfLw1TrJ5A.text: Went in for some breakfast.  I ordered their Pain Purdu which was amazing.  The carmel whiskey sauce was good and not overly sweet.  The staff was very friendly and the place has a great look.  Nice to have a good breakfast place close to home.  Definitly want to try something else off their menu.

LqVm__r4i1XxxjqseCnk3A.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix. It's never empty and even on busy days the line moves along quickly. I always leave satisfied but never feeling "heavy" if that makes sense and The coffee is awesome

DBQZZJKLalCKO6KersxnEw.text: Fabulous European style place! Innovative menu.... Loved it, and can't wait to go back....

Y_QfBkR_TcgeibWnCRGrDA.text: Charming atmosphere and amazingly friendly staff!  By Far my favorite breakfast potatoes in Phoenix!  Not to mention, for a Midwestern girl from St Louis, Gooey Butter Cake!  The Japanese cold brew coffee is sooooo good!

9INUobFzQCYfVlG-CbYh_Q.text: Must try! Being from Los Angeles where there is a ton of amazing food options, I was surprised there weren't a lot of hip brunch options in Phoenix, but thanks to yelp, I found this spot! Great, amazing, scrumptious food! To top it off, the service is phenomenal!! If I'm ever in Phoenix again, this is the one stop I am adding to my list.

eeygKjDXgRbe9Wl0aiQyzg.text: Waffle was made as good good as a waffle iron can make it. Coffee was brewed as good as an expresso maker can make it. If u like self service, generic food,  and overpriced coffee this is the spot. Get there early to avoid lines.

bQA7vbBxPCevbifKizfLnw.text: I am always out for a good breakfast place so I was happy to have a new one near our home in downtown Phoenix. Unfortunately my husband and I were pretty disappointed with our food. The Coffee was awesome but the food was way too greasy and way too salty, I felt sick the rest of the day. This all coming from someone who typically likes salty food. I realize breky can be a greasy treat but this was too much fat and salt for my taste.  We tried it again to give it a second chance and went with a friend who happened to be a Vegan. There was nothing on the menu she could eat. It's 2013 ya gotta be a little accommodating to other peoples food restrictions in a restaurant. So, two strikes and you're out in my book.

R1N-lFhPkoxdy9NLrkCuJg.text: This place is absolutely amazing! A girlfriend of mine mentioned we try it out a few months ago and now we cannot get enough of it. The food is organic, fresh, and just simply delicious!! If you go on a weekend get there early! It is a smaller space and fills up fast. The staff is amazing and super nice! I just wish they were open on mondays....my day off

SgeXJs2wnV1Bm6_U-TSOTA.text: Really good food and some unique choices. The place however is a tad too expensive in relation to portion size to be honest but I'm willing to pay a little more from time to time to enjoy the food here. Parking can be an issue since there are a ton of places around this place. If you are looking for something new and in the mood for brunch give the place a try.

OW2PYhuXKPCFGE9yohfo4g.text: OMG, for sure, a MUST do for breakfast.  The Banana Bread French Toast was amazing, especially with the Caramel Whiskey sauce!  GREAT atmosphere, good service, yummy food.  I will be bringing friends! Thx

JpXlfsUOqiJBP9B57Mkc4Q.text: I've been wanting to check out Vovomeena for a while, so when my mom and I found ourselves in the neighborhood, we stopped in for Sunday brunch. We both got the basic Wilcox Avenue which came with eggs, toast, potatoes, and bacon or sausage. I got the bacon and my mom had the sausage. We both agreed the potatoes were awesome. I liked the bacon and tried some of my mom's sausage. It was the real, fresh kind of sausage and cooked perfectly. The best part is they have a cute patio area they share with the other restaurants in the section. Made for a cute and relaxing dining experience! Service was good though they did run out of the Sunday special, chicken and waffles.

9K5H6nTaJg5NljHSKQmsDg.text: Every time I visit this spot for breakfast I think why do I go anywhere else ever? Great food, which by the way they will make simple modifications on if you avoid wheat in your diet. Great staff. The Barista who works on Sunday, I don't know his name, but he's always part of a fantastic experience there. Great attitude, big smile, and on top of his stuff! One of the best neighborhood breakfast places in Phoenix.

-60NYr3yqCvQgLeSfQ52oA.text: This is a great place for breakfast. The staff and manager were very accommodating for our party of 10. The food is excellent and was enjoyed by all. They worked with me on my order since I have to eat gluten free.  The coffee is the best!!! We will be back!!!

9X9YRtA2kxzPYE7_qFBZZA.text: Absolutely love this place.  First time there and definitely will be a repeat customer. The menu is so interesting and innovative.  Husband had the Special, biscuits and gravy with fried eggs....this was like no other sausage gravy you have ever had...this was a masterpiece.  I had the potato pancakes with grated apples...fabulous!  Kai, the Manager, is a real professional.  He has this restaurant running like a charm.  He is truly an asset to this establishment.  Can't wait to return.

P5lfoj9obl7XXoDh7UEJbQ.text: Great food, nice location. The staff is nice. Modern atmosphere. The only complaint I have is they tend to burn the "boxty" every time.

CBTRRki7yAFB4RcP6Rlj5A.text: After months of eating at Vovomeena, I'm not sure why I shop for groceries any more.  My only complaint?  I wish they were open later.

7qL5NRbJ4P9Rj6R94_Td_g.text: Amazing coffee! Food is great! Love having this neighborhood spot!

ZB3pB_mVrt-xDOWdnNZJMQ.text: I wanted something different for brunch. I got the sausage in pita, it was very good. Nice clean restaurant, priced well. I'll be back.

UsBgmQ2xaQBxUPW-qDEwkg.text: Very tasty!  If you are in the mood for comfort food, this is the place. I enjoyed brunch there a few weeks ago with my mom. We both something sweet with a side of savory meat. I had the Johnnycakes which is like a corn pancake with prickly pear syrup. Mom had the boxty which is apple and potato pancake with mascarpone.  We were full for the entire rest of the day I believe.  So satisfying!  There weren't too many healthy things on the menu, but I don't think that's what we were looking for.  Excellent cappuccino too!

n2luHZ3QXg7dVsV_IiK0TQ.text: The coffee flight, and the tortilla espanola are a must try. Three different kinds of herb/spiced infused (tea-like) iced coffees, all delicious. The tortilla espanola looks like it would be a greasy, heavy meal but it was actually very light and refreshing! I like the casual setting and ordering at the register. It helps a lot that there a lot of nice, charming, and cute boys working there. Definitely Glad to have this place in the neighborhood.

C86ySJsnAfvmm8XD6q9F-A.text: This place does NOT disappoint! I saw this place on Check Please so of course had to try! We walked in on a Friday morning at 9am me and my 2 trusty co-worker/friends. We greeted by the very friendly very helpful manager. I wanted coffee ASAP! So I got the iced cup of Japanese cold brew. Which I enjoyed very much! You order at the counter and staff brings your food to the table, finding a table at that time was not too bad as everyone was eating and leaving pretty timely.   For breakfast I had the Wilcox Avenue which was 2 eggs, the best potatoes ever, biscuit and sausage! And yes I added the Portuguese donut!! Everything was amazing! My friend had the pancakes bacon and spuds which was delish as well! My other friend ordered the same as I but with a side of gravy for her biscuit which I normally do not like but she had me taste it and it was the best gravy! The whole place reminded us of our grandma's kitchen! This is REAL comfort good food cooked right to order! It is a nice clean classy diner feel to it! I told the manager we would be back soon, as we were.. the very next Friday! We are calling Vovomeena our little secret and getaway from work!

BfT7qLJ7WWHQPPV8rB85OA.text: Tried this place for breakfast over the weekend and it's definitely not what I expected for a breakfast spot. You order from a selected menu and pay up front; then, they give you a number and you wait at your table. Their coffee is awesome and the staff is super friendly, but I wasn't too keen with having a selected menu. Reading "No Substitutes Please" at the top of the menu didn't help either. The food is okay but nothing blew me away or would make me want to come back.

MlkAl6Vb_o6Eaq6vEWGU7A.text: The atmosphere and staff are REALLY nice, pleasant, great vibe, clean, with a well thought-out menu.  The food menu sounded really nice, but honestly the food was just meh.  We are both spoiled because I cook everything from scratch all the time, so the best way I can explain it is that they had lots of great concepts (using banana bread instead of regular French toast, for example), but the food itself wasn't super flavorful.  The individual ingredients like the meat  and bread used in the benedict could have been tastier.  I loved the fried potatoes that came as a side dish for breakfast.  The coffee was just okay and the espresso wasn't good. I think that most people would probably love it, but if you're an extreme foodie, or maybe it was just us, we wouldn't return.

PG-e6LyXdCoQmqAVslssXg.text: Had an iced coffee. It was good, but way too expensive.  I paid $5 for a 16 oz iced coffee. So my point: good coffee, just too expensive.

1lJ50ATM3U_6jNmtBNlpbg.text: My sister got the mexican benedict. She said it was super hot yet tasty :)   I got the tortilla espanola, ehhhh. The salad was very tangy and has a wierd after taste, it was similar to lasagna really, but other than that my plate was good. :) their house made orange juice was really good. Perfect.  I didn't like the set up how you have to get up and order. I love the fresh sun flowers on the tables :)

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U9Wm6HJrW2GD5OyikFVrgA.text: Amazing coffee, and even better breakfast.  My two favorites are the benedict and the pain perdu. I highly suggest going with a friend and splitting the two, because the pain perdu is VERY sweet.  The service is amazing, impressed every time I come.

Mg19tHtT0XgRco0ovKBMdg.text: The gentleman with the glasses greeted us on arrival and he was very friendly. He told us how things work here where you look over the menu, order what ya want, then you sit wherever you'd like. He was very accommodating throughout our entire visit and made us feel at home. The food omg the food was amazing. I had the Mexican Benedict and my gf had the biscuits, gravy and eggs. They were sooooo good the egg was delicious and the chorizo was very good not too salty and everything being on top of the sope I highly recommend this dish. The biscuits were nice and fluffy and the gravy was very flavorful. Next time I'm in the Arizona area this is definitely going to be my go to spot for breakfast. Thank you so much to the man in glasses who I believe was the owner for his hospitality my family and I appreciated it very much. To anyone reading supporting local businesses like Vovomeena are just as good as finding gold I tell ya.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

OIp9TBAH59MO0LosDIPJOg.text: Friendly staff and amazing food! I always leave here with a smile and a stuffed belly.

HyPQ3DiRbgFFNgWdIxQavA.text: Great food, great service, great ambiance! I had the mexican benedict and my boyfriend had the wilcox breakfast. Even the coffee was good. Will definitely be back.

z0gvnZ2UTJf3R5fUbRpSJg.text: Went here on a Saturday morning based on the reading the reviews here on Yelp. Definitely did not have the same experience as so many others. The restaurant is fine, it's clean, on the smaller side, but nice. I go up to the counter and ask the guy taking the order "which is better: Pancake or Waffle?" and he straight faced told me "They are the same, just a different shape." That right there I should've walked out. I ended up ordering the pancakes with eggs and a side of bacon and an Iced Tea. Sat down, and they brought my order relatively quickly. As soon as I saw the bacon I knew I wasn't going to dig it. Tried the pancakes, they had a weird after taste. Not sure if it was the syrup or what, but I didn't get through half of them. Bacon was limp and not very good, blah. Eggs were probably the only thing I finished. I was about to take off when the manager was making his rounds and asked how everything was and if I liked it. I informed him of what I thought of the food and he was quick to offer a refund or replacement. That right there was the best part of my experience, the managers customer service(only reason it didn't get a one star).   Needless to say I have no desire to go back or recommend the place to co-workers, friends or family.

5VeJ8l355gwvnhIDKnrpGQ.text: This has become one of our new favorite breakfast places in Phoenix, The Vovomeena! They have unique food combinations that are delicious, a very comfortable dinning experience and their name is fun to say ~ Vovomeena.  Say it with me; "Vovomeena" :-)  zee food ~ My fave is the Mexican Benedict or the BMOC.  They both are excellent choices!  The Mexican Benedict has great favor and textures with poached eggs a top of the english muffins with some chorizo and a great hollandaise.  The BMOC is pockchop/waffle/eggies and a portuguese donut (not made by a portugese person nor flown in from Portugal because I asked..) is a flavor-fest!   My son loves the Pain Perdu which is banana bread pudding french toast with the most amazing whiskey caramel sauce and a side of bacon or sausage.  I like it as well! The coffee is great and they provide you with a to-go cup when you're ready.    zee place to eat ~ it's nicely decorated with plenty of seating despite this place is so small.  They have a few larger tables, which provide you an opportunity to dine with others you may or may not know :-)  The staff is very friendly and they are always ready to help you find their morning moonshine.    It's a great little place for breakfast.  I hope to see you there some day soon!  I'll save you a spot at the end of the big table :-)

4Wn7mD7ynE0Od5H6X1MxYg.text: Our Friend posted on Facebook about Vovomeena and RAVED about the Pain Perdu. Naturally, we had to check it out. The Pain perdu is Banana bread pudding French toast, whiskey caramel, and a choice of meat or spuds. Like the G that I am, I had the turkey sausage and the spuds (so damn good)! The sausage was OK, but the spuds were cooked to perfection, and let me tell you about that banana bread pudding French toast... "So, good you'd slap yo Momma" - Pops! Much like the Terminator, "We'll be back!" to terminate some other yummy selections from their simple, but yummy menu selection.  Until Next Time...  Maine  PS The ICED COFFEE isn't to be played with, I was full of energy for the rest of the day! The OJ is really good, taste so fresh, and so squeezed!

HQg-NypnaL4QOAqCYTskSw.text: I was in Phoenix last weekend visiting the fam, which meant we were definitely out and about on the brunch scene. I've had Vovomeena bookmarked for a couple months or so, and my sister, who lives nearby, assured everyone it was a solid choice.  First, the vibe is super hip, as others have noted. However, I felt very welcomed, even with my parents and a toddler in tow.   The coffee is obviously a main attraction here, and the coffee bar side is worked by a couple guys who seriously know and care about what they are doing. I got a tea latte, since I'm not into coffee, which they had never made, but they were very interested in making helpful suggestions for something I would like.  The food was delicious, and I think between our party of 8, we tried most of the breakfast menu. The Banging Pocket (Shreiner's sausage, duh, it's the only sausage to eat in Phx these days!), the boxty (unique, kinda fruity), johnny cakes (loved! my fave!), mexican benedict, something about 3 sisters that was slightly mexican in style, and the savory crepes....all were really delicious. I even loved the link sausage and I am usually a sausage avoider.  On top of all that, a cool location, and I cannot recomment Vovomeena enough!

qcgMSTGhp-EgfuvpymXdoQ.text: Positive  The counter person/severs awesome people!   Cool coffee bar   Poached egg was perfect   Negative   There is a smell of drainage or sewer that hits you in the face once you get towards the back by the bigger tables  Spuds were cold   OJ was in plastic containers for here not eco friendly   No VERY vegetarian friendly   Biscuits were dry

OQ8f2EchhidFPrec6vGaYg.text: In my opinion, it was difficult to figure out where to order at first, and then was unimpressed by the small menu, especially on a Sunday brunch time.   By the time we got there they had run out of half their menu, and I ended up getting something that looked nothing like how it was described on the menu. It was basically an egg and potato quiche.   The coffee was good but overpriced. The food itself was average at best. The bacon I got was tough. One good thing was the arugula salad, the dressing was delicious.   I would go there again maybe for coffee, but probably not for food.

2TitgshvB3du5CwmxryNTQ.text: Props for the awesome decor and vibe but we thought the food was just OK for brunch; bland and nothing to write home about. Plus, we waited in a long line to order our food (30 mins) and by the time we got up front to order they were out of the  top 3 items I was considering to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KC-y5X5uUxvQUbl6rU4WdQ.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for new breakfast places to try and decided to check Vovomeena out. The reviews were off the charts, especially for the Pain Perdu.  To make an unbiased assessment, I refused to order the pain perdu the first time. My logic being: how good can a place REALLY be if they only serve one fantastic item? So, I ordered the Blackstone scramble while my boyfriend decided to continue his search for the best biscuits and gravy.  The food was as fabulous as I had read. The biscuits and gravy were some of the best he had ever had and I made a personal oath to come try the pain perdu. That mission was completed today and I concur with all the positive reviews. I was sincerely sad, and disappointed in myself, for not being able to finish what was on my plate.   We will be coming back!

SPJp9K13i18to4ccFdTrpA.text: Check this delicious breakfast and brunch spot out! My husband and I both ordered the BLT sandwich which was served with potatoes. My sandwich was served on a wonderful multigrain bread. In between the two pieces of toasted bread was crisp bacon, a blue cheese mayo which I was nervous about, but was the perfect condiment, lettuce and tomato. The sandwich was only $7.50 which is more than respectable for a great sandwich and side. Definitely worth trying!

eqZXky0w3LSjpOQRSmJRUA.text: Been here 3 times and the food is amazing the 3 sisters omlet is super fantastic and the bacon is the bomb! great americano / coffee beans too! This by far is my favorite breakfast spot, place is busy on the weekend but with food like this I understand why. It's why I come during the week! Lol

pH4UGxI5IRF6FwmWROrCrQ.text: Very good French toast. It was so good we had to go back the next day for more. I was a little disappointed in the Portuguese donuts but that was most likely just because they weren't the Hawaiian style I'm used to but my wife enjoyed them.

U12L-WYHoCij5NvDyWZq4Q.text: Our very first stop in Arizona. If the rest of the trip has food like this, we're in for a treat. Really cute and cool decor with incredibly delicious and inventive menu items. The Pain Perdu is a must...banana bread pudding French toast, whiskey caramel and delicious sausage and/or potatoes. We also enjoyed the Orchard French toast with honey marscapone. The Banging Pocket looks delicious and will make it on our next visit. Delicious coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice, friendly staff and cool jazz music have combined to get our vacation off to a great start.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool wall decor.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu...love it

ic58EyXkkuIezjX1T0ixww.text: Great, great, great breakfast place!  The best I have had since moving to AZ.  The owner is from RI (no surprise given the top notch food) and many of the dish names will make you nostalgic for the Ocean State if you ever spent much time there.  Try the cold brew coffee.  It is great!

-cBocl_-lUOMBbpLEes_9Q.text: I'm usually pretty lazy about having to get in the car and go somewhere from brunch since I have quite a few choices within walking distance. But after trying Vovomeena this weekend, I may have to make an exception.  When my boyfriend and I walked in, we were a little confused about how it works. The manager was super friendly and guided us through the process. You order at the register, they give you a number, you pick a seat, and they deliver your food. I ordered the tortilla espanola, which is a potato and egg Spanish omelet, and my boyfriend got the pancakes with sausage. We also got two donuts to share, because why not?  The highlight for us both was the omelete. My boyfriend doesn't like eggs, and after trying the omelete, he said he would probably get that next time. The omelete is very basic, but it's still delicious and the hot sauce it comes with adds the perfect kick. We both also really liked the pancakes. Nothing fancy about them- they just taste like really really good homemade pancakes.   While the side of sausage was delicious, my side of bacon was kind of lackluster. I would definitely recommend the sausage over the bacon. The donuts were also just okay. They just didn't taste like they were freshly made.  We got here about 9am and didn't have to wait at all. But by the time we left, there was quite the line waiting for tables to open up since it's seat yourself. They also had a decent sized patio, but since it was raining, everyone wanted to sit inside. I'm thinking the crowd might not be so bad when outside seating is also an option.  I almost forgot to mention, the prices were great! With our two entrees, side of donuts, glass of milk, and a coffee, the bill was barely $20. I will definitely be adding Vovomeena into the brunch rotation!

2LD9cnoLwGxefFBXc4kyAA.text: all I can say is wow the minions different from anywhere you can go things that you rarely see like my tortilla Espanola it's kind of like a egg casserole with tortillas very creamy text sugar tortillas perfect like the fact that they give you a greens with a light acidic dressing and balances out the eggs since I don't eat pork this is one of those very few places that has chicken as an option or any non pork meat would recommend getting this download waffle on the other hand was just one step above Eggo waffle very Bland very soft not too good another one of those places you get really good food that you order at the counter no tipping required so I could save money for more delicious food can't beat that I think next time I'm going to try the French toast saw them making it look very good will be back very soon

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

dmNKPpnW3Fn_CntzxRCskw.text: In Phoenix for some baseball Spring Training. Craving a good breakfast on our way to the game. Holy smokes! Our craves are satisfied beyond our wildest expectations. Excellent breakfast sandwich. Excellent scrambled eggs with onions, peppers and pork. We ordered a pancake style dish that has corn in it - terrific and original.  Excellent customer service. Wonderful coffee. Nice people. So awesome.

1eheSwkTXUpOueL7JBlebg.text: Met clients here for a working lunch and everyone was super impressed. Great laid back atmosphere, service was quick and efficient, and all the food was amazing! Will be adding this place to the regular rotation for sure!

OzZPd089pKPJdaon_EoaAg.text: One word, wow. Amazing food. Pork chop and waffles is a great twist to waffles. Can't see anyone not like this meal for breakfast, lunch or brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8fl51XgDxirUzbwoOQD5cQ.text: This place is not the perfect breakfast experience. It is loud, noisy, small and crowded. At least it was the day I went. However ... upon taking the first bite of their banana bread pudding French toast ... it was as if I was in the restaurant all by myself! It was that good!   Pain Perdu is the name of the dish. I will go back to this place just for another order of that! But it is also fun as the line to order passed directly by the open kitchen. You get to see what all of the dishes look like and even ask the cooks what everything is.  Price: little high Ambience: noisy hustle bustle  Service: quick and friendly  French Toast:  AMAZING!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu!! Awesome!!

qSQsPSDgXjOHpNdtWUAkAQ.text: Upon entering Vovomeena we knew that the five us stuck out like a sore thumb. Strangers in a new land searching for a delicious breakfast that will carry us through until lunch time.  I didn't catch the gentleman's name, but he knew we were outsiders. He told us about the restaurant. That we were allowed to sit anywhere, and that we should grab a menu and wait in line to order.  While waiting you can check out the cooks preparing others food. The sights and the smells were very inviting, and only made us that much more hungry. The entire menu looked good, so I decided to start the top with the Blackstone Scramble.  Of course you gotta order the bottomless cup of coffee too. I added Almond Milk to mine because I hadn't seen this option out in my native city Las Vegas. Everyone ordered food, and everyone's looked great.  Even better we were all quiet, and most importantly we all cleaned our plates.  We had a wonderful experience at Vovomeena and we will definitely return the next time we visit Phoenix.  I think I'll just keep checking things off the list, and go for whatever is second on the menu next time.  Oh, and if you want a really soothing experience.....go check out the bathroom. It's quite calming.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The crew grabbing breakfast!

s1-dO48GMYGXJoeAnq044A.text: They are lucky to get two stars and the only reason for that is there amazing coffee. Food was terrible, seriously major ball drop on the food.

Hcp3ek0hJQmoexnPeI31fA.text: Do you watch that show 'Portlandia'? If so, then you're already familiar with this place. Not because the restaurant itself is featured in the show (it's not), but because this restaurant is the sort of place that they're always poking tongue-in-cheek fun of. It's hipsterish, it's a wee bit self-important, and you'll come up on phrases like 'hand-crafted' a LOT, but the simple fact of the matter is that they've got DAMNED good food, some DAMNED good coffee, a DAMNED friendly staff, and DAMNED adequate seating.  We came here for brunch (oh shut up) and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. You *ARE* going to be surrounded by Caucasian hipsters with children named Schuyler and Harrison, but that shouldn't turn you off too much. This place has gotten some good buzz lately, and I'm thinking that they'll probably just get more and more crowded in the coming months. That's why you need to get out there RIGHT NOW and enjoy some good food and good coffee, so when you take your friends with you you can be all like:    "Oh yeah you know I used to come here all the time before it was popular"  And you'll be a better person for it.

8ZGZKhS-aK0WUO-gT_aoxA.text: The food (johnny cakes and pain perdu) was good, and the service was exceptional. At least 4 times someone stopped by the table to see how our food was and if there was anything they could do for us. We were also asked how our meal was on the way out the door. The staff were really awesome!

muEMEd1oIG-WRXgmMikZ8g.text: It was our first time coming here and I got to tell you it was pretty tasty, the atmosphere and the vibe was awesome which is always a plus. I ordered the Wilcox Avenue which were scrambled eggs,spuds(potato)and bacon with a biscuit I got the biscuit for the side of gravy I ordered which is some pretty good gravy actually the gravy is what got us to this fine establishment , My wife ordered the Mexican chorizo Benedict which she said was good but, a little spicy for her. I think she'll try something else next time. I already know what I'm going to order for next time. Coffees great and also this watermelon iced tea. Well let's see what you think after you try this place out

FZY2ou1UDoz4w9dIkBURow.text: Want to talk about the heart of a restaurant grand view of that here, as you wait in line for your fantastic meal you get a up close and personal with the line here watching them work hand anD hand together is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gPIDFnARa7H99wlIEGGqKw.text: The food is excellent, the prices are very fair and the customer service is excellent. Super cute hipster location with an open kitchen. When we walked in we were greeted by a friendly guy who seemed to fit the roll of a manager. He explained how it works, you order at the counter first and get a number and there always seems to be enough open space (tables) once you order and get your number. The server will bring your food out a few minutes later.   We all opted for the fresh orange juice, which was outstanding! We had the Pain Perdu which I didn't care for.  I was thinking Pain Perdu was going to be a banana French toast/ bread pudding type of deal, but to me it taste like soggy fruit cake with bananas over it and a rich caramel sauce.The floating manager guy was super accommodating and recommended the Orchard French toast as a replacement. Yummy. The French toast was perfect with the apple ribbons to provide a nice subtle Apple crunch and flavor change throughout the dish. We had Johnny pancakes with eggs over easy which was my fav. The pancakes are huge and delicious and the eggs were perfectly seasoned and cooked. We had pork sausage, turkey sausage and the potatoes side. All were delicious! The sausage was hearty, a bit spicy and good sized, but most importantly, not oily so the high quality of meat should definitely be noted. This was the best turkey sausage I've ever had. We also got the waffle kid's meal which comes with 3 delicious fluffy waffle sections and a sausage for $4.95.   2 adult meals, a kids meal and 3 fresh orange juice for $33 is a very great deal. We can't wait to go back and try more of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle kid&#39;s meal
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Johnny Pancakes
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu

kzSastRUn3aDNSFLlUdxwA.text: We love Vovomeena! We have been there 5 times now, and the food is always great. I order the Mexican Benedict and my husband orders the biscuits and gravy. We are always pleased with our food... the best part are the spuds! Be sure to order something with the potato spuds!  What makes this place special is the cold-brew iced coffee. We bought a glass jug and bring it to fill it every time we visit. It's delicious! We highly recommend the coffee.

rL7o3PpDVMVVPok1PEmVOA.text: Love the laid back chill decor.  Easy to order your food at the counter,  pick up your barista coffee, at the next counter, and help your self to refreshing lemon water.   I ordered the Mexican benedicts.  They were served over a sope, which is a thick round mini tortilla.  Gluten free of course.  There was chorizo in the sope and the perfectly Poached egg on top with a light hollandaise sauce.    Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

6DYMFi2f2lz-QschpCOBSw.text: An awesome time with my wife, she loved the potato and orchard French-toast. My eggs Benedict was well seasoned, a little intense for me. I did not have the eggs runny, that might have taken away from overall intended taste. We sampled six flavors of coffee, all good. Reasonable prices and friendly hosts.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict, French toast and orchard potatoes
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hours

tCnIkcrP8Lx4LDP0aiLzgQ.text: Just finished a truly fantastic breakfast at this place. Egg sandwich was delicious - sauce was very tasty and just the right amount. The Johnny cakes are an experience not to be missed - essentially a pancake with real corn and Chile inside. So so good.

u9UXd9uOFJ-VE8v9x1W5XQ.text: Vovomeena is the place we keep coming back to. The quality is always fantastic and the staff are friendly and helpful. It can seem a little hectic because you order first, then get your table, but it all really works out well. We've been at times when it's really busy and the quality doesn't suffer at all. If you've never been here for breakfast, I'd highly recommend giving Vovomeena a try.

pwTxBS8c-UypD3ePKx-fbw.text: It's THE place to go get Brunch! So delicious! I got mexican benedict eggs and they were fantastic! My husband got the spanish tortilla and it was yummy too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. MEXICAN BENEDICT EGGS WITH POTATOES

JcJ28GW_Fr9vMPanpuZa-A.text: Welcoming atmosphere.  The food and coffee are spot on. Employees were on point and attentive.    I'll be back when I'm in Phoenix!

YMsX_7pbZiQNwOAroEwtxQ.text: Food was pretty good. They didnt have alot of variety and they also dont allow substitutions so that was a bummer. Kind of pricey for not really having that much variety but staff is super friendly and nice which is cool.

qikl0_LXiiS1h2a7sWPxAg.text: Love this independent nestled into the corner of chain eateries. Not to be missed!  Thrilled to live in the 'hood so I can walk here.

jgjMGUrXPdN4uYl5UyJnkw.text: This place is real close to our house. Love, love, love the cold coffee options. Great food with unusual and delicious menu items! We will be back again for sure. :)

diDXVWgDrgHj1pZoCp_UVQ.text: Vovomeena opened in my neighborhood a few years ago, and I've been maybe 35 or 40 times by this point. The quality of the food rivals, well sorta-almost rivals a Big Breakfast, and while that may not sound like an overt compliment, that is actually high praise! The winner point here is the ability to avoid the turista/gawker contingent that plagues Matt's. You can reasonably expect to get a comfortable seat here except mid-mornings on the weekends, when it does get very crowded. We stopped coming for a while when there were more-than-occasional loud-baby issues at these very crowded times last year; it seems to me that management did nothing to encourage the young parents to perhaps take the unhappy one on a brief outdoor excursion to maybe give a break to the other patrons. This would be less of a problem if the acoustics of the layout were different--Vovomeena can get loud when crowded. Anyway, it's a problem all restaurants face, it just seems Vovomeena didn't quite master the communications with the new-child set. We just started leaving when we'd come in and see babies, and then just stopped coming in altogether when this happened a few times in a row. Things seem to have been sorted on this front in 2015, and so we've returned

X-4fuinZqZ9D31JTNtWeqw.text: The Mexican eggs benedict was awesome.  One star off because they don't have Sriracha but I'm pretty sure we talked them into getting some so they can still win it back.  The French toast was also awesome.  The location is cute and a nice size.  I think this was a great addition to the area.  Get some Japanese cold brew.

UNVTNBNSwpc4MKHMKOPu-w.text: I think for those of us who came in on the wknd of 9/30 the place was too busy and they still need time to figure out the kinks like others said. It was busy, which is a good sign, but also they were running short on the menu so I wasnt able to get the grillades just yet. Thats what Ive been wanting to try. I did have the BMOC, but it didnt excite me like some of the other reviews. I did have the pain perdu a week prior when it wasnt crowded, which is the banana bread pudding french toast and I have to say those were excellent and by far my fave thing I have tried there. My hubby had the boxty and mexican eggs benedict(by the way to other comment who mentioned, they had Sriracha and Cholulah the day we came in) Hubby said a piece of toast would go well with the Mexican Benedict to help finish up all the stuff on the plate, other then that he liked it, and hes a big fan of the Japanese Coffee also and said he probably wont go to Starbucks again either. The Boxty was interesting, but I was too busy eating my banana bread pudding french toast with Whiskey Caramel Sauce. The food is very rich and Ive found Im stuffed and cant even finish my plate, so Im usually taking some to go. If you are coming with a large group on a busy day you will probably have to sit outside at the big long counter tables. Most of the seating inside is for groups of 2-4. Very happy to get more variety in the strip mall! And yes the manager is out speaking to customers and was carrying food out along with the staff. We will be back!

OpRMZ3nL8H5L8ay0nEpHgw.text: we went to Phoenix for a show and our son found this place.  Being in the restaurant business myself  I am not so easy to please..... however I found this place so very refreshing with dishes out of the wall. The pricing is right and the food is homy with no pretention to be out of this world. Just VERY good homemade food. My wife asked if she should have the biscuits or whole grain bread. DUH.... the newly fresh baked biscuits were sitting right there in front of her. For those who have all those ideas of what they should do my answer is that those should open their own restaurant and make it better. Easy to talk and critic.... put your money, experience, knowledge and ideas where your mouth is. In my opinion this place is a go. When it come to no changes on your orders....,.. I agree. You are insulting the creator of  the concept. Get a life..... do you ask to split a Mc Donald???? with chipolte sauce???? Mc Do doesn't even know what that is. Congratulation on your concept. Great food and Great coffee. What a way to start the day with a smile.

Sikgl-RP3tGPjNJwyNBgSQ.text: This place is a tremendous addition to the 7th Ave & McDowell corner - we're very excited to have it so close to home!  I had the Savory Crepes. The filling was delicious and the sauce that topped it was fantastic. My boyfriend has the Pepperonata which he raved about. Even though it was a busy Sunday morning, we got served  more quickly than we expected. The coffee was excellent as well - a vitally important part of any Sunday breakfast!  As another reviewer mentioned, I would like to see more non-meat options on the menu. I'm not a vegetarian, but I'm not big on sausage and pork chops either. I could probably be happy with the crepes on every visit - they are that good - but I'd like to have a few more choices.  I'd gladly up a star too if I saw that happen.

uYbZqMYK0YWuYPjcvY8BUQ.text: This place was great.  They have a nice outdoor seating area as well as plenty of room inside to sit.  The decor is really nice--it felt like I was stepping inside a West Elm catalog.    As for the food, we loved it.  I had apple/potato pancakes and my husband had the Mexican benedict--both were fantastic.  Oh and the coffee is fresh and hot, which is also a plus.    The staff was friendly and helpful.  I'd definitely go back when I am in the area again.

Z_oFBSBb6k_B8szjmP3V9g.text: This was a really chill spot with friendly staff and yummy eats making it a nice place to stop in & out.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yRvgR7ccbo6bPNyAhdYhRQ.text: If you like breakfast food, now let's be real-- breakfast is the best, Vovomeena is the place to have breakfast/brunch. They also serve one of the best coffee in the valley. They get it from a roastery in Cave Creek, AZ called ROC2. They have pancakes, eggs, bacon/sausage, Portuguese donut, daily fresh desserts, spuds... List goes on and on. They are simply amazing. Give it a try and you will fall in love. Guaranteed. Oh they also have a really friendly staff. All in all, nothing but best...

9MKTTdZkm4YqmLwzdCdDaw.text: My boyfriend and I love this place. It's definitely our #1 choice for breakfast. Service is great and so is the food. The owner always acknowledges us, says it's nice to see us. I get the 3 Sister's and my bf gets the Wilcox Avenue. Also, if you sub a veggie for meat they take a dollar off. Two thumbs up!!!

EzerXrhaVR3HmbQgH2ExpQ.text: Wilcox Avenue and fresh OJ were delicious! The only thing I don't like is the order first and then wait to be seated ordeal. The place is great, rustic modern and small at the end i will still be returning.

GRdaoAOziDmhbKcsC-zPxw.text: There's nothing like meeting up with good friends on Saturday or Sunday for breakfast or brunch. It's nice to see an additional local restaurant along this strip. The Tortilla Espanola was delicious and I did sample a yummilcious bite from a Banging Pocket entree. The cozy decor is inviting. The coffee alone is worthy to make me a continued patron of this place. I'm happy to add this restaurant to a string of Breakfast joint faves within Central Phoenix. Cheers!!!

egxPxeKXVufkvnsFh-Eteg.text: Vovomeena has restored our faith humanity. The food was great and the wait staff couldn't be more helpful.. Hats off to Kaj and crew. Thanks for making it a great experience, we will be back for sure.

3RF3OMdFSj5Wx1fWLGL85g.text: I went to Vovomeena for the first time today and loved it. I had the Banging Pocket which has Schreiner's banger sausage, scrambled eggs, and smoked gouda in pita bread. It was phenomenal! All of the ingredients taste so fresh. Loved the home-style goodness!  I also had a cafe latte with vanilla. Simple but delicious.  The setup up is very modern and practical. Nice looking art on the walls. The staff was polite and friendly. The bathrooms were also very clean!  I will definitely be going back when I'm on this side of town.

yBBtU-pewa3vUes5d4-ATw.text: Wow! So impressed.  Breakfast is one of the best I've ever had.  Good service, nice fresh environment and a big plate of delicious enjoyment.  Looking for a quality place with top quality food?  Stop here; I promise you won't regret it.

8X4OEA5zJhA4udUxjSKvDw.text: We werent sure about this place before trying it, it was a random find and not typical to our normal choices. From start to finish it was great --- great service, delicious food, reasonably priced! My husband eats a lot and was full from his BMOC and I had the best waffle I have ever had! Great twist on breakfast. Can't wait to come back again!

EmkXbEq3sAXb7bCJhz7_zQ.text: Good concept and great space.  The menu is small but has some potentially exciting dishes.  Expect to wait in line, as a lot more people are becoming aware of this place and the only have one register to pay at.  Once you have ordered and are seated, don't expect to get your meal right away or even at the same time as other people at your table.  I think once they iron out the kinks it could be a really cool place for brunch and to hangout for coffee.  I am not sure it will be on the list of places to return to any time soon.

lBFAPiskW-pJ6VYP2th9zw.text: I normally order the Mexican Benedict and my husband gets the Wilcox Avenue but today we tried to other items! They sure didn't disappoint! I had the biscuits and gravy w/scrambled eggs & my husband ordered the pain Perdu. We wanted something sweet and salty so perfect pair to share. The gravy is simply perfect - full of flavor, bits of meat in it and not overly salty. The Perdu had a subtle sweetness compared to French toast (my next item to try). Needless to say we finished both plates!

mVahe-E5V0K7Yf5tHN-3jw.text: Had a day off and thought I'd amble down here today..friends had recommended it.  Had the orchard french toast, bacon and coffee.  The bacon was tasty, the apple slices on the french toast were a good touch.  Nice little place, good decor.  A little unusual in that you get your own coffee (no table service).   Definitely will try again.

LBDFTyFKLQjD83xTOqs9TA.text: Small spot with good food. I came specifically for the Banana bread pudding French toast with caramel rum sauce, and it was worth the trip if you like sweet for breakfast. But I noticed a lot of savory items being served.

x2QNw0CgsGw_FZsDRwa_Dw.text: Delicious dishes with nice staff. What else we need? I went there twice. The first time I had banana bread pudding. It is awesome, not too sweet and a bit burn  which made a perfect combo. I had Mexican Benedict on the second time. It is good and tasted totally different from the first dish I had. I cannot believe that them came from the same kitchen. Amazing.

IUW_KspKufD2VQ3lQblNEQ.text: What a wonderful place for breakfast.   Great concept great execution.  Fabulous coffee.  Makes me wish I lived in Phoenix.

uczrDzJ0eDYQ3A1CRQpUBQ.text: Finally!!!!!! A breakfast I can rave about. While the menu might not be ten pages of omelets, what they do have is delicious and unique. I got the pain perdu which was phenomenal. No odd dry parts, flavor was incredible. Sauce was perfect. And I got the sausage...yum! Done of the best links I've ever had. Perfect snap and delicious flavor. Hubby got the Mexican Benedict which is fabulous. I'm not a huge chorizo fan nor am I a big corn meal(masa) fan, bit this was epic. My husband who is pickier than a toddler loved it. "Make sure you give them a good review" and for him to say that..well it means something. I thought he would be overwhelmed buy the noise, counter order, trendy factor, but in the end none of the discomfort of those things was a problem because the food was that good. Very quick service. I do wish someone ran around and filled your coffee, but it wasn't a big deal to get up and get my own. I'm full, happy, and will for sure be back the next time I'm in town!

ICBwvlUeUnVmcgv3s8p5pA.text: My new go to breakfast place. Love the banana bread french toast. Just wish you could order a small order as a side dish. Great food, great atmosphere!

heDrURF1J9dt5x8c-RaBQg.text: ice brew coffee! with my traditional mexican benedict and chicken/waffle/pork chop/egg delight  use promo code for first free ride: uberSF8

ytUWMu4VF7J8EuCsE9mGTg.text: Although the menu is relatively limited, there were a variety of food options for me, being vegetarian. The atmosphere is great and the weather was nice enough for me to sit outside at the community style table. The food was made so quickly and with great quality. My only debacle was the request to not modify menu items when ordering.

0H66BhFaqHJKKBHmhrP2vQ.text: Breakfast with a friend is what brought me here. After the first experience let's say there will be many more dining visits. My breakfast was AMAZING.   The hidden gem has the cutest decor and layout. You can walk in through the patio or the front door that leads to a tiny coffee shop setup. I'm not a BIG coffee drinker but my friend is. He loves the variety of fresh coffee they offer.   In a fast pace moving line I ended up ordering the Portuguese Pancakes, passed on the meat and had the breakfast potatoes. They are called something else but they are potatoes. I will put it to you like this I am a pancake person. It is one food I could eat daily. Vovomeena has the best pancakes I have ever had in my life. I repeat BEST! I don't know what is in them but the flavor is so amazing I eat them without syrup and butter. My potatoes were good too but the is one problem. A good problem every time I eat here I order pancakes and fill up on them so I miss the opportunity to try anything else.   I could go on about the pancakes forever but I have to not fail to forget there service is top notch. This Resturant is all about customer service. Every person who works there you can tell they enjoy their job.   It is worth the travel I highly recommend stopping in and of course getting the pancakes. lol!

cAdJaHIDEbMSPpoA54zR6g.text: Really hip place with unique dishes. I got the Blackstone Scramble, delicious, the tortilla made it. My boyfriend got the Bangin Pocket, again the bread was phenomenal but this time it was a pita. I liked the layout, order at the counter and they bring you your food, service was quick!

fRYsisxOv51phMKvm9TBqw.text: Cute small little place with just average food.  Maybe if you come here with no expectations you might enjoy it more than we did.  The staff of very nice and accommodating.  The place is kept clean and tidy.   But in my opinion overpriced.  I don't cook but I think I could have made a better breakfast sandwich and omelet at home.
