csHFEPTnjxjfTz4tG5AsCg.text: This place was the Bizzzz! I got the Mexican Benedict that has chorizo and comes on a sope. I've never had an eggs Benedict like this and I'll never forget how magical it was. This place had several fresh coffee options which girlfriend loved. Only thing I wasn't fond of was a waiting to be seated after we ordered. We were a group of six and had to wait after we ordered. It's not the most ideal/efficient, but with a busy place like this and how great everything was ok.

qdQUp9LjorIKnv2jANKRTg.text: I don't even know what was in the 3 sisters omelet To make it so amazing, but they found the perfect seasoning blend to go with all the cheese and vegetables. Easily the most memorable omelet I have ever had. My husband got the Mexican Benedict, which was really good, but for the first time ever, he was jealous of what I ordered!  The spuds that came on the side were perfectly crispy and tender. The orange juice was unmistakeable fresh. We stumbled in to this place because it was close to our Airbnb and the pictures looked cute. Lucky for us the interior was even better than the pictures. We spent almost the entire meal pointing out interesting touches, and admiring their coffee and tea bar. Loved everything about it, can't wait to make our way back and try something else from their menu.

pTxSBIjnOEYVd3_ZJnRNAg.text: Food was good, I do wish the menu was a little more descriptive.   Love the ambiance and the coffee bar, will give it another go at some point.

9Gt1smNiw6SzdgJBkrsoag.text: The americano here is some of the best i've had. So smooth. Perfect temperature. We came to Phoenix on vacation and went here almost every day!  Food is excellent. Tried a number of things including the mexican benedict, savoury crepe. The pancakes are so fluffy. Perfect.  Highly recommended.

Co6f_8rhAIQSUIV815JU9w.text: Short Review: Good breakfast, somewhat expensive, nice dine in, warm and awakening interior (perfect way to start your morning breakfast), and good service as far as I know.  Long Review: I've only ate here once and only did take-out instead of dine-in. I've been meaning to come here to try out their breakfast since the rating of review is so high and it's right across from my work place. If I had the time, I would like to dine in next time. Let's start with the exterior. To be honest, this place is easily missed, if I didn't look up on yelp, I wouldn't have notice Vovomeena, which is a damn shame. For people who are used to looking at restaurant with your bare eyes, it's going to be difficult to locate this place since it's behind most of other food shops. However, upon finding the location and the entrance, it was beautiful. Small area outside, yet elegant for people who preferred outside breakfast. Upon entering Vovomeena, the interior environment felt warm and rich (in details of ornaments, of course). I didn't get much look around because I honestly did not have much time until I start my day of work. So, I was more focus on the menu and finding what I'd want to eat. But there were old painting around the walls and frame seems fairly worn out. Do not misunderstand me, this is by no mean a critique, I feel like frames and painting being a little worn out is a sign of classic touch to fit the morning glory of the day, the important meal of the day, breakfast. As for the service, I'm honestly not sure yet since I haven't dine in. But when I did my order and got my order, it was simple and fast so that was good. Now onto my main dish, the food, oh... goodness. I chose Mexican Benedict because egg benedict is my favorite breakfast dish. Upon touching the poach eggs, it felt almost as if soft boiled eggs. However, when ripping its' soft belly, what gurshed out is the shimmering yoke wanting to be playfully poked. On top of that is the balanced hollandaise sauce waiting to be in touch with the yoke. Leaving the other soft side is where you get your crisp bun and ground beef marinated and fried in Spanish ways. On the side the accompanies the egg benedicts is the side of country fried potatoes. Soft and gentle yet fried crispy enough to hear a crunch upon the bite. It also well seasoned that ketchup isn't necessary. All that said though, it wasn't enough to go out of my way to stop by here and grab breakfast everyday because, really? $12 something for a breakfast? That's a bit much even for mid class. It is True that price is purely subjective without doubt, but in my book a breakfast should be no more than $8. But anyway, I definitely recommend trying this place out, but I wouldn't recommend eating here everyday unless you're here for light coffee or if you have extra money to spend. Otherwise, I feel that this place is worthy of eating.

IJrCMyo5GxNMq7n2bsec4w.text: We were looking for something different for breakfast and stumbled upon this little gem. Very modern decor and clean!  This is a order at the counter and sit type of place. We like t usually sit and figure it out in the mornings..but no complaints. Simple menu We loved our breakfast... so you will see us again sometime soon

XV3KlT3keCYnQyX61yZ9tg.text: Definitely recommend for brunch. Had the Mexican Benedict which was delicious, and without eating the spuds, it was not too filling as well. The wife ordered the Banging Pocket. Salsa that was served with this was quite good. Pocket itself was ok in both of our opinions. Try the Portuguese donut as well...mostly like a funnel cake but still tasty. Only drawback to this place would be the limited seating especially if you have a large party. Otherwise, for 2-4 people, you shouldn't have any problems.

XO_l-wEsaVUQpaRuHw1-_g.text: Excellent food. I got the johnnycakes and they were very good. Coffee was very good as well. However breakfast for two was over $40. And the restaurant was incredibly loud. I won't be eating here again even though the food was good.

tFA9-qdrfgQnN57mdqPtPQ.text: We now have a great breakfast place when we go to Phoenix! Great food, Great service and cute place. We will be back!

mXqRvZvbiQb4JcrREkZ9ug.text: I love everything about this restaurant! As a new yorker i am always pleasantly surprised when the service is exceptional and this service was exceptional.  So you wait on line to order your food before getting seated. We were a party of 7 and they were nice enough to seat us towards the back by ourselves.   From the other reviews on yelp I ordered the banana french toast and it was delicious. If you have a sweet tooth definitely go for this. I also really appreciate the potatoes that came with it since it added the right amount of savory to my sweet dish. I had thought i ordered a donut and the waitress went to check on it for me. When she came back she told me I actually didnt order it but they made an extra and gave it to me. Legit almost started crying 1. because i cant believe i forgot to order the donut. i love donuts! and 2. that she just gave me one.  I dont remember what my friends ordered but they all really enjoyed their food and we all enjoyed our donuts! It was light fluffy and had a healthy dusting of sugar!  The service was great and they never rushed us to leave even though we were a big party and took up a rather large table. I'll definitely remember this place the next time I'm back in Phoenix.

08SROmuEipfZtiC-ErzE1g.text: Absolutely delicious food! Thank God I visited early on a Saturday because at around 1130, it was packed!!!  First, I like the way you order and are seated. It was pretty interesting. Next the menu wasn't too big or too small...it was just right! I ordered the Johnny cakes with bacon, I was very pleased! The rice, fruit and prickly pear syrup the came with the dish was amazing. The only thing that I didn't like is that the coffee is self serve and I didn't want to leave my plate on the table to refill my coffee cup...other than that...I loved this place

Vm3Ej7M-A3Voo1b0bktnrg.text: After a few years of service, they definitely got the ordering and table seating down pat!  Don't worry if you see a line and zero empty tables.  You WILL get a table, just line up by the coffee area and the manager, who has been there forever, will seat you well before the meal. Do not try and steal a table, they will catch you!   I ordered the Three Sisters Omelet and my DH ordered the pork chop with Portugese donut.  Everything was very tasty, with the exception of the side of bacon.  One piece was fairly crispy and the other very limp and fatty.

feVI8GUZuc8VDDNCzOCcXw.text: This place is great, between my breakfasts & my boyfriend's breakfasts I've sampled 5 menu items & a special! Everything is/was delicious  Blackstone Scramble was yummy & I took half home to eat later and that turned out to be what's happened with every dish I've gotten there. Tortilla Espanola was good, light, & delish but I only got one bite cause it wasn't mine.  My boyfriend had nothing to bring home so it was at least that good.  We did a Mexican Benny & a special Portuguese Benny and shared each having one of each, again, I brought half home. This was so good and the eggs were poached perfectly. Not spicy so I loaded the Cholula and the potatoes were great for soaking up the extra sauces. On the sweeter side of the menu we've tried the Pain Perdu which is SUPER SWEET!!! Dense and delicious 2-4 bites and wow enough sugar for a week! The Orchard French Toast is my favorite, a quarter of this dish is plenty but totes worth it!!! Lastly, GET COFFEE, it's all so good and then add some sweet Italian cream and you're in heaven.  bon appetit!   Also, the servers are friendly and will grab you a to go container if you need so you don't have to wait for the line if it's long

4WIbcqJ6Fx1GmT1F0iNsvA.text: Solid breakfast, get there early to avoid the line. Locals and tourists had packed the place. Great cold brew and quick service.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_D4Ht5CYT8fUZM7TCUFN3g.text: Great place for brunch! Barista made a great cup of joe, food was delicious. It was a different menu from your run of the mill brunch or breakfast. Highly recommend. Left one star cuz there is always room for improvement but it was a great start to the day

BeDizIJohjIeiAkuNeLRsQ.text: I like everything about this place! The food is delicious, the ambience is casual, the patrons and staff are friendly. Perfect for a fast and delicious Sunday morning brunch.

d3DBdjY4886l-zttRRxCsQ.text: This is definitely a MUST try. If you are in the area and hungry, don't hesitate to give it a go. I've been eyeing this spot for a bit and finally made it in, boy do I regret not coming in sooner. The food was absolutely fantastic and the employees were nice and helpful. There is no doubt that we will be coming back here many more times in the future. You will NOT be disappointed in the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

c_AC4BtsDlARpUU9jtH-rQ.text: I finally got to try this place a few weeks ago with fellow YES bud Mel B who is a regular. Thanks to her for explaining the parking situation to me, park behind the Chipotle!  Huge line but it went by quickly. I ordered the Tortilla Espagnol. The tomato sauce the eggs were served on was to die for.   I also ordered the flight of Japanese cold brew teas. I honestly could not tell the difference between the 3 flavors. Each were smooth and light almost iced tea like.

PYma2qXOSx2AZmhQuWfZGw.text: Food: BISCUIT AND GRAVY: had alot of meat in it, good size. Pretty flavorful and the consistency of the gravy was thick, not watered down at all.  BMOC: waffle was so fluffy and already had syrup on it so no need to ask for syrup on the side. Its already sweet enough. The porkchop is a bit more salty than a usual porkchop...I wasn't feeling it. But the waffle and eggs was delicious! The Portuguese donut was similar to a funnel cake just a bit tough, still tasty though.   PUMPKIN MUFFIN-good size, tasted great, not too sweet. Its fluffy and moist, I loved the raisins inside yum.   Atmosphere: Nice and chill environment, looks clean.   Service: the staff member in the superman outfit was figity and had no manners...running around serving plates but yet doesnt say excuse me if there are customers nearby and hes running into that direction...when we placed the order, he coughed and kept dealing with our napkins and the pen for us to sign. Ummm no very unprofessional and unsanitary.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuit and gravy

gmIZN97YfzcH88jXy44T0w.text: Packed lines are worth the wait. I love everything about Vovomeena, even the name is fun to say. The crepes are outta this world good and the coffee bar is the coolest around. Quiche is wonderful as well. GET THE BACON with everything and thank me later   Sit on the patio when the weather is nice and pet the doggies everyone brings to dine with.

x808c1TPkn-1G62hpKKUZQ.text: I LOVE this place.   I've had numerous friends give rave reviews for several years and for whatever reason it took me too long to get in here.   The food is super fresh, made from scratch. Everything on the menu is delicious (that I've had). Pancakes are to die for (as are the corn pancakes). The coffee is fresh and strong!   Staff are super friendly, and always come to check in on you.

9-D-NdMZmRh5m4k0F2V2JA.text: The Mexican Benedict is as amazing as they say! Moist chorizo over an English muffin and a poached egg. So delicious. Also comes with a side of seasoned potatoes.   The interior is very industrial/rustic. They're also known for their cold brew, and they have real coffee dripping in house in those cool glasses. What drew me to Vovomeena was the beautiful mural on the outside of the restaurant.  We came on a day that wasn't too busy and decided to sit in the back outside to be on our laptops. The wifi isn't amazing and there will be a lot of little birds hopping around outside in the summer. But overall Vovomeena is one that I would return to when I come back to Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V1I7oUGXx5CdaSbddL8Lhw.text: Breakfast breakfast breakfast. What a great little spot to enjoy some cool twist to classics. As soon as you walk in the you notice the decor is quaint.   The service was nice and knowledgeable about the menu which helped when choosing the best start to the day. Menu is simple and the full description of the selections in case you didn't catch it originally. I ordered the French toast and 2 eggs sunny side up. It was delicious , fluffy toast with the right amount batter. Eggs shouldn't be tricky sometimes the kitchen just doesn't get them right but fortunately for me they did. Had some coffee of the moonshine menu which was great. As we left some of the staff thanked us for coming which was a great way to keeping a great morning going! This is a cant miss spot. It does get busy is you can imagine just like it's been shared in other reviews.

FRHjndT2yRqfbk6cLpAMVw.text: Super fast service, loved the cute theme, and the food was really good! Sucks that you cant get refills on iced coffee, but it still tastes gr8!

d_eocPVsgckhZUBP5gvG0g.text: Amazing brunch spot. We always go to brunch in Scottsdale so I was glad to have found this place in Phoenix. You order at the counter before you sit down. We were four people but we got 5 entrees. We got the banana bread French toast to share as our "desert".  All the food was super fresh and delicious. The scrambled egg was probably my favorite. The tortilla was delicious.  Would highly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch.

mt3LOMNgNwCRWev5_-jDfw.text: Dear lord of above us. I got the three sisters omelet. I just flew in for the night and found this place on yelp. Totally worth it. I'm a bit of hard reviewer and a five star means it's awesome. Get off your butt and get over here. I wish I was staying longer to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_rJtvyM-4DkKN81-dpwg1g.text: Vovomeena has delicious food, and good coffee. Before we had kids I would have given it 4-5 stars. The seating is a little cramped, and I don't love the counter service model, but before kids those negatives were easy to overlook.   Since having children (2) it pains me too say that I won't be returning. The counter service model makes it nearly impossible to order. You can't sit down until you've placed your orders, and tables are already slim pickings. The management acts irritated with everything (even before I had kids) but that is super amplified with kids. If your order takes a second, or your kids are antsy (remember they have to wait in line too, because they can't sit down), or you add a juice to the order or anything really the two male managers make you feel like shit. They glare at you, they sigh, they DO NOT offer to make anything easier.   The last straw was that my wife took our boys to breakfast on a weekday morning, early. It wasn't busy. She had our 2 year old and was carrying our 7 month old. She ordered, they made her feel bad in the way described above. No one offered to help her carry the 2 orange juices she ordered, so she had to leave them at the counter, find a table and come back for them even though there was no one in line behind her. Then she had to ask where the high chairs were (arms full of infant and hand holding a 2 year old) and the manager pointed to the corner and then watched as she sat our 2 year old at a table alone so that she could carry the high chair with our son still in her arms. Then she had to sit him in the high chair, strap him in and walk back to the counter to get her drinks. Meanwhile they were still no new customers.   I just feel like ok, you're a counter service restaurant, but she specifically came a time that wouldn't be busy. Customer service should never be this bad. Also, guess what? Kids are part of the human race and having them shouldn't disqualify you from eating at a breakfast joint. The food is good, but everything else sucks.

KFb5uhb6sltQOAMjA5o5dg.text: While traveling to Phoenix I found out not many places near the downtown area are open at 9 AM. After scouring the Yelpiverse I found Vovomeena, and it was open! The menu looked more unique than the other locations open so I figured this would be my breakfast stop while I was in town. The location is super cute with plenty of shaded outdoor seating. The inside is really trendy and casual. It's an order at the counter then find your seats kind of place.  I went super early before it got busy so we ordered and sat down pretty quickly. I ordered the Blackstone Scramble, my boyfriend ordered the Johnnycakes. While the Blackstone Scramble was very tasty, the Johnnycakes totally stole the show. The corn pancakes were out of this world, and the prickly pear maple syrup was so unique. I kept stealing bites from his plate while also eating my own scramble. I also enjoyed the sweet rice that came with the Johnnycakes, it was basically warm rice pudding.  If you're looking for a quick, casual place to get a unique breakfast and some good coffee; Vovomeena is the place!

uN8jHvJnCZZFknpvPsQAEQ.text: This is a fine hole in the wall breakfast joint and won't disappoint the food adventurer at all. The menu is small but loaded with unique choices. I had the Mexican Benedict which was poached eggs with chorizo on sopes was great and ordering a waffle on the side is a great choice.  I've been curious about this joint for some time. I'm not going to claim myself as a breakfast connoisseur, but my gut knows what it likes and that's Vovomeena. I did enjoy popping the poached egg, it's always rewarding to see the yolk smothering it all.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mouth happiness.....

UKT4rlsMr75t-XvyaaKceA.text: THE BEST BREAKFAST!!!! Literally this place was amazing I can't say enough good things. So it's unique because you go in and order at a counter then wait for the host to seat you. Then servers come by with your food pretty shortly after. There is also a separate coffee bar. The set up is more fast casual, but the quality of the food and layout is definitely that of an upscale brunch place. The food is SO GOOD!!! You cannot go wrong with any of it, but I highly recommend the Blackstone scramble. I would 100% return!

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackstone Scramble

zV4RwaHBmuARqrrelf-V-w.text: I AM SO HAPPY that I finally made it in to Vovomeena! You guys, this place lives up to the hype and I absolutely love it.   For starters, the setup was a bit different than I expected. You stand in line and order at the counter (which is cool because you can see the chefs cooking up their creations as you wait), then get a number, visit the coffee bar (because you MUST get their Cold Brew), and then the manager will find you a table. You cannot snag a table BEFORE you order. But it was packed when we showed up and by the time we got through the line, there was the perfect table for our group of 4! So don't fret!   I ordered their classic breakfast sandwich that was on the softest brioche bun with eggs, bacon, pepper jack cheese, and chipotle aioli. It. Was. Dreamy. They served simple breakfast potatoes on the side that were also fab. I am a sucker for potatoes so this as the side made me happy! I also snagged a fresh orange juice and then our group ordered a jug of their Cold Brew because we all had to try it. If you have a group, the jug is the way to go. Let me tell you, I am so happy that we did because you guys, this stuff is amazing and will give you the energy boost that you need to get through the day!   I will 100% be back ASAP because it was incredible! Definitely expect a wait between 9a-12p on weekends because it is a very popular spot but they've got it down and you won't even notice that you're waiting! The ambiance is GREAT. See you soon, Vovomeena!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee is a brewing!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their amazing cold brew!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RTkQYuFefbpqlIXkTkWlgQ.text: Great brunch spot - small cozy vibe but busy and with good reason. The offerings aren't overwhelming but you're covered whether you want sweets or are more of a savory breakfast type. I usually go for the sweets but was craving some protein so my friend and I split the Pain Perdu and the 3 Sisters Omelet - it was perfect. The omelet was good with a good amount of veggies and not completely overwhelmed with cheese but the Pain Perdu just stole the show. It was a banana bread pudding french toast, so think a really dense banana bread, but moist like a french toast, topped with a sliced banana. For most items on the menu, you have a choice of meat (bacon, sausage, or turkey sausage) or spuds. Obviously, I went for bacon and it was perfect, balancing out the sweet Pain Perdu. Vovomeena gets a thumbs up from me!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu - banana-y goodness
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee lab

mCfR9x1ywrFIw3q3qcVMcQ.text: So much YES. We had Vovomeena for breakfast our only morning in Phoenix and it was so good. I don't remember off hand the name of the dishes we got, but mine was the banana bread French toast which was dense but packed with so much flavor! My husband got the waffle with pork and egg and it was not like anything we've had before, so many levels of flavors and textures. We left thoroughly satisfied. The inside and patio of this place are so cute too! The only thing we didn't like is the "order at the counter then sit down" style but it was worth it here.

ggGYPO-HccmV_8p0hI7K8A.text: Absolutely perfect! What a fantastic breakfast! Homemade goodness right there! We ordered an egg sandwich, orchard French toast and the 3 sisters omelet.  Coffee was delicious as well as the freshly squeezed orange juice!  Come here and leave 110% satisfied!  Thank you yelpers for giving this place such high remarks, that lead me here! Forever grateful

HHhgZOfk3kerZHSwlI41OA.text: Nice find  Vovomeena is tucked away and almost hidden in a fast food restaurant complex, this small restaurant is  serving up delicious breakfast.  My sister and I went for Sunday brunch around 9 am. When you walk in, you are given a menu and asked to place your order at the counter. There was a short line, however we were seated quickly. Our drinks were served as we waited for our meals.  Although a bit pricey, I really enjoyed my breakfast of Johnnycakes.  My sister ordered the B.M.O.C (waffle w/pork chop and eggs) and said everything was delicious. I'm sure are meals were loaded with calories but it was worth every bite.   Indoor and outdoor seating is available.

4290M-PZF5Vhhfaymf6OtA.text: Why bother with a little side of bacon when you can get a whole piece of pork on top of your waffle? WITH eggs AND a Portuguese donut! B.M.O.C. - just do it.   Cute patio area and relaxed atmosphere. Decor is hip and clientele is very mixed. Great people watching :)

pqjdb5FXI9d5CBOMSZyR_Q.text: Service was excellent. Fast and efficient. We ordered the Mexican Benedict and the pain perdu. Mexican Benedict was delicious! The pain perdu was a little too sweet for breakfast but it was really good, tasted like my mom's capirotada!

vLStCgXPeARDNvegd_sz_w.text: Found this fantastic breakfast on Yelp. Great food, great service. Big fluffy pancakes!! Groovy atmosphere. Loved it. We'll be back to try some of stuff he more creative stuff on the menu.

aKS84_Z7a_omYxL-wqdjQg.text: A very trendy eatery. Coffee is on another level! Food is great but not fantastic as far as flavor goes.

8quDScQ5kkJXDW6S9BrDFg.text: This is an update to my pervious review, I got a pm from the manager stating that they did have the mexican benedict but their warmer was out (idk what that means), it's even more disappointing that they did have it and refused to serve it, i don't get to downtown phoenix often and made a trip just to try this place, so disappointing

FzU_wMnyrw6C0gxYayXjYA.text: Craving biscuits and gravy and reviewers raved about them here. The gravy itself wasn't all that flavorful, but it was full of sausage chunks that helped. The biscuit was a bit stale; almost like they had used a day-old biscuit in my dish. My boyfriend had the pancakes and enjoyed those, though.

jS14N_hu_QV4op04IYIQcw.text: Love the vibe and smell of the place!  I love to smell coffee, but I am not a drinker.  I got their green tea.  Pretty good.  Came with friends and wanted to try the Japanese ice coffee.  I would come back for a bite, next time!

Fj6Fye63Lq45Rr8K9G04yg.text: This place was busy but we were able to get a table.  The food was delicious and everyone was very nice.  The pork chop and waffle was amazing!!!

q0gnkb7G_VmBDmpxbOo7rg.text: I love this restaurant. Been here many times. I've had several dishes including the banging pocket, Mexican Benedict, as well as the French toast. So good. Iced coffee is delicious as well.

pZUr-ZnOBLEhPX0x-Pe_5A.text: This place was pretty good. I got the Savory crepes they were really good except they came with some weird red sauce. Didn't ruin the meal but if I ordered again I would request that not to be on it

09EBnIpBo_uN-7KeZ3RYYQ.text: Came into town for training and stopped in for breakfast. I was not disappointed. The food was delicious, and the staff was great!

7OoeXNu4NWXP0OWPjWTngw.text: I found myself with a morning free and contacted a very good AOB buddy of mine, T, and asked him if he wanted to join me for coffee and a bite to eat. "Sure, but I only have an hour or so. Where do you want to meet?" He said. Hmm, he lives about 2 miles away from Vovomeena and I had bookmarked this place a while ago so it seemed like a good time to give it a try. First of all, let's deal with the location. No problem for me. Personally, I typed the address into Google Maps and let the software do its thing. I read some people were unhappy because Vovomeena was hard to find. I guess they don't have a cell phone with Google Maps, or a computer at home with same, or GPS in their car, or... seriously. If you can't find a place that has an address, who's fault is it? Bash the establishment? It just makes you look silly. The place is on the South East corner of McDowell and 7th Ave. It's there. Just pull in and park, you'll find it. Once you're inside you'll be happy you went through all the hard work it was to find Vovomeena in the first place. OK, I'm being sarcastic. The innards are cool. Simply laid out with a coffee bar as you walk in. And it serves Japanese Cold Drip Coffee so if you're a fan, get some. There's also a good variety of other coffee's according to my friend so the variety should satisfy most coffee drinkers. Plenty of Yelpers have pointed out how you order and blah blah blah, so I'm not going to go over it again. I felt the guy behind the counter who took our order was very pleasant. I had a few questions about the menu since I was a Vovomeena virgin and he gave me all the insight I needed. We chatted about nothing in particular and he seemed like a very pleasant person. We had already grabbed a table in back before we ordered so once our orders were in T got himself some coffee and I opted for the fresh orange juice. Yummy stuff. The orange juice that is. I don't drink coffee.  I had the Banging Pocket ($9.95). This thing is huge. I was very impressed with the portion size. A delicious pita stuffed with scrambled eggs, sliced Schreiner's sausage, and smoked gouda. I felt everything worked together well. Winner winner Pita dinner. Could it have used maybe some other ingredients? Sure, I'm a chef. But I think the focus here is showcasing the Schreiner sausage, which this "sandwich" did. I enjoyed it. If you read the ingredients on the menu and think it should have something else, ask. There were also some lovely breakfast type potatoes alongside. T ordered the Pain Perdu ($9.50). It's a banana bread pudding French toast with Whiskey caramel sauce. He said it was pretty good. It looked good. He ate the whole thing. There were a couple of, let's say, hiccups however. The plastic varnish coating on out table was peeling away. That's because the sanitizer, cleaner and whatever else they might spray on it to wipe it down does nasty stuff to the top coat of the tables. Another issue is that since T and I ordered separately our food didn't come out together. T ordered first and I asked the guy taking the orders if he could just put my order under the same number. Nope. No can do. So the food didn't come out together. In fact, the food came out way to far apart. 3 - 5 minutes. Unacceptable. Both are easy fixes though.  Great Food. Fair Prices. Pleasant Staff. Timing issues. Furniture in need of repair/replacement. 4 Stars.

3FdvH84rJ0oskPNmY3Fb-g.text: We're from Buffalo, NY, so we are here based solely on reviews. Vovomeena did not disappoint! Our food was extraordinary. I had the johnnycakes with spuds. Oh. My. God. Make sure to ask for the Chilula, the green hot sauce with the wooden top.

sHfBoEVhihVKQBe6c1mMSA.text: We saw Vovomeena was listed as the best breakfast in the neighborhood by the New Times so figured we'd give it a Sunday morning go. What a great place! It's hidden behind the Five Guys in that center so we'd never even seen it before. We were fortunate that it was not as busy as some other Yelpers have experienced and,showing up during a lull, the coffee bar guy even came over and discussed the menu with us.   Great service, great food, love the atmosphere and coffee. And all just an easy bike ride down 5th Ave. Sinfully delicious but a worthwhile breakfast bookmark.

QP3WmWBsS6oPqLqbBKUMpQ.text: It was a warm after thanksgiving Friday. I was one of the lone people at the office, my hunger grew and at each attempt for food I was foiled as many places were closed for the day. However I lucked out and found this place. Cute little brunch ish spot.  Most of the menu said "your choice of meat" so that meant for me as a veg look elsewhere until I found the roasted veggie and egg burrito (to go only) for ~5.50   I raced back to my desk and tore open the bag. It smelled great maybe beacuse it was also close to 1:30pm and I was starving, but it was a bit small, the tortilla was a bit too soft and moist for my liking the eggs were well cooked as were the veggies the cheese added a bit too much grease for my liking.  The included salsa was unique as it was hot more like a chunky tomato soup.  If you are not veg maybe you will find a few more options than I.

626r3EZonevm9s4yGLfa0A.text: I've been twice and the food is very good. The service is excellent as well. The atmosphere is nice inside. It's busy and there's a lot of bustling around, but I like that.  I got the Mexican Benedict the first time and biscuits and gravy the second time. I enjoyed both items very much.  If you like cold brew I recommend the cold brew sampler. Nice addition to a nice breakfast   Just keep in mind the prices are a little more than most breakfast places. The quality is worth it in my opinion.

WaLj93MQ8i3mbN3c-ftnsw.text: Went today for brunch and enjoyed the Mexican Benedict and Bread Pudding.

yXD2q098_5xw3wcCJOfL1g.text: I've been here twice so far and both times have left stuffed and happy with the food and service. I've tried the Mexican Benedict and the special of that day, the huevos rancheros. Both were so flavorful, and those potatoes complete the meal. I've only tried the regular brew coffee, which is also very good. My friend ordered a cappuccino that was just about the frothiest coffee I have ever seen! I like that you can order your food and pay before being seated, and I appreciate the little coffee bar to the side where regular brew coffee is self-serve or they make specialty/espresso drinks to order. Staff is also very friendly and accommodating.

faeeq02l5UQjIeg-I8rs6A.text: What a hidden gem! We were in from out of town and found this place on yelp. Chef, your food was amazing! It was so hard to decide on what to indulge in. We score with our selection the Johnny Cakes and the Mexican Benedict. Potatoes were to die for. The Arroz de Leche with my Johnny Cakes was the perfect combination of sweet spice and tart with the strawberries. We will definitely make this a must stop when we are in town. Oh I also tried the iced coffee & Caffe vanilla latt, yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Johnny Cakes and Mexican Benedict

FhUiESJtfV42A8hcweg7Cg.text: The breakfast and brunch here was great.  Loved the atmosphere.  We had the special of the day which was a prime rib sandwich.  The kids had pancakes and waffles and all tasted great.  The portuguese donuts were great.  Will definitely come back again.

LktcF_GiUp-o76mdEuEd-w.text: One of the best breakfasts I have had and I have been to many unique places.  The portion was a little slim but the taste and quality outstanding.  Just a cute and unique little place in an older and rejuvenated part of the inner city.  Great and friendly service too ! I will return

WYZ8m46lPYzVN-z9Y1WVpw.text: I really enjoyed Vovomeena.  The food was excellent and the portions are great.  I would be hesitant to eat there again on a weekend, though.  It was so busy (good for them!)  Hit it up on a lazy Thursday AM for a great, chill, relaxing breakfast.  The Japanese cold brew coffee is very very tasty!

nogBb4Y4vWVKls1ZL9fhBQ.text: Good, but almost too hip for this self proclaimed foodie. Two over medium eggs, sausage, potatoes, toast. It's breakfast, not art. Fifteen minutes to get to me and being picky, no run to the yolks. Not killed, just not perfect. No subs, out there indie music, order and sit. Food was good; it's me vovomeena, not you.

VAH7nnDXOTVf8tuwirbnkQ.text: Not from AZ, used yelp to find a nice, favorable restaurant of the locals. I found this restaurant to be a flop unfortunately. I really wanted to like it. The location was ridiculously hard to locate, the decor is adorable, and the food was subpar. Walking in had no direction on what to do, apparently you walk to a wall and grab a menu then proceed to the cashier stand and order, then grab a number and seat yourself, which I found to be slightly edgey yet confusing. My cashier was unpleasant to order with as I was with a vegetarian person and she wouldn't budge on letting us upcharge for a french toast? It would have to of been a separate charge to an addition of their meal. I ordered a Mexican Benedict which seemed like a nice modern twist, everything they could have cooked before service, THEY DID AND IT SHOWED. The poached egg, was over cooked (no runny yolk at all) and cooked well before I ordered, as were their breakfast potatoes, which were too thick, par cooked, slightly cold and just mainly inedible. Overall, it's a neat concept restaurant, yet I would not go back.

Foy_TCY80hBrYiGIKXzT5Q.text: We went on Mother's Day around 9:00 am and they were able to put tables together for the 10 of us. The service people were very nice and friendly. We really liked the food. Among all of us, we had just about everything on the menu. If I had never had Matt's hashbrowns and bacon, I would have thought theirs were great. Still good though. I had the BMOC and it was wonderful. My husband had the Grilllades. He hates biscuits and gravy so I was surprised. He liked it and the fact that it was spicy probably really helped. I tasted the pancakes and waffles that others had and they also were very good. Based on just one visit, we will definitely go again.

LBqDJ0Ni1-BPzqaAayk0Ag.text: The banana bread French toast was amazing. The chorizo in the Mexican eggs Benedict overpowers the dish but it wasn't bad - just not the best Benedict I've eaten. Just avoid the coffee flight - overpriced, bitter and undrinkable.

Z38WkKMbZECEouMfrsxIBg.text: Wicked fast service.  Cold brewed coffee is a nice change.  Good variety of menu choices.

sJPmdlGMhp4UcNTicwOMWA.text: If you've read my reviews of Tuck Shop or Astor House, you knew I would be at Vovomeena within a week of them opening.  My dad and I made breakfast plans and he requested Astor House.  I let him know they opened a new place right by Easley's we had to try instead.  He happily obliged. Vovomeena is a saving grace for an awesome brick center that was face-lifted to house small chain eateries.  I shouldn't be so hard; I love Zoyo too.  Just like Astor House (and the other eateries there), Vovomeena is order at the counter and a staff member will bring you your food.  I recommend finding an open table before ordering and claiming it with sunglasses or a book.  We were there the weekend after it opened and open tables were sparse.  I'm sure by the time I finally got around to writing my review (two months later) that it must be much busier and tables even more sparse. I woke up that day craving biscuits and gravy; so I naturally ordered the biscuits and grillades.  See my Astor House review if you want to know more about this tasty dish.  (It's just as awesome in the aves).  At a little nudging from me, my dad ordered the BMOC - Big Man On Campus.  Heck yes!  A deliciously rich waffle topped with the best pork chop I have ever had, over medium eggs, syrup, and a Portuguese donut for good measure.  I knew the waffle would be bomb because I've had the waffles at Tuck Shop (you can read about those too in my Tuck Shop review).  This pork chop was heavenly.  I'm telling you that I'm seriously planning to make pork loin with maple syrup in homage to this pork chop at Christmas.  Cut it with a fork smoked tender meat... oh my goodness!  I don't know that I could ever finish a BMOC on my own, but was happy to eat some of my dad's.  The donut was a perfect dessert my dad and I shared at the end.  Light and fluffy with a taste reminiscent of funnel cake.   Vovomeena has that amazing cold brewed coffee chocked full of the caffeine I love.  Fantastically attentive and friendly staff - probably from all that cold brewed coffee. The space is that modern, industrial chic that we all love.  There's a buffet table near one of the entrances we thought was the hostess stand before we determined it was also counter order and seat yourself - my only complaint.  Though it is not really a complaint.   I can't wait to go back and try more.  I'm disappointed in myself that I was so hell bent on having grillades that day, I didn't get to try two brand new dishes.  Luckily, it's just down the street.

I2WGeOHrKXjQbDBuvTXLMw.text: My partner and I have been to Vovomeena three times, and everytime it was great. Full disclosure, though, the second time we went we only got the iced coffee as their kitchen had run out of food! (This was around 12:30 on a Sunday; absolutely forgivable for a restaurant who just opened and is working out the kinks, and if that's the worst thing that will happen when we visit then that's a pretty great sign.)  The space is absolutely gorgeous. You forget that you're in the midst of a glut of chain restaurants and it definitely rivals the Tuck Shop for ambiance. It's wonderful that they're both different yet obviously part of the same family. Another thing those two spots have in common? Gorgeous, uni-sex restrooms. It's a small touch, but it always make a restaurant feel more like home when the washroom is nice and I always appreciate non-gendered restrooms.   Another plus is the counter service; it makes things a little quicker and is smart for the lunch concept. The service itself has been gracious, from the barista to the counterperson to the kitchen staff to the busers, with a special mention to the manager, who has been sincere and nice. This level of service is impressive for a new restaurant. (Stark contrast to the Chipotle 20 feet away, where the staff still acts like it's the first opening day and runs around like chickens with their heads cut off, but that's a whole other review!)  Lastly, the food is fantastic. I had the B.M.O.C. the first time to quench my enormous weekend appetite and the pork chop was remarkable. The waffle got a little lost, but I tried the waffle on its own the last time I was there and I think I'll just get that from now it, as it's really fantastic all by itself. Other items tried and approved, the tortilla espanola and the johnnycakes were really great. (The rice that comes with the johnnycakes was a fantastic complement to the johnnycakes, please don't get rid of it like another review suggests!) The prices are fair, I think ordering a la carte might be the most economical option if I end up going here as often as I want to. Also, the food comes up a little slowly but it's nothing unusual for brunch.  My only critique, although I'm not taking off a star: please get real maple syrup! I saw some fake syrup being walked into the kitchen one day, and the syrup that came with the waffle seemed overly sweet, so I'm guessing that the real stuff isn't being served. I could be wrong, though, as I'm not maple syrup expert, just an enthusiast. All the other ingredients seem top notch, though (thanks for locally sourcing the meat, so this former vegetarian can eat it without much guilt!)

8SQRuNbXzmRIFdX1J8ewPQ.text: Orchard French toast is the best French toast I've had.  Decadently sweet but not cloying. Even the regular coffee is awesome here.  We're from out town and sampling different local places but we'll be back here tomorrow

0pwpmBi3_jMCbMSpeDHeBg.text: I hate to do this, because I don't want this place to be busy for selfish reasons, however I have an obligation to uphold. It is of no surprise that Vovomeena is anything but fantastic, coming from the flavor dense minds from Tuck Shop and Astor House.  This morning I got their signature Japanese iced coffee and the Espanola which was kind of an egg, potato, spinach and cheese pie with a chunky red sauce that is bursting with flavors.  The decor is sustainable and hip, chairs were comfortable, lighting is good, staff is friendly and personable as well... Can you tell I like the place?

Ii1ziCuEcA4u1LzIj3zOxg.text: I work at the Zoyo next door to Vovomeena - Today was my first time ordering from them. I truly had a wonderful breakfast, I ordered the Wilcox Avenue which is a traditional breakfast - i wanted to play it safe.. lol And it was amazing. as i was waiting for my food i saw a few other dishes that looked amazing. The menu is small yet the options have so many items it seems bigger. The best part is the coffee bar which is all "locally crafted" as it states on their menu. They can make u just about anything!! Ben the Barista was a super sweet guy and gave great service!! The decor is beautiful. Check it out!! u will not be disappointed!!

Ttp42x6oZrARY3KWEj8DRw.text: My sister took me here while visiting from WA and I must say I haven't had French toast this tasty in a long time! It was done with challah bread and topped with sliced apples and honey mascarpone! It was so delightful!

F_qspobo6g-8IWMi8cCArA.text: Me and my bf have been wanting to try this place for a while because we've seen other Yelpers' reviews and pictures. First off, for first timers, vovomeena is one of those places where you stand in line and order first then get to find a table, which I don't mind, unless there are no tables available by the time you order. We ended up sitting outside. The food came out pretty quickly; I ordered the Mexican Benedict and my bf ordered the Banging Pocket. My food looked good at first glance, until I noticed a puddle of grease under the eggs. Since it was a variation of a traditional Benedict, it came on sopes instead of English muffins, which was not my cup of tea. The Banging Pocket was described to me as cheesy eggs and sausage in a pita.  It was very one-note and just needed something... The food was nothing to rave about and definitely nothing to come back for. We decided that this was one of the few times Yelp ratings and reviews let us down :(

yj2JzQSGQbNvPyKXqOeCWg.text: Great food!  Different options than the average brunch. Casual atmosphere, no wait for a table due to their set up of ordering before being seated. Will definitely be back!

bVzIxcEvjBJz2BI1wV2lnw.text: Just the eggs with potatoes, toast, and sausage were great, and I enjoyed the coffee too. Over easy eggs were cooked perfectly and who doesn't like Schreiner's sausage? The whole grain toast was hearty and came with nice butter and jam. The manager here is super nice and very accomodating. Well done guys!

cfy6qzbiX2md6rvyeM48xA.text: Here's the deal.  The food sounds special but it really isn't, and normally that would doom a place to me.  But... I keep coming back.  Why?  Because I don't come here to eat amazing food.  I come here to hang out in a casually stylish environment with good music and truly good coffee in a dedicated daytime establishment.  VVM definitely owns its slice of the restaurant ocean by sticking to a simple and stylish formula.

bkf7HTKwikuuLK0IZvfWug.text: Delicious breakfast, NOT low-calorie!  It's in an odd strip mall, missed it our first time around.  Biscuits are delicious.  Self-serve coffee, casual yet efficient service.  We had a late breakfast, but I imagine it's busy early in the morning.

qaXiO_5dCv9GMj2wX_0xkg.text: Absolutely delicious food and great service! Very unique menu items and cool atmosphere.

snFjQc6yyelE3XvnY6tSnw.text: I think this is going to be my go-to spot for breakfast,  A friend who is a semi-regular at Vovomeena and I had a breakfast meeting there at his suggestion. I had the Banging Pocket and loved it.  The food was delivered quickly and the service was attentive.

gLFBk5F_GyoMNd4tQeRrgw.text: Delicious food!! Get ready to wait for it but definitely worth the wait. Johnny cakes are amazing!! Try the pork sausage as well.

Ca9PSl0lMznztHZ3xr1URQ.text: We have been coming here for breakfast weekly for over a year now. Never been disappointed... Great food and awesome service. If you want to rev up your taste buds this is the place awesome favors that will keep you coming back for more ..did I mention the great service .

9vQIpFA7ornsUFYodpROrw.text: Great breakfast, really enjoyed the breakfast potatoes, that are typically a miss for me, and the biscuit was tender and flaky. I am in the area all the time and never realized this little gem was there. Definitely can easily become a new breakfast fav!!!

1Mc_w9KlCsgQ3T-QbQPfNQ.text: We came for breakfast at about ten on a Sunday morning. Our table had Mexican Benedict, pancakes, and biscuits and gravy. The food is good, home style cooking but didn't seem outstanding. Everyone liked their food with the exception of the hash browns being a little below average.  Would we come back?  Probably in the winter but it's maybe not good enough to come back, stand in line and then eat outside in Phoenix in July.

EtbduvEg7bX88t7sc0pSpQ.text: Seriously, kind of wish I never tried their waffle because it was THAT good! Urgh, now I'll never want one anywhere else! An additional bonus, the bacon was fabulous! Love the atmosphere and how on top of it the staff was! That in itself, is hard to come by!

emPz41eLjVAX6nTZsyL-9Q.text: Love this place! The BYOC is amazing! Best pork chop I've ever had. The Mexican Benedict is good, the Banger is good, it's all yummy!

PCcXbNNz4y_5kFv6EfvMhw.text: This restaurant is super cute inside. You have to order first up front before you sit. They have a good selection of breakfast items. I always order the Wilcox Avenue. I get it with over medium eggs, their spuds (which are super delicious!), the biscuit, and bacon.

DkX8o6BQsOOp74f_V5tUOQ.text: Love this place... Atmosphere is great, very friendly,  but parking is sometimes a little crazy.  Great food, coffee orders are sometimes a little slow,  but those donuts make it all worth it!  Yum, just like the ones I had in Maui.

8fxgbreKkQ_Aanu9iEUI9Q.text: AWESOME!!!!! I got the Wilcox Avenue and a waffle....the customer service was top notch, I actually made a mistake and ordered a dish that didn't come with a waffle, and was given the waffle for free....(can't beat free)

hMxEnZDU3VNbdbcdxMkvgA.text: This is what downtown has been missing. A quaint, reasonably priced, good energy place that is all inviting.   This place is just plain good. Great food, great service, great atmosphere, great time!   And they have tabasco sauce!! So many breakfast places now don't have tabasco sauce. The young girl who served me said "thats all we have...".   I'm hooked. I'll be bringing people to eat here.   Impressive joint.

osb0asPduGid8LpwCmhCHw.text: Always wondered what this place was and I am so glad I tried it out. My boyfriend and I went on a Saturday morning. We didn't have to wait to order, which isn't the norm at most breakfast places downtown on the weekend. The staff was very friendly when we arrived. We both ordered the biscuits and gravy. The food arrived to our table quick, less than five minutes after ordering. The portion was large and it tasted great. I enjoyed the atmosphere and really liked the coffee bar. I would definitely recommend this place to friends. We will be back soon!

kkJEItSEupEQDUQ7RhX0QA.text: It was good breakfast, not sure if it is better than Matt's or Snooze, but comparable. The bacon was good. I wasn't wild about the coffee and they only had one, the others were out. It was extremely busy and we sat outside. I am interested in going back to try something other than breakfast.

ukoZUuHKZCkfMa06zbUp8Q.text: I had the Savory Crepes, and it was very good. Portion was generous as well.  I went on a Sunday and the wait was not very long. Staff was super friendly, and decorations make this place very cozy, good for meeting up with friends! This place was not so loud that you couldn't hear yourself talking.  Also, they have outside sitting that I highly recommend!

iyFpVPKoj_uC16YxfUY-9w.text: Full disclosure: I'm not a pretentious foodie.  But, I do enjoy a wonderful meal and we found one today at Vovomeena.  The pain perdu (banana bread pudding french toast with whiskey caramel sauce) will be a contender for my last meal.  The service, simple atmosphere and price point were equally delicious.  Vovomeena management, get yourself to Chicago!

39WkvQjJcvVAOt20ZcRQsw.text: The Service, Atmosphere and Breakfast - all top notch! I had the Orchard French Toast with brekafast potatoes and it was delicious. All the flavors melted together on the french toast and the potatoes were crispy and soft, just how i like them. I held out to eat here on my 4 hour drive from California and I am so glad I did. Breakfast Heaven!

Pf32QISRDRqsFwhx5xbXng.text: Finding Vovomeena and parking there are a bit of a challenge.  Accept that challenge!  This delightful, locally-owned place offers wonderful food, ample portions, and high quality at very reasonable prices.  We're vegetarians and Vovomeena makes ordering non-meat items extremely easy.  Have out-of-town guests?  This is definitely a "don't miss" for visitors.

DqPELGDET24-UdeL6sS9SA.text: Hidden gem.  The only thing that supersedes the great service were the homemade biscuits and coffee.

lBPU4zLEtC6R_FNQgAxxUg.text: Pretty tasty breakfast, had the mexican benedict which was savory and spicy.  Ordered a side of pork sausage which was ok but not great.  I shall return for the benedict, very delicious.

6-CCCxUYVVobCygm1H166w.text: Delish! I ordered the Pawtucket west and added 2 OM eggs. The perfect mixture of sweet and savory.

I6WOeMz79Lx3cxzt9d2xJg.text: Love that is little local spot is a jewel among the chains that surround it on 7th Ave.  It is always busy with activity for breakfast/brunch.  Even though I am not a coffee drinker the Japanese cold brew is a favorite with my husband.  The hot chocolate we ordered for our kids was "real!" The food is reasonably priced and tasty.  The service was quick and the manager walks around checking on the tables.

xM2RLhfEujegRy6_EfizsA.text: One of the best breakfast places around! Their classic egg sandwich is fantastic.

13SPTmnSuTBbMtx2a2JSxA.text: My family and I visited this place on Father's Day. It was a little bit hard to find because the location is kind of hidden. However , when we finally did we were helped rather quickly despite of how busy they were. The food was delicious, and a good size too. Their coffee is great and the employees are friendly and helpful   They lost a star unfortunately because it took a bit to find, and it was slightly on the pricier side but worth it! We had a little bit of a miscommunication with one of the workers that left a little bit of a bad taste but nothing that will probably keep us from coming back

mAIEM3ju7c_KRH-t-DrHDA.text: Good spot for breakfast. Orange juice is not the fresh type just FYI. Got the chorizo Benedict, which was pretty good, but it's also a little spicy so watch out.

483iG6XFTfXfmNLPQKap6g.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in town! It's a very cute and hidden place but i love their atmosphere and the food is always on point!

IturJlLo0_BsRbYvaX28Og.text: AUGH that waffle/pork chop/egg combination is So good perfectly meaty, sweet and carby  i hear the service can be a bit wonky  but the food is definitely solid  come by for breakfast just don't order a coffee that was the one thing i thought was wildly overpriced

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ORzrJ8Z8fP7N_SXW3yinTA.text: Out here in Arizona and found this gem of a place! Great ambiance, great breakfast! Great if you are short on time. Definitely recommend to out of towners looking for a good breakfast place with quick and polite service.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YaAVt5uwkNKYno1z7VkGdw.text: Such a cute little place, very clean. Came here on a lunch date. There wasn't very many people at all (later in the afternoon) so we were able to get in and out pretty easily. The food was very delicious, ordered a sandwich (forgot which one) and enjoyed it way more than my date :-0   My only complaint, is the parking sucks as it seems they share a small lot with other businesses.

0vKuyecmZ0G3cV0Vd1VvUg.text: Nice breakfast spot we found while traveling through town. Friendly staff will help with suggestions on food. Good portions with plenty of options. Casual atmosphere with outside tables too.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

A8sR-8DanHxDbnXIcMbrRA.text: OMG I love this place . I could eat just about anything off the menu and be happy. (Just about, because I don't eat beef, but seriously anything else) The food is just damn good. Absolutely one of my favourite breakfast places in CenPho and every single trip here has been a wonderful experience. They have enough cold brew here to fuel a zombie army for ever with those massive yama towers in the background. The coffee is fresh and strong and the barista is very friendly and helpful.  The decor is definitely worth taking a picture or two, the place is spotlessly clean every single time and  the portion sizes are generous. Definitely will come back for more !

aElejLGCPXKJimV-9wtNRA.text: Yum! the waffles and pancakes are the bomb.  Great food and coffee.   I would say what really impresses me if the staff.  They are always very courteous and welcoming.  I won't go back to a place that has good food but the staff sucks so the spirit of this joint is refreshing.    Good job Vovomeena.

rtZ3sr4JMDcsfLJyzjpZ8w.text: Visited this cute little restaurant last weekend to have brunch with a friend. There are menus available upon entering the line to order. There were many different egg dishes, but I went with the French toast! There was indoor and outside seating and the wait for the food did not seem longer than 10 to 15 minutes! However, if you order a beverage such as coffee, it is not brought to your table, but to a table nearby the drink station without notifying you.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YPvhDMMN4WILiIUcNBOVoA.text: I came here for brunch and tried their biscuits and gravy, Mexican Benedict and their banana french toast. I was really excited for their biscuits and gravy, but it was just okay. I liked their sausage gravy but it wasn't as flavorful as I expected it to be. Their Mexican Benedict was just okay as well. Their french toast was pretty good, but very sweet. If you like banana bread, you'll probably like this dish.

eMbkV_GCiohGT_PrGokeNQ.text: I got in here pretty early on a Sunday morning and didn't have to wait at all. The menu is different from a lot of breakfast places and I appreciate their creativity.  I went with the 3 Sisters omelet. The ingredients were tasty and I really liked how fluffy the eggs were.  Coffee and service were good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 Sisters omelette

VS0eZalL0FPBkrndpfFW2w.text: Delicious!! Great coffee and amazing food!! If you haven't been here, you're missing out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EKpOAoGvThVL3lXwg5py5w.text: Such a cute little brunch place the Vibe is great, and so is the food, it's also known as a great coffee spot but to my personal opinion I have higher expectations for coffee . Customer service is amazing and food was looking forward going back and trying other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XR9Srq-94GNSxsvgqk_U3w.text: This is my first and may be my last experience with Vovomeena. Google Maps is our constant companion while on travel as is Yelp in helping us to navigate an area which we are unfamiliar. My husband and I value our breakfast time and after a search I decided upon this local place. We made our way over with the help of Google maps and imagine our surprise when the app said we were there but none of the restaurants were of the name we were seeking. Puzzled we walked about the corner thinking a restaurant should have some kind of signage especially if tied to the same block of businesses. Still nothing. Having gone so far I was not deterred and proceeded to call the restaurant. The phone was answered and I asked for help if we were at the right location. Somewhat tinged with an air of pretension the staff person directed us to the back area of the business fronts stating we had to gain entrance through the courtyard. My husband and I made our way around the side of the building and saw a sign (at last!) that stated Access to Courtyard. A bit wary because it looked like the area where they would dump grease or trash I slowly creaked open the heavy metal gate to come upon a small man seated upon a bucket having a smoke. I asked if this was the entrance in a somewhat sheepish tone but also keenly aware that local businesses can at times have their quirks. He looked at me and chuckled but said nothing aside from a slight shake of the head. I asked again unsure if we were in on the joke or the butt of it and then slowly backed out thinking this can't be right. One final push took us around the corner to the back where finally we saw a small patio area with a sign (yay, another one) nestled in a receded business area that directed us to the restaurant. At the entrance there were posted directions for guests (a bit Soup Nazi-ish  but I guess they need order) and my husband and I after making our decisions made our way to the register. The cashier was not friendly asked for our order and had the air of pretention and exasperation with new guests that immediately made me feel unwelcome as if our presence was a bother (think nothing of the need for patronage and common courtesy for your customers). I ordered a variation on eggs benedict while my my husband had an egg scramble with a tortilla, coffee, orange juice and waters. We chose outdoor patio seating to have our meal. Not long after a gentleman came out with our food which looked reasonably good but was made better by his much more customer service oriented attitude. My meal was 2 poached eggs set upon a bed of chorizo with 2 hockey puck sized corn meal discs. The dish was "ok". To me not worth the effort and slights taken but enough to fill the void. My husband found his eggs to be a bit bland as well and used a copious amount tobasco sauce to give it additional flavor. Coffee was fine and maybe would have bliwn my socks off had we ordered the specialty coffee and not just the regular offering. Wanting to end with a bit of sweet we ordered one Portuguese doughnut to share. The doughnut was a small disc made heavy with the residual grease gathered at the bottom from not having been drained properly. We ate little of it noting the simplicity of such an offering goofed not speaking well to an establishment that holds itself in such high regard. Overall the experience was lackluster and little effort made by staff to make it any better less the server of our food. WilAnd then l I make my way back ever? Probably not. I think a business should value it's customers and not think a haughty attitide will be made up for with mediocre food.

OC6zf-G5--hEQF3rYrw8lw.text: Decided to try this place since it was close to where I was staying on vacation. The set up is different from any other place too. Walk in, get handed a menu, get in line, order, wait to be seated. Once we sat down, our food took less then a minute to get to the table. The food was excellent & the staff was very friendly. I would recommend this to everyone who's around the area looking for a quick breakfast/brunch place. Will go back once I head out to AZ again!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IAy8kzMTQRUuNK6MUZR0NQ.text: First time today and it was ok. Wasn't too busy. It's a little awkward because they have a different process for ordering and seating but theres a sign to explain that. Basically you place the order, get your drink and then wait to be seated. The menu wasn't impressive, I didn't think there was many options to choose from. Anyhow, ordered the Mexican Benedict. It wasn't very impressive or anything special. I wish they had sides to order because you really don't have options. Overall, I might try again but not anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

B6ABuXJiIVesWU2duL6dEw.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would! My husband and I shared the Orchard French toast and the Wilcox Avenue. Both were out of this world.  I am from Rhode Island and I loved seeing the menu offerings named for things from back home like Blackstone, Three Sisters, Pawtucket, and Johnny cakes.  We sat outside to enjoy our breakfast which was a great start to a beautiful day.  This place is just great and you must try it out ASAP!

-Ztpjw4NTzBaW1XkT1ps5g.text: Loved the artsy vibe breakfast was bland good but not amazing didn't really like the flys flying around there was quite a few obviously out of the restaurants control. It did make me not enjoy my breakfast fully.I would give this place 3 stars. The service when you ordered was subpar the manager did come to greet the table which was nice would I come here again not my first choice but maybe someday I'll give it another shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Art
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Japanese flight coffee
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orchard frenchtoast

2OTw7H3yi3U3fsSLoY5rAA.text: I was in the area to attend to some business and in the mood for brunch. The hubby and I found this little nook of a restaurant. The parking lot is small but we had no issues - we came on a Monday at around 9 am so it was not packed and not a long wait. I am not sure how packed it is on the weekend but on a weekday, it was totally a laid back and chill atmosphere. They have a separate place where you can get drinks and cups for ice water.   The food was amazing! The innovative menu and obvious care in the prep of the food and tasty, generous portions is the reason for the 5 stars.   We loved the BMOC - waffle (soft inside and just melt-in-your mouth delicious), a tender sweet-yet-savoury pork chop, and an apple syrup that I wish I could buy a bottle to take home, and a egg. OMG! It was so good, better than any version waffles I have ever had. It is worth a trip just to have this! It came with a Portuguese donut which was too delicious to describe with mere words (I think it would have tasted like pillows of heaven if it had been warmed up...).  The Mexican Benedict was novel - spicy meat topped with an egg. I have to admit I have had better hollandaise sauce but it wasn't bad, just not the best... The corn (?) tortillas-like cup instead of English muffin I didn't really think added much to the dish - might I suggest a sweet corn pancake instead? Well, that's just the foodie in me imagining I could do better   There are so many other menu items that look just unbelievable and I need to try so I am definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican eggs Benedict
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half eaten BMOC - you can see the layers of waffle, pork, apple syrup, and egg - Portuguese donut is behind the egg.

sQX26VsWPvmpDVnFEDKe9w.text: Very interesting menu ... a lot of good looking items, so it was hard to choose. The starting muffin was nice and spongy ... good and dense and not overly huge.  Good coffee too.  The scramble we had was filled with big chunks of veggies ... the pork shoulder was soft ... a fresh soft tortilla ... steaming hot.  Usually we really like order first sit second atmospheres.  However I'm not too sure about a manager to do the seating if you aren't going to seat me before I order. At least don't make me fill my coffee bags in hand and then stand and wait for you in everyone's way.  I know on a busy day there is wait, but that was very uncomfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackstone scramble
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate cherry muffin

-6F2z2FsciJ2vFQmMbgFpw.text: Nice brunch place. Definitely try the biscuits and gravy. Flavorful gravy with nice chunks of sausage. My boyfriend got the blackstone scramble. It was meh; no real flavor. The only real complaint I have is with the cashier. He didn't greet us or try to make small talk like he did with the other customers. Just stared at us until we ordered. Also! The muffins are dry.

JJooBCu5CDuMY8qh8RxM-Q.text: I'm so sorry to write this review, especially after reading some of the higher rated reviews, but here's my opinion.  First things first: seating. For large and wide bodies, pure agony! The seats are very small and uncomfortable. There are outside benches that will accommodate large bodies like mine, but it's August. I'm not eating outside.  Inside the place is very cute. You order at the register and your food is subsequently delivered to your table. Self serve water with small plastic pixie cups so if you're thirsty, fill several cups at one time.  I ordered the Wilcox which consists of a salty biscuit, a strange tasting jam, half cooked bacon, sliced half done potatoes, scrambled eggs. I was not happy.   Thinking back, I should have asked what the jam was made of rather than simply ignoring it. Also, I could have asked them to crisp my bacon, but it was busy and I didn't want to bother people.   All in all, I will return to try another dish, but I'll have to return when it's pleasant enough for me to sit outside.

kqaB5kmJ7ysS7MzHmUpfEA.text: Vovomeena is set back in a little plaza with a cute patio for outdoor eating. The inside is done well, very welcoming and decorated tastefully. The ordering is seamless, there was a line on a Sunday morning, which would be expected and the manager helps you find a seat. I ordered the Mexican Benedict and bottle water, $16. I sat down and shortly after my plate arrived. I had my first bite and it seemed a bit underwhelming. The hype with all the positive reviews I was anticipating a breakfast packed full of flavor and originality. I felt it fell quite short, lack of any taste or unique flavor. It wasn't the best, but certainly not the worse. I wouldn't go back, if I had a choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Long line, but hope it&#39;s worth it!

-YnrMc5b0QPZr7Rfuj1DlQ.text: I can honestly say, I never had a tortilla espanola before. It was super tasty and was made with egg whites and potatoes. It reminded me almost like a quiche. I normally don't eat salads but this one was arugula and it tasted pretty crisp. My bf said it tasted like grass, but I told him if it did then people would be eating grass by the handful. I chose the sausage as my meat option and it had a similar mouth feel like bratwurst.   My bf liked the simplicity of the classic egg sandwich. Can't go wrong with classic.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic Egg Sandwich

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back entrance

4PyQY0dP398zhZ9ma4-BGA.text: Vovomeena was solid. I am glad I tried it, but the food was not amazing. The menu was not overly creative and ingredients were fair in quality. The actual restaurant is very cool. I ordered the special which was corn beef hash. Not bad. The coffee was a little burnt tasting as well. The others I brought wish really enjoyed their meals, but they're not yelp elite. I'd come back and give it another try.

qVSKPUPBi9rojwOmvoUJ7A.text: Delicious!!! The service is great, cool environment and the Mexican eggs Benedict was amazing. Cold brew coffee was so yummy! I will be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cold Brew Coffee
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Eggs Benedict

CSk6qOVinxxLSSTkStciNA.text: "Insane!" That is the word my (very picky) fiancee used to describe the food here. Yep, it's that good!  Modern, hip, clean and friendly, with a unique ordering/seating concept that seems to work well for quick service. We split 3 meals--Pain Perdu, Savory Crepes, Mexican Benedict--all exceptionally tasty!  Only complaint would be parking--be careful and patient searching for a spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Savory crepes, Pain Perdu, &amp; Mexican Benedict

_L1xfNEPcGTHYeH9Cc9H2A.text: Food was bland.  Ordered Mexican Benedict, great concept poor execution. The chorizo wasn't bad but it was missing flavor as a whole. The potatoes were bare with a hint of onion. Reason for the 3 stars was that the iced coffee was great, the service was amazing and I enjoyed the ambience.

7EYYoBxolz55UFy97O5XLg.text: Delicious breakfast / lunch spot .. entrance is in the back by the parking lot ..  Pick up a menu before you get to the register to order & before finding a seat.. you will get a number and a mug, to get your own coffee if you have drip coffee with your order ..  I've had the Mexican Benedict it was a delicious twist on chorizo & eggs .. every bite was full of flavor.. highly recommend   On my recent visit I had the Wilcox Avenue which comes with eggs your way, schreiner sausage (locally made, amazing.. so good!), potatoes & toast with a jam that I poured on everything it was delicious.. possibly homemade.  The drip coffee is also rich and flavorful without that burnt aftertaste you get from a lot of coffee places. The coffee counter has your choice of milk .. soy almond half&half and all the sugar options you could need as well.  Stop by the place for breakfast lunch or brunch you won't be disappointed

E3w5dEqZuCDkKpmBbW4OZQ.text: I tried this place since a coworker recommended it and I was not disappointed. I had the Johnnycakes which was, "two corn and chile cakes, prickly pear syrup, sweet rice, choice of meat or spuds" ($9.50).  My favorite part of the dish was the sweet rice which was essentially excellent rice pudding! Mmm I'm wondering if I can just order that on its own.   The pancakes weren't bad, just not my jam. I took what I couldn't finish home and used my maple syrup on the cakes, and it was much better! I think the prickly pear syrup is just too subtle.  The place is however very beautiful! Love the interior design, truly some original features like the vertical rope divider (my favorite part).

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Johnnycakes, corn and chile pancakes, sweet rice (rice pudding), prickly pear syrup, and potatoes ($9.50).

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front.

Qjl624VMPNULx1jWTN6dng.text: I was expecting a lot more from Vovomeena after reading all of the amazing reviews. I came at 10am on Saturday and the line was out the door. You order first, and then you wait in another line for the manager to seat you (they don't allow you to seat yourself or save tables). I thought that was a little weird but oh well- we didn't end up waiting too long after ordering to be seated.   I'm giving Vovomeena 3 stars because the food just was not that impressive. I ordered the classic egg sandwhich and was so excited about the chipotle aioli sauce but the sandwhich ended up being pretty dry and flavorless. I would not order this again. I also tried the Mexican egg Benedict which I was not impressed by either. The meat was not marinated well and the sopa was very rough. Overall, the food was not as enjoyable as I hoped.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic egg sandwich
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pawtucket West

w_d6tsvDrU56J7v3BZnzAA.text: Vovomeena is one of about eight choices for food on the Southeast corner of 7th Avenue and McDowell.  The good: It's charming, welcoming, warm and adorable inside. There's areas to work, areas to socialize and an outdoor patio. The food is unique, as they are adjacent to common fast food chains. Their menu is creative and it was really good food.  The 'meh': It was a tad pricey, especially given there are much less expensive choices within twenty feet. And yes, at least one of them are very healthy. More good : Vovomeena has a healthy menu.  The ugly: Parking! Oh man. Tiny lot afforded to a very popular corner. There are a few alleys to navigate, two very busy roads, and an extremely popular location with a small parking lot. There is a road parallel to McDowell you can park on, but be careful, lots of driveways and some no zones.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seating and ordering
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee bar

Xq5erejmq9FGnCLtJmkXlw.text: Great little breakfast joint.  My coworkers and I came here to celebrate someone's birthday.    This location was clean, well kept and well decorated and quite inviting.  Seats are limited, but the staff is friendly, kind and professional.    The food was top notch and very delicious.  I ordered their blackstone scramble.  Decent quality and good portion for the price.  Their jam was quite amazing.  So order some bread!  Parking sucks here, so try to carpool or come during non busy hours.     After the meal I went to the loo to do some business.  It was okay, not the best I have experienced but not the worst either, the toilet was same as a common house toilet in power.    Overall a good experience, don't see why I wouldn't come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
