RV_drApc8e2Li6mfCuTQgw.text: Vovomeena is located on Mcdowell and 7th Ave, parking is away back.  No servers, you order your food and beverage and then it is delivered to your table. Food didnt take that long, and was delivered hot. Super cute trendy location.  Food; you have to try the Mexican Bendict, to die for I would highly suggest having it.  I loved the combination or traditional with an mexican food feel.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LZ7fsxaDiGKGXHxXhdEcyw.text: I came here for the egg Benedict, and unluckily I chose the Mexican Benedict, I just keep forgetting how much I don't like Mexican food... but that's my fault, overall it tasted well, The waiter was friendly and I think it's a really nice place for Breakfast

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. London fog?
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican egg Benedict, if you don&#39;t like Mexican food don&#39;t try it

3YeCJvVwElxgGleNKwh__g.text: Was looking around for a nearby brunch place and this came up as a recommendation. I live down the street from this place and have strangely never seen it. It is definitely a hidden gem, and I'm so glad I found it!  As soon as I walked in, I was greeted by the manager and prompted to order at the front . The menu selection is very diverse for brunch. After reading the various reviews on Yelp, it seemed that the Mexican Benedict was one of the most popular items so that's what I got. Despite being pretty busy, the food was done in less than 20 minutes for our table! This is crazy for a nice brunch place! I'm use to waiting at least an hour for food and table! Not here!!  The Mexican Benedict was very flavorful and unique. I've never had anything quite like it for breakfast! Poached eggs were perfectly cooked on a bed of chorizo and sopes. My partner got the 3 sister omelet. Very cheesy with unique flavors!  All in all, this hidden gem has top notch brunch and coffee  at a reasonable price without the crazy long waits of other places in the valley! Will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Three Sister Omelette
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

bX4F-uwTvb6TKXuTEVU3kA.text: A must try! My friend and I loved what we got. I had the Mexican Benedict, which was very different than a traditional egg Benedict, but super tasty! My friend got the tortilla espanola which was also very unexpectedly delicious. The cold brew was also very good. I definitely want to go back and try other items!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla Espanola
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cold brew

8rCRvidXC7jH_UE46eBDDA.text: After several years of going here, it seems they've finally set into their stride.  I almost always order the b.m.o.c. and I encourage you to do so as well.    When they first opened they would endeavor to really impress you with the dish, the quality is still there, but the presentation has become more functional, with less pizzaz.    The proprietor is almost always there, and makes the rounds to his customers, a good touch.   The wifi seems slow and weak.   The coffee is very excellent, and I suspect they hate wasting such excellent coffee because it's almost always on the verge of running out.  Good job at increasing the size of the coffee mugs, which reduces the number of refill trips.   There's sometimes a long line so I would get their either before or after the brunch rush.  I've gone at 1pm for a late Sunday brunch and there was nobody in line.   Overall, 5 stars.  The menu is so dialed in I am sure, but I'd love to see some new things, or variants on the classics.  I know exactly what I'm going to get when I go to Vovomeena... A good solid breakfast.

aL8COE5hL08oZVehPz1yjA.text: Great place for breakfast! Awesome combinations, friendly fast service! Omelet was super good and so were the pancakes.  We will be back for sure!

3aFAG5Paqi58tQeI7Ul4CA.text: This place is amazing!! Best French toast I ever had. And the people are very nice. Food is incredible.

MvUUUWE5nQnIuBAOM5zcFA.text: I'm not one to give 5 stars, but VovoMeena deserves it. Incredible food, incredible staff. The quality of food was exceptional: fresh, perfectly cooked and thoughtfully presented. Their coffee is excellent too!  Add the donut to your order!!

Mvhy_SfsCXrWvFBK17seCA.text: Amazing breakfast, lovely people, and perfect iced coffee! I (heart) you, Vovomeena!

AV6MtADEYi2_ZUzJOTuG-w.text: The food was great, the coffee rich and delicious, and even though our party was larger (10 people) and the inside seating is pretty tight, the staff was very accomdating and helpful arranging seats for our whole party.  I'll be back!

A-0m-4t35QQ0Ya_Ulk1Dgg.text: I decided I needed to finally leave a review after I have been here so many times. My favorite breakfast in Phoenix, hands down best service and food you will get in town. I have always had such positive experiences here, and whenever I have family or friends in town I bring them to vovomeena. I think the quality of each dish is outstanding time and time again, paired with the friendly staff and quick service I am never disappointed. If you come before 8 you won't need to wait too long, but even if you do come in the busier time of day 9:30-12 its worth the wait! Thank you Vovomeena! And as always support local and family owned businesses.

KxdML5o_Qvlt-VsXDs7lWg.text: This spot is special.  I love the atmosphere and the modern/hipster vibe I get from here.  My friend got the churrizo eggs Benedict, and I actually forgot what I had lol.  I remember being satisfied though.  The way they have the service set up is that you get seated (or in a cue) once you place your order.  Tables are turned rather fast and food comes out pretty quick as well.  I loved the self serve tea and coffee station they have, it really sets the vibe for Vovomeena and makes you feel like you're in another state/country.  I did have an issue with my plate, however the server immediately gave attention to the matter and swapped it out right away.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends/fam and can see this being an instant favorite brunch spot!!

TvqgS9vrOHpZ15dcHunCbQ.text: This place is certainly a hidden local gem! Amazing food and the coffee in and of itself is worth the stop. The Johnny cakes are a must along with the biscuits and gravy. So far, I haven't been here and tried anything I wouldn't recommend. Parking is scarce, so I would recommend car pooling if you're meeting people. It's the perfect little spot for weekend brunch with girlfriends, family, and kids.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Be prepared for long lines... But the food is soooooo worth the wait!

JTIIfBBzXwQs78Q-TCw3vw.text: I came here last Saturday with my best friend for a post Junior League rummage sale breakfast and we were impressed.    The decor is cute, you feel almost like you are in someones home, even if the traffic flow and set up the restaurant is somewhat perplexing at first.  Soon enough we figured out where and how to order.    For other first timers, apparently you grab a menu at the end of the line that runs right in front of the open kitchen, you chose what you want while in line and then place your order and pay at the end of the line.  Not a bad set up as it allows you to see right into the cooking stations and watch the chefs in action (which is both neat and reassuring at the same time) but, when you get to the end of the line and pay that is where you are expected to also add your gratuity, and I just don't like the idea of having to pay gratuity on a meal before I've even been served or tasted the food.    Am I the only one that feels that way?  I think setting it up like that almost encourages patrons to hold back on the gratuity because we have to bet on the law of averages and assume that the service will be mid-grade so that we're not over tipping and if the service was great the server loses because lots of people don't carry cash.  I'm definitely not gonna swipe my debit card again simply to pay an additional gratuity.  Tipping at the end of the meal represents a better snapshot of how the diners experience really was.  Okay, getting off my soapbox now...  So, I ordered the Mexican Benedict and it was very good; spicy, savory and filling.  The poached egg was laid atop a perfectly flavorful bed of chorizo and smothered in delicious Hollandaise sauce.  Sadly I didn't detect any tomato or cilantro in mine.  Perhaps it was cooked into the chorizo and that's why I couldn't taste it?  That's okay though.  Honestly, the only aspect of the meal I didn't like was the dense, cold sopes that the eggs were perched atop of; they were hard, flavorless and cold.  While I understand wanting to keep with the Mexican theme, I still think that an English muffin (or anything else) would have been a better option here.  Or maybe just heat up the sopes first, so that they're hot and soft?  My best friend ordered the Pain Perdue with whiskey caramel sauce.  Oh, dear sweet, 6 lb, 7 oz. baby Jesus, it was SO GOOD.  It had the perfect texture and sponginess and spice.  You could really taste the bananas and the whiskey sauce was the perfect complement to the French toast; amazing.  It was served with two pieces of breakfast meat (she chose bacon) and the bacon was just so-so.  Not really brilliant or detracting, just your average piece of bacon.    She had a caramel latte and I had a plain cup of coffee, she loved her coffee and I thought mine was just okay.  Again just average coffee.  Decent, but not exotic in any way.  The service was very good and we were brought our food within just a few minutes of taking our number and having a seat.  About halfway through our meal we were checked on to make sure we were doing well, we were, and then we spent the rest of the meal enjoying the food and the decor and making silent comments about the eclectic assortment of guests around us.  (When you've been best friends for over 25 years, you learn to have whole conversations with just a look.)     So while I did mention a couple of things that I thought could be improved upon (the cold sopes and the advance gratuity being the most important issues) I still had a great visit, and it was a nice breakfast out for both of us.  We will definitely be back.

0dQ3d5jzwgYV7hsCXNTXOA.text: I don't know where to begin.....the service, atmosphere and the food was perfect. I was quickly greeted as soon as I entered the door by a very kind man who I found out was the manager. He gave me a menu and explained a little bit about the process of what to expect when dining here. While you wait in line to place your order you're able to watch the cooks grill up some of the tasty plate options which makes it even tougher to figure out what you want to eat. The aroma from the grill is just intoxicating!! Ok.... focus!!! :) So, the juice if freshly squeezed here too. Talk about every single detail was evaluated here. You are seated after you order your food so don't pick a table prematurely. You can choose to dine in or outside either way the atmosphere is very inviting. So back to the food. I've had the chorizo, biscuits and gravy, waffles and chicken, and the ham. Everything tasted spectacular and was cooked perfectly. The way that they plate the food here is a work of art. I guess you can see that I'm a fan. So fellow yelpers and foodies you need to come and check this spot out if you haven't already, see you there!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles and the best donut I think I&#39;ve ever had my life
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage biscuits and gravy

TM00XCTh8B3aqkVf1YFpfg.text: Vovomeena has some of my favorite food and coffee in all of Phoenix! The best service! The business makes for a fun brunch!

4f_gnKTf53-Qtx5Cd_k26A.text: I've been here several times and always get the Pan Perdue.  It's excellent.  The staff is friendly and the food is prepared quickly.  I don't drink coffee, but my husband said their iced coffee is the best he's ever had.    My only complaint would be the various signs posted all over the place mandating that you do not sit down at a table unless you have placed your order.  I've never seen such a rule and I've certainly been out to eat many times.  Seems like an odd thing to enforce or care about.  What if your feet hurt or you are old or you have kids with you?  Ridiculous, especially given I've never witnessed a time where someone is standing around with food and no place to sit.

mOCpz4vahJhxps9cpmx_fw.text: Terrific breakfast. Awesome location.   Inside decor is really cool.   Recently went here and took a long time to get my food. The owner took the initiative and checked on our order to see what was going. He came over to my table to advise me that my ticket was lost but they re-entered out order. The owner refunded us our money. Whether this is normal protocol or not, the manager did not have to do it and showed us how amazing their service is.   Even with the mishap, I will still be visiting this place often!

vSVcuG4ahSekQegHN2aOag.text: Exceptional food and service.  The Johnnycake's we're amongst the best I have ever had.  Get the sausage!

RffMP_dS3WepJSYJuWoMPA.text: Pros:  Goodfood and diversity on the menu.  Awesome space and great outside seating Parking is accessible  Service was nice GREAT MUSIC. Ha! 3/15/16 whoever made that playlist deserves a metal.  Cons: Weak coffee Small portions for price  The ordering system is annoying; you order at the counter like its a coffee joint and then get your own coffee refills, etc. I don't care to eat out for any meal besides breakfast and I guess I'm a bit of a diva because I love being served -- I recognize I am probably not the majority, but it's a con for me.

JGos7z3K4BMTYEgeXjpbtA.text: Diverse menu with cooks that can back it up. Place was really busy and they were able to put out 4 star food in very short order.

stdLllZgIPaunERwuPPsRw.text: 10/25/12 Cool-looking eatery! Loved the artwork, especially the mosaic pieces, and I liked the twist taken by using recycled twine as a dividing line between the pathway and the tables. Way too cool! :) yelp.com/biz_photos/vovo... yelp.com/biz_photos/vovo... yelp.com/biz_photos/vovo... I've eaten here twice, once with a friend (see photos taken on 09/30/12). The first time, we ordered a few items and shared, and we were both blown away by the very-high quality and big portions of the dishes we tried. My favorites then were the Pain Perdu with Schreiner's sausage, yelp.com/biz_photos/vovo... and the B.M.O.C.-- a HUGE bone-in pork chop presented on a lovely waffle, topped with two fried eggs, with caramelized apples in whiskey sauce to garnish. yelp.com/biz_photos/vovo... We tried two other items, the Banging Pocket (didn't impress me) and Boxty (I found it too greasy). On my October visit, I was disappointed in the much-smaller portioned Pain Perdu I received, yelp.com/biz_photos/vovo... and the pieces were so dense, they weren't much fun to eat. yelp.com/biz_photos/vovo... The coffee was still very good, however. Five stars for the first visit, and 1 star for the second- great coffee, and free refills to boot, so what's not to love?, so an average of 3 stars. Will return to try the B.M.O.C. again. Hope to bump it up to four stars, which is a good review from me, as I'm assuming this isn't a GMO-free establishment...

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuit, on the side.  Delicious!  Eaten on 9/30/12.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 9/30/12
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Pain Perdu, consumed whole-heartedly on 9/30/12.  Notice the HUGE portions.

Q8TP23c9Xb9on0EPvJurpA.text: Vovomeena was really good. We went on a Saturday around 11 so it was pretty busy but the line moved quickly and we were able to get a table almost immediately after ordering. I was worried about parking but there was a decent size parking lot behind the building and another next to it. I would definitely return and try more from the menu.

Wv58YVKvmq33rdHxPp4XGw.text: Known in folklore as a cure-all, the Vovomeenian johnnycake smorgasbord (not the right word to use, since it means bread and butter, but let's just run with it) offers life-replenishing powers for uninspired, hung over, and weary brunch soldiers. The legend says... "Add four poached eggs to this. And a Portuguese doughnut."   So I did. The dish is just called "johnnycakes." You know, johnnycake - noun - a flat cornmeal cake typically baked or fried on a griddle.  I received two, plate-sized. Studded with corn. Stacked with fresh strawberries. Oh, and scoop of sweet rice pudding. Plus, two sausages. And a pitcher of prickly pear maple syrup. So, when you order the johnnycakes, know that it may be a working title, and that the definition is approximate at best.   Use this flexibility to your advantage and continue adding brunch items with reckless abandon. Don't think about it.* I recommend four poached eggs and a doughnut.  *Unless you have something to do in the next four hours, besides for nap.

jwYClOAKF9L2aM0rJx2-1A.text: Strange layout and awkward way to get coffee. I think this place would work better as actual "sit down" service, not counter service.   But I digress, food here is incredible. Got the biscuits and gravy, wow, have not had such good gravy in years! Go try it out!

eQYsMPGBA6S0suozsK-p1w.text: Good eats!  Had the blackstone scramble. Really good. I'd add cheese. Homemade tortillas are awesome.

BCtTuTVuvxCm_6MSBfxp6w.text: I loved the people in here (employees were super friendly)....I loved the patio. I loved the free parking. The design and little kitchy things that made this place unique.   My husband said his espresso was excellent. Seemed like a super popular place.   I feel like the menu could be better somehow. Wish they had poached eggs.   This was my only problem: I discovered a hair in my food.....I was upset. I didn't tell anyone. I was grossed out.   The people, staff were welcoming and super friendly. That part I loved.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla espanola
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Purdue

BnhmBD-1T2r7st95wYaCuw.text: We were in a rush to catch the diamondbacks game and wanted some brunch type meal with some coffee. We called ahead to see if there was a wait, and the person of the phone responded with there's never a wait, but it's a little busy right now. I was curious to know how there is never a wait, and it's because you go up to place your order and then find a seat. Very clever way to handle a rush in my opinion. We tried the Japanese iced coffee and it was really good. I had the tortilla espanola, which was delicious and fluffy like a cake, but savory like an omelet. I also ordered a Portuguese doughnut, which was kinda harder than what I would expect a doughnut to be, it was lightly sweet, so it kind of reminded me of a flattened churro.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla espanola

N-G0BL-RNmIwluWNn88yAA.text: So I came for the first time today and it was PACKED at 11-11:30am. Tip: do NOT come on Sunday mornings around this time (maybe better next Sunday?)  I got my food at a pretty reasonable time considering the amount of guests here. Was told the Portuguese donut wasn't available anymore and was kinda disappointed but when they brought out my food I had to ask if that was it or not. Apparently I lucked out and got it anyhow.   4 stars because of the great tasting food. Solid amount of food to definitely feed you and your girlfriend (bmoc at least).  Come give em a try! But sit inside and make sure you don't have a crowd of over 2 because seating is limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tknNeaqzDOJj79-uZYeQfw.text: This place is great.  Really cool spot with artwork before you walk in.  The dining room is small and we barely found a place to sit after ordering.  The food however didn't disappoint.  I had the eggs over easy and bacon with hash browns and a fresh biscuit. The hash had caramelized onions and were nice and crispy.  I had the banana bread French toast or Pain Perdu.  I thought it was very creative and delicious. Not too sweet.  The iced Vietnamese coffee was bold and nicely balanced. Would definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not a crumb was left.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana Bread Pudding French Toast. So good. Wanted more.

Ycofh7Aj5ATHSk_0GgM4vg.text: really good it would have been 5 stars if they had food for a person who doesn't eat pork or eggs lol. yet their one vegan option was good.

QYuTA80Z_tt4xh7fqw2ejA.text: My family and I tried Vovomeena for the first time today and we were impressed. My husband had the Mexican Benedict and I had the Johnnycakes. Both dishes were delicious! We shared the coffee flight and each one was unique and tasty. Great price too! We are definitely coming back to try the other dishes. Highly recommended.

gjf7vhf9idvzRlhkaWc2BQ.text: Not only is the food fantastic, but the service is beyond.   Having moved here from the Bay Area, I was spoiled with great food and quality people, and there are very few places here that can measure up - Vovomeena is one of them!  Came in this morning for the amazing biscuits & gravy and had a side of a pancake - delicious as always!  And the coffee - OMG!   One little snag - the water had a funny taste. Mentioned it to the manager, Kaj, and he promptly brought us a bottle of water! Really above what's necessary, but just a sign of the high quality of customer service.   If you haven't been, you have to visit. If you haven't been in a while, you have to come back!

tMvRmwkf6xuzq5vXxEceyQ.text: I live in the neighborhood and I have heard wonderful things about this restaurant. I got up early one morning and decided to go down and try their cold brew. The restaurant opens at 6:30 and I arrive at 6:25 with the doors unlocked. I peaked my head in and asked if they were open. I told, who looked like the owner, I just wanted to grab a cup of coffee. The server snottily replied that they weren't and I need to come back after they opened. I thought five minutes was strange but I went back out to my car. Just as I do that I see three people walk in and get seated for breakfast. So strange.  I have heard the world about their  cold brew and had to try it. The wait staff was so cold even after I told them this was my first time there and to tell me about their coffee selections and menu. I, myself, am a culinary school graduate and a past restaurant owner. Customer service is everything. I ended up settling on a six dollar cup of the worst cold brew I've ever had. It was so bad that I told the man waiting on me that the coffee tasted strange, asked for a different kind and to hold the sweetener. I then walked over to the coffee bar to add my own sugar when I look down and see the entire table covered with ants. They did promptly clean up the table. The cold brew was absolutely disgusting, the customer service was even worse and I won't be going back to try breakfast. So sad.

5WXnZRLpjg8JIjtKNJUPIQ.text: This is a great little spot that seemed to be hopping with trendy folk. The menu was fu and relatively diverse. Tried the bread pudding, bmoc, and cold brew coffee flight. I'd get the bmoc again, but pass on the others (the coffee was all very over-roasted). I'd like to go back for the Mexican eggs Benedict.   Service was fabulous and friendly. Looking forward to a second visit!!

HJ13OOR1hw0h4sO1XerCLg.text: I was here on labor day and it was a bit busy, i ate a delicious chorizo burrito. The coffee was also good. I recommend vovomeena.

j6EjLVNNxkCHS7z6sy-Qgw.text: YUM YUM YUM!!!!!! Food is absolutely delicious! Its weird to figure the place out at first but the staff is great at walking you through it.   BRING CASH TO TIP.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackstone scramble and pain perdu.

aWDSDrCN-i1UA97YfM7nfg.text: If you have had a night out and wake up with the worst hangover of your life, this place will revive you! My friends and i come here just about every weekend. Today, all three of us got the chicken and waffles special and it was the BEST thing I have EVER eaten in my entire life. Love, love, LOVE.

vJPtzj70l_4-c1aZLfXssQ.text: Excellent, excellent!  If you're a fan of the trendy cold brew coffee, they've got a whole wall of it.  You can even get a jar to take-home.  The jar is allegedly for four iced coffee drinks but if you're like me and you like a little coffee in your almond milk, it'll go a lot further.    Because of the rave reviews about the pain perdu, that's what I had to get.  It's essentially bread pudding disguised as breakfast and as far as I'm concerned, that's brilliant.

uiKYmeiLIjXWgrDCFe-FzQ.text: Easily one of the best spots in Arizona if not the entire US. Amazing food done right, great atmosphere. Amazing customer service. Can't say enough good things about this place.

4XBTBhpTj6NTV-viz32S6A.text: As soon as I arrived for the first time, I was promptly greeted. The ordering process was fast and my food arrived quickly. I had the "Tortilla Espanola" with turkey sausage which surpassed my expectations as a former resident of Spain. The wait staff was very kind and attentive. I ordered the cappuccino also, which was ok...ended up being more foam than cappucino. So, I'll pass and just get the regular coffee next time. Overall great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla Española which comes with a tomato based brava sauce and arugala salad. Also, choice of meat (turkey sausage).

wGYUjusXijZD-9tKD5EiRQ.text: I ordered the savory crepes and a latte and I was so impressed. The portions were great, the food was elegant and delicious, the staff was kind and attentive, and the atmosphere was relaxing. Will definitely be going back.

XBAFt2ffSxN256iaIGkNTQ.text: If you are looking for an awesome breakfast  you will  need to go here. The service is incredible and the food is perfect

7eMkJRbB3nhIovPH8Uf2gw.text: Well a Nother great you'll find quite a simple menu but very good I would go with the banging pocket or the Mexican Benedict!

AbCIQCsKS3unMp6X16NZvQ.text: Great food, great service. I ordered food and was closer than I thought. Was there in 5 mins and it was ready and coffee was amazing also.

qfw4P1_v608jQf6riZHN3w.text: This place was a little hard to find, but i found it! And thank god i did! Its a cute little resturant, very mellow inside. I ordered the pain perdu and it was awesome! VERY different from what im used too but very good. The pain perdu came with bacon which was a nice mix of sweet and savory. The texture of the bread was a little weird reminded me if i was eating a very very stiff but moist cake. The only downfall i think would be there are A LOT of flies inside.. it was hard to eat because i was constantly shooing away flies.. But other than that i enjoyed myself very much.

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain Perdu, bacon, and nice cold coke!

PBQ-YagWagRk_ib36wbDYg.text: While visiting Phoenix I saw that this place had 4 and a half stars on yelp With 400+ reviews so you know I had to check it out!    All I can say is WOW!  This place rocked, I came with 2 buddies and we all cleared our plates.  I ordered tortilla espanola, one of my buddies ordered the Mexican Benedict, and my other buddy got pain perdu which looked like a brownie with bananas and caramel!    It's an interesting setup, you order at the counter then take a number to your table, the staff was very attentive to us and made sure we had everything we needed (hot sauce).  It's right next to 5 guys off 7th, took a lap around the block to find but WELL WORTH IT!

XRwM-DcIjTRoEqFD91N-FQ.text: Some of the best breakfast food, and post mates delivery is huge hit.

cAaF8kADPkHe8T7itAxZkg.text: Had such high hopes but was utterly disappointed...ordered the Mexican Benedict which was drenched in oil and was incredibly salty --couldn't even finish one...orange juice was good, staff seemed pleasant, the biscuits and gravy were good but nothing spectacular-it was biscuits and gravy. A one and done deal, prob won't be back.

u8NO2P95cHu_Nw29dMHxIw.text: First time here! So good! The line was out the door but totally worth the wait. Took half an hr to get in. The staff was great, very organized

tcWn5_TUc-20SizbEZFW-w.text: Great brunch place with a cool southern twist to the traditional american diner brunch food. The cuban benedict daily special tasted more like an open top burger than the traditional eggs benedict. The b.m.o.c was rather large in portion size. I like that the slightly salty smoked pork chop goes very well with the plain waffles and sweet apple-maple syrup. The blend in sweet and salty, as well as the different textures made this a rather well executed dish.  Their special Japanese ice coffee was also rather tasty, and definitely did the job of giving me the caffeine kick I needed!

04iklNYCz6HMzRe_6UZHfA.text: Lovely hidden treasure in downtown phoenix. Very casual concept that just seems to work no matter how crowded it is. Great customer service and a nice relaxing atmosphere. Good amount of parking very clean inside and out. The food is from local source and is simple but very tasty and you get a healthy serving as well. No doubt we will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Orchard French toast two thumbs up, this is good stuff!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict yummy
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From parking area

2c7Dl3jiHJ21oUFjZFF8CQ.text: So I've lived downtown for over a year now but only just now got around to trying this place for the first time.  Yeah, I know, fail on my part.  But better late than never.  I've always loved Tuck Shop and found out the same owners also run this little breakfast place.  So up early on a Sunday morning I decided to venture in.  I wandered in by myself right at opening.  The restaurant is packed into a cluster of restaurants on the southeast corner of 7th Ave & McDowell.  You can enter from the courtyard patio area on the west or the parking lot on the east.  The interior is cute and comfortable with enough seating for probably around 40-50 people, though it still has the feel of a small tucked away place.  There's a couple of counter areas inside.  One looks like it was strictly for selling their in-house Mornin Moonshine coffee brand.  The main counter is where you put in your order.  No waiter service here as you just order your meal at the main counter and find seating on your own.  Easy enough for me since I was by myself and the bulk of the morning crowd didn't stream in till later.  Looking through Yelp and perusing the menu, the BMOC seems to be the star here so I decided to give that a whirl.  Meal came out to me about 10 minutes after I ordered.  Long story short, this is a breakfast that eats like a dinner.  The layers from bottom to top are as follows:  Waffle, smoked pork chop, apple maple syrup (with actual diced apples), 2 eggs (any style you want), and a fried donut with powdered sugar.  I can promise you won't go home hungry after eating this.  Lots of flavor in this thing.  I especially loved the apple syrup as it helps mellow the smoke flavor of the pork chop and goes excellent with the waffle.  The pork chop itself is well cooked and hearty, though the smokiness of the pork chop might have been a little bit overpowering for my taste.  But overall, good solid chop.  The best way to attack this dish in my humble opinion is to try and get a fork full of all 5 layers at the same time.  You get a little of everything.  Total tab for the BMOC as well as an OJ came to about $15.  Pretty reasonable for the amount of food I got.  I think next time I come here I might give the Mexican Benedict or the Johnnycakes a try.  Overall a pretty solid and unique breakfast and brunch option downtown.  My first experience wasn't perfect, but more than worthy of another visit (and next time it won't be a year in the making).

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC and an OJ

v6zJLOI9z35JfAApt_Rb8Q.text: The food was fantastic. Everything else was subpar. The setup of the restaurant on a busy day left us confused and in everyone's way. Very cramped and disorganized. As we placed our order, the man taking our order walked away mid-sentence for 2 full minutes with no explanation or reasoning given to us. After we got through placing our order, we were told to go stand by the wall and the manager would seat us. About 90 seconds later a man walked over and just said "Seat?" to us. We said yes and were seated at a table that was halfway in the walkway from the kitchen. Due to this, both kitchen staff and customers who had just placed orders bumped into the back of my chair and head constantly. In the end, we won't be returning. Not due to the food, which was very good, but the service and environment were too strenuous to entice a return visit unfortunately.

Zz1kxk0JoEb5bDfpuzIGNQ.text: This was a spectacular breakfast! The line was out the door when we arrived, but I liked how well-organized it all was. I didn't mind standing in line knowing I was going to be ordering at the end of it, and loved how they made sure tables weren't occupied until you had a number for your food. It really kept people moving without worrying about holding a table. Loved their patio seating too.  I had a really hard time deciding what to eat because there were so many delicious sounding, and looking (yes, I was that person creeping on other's breakfasts as we were standing in line). I finally settled on their biscuits and gravy because that's one of my favorite breakfast foods- it was so delicious!! Definitely want to try their Mexican benedict next time I'm in town.  Loved their Japanese cold-brewed coffee as well! Smooth, rich and totally hit the spot!  The owner, I think, was working the register when we ordered and he was so friendly and welcoming- that kind of attention goes a long way. I will definitely be back!

DQuus07Cbxu9HwvPSsw5sw.text: Beautiful shabby chic interior. Great cafe style ordering of food. Wonderful service. Food was impeccable! Japanese cold brewed coffee was to die for!  I've been here a good handful of times and tried something different from the menu each time.  My favorite so far is either the Mexican Benedict or the Banging Pocket. Each has its merits.   This gem is from the same folks that brought us Tuck Shop and Astor House. The same staff from what I remember from Astor house, even, if I remember correctly. Everyone is super friendly regardless.  Just one more reason to love breakfast. Thanks Vovomeena!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banging pocket. I highly recommend. Highly.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BMOC. Way too much food for this girl. And I can eat.

PAb7qhbm_pxZcsGVcbaSRQ.text: All I can say is that this nice comfortable, neighborhood place is at the top of our list for breakfast!  Get there early, place your order and find a spot (and it's a good time of year to sit outside). Can you say 'tasty' food with an eclectic touch to the menu?  Try something outside the box. You can't go wrong the Banging Pocket (with local Schreiner's Sausages), the Mexican Benedict (excellent) or the Orchard French Toast. Great coffee and juice too.

yGt4AO7G1vGta2FBqanHIA.text: This place was great! Great atmosphere, food was exceptional and staff was super friendly! Also easy to get to. I got Mexican Benedict and if you like chorizo it is amazing. Spicy, but amazing. My friend got the corn and chile cakes which are like cornbread pancakes and they were equally amazing! 10/10 would recommend

1H13Nyibir7LdsZJTvBPFA.text: 2nd time in today. I adore this place. The service is great and the food is wonderful. A bit more crowded then the last time but no worries. I stayed a while and was not rushed out. I will have to try something other than their to die for "Pain Purdue" though the next time I come in. The owner/manager, and other patrons it seems, suggest "The Pocket." So next time it is a pocket for me.  Vovomeena has great sausages too. Some of the best I have had in AZ. In a city that thinks "Matt's Big Breakfast and Denny's are Foodie Heavens ( Why?) I am happy to find Vovomeena. Drawback- it is pricey but I do not have to eat again all day after eating here. lol

pweuEAAaqXy0KRIRVjk4sA.text: Amazing food but horribly cramped! Not enough place to eat comfortablly and would.not recommend big groups since it has no space. Food wise, amazing and perfect for a small date brunch!

PAv3Ho79Hz8eU6wF9pfvVQ.text: This is such a great breakfast/brunch place.  I love it.  The food is fresh and well cooked- not the kind of place that just serves prepared Cisco Foods.  A little pricy but worth it.  I got the Mexican Benedict and it was HEAVENLY.  They also have great coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice.  I basically felt like I got a mini vacation today when I had breakfast there.  The only con is it's a small place, so you might have to wait to get a table.

fHLu5l1X8uxCq2O0egPz5w.text: Decent.  Not expensive. Busy. Pretty standard brunch.  Little things hold it back. Biscuit tough. Entrees lacking depth or sides.

OdxbrBeC-eHztM0ZZUBAqw.text: I had been wanting to come here for awhile so I'm glad we made the 30 minute drive to come! Everyone was so friendly. all of the staff came up to us and made sure we were good and had everything we needed. The iced coffee was really great! I ordered the BMOC and my bf got the banging pocket. They were both really delicious. I would order either of them again. The atmosphere was comfortable, modern, and clean. One thing I did not expect was that it was counter service. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious BMOC and Banging pocket

EZs35_nrZb-r_kTZXnVOxQ.text: Great energy and positive vibes at this pleasant surprise of a brunch spot. Food was excellent as was the friendly staff. Left stuffed to the gills with yummy deliciousness. Will return on the next Phoenix visit...wish this place was in my neighborhood in California. Thanks Vovomeena!

ZCGAbptorikoUIjoHdPvhw.text: Service was on point. The manager was very friendly and attentive! Also came to check up on me when I was seated outside to make sure everything was good after I ate.  Good is mediocre for price but the atmosphere is nice.  I liked the Orchard French toast but the portion is small-- wish it came with more for the price. Loved the Mascarpone added :)

uoAaBanEfdjT0c4mCFBlQw.text: I've had the Mexican Benedict and the Pain Perdu both were excellent. The atmosphere is really cute and chill. I'll definitely be back.

ii2Klqc27WoZnBTenbpV1w.text: Second trip to Phoenix meant a 2nd trip to Vovomeena. Everything we have had is tasty. Chilis in my johnny cakes? Sure!  Not my usual breakfast but the flavor combos are so tasty. Pain perdu made from banana pudding bread?  Oh yeah!!  The coffee is solid too. My plan is to return often enough to try each item on the menu. It's that good.

D5GcC-wftySvS3DWzGNoqQ.text: I was a little thrown by the bleh strip mall location at first... but then, that's pretty normal for Phoenix overall I guess.  The place is set back into a little courtyard, so the outside seating is pretty relaxed with no cars whizzing by or anything.  This is a popular place, for sure - for good reason.  So prepare for a wait.  It's the type of place where you walk in, grab a menu, and stand in line to order - then they bring you the food after you order.  I've always been a fan of that style, so when you're done eating, you just leave, but it took so long that I was wishing I could just relax at a table instead of standing in line for over 30 minutes, but whatever.  I loved the menu.  Short but sweet with creative breakfast options.  So many things I wanted to try.  I loved the biscuits and gravy.  Coffee was meh - made in mass quantity instead of to order.  My girlfriend liked her breakfast, but didn't love it.  We'll be back...

aZpFCtZgrNiTYaipHzo5qw.text: Amazing food! Quick,  friendly service! Would definitely recommend! We just landed in Phoenix and were starving, searched the highest star restaurant in the area,  this one popped up.  So glad we stopped!

JTXrFjXCEfIyqkKe54gAag.text: Food is very flavorful. There service is different as other restaurant but it works. I love their food it's different it tastes home made and the flavor sit has are outstanding . They are a little pricier than other breakfast joints BUT so worth it. Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bmoc

hvRmH7Rfp8bmRDV_xUe_hQ.text: Nice indoor/outdoor, industrial/rustic, bustling atmosphere.  Very friendly, welcoming staff..with fast service.  I tried the Japanese cold brew flight... A-mazing! The flavors in the flight are rotated..today was star cardomen, orange ginger and Black and Tan. I went with the blackstone scramble for brunch...just the right amount of food, fresh ingredients and a killer tortilla (I don't normally eat tortillas but this one I couldn't pass up).   If you are downtown, I would highly recommend...please build a sister location in downtown Gilbert ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast of Champions
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight of Japanese Cold Brew

ojn1ULZho6f2tL7EIqhDUg.text: This is a great little hide away for a wonderful breakfast. Service is amazing and everything is served very fresh. Kaj is a very engaged manager and the rest of the staff are equally as engaged making sure their product is served at perfection. 5 stars is not high enough for this place

3b95PrP-oFL1xA9Ni-AMlw.text: The food was great but the seating arrangement was not so great. Although we didn't have to wait long to get seated it was cramped and uncomfortable. We will return and hopefully go on a less busy day.

5Wxbuqrcz5rnPcBVqP9Jug.text: Very cool, tasty gem of a restaurant. Went for breakfast & had a very good meal & experience. I had the banger pocket and my wife had the 3 sisters omelette. Both were excellent and more than enough food. In fact, from the plates I saw, most meals were big enough to split.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sorry, this is what&#39;s left of my Banger pocket.

qiglu3SK1Bhs_mO_6lJu7A.text: I like the vibe here, and I've found the staff responsive and friendly. The menu is sort of a mixed bag: unusual combinations, some of which really work and others that really don't.  The main thing that keeps me from going back more often is that the food is generally very heavy, and the menu doesn't have the flexibility one usually expects with breakfast. For instance, you can get bangers in the one dish that features them, but not as an option in place of the breakfast links that come with one or two other dishes. No building your own breakfast here. The menu hasn't changed in the few years since they opened, so things are pretty much set in stone.

TZz0dwVWZVKh3K7YNIWW7A.text: From the whiskey caramel on the pain perdu, the spuds on the side, to the arugula leaves in the savory crepes and the amazing locally crafted coffee, I have to give it Vovomeena!!!! You guys are an outstanding breakfast place. Keep doing what you do! I shall be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fi69gM2rP-aLvVnO00UHug.text: Incredible. Top two are the Mexican chorizo sope eggs Benedict with a side of arugula and also the biscuits and gravy with schedulers sausage and side of potatoes. I brunch a lot and this is the best breakfast I've ever had in Phx. #native

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo on sope w eggs Benedict and arugula. Best breakfast of my life.
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best biscuits and gravy w poached eggs and potatoes

VWDCPmStZ31dXALxvH6oXA.text: If you haven't been to Vovomeena, your mouth has never been truly satisfied! Not only do they have amazing food, they have GREAT coffee. The thing that actually stands out the most is their customer service! Im an admitted coffee snob/foodie and they have, on more than one occasion, made sure to go above and beyond, delivering the best experience!

6ROfUnLkx_kv-1izivYlPQ.text: The BMOC and the Mexican Benedict was nothing short of amazing. The place looks small but they get people through pretty fast. We thought we were gonna be a while because the line was out the door (now after tasting the food I see why). But this was a hit. The orange juice and coffee (morning moonshine) was fresh. Will come back again when in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XeuEf_yKCyExTN9tP7TXCA.text: Yummy!!! This place was quick and quaint just like I love it! The service, food and people were all good. We ordered your traditional breakfast of eggs, pancakes, potatoes and sausage and it was all good. My waffles were the best I've had in a very long time. Being fluffy and buttery was a complete party in my mouth. The coffee, vanilla latte and fresh squeezed orange juice was superb as well. Well done. Next time I'm in Phoenix I will be back.

byz_-Xs1nMDEDS2RNW6cUw.text: Yes its a hipster place, but the food is fantastic!  You all know I love my Biscuits & Gravy, this place gets it right! Homemade gravy with chunks; Chunks People! Not that doctored up stuff from the can that other places like to pass as "homemade!", nicely poached eggs and fluffy biscuits! The coffee was great, service was good, the only complaint I have was the food was not that hot.  Grab a menu at the end of the rope wall and pick your passion by ordering at the counter. Fast and friendly service is waiting for you here so check them out!  Second time I had the Banging Pocket and it was a flavor explosion (does all that sound right?)! Piping hot and a nice fluffy pita, can't beat this thing, I was full half way through, but kept on eating.  Check this place out for sure as its a hidden gem in Phoenix!!

frjwSCf1C7-ImTxjIfBjsQ.text: Went here with a pretty big group. We had a reservation and the table was ready. The food came out pretty quickly after we ordered and it was all very good. Those who had coffee said it was delicious coffee. My food was good nothing spectacular, I had the Wilcox Avenue. The sausage was yummy, wheat toast was good and the jelly (I assume homemade) was awesome.  I would certainly go back and try more items on the menu.

nAcJcDBXrkpFF2TNBTGOMg.text: Friendly people, neat vibe, great food. Super breakfast experience. I had the banana bread French toast.

N6k5-TRUMztL33bf-14Rrw.text: Food snob Here in Phoenix from LA. This place, the food, the service, the atmosphere, the lattes, the coffee, the cappuccino - everything was excellent and satisfying.  Will definitely come back when I'm Phoenix again.  Try it. You won't be disappointed.

LVX5XVbdn9D5uNu3Wnq0ag.text: Oh Vovomeena.. how much I wanted to LOVE you..  and I did!  Yet, my continued patronage just exposed your many flaws.  Although the food is tasty and the portions are large.  The inflated price, inconsistent quality of food, and terrible staff has driven me away.  This all started about 1 month ago..  I took my family here, gloating about how this would change their opinion of how breakfast should taste.  Well after getting my order(b.m.o.c) wrong, and then giving me the biscuits and gravy, they served my family(they were a separate ticket) and then gave me another order of biscuits and gravy, which was still wrong..  I brought this up with my waiter, who then promptly said he would make it right and return with my b.m.o.c..  Sadly another employee showed up at our table, leaned over with her elbows on our table and started reading over a ticket..  She then looked menacingly at our table and walked away while scoffing.  About 15 minutes later, the saddest pork chop covered by a waffle, with an over cooked egg sat in front of me.  Not only was the presentation wrong, but the pork chop looked anemic and obviously was not of the same standard that I had before.  So I ate my food and left, never looking back.  Sorry Vovemeena, but you aren't the first place to lose a customer over terrible front of house workers.

xXwGHYouUqY-nbfA_zwsAQ.text: Food is great. No complaints there. Problem with this place is they will close whenever they want! One time it's a sign that says "We ran out of eggs", next time it's " We ran out of food" and finally "We have a gas inspection, closing at 1". The last one I can understand. Running out of eggs...... send one of your hipsters to the damn store to buy more!  Do your eggs come from special Vovomeena chickens?? I'm pretty sure I'd be OK with some store bought organic eggs. Like I said, food is excellent, that's why we come here. Straighten up your inconsistencies please

jIfJcELd0fWSgAzdCyHHUg.text: This is a terrific breakfast spot in downtown Phoenix if you want somewhere small and cozy with delicious comfort food (and great coffee!). A lifelong Phoenix resident took me here and swore by it, so I came with an open mind despite a difficult parking situation in the small attached lot. Upon entering you wait in line to place your order and I chose the biscuits and gravy as well as the unlimited hot coffee before taking our seat.   The coffee itself was great and worthy of any boutique coffee shop in LA! While I got the unlimited hot coffee (for only $3!) my friend got the cold brew sampler which was a unique experience if you're a cold brew lover! Out of her four cold brews she really liked three of them, so don't go into it planning to love each one but if you want to try new things it's a great option.  When our food arrived I was blown away by the biscuits and gravy. As many here have said, they're incredibly rich and indulgent but are the perfect treat if you're craving something heavy on the carbs and cream! The menu is expansive, as well, so next time I'm in Phoenix I'll certainly come back to try something new!

SDRKcA0-IpgUYyKxyr2SGg.text: We were visiting from Hawaii and found this place through Yelp.  We arrived there 40 minutes before closing and it was not crowded. The place is very nice. The menu is simple. You place your order at the serving counter and they bring your food to your table. There is a separate counter where they craft your coffee drink. I ordered  the b.m.o.c. and was not disappointed. The pork chop was tender and tasty. It was a first for me to have it with a waffle and it was delicious. My family members had the Mexican Benedict which was very good; Wilcox avenue and classic egg sandwich which were all very delicious. I would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WuG3OYC7ReK9fwvJvauH0Q.text: Got take out. Fast and friendly service, super cool ambiance (wish we could have stayed), and most importantly delicious food! Reasonably priced too.  Got the Johnny cakes with sausage. So delicious!

wmLo630DTUTeVjJcxPmm3A.text: Got the classic egg sandwich and the orchard French toast last time, and the banging pocket and pain Perdue this time. All absolutely delicious, and I think our favorites are the classic egg sandwich and the pain Perdue. The classic egg sandwich is a classic, only upgraded. Savory and decadent, I could eat this every day. The pain Purdue has the texture of a bread pudding in a French toast form, and is very tastefully spiced. Serving sizes are good too.  The atmosphere is also great, relaxed and beautifully decorated. I love that one can see the exposed supplies, ingredients, and other items in the back of house. It gives one the feeling of fresh preparation and fresh ingredients.  Overall very satisfied! Will come back many times.

TK-sVVvqjtjEQ5jaoF8swA.text: Got mixed feeling about this place. Food was good. Just ordering 1st and then grabbing a seat threw me off a bit. Worth the try I guess.

CDd7SfYQWODEtMEzfdCHxw.text: Vovomena has what I like to call world class customer service. The food is fresh and always made perfect which Is always a big plus when eating but what I can honesty say that what keeps be coming  back is the friendliness and attention to detail by Alex.

utZu_X2Tsq8fF6VjV5Wgqw.text: They're syrup was honestly the best syrup I tried. It tasted natural. I took my dad and he's weird when we go to new places. But he loved their coffee and everything we got

5w_6IGiPAvxhymG-rOfcUw.text: One of the best breakfast joints in town. I highly recommend the Mexican Benedict, BMOC, and of course, coffee. I came here early on a weekday, which was perfect for tucking in a hearty breakfast and catching up on work.

Pdmypwk6OLZxyN81kPxwJg.text: Great breakfast spot with delicious food. You wait in line and order like at a cafeteria and then they seat you after you order. Kid friendly too!

RlGbMBK2amsQ81kPTPIgTQ.text: We came here wirh a party of 8. They would not put tables together for us upon numerous requests stating "seat yourself" (this went on for 15 min) I asked the manager several times to put seating together as we could not sit at a hofh top table and she mumbled under her breath and said sit anywhere. We ordered expensive cold brew coffee drinks that just sat on the bar for 20 min and had to ask where they were. They gave us attitute about that and said " well its at the bar" when we got there, the order still eas not right. Food was ok, a bit pricey

ya7DWtrLXl9lL9zRzSMKNg.text: First time diner. Lifetime fan!  Have always wanted to try cold coffee but didnt want to over-invest in a whole cup of just one flavor......Enter the cold coffee flight of 3 ...Love Love Love it!  Good selection on the menu and the serving sizes are generous, fresh and flavorful. Nice seating on both patio and indoor space. Go!

Uy6DwzItUWNBVYux1FlIgw.text: Great place for brunch Very spacious with a friendly staff The wait was minimal on a sunday at 11am I waited probably 5 mins for my food I got the pain perdu with potatoes Everything was delicious and I finished the whole thing wishing I had more! Will definitely be coming back to try out some of the other options!

aHkB4iHNWsIyF6OOlQaxzw.text: Yum! I ordered the Johnny Cakes not exactly knowing what to expect. It was Corn and mild chili pancake with fresh strawberries and a dab of cinnamon oatmeal of some sort. Love trying different foods, the menu is unique. I watched a family review and walk out, too bad they missed out. Food and service was great. Ample seating both indoor and outdoor

wfrWi8Mypkz44Slczdn13A.text: Stopped by yesterday and spent about $30 for a coffee, tip, and two meals . The food is . When you first walk in you order up at the counter and then the manager sits you. They have the kitchen in plain view so there's no bs going on behind closed doors. Great place .

-wX9EWxI_GI2NowkbsKcSQ.text: Unbelievable service and passion in this little restaurant. Came in early Sunday morning, the GM and cold brew gentleman recommended me a great breakfast. I'm a fan thank you

LcGfCPg1ZuJC_3nhJ-4jzw.text: We stumbled on this place via yelp, when we looked for an open breakfast place when we arrived in Arizona for a vacation. Our flight came in early. We found this, was not totally easy to find (blame it on the GPS) but when we did, we were in for a surprise. The place is hip, the food was great, and the service is exceptional. There were food choices that were among things I was not familiar with so I was willing to try out. We ordered 2 different items. They came out really well, except that I am not a big fan of waffles and, well, I ordered waffles. It was a little too sweet, being that it was mixed with some compote or apple-something. Otherwise, it was good. Outside of food, the service was great. The manager and food server were there helping us out as we figured where to go on our visit. You cant find that easily elsewhere-- staff members, who are willing to talk to you.  Do check this place out if you want good food and wonderful people in AZ!
