Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pK5dMCmSYi4gUE-C5L9nsQ.text: You can tell from the moment you step in and see the intricate cold brew coffee machines, this place cares about the details.  Breakfast was wonderful and my kids and wife each had a different plate and they were all on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple-topped French toast and sausage

ucMHKIs0uwP26InGb12Z9A.text: I saw the yelp photos of the Banana Bread Pudding French Toast, which made the decision to visit. But they didn't have those at the time, so I ate the Mexican Benedict which was delicious! My girlfriend ate the apple French Toast, and loved it. Quality craft food with a nice comfortable, urban farmhouse design. I normally drink coffee with creamer, but the Japanese cold brew was so tasty it didn't need anything else. Menu is short and to the point, not overloading with options.

yRBQsnftjDfm3ir8Ro-mwQ.text: We decided to check this place out after seeing how many awesome reviews they had. We had the Mexican Benedict, Orchard French Toast & iced coffees! Everything was delicious! I'd definitely recommend checking this place out!

Iqg5wgNtEIu2vbNuA6fsHw.text: I had the Pain Perdu.  It's a banana bread pudding French toast with whiskey Carmel sauce. My son had biscuits and gravy. I also added eggs and coffee to this and we came out at right around $20. This had to have been one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. Love the option of outdoor seating.

90D27MDIDxRaVBIfZtWtFw.text: I have been here twice now. I anxiously await my next visit !! :) I have been able to try the johnny cakes ( perfection ! Better than mine -pat pat ) the biscuits and gravy (oh my wow ! So sausagyyy and herby and creamy and wow !) the b.m.o.c. (way more that I dreamt it would be, tender smokey pork, sweet strong vanilla waffle make magic together) and the pancakes and bacon (right on). Their potatoes are outstanding. Their coffee is wonderful. The customer service is caring. The decor is nice. Great spot !

8eovpQWzuKG4OCGN2lrjRw.text: Had a great experience this afternoon; Japanese cold brew coffee was great and the food delicious...My only comment was the server was too quick in discussing the menu and coffee..felt rushed for their first week introducing themselves. I will be back to tour the menu!

k0afeHYEu2QELA8caWTJKg.text: Was in town for Spring Training and was downtown to eat at another establishment recommended. The other establishment had a long line so we searched Yelp and found Vovomeena. Their menu is outstanding!  In fact we came two days in a row. Had the Mexican Benedict the first day and the Biscuits & Gravy the next. Great flavor!  My son had the B.M.O.C. which is a pork chop on a waffle with two eggs on top. I tried the pork chop and it was tender and had a great smoky taste to it. Would recommend this place to anyone traveling to or through Phoenix!

fBopo5peVgMZ7h4VcOXbrQ.text: A new favorite for us foodies! We are always on the look out for new and different and Vovomeena delivered! Between the Mexican Benedict and the B.M.O.C my BF and I were beyond satisfied. The Japanese cold brewed coffee was spectacular....try the lemon jalapeno and the green tea mint flavors, you won't be disappointed

JKIrigz2HbVJVcFR5PHVeQ.text: Everything was delicious. Bisquits and gravy, eggs benedict cooked to perfection. Eat the donut too!

ZNR892kwCKuFbYh46R_G1g.text: In Phoenix on business and yelped for a good breakfast place. Very impressed with the food, quick service and casual atmosphere. If I lived here Vovomeena would be a fav.

VhxDqqy2lgOJFD9bAReDAQ.text: Nice little joint to visit- food was decent, long waits so I would probably pick this place on a weekday after the rush.

i4K5y4iOxhDkyjvThM9GnQ.text: Great coffee. Great food. The iced japanese coffee is something else. I don't know of any other place that has such a thing. The Mexican Benedict is very good. It has just the right amount of spice, and the eggs are runny with a great hollandaise.  Just what I want.

Xjb90f24ThZgJ5kE560HKQ.text: I am big on breakfast, I mean it's super important. I like to think of Vovomeena as inspiration for me to open a breakfast restaurant in the future. I LOVE this place! I've tried almost everything, everything is so so good. Of all the times I've visited, never been disappointed. Ice coffee is bomb! Tortilla espanola, bmoc, waffle, pain perdue, everything is great! The staff is also very friendly. When I took my dog to the patio, they came out with a bowl of water and offered that I buy her a cold protein snack! Always looking forward to my next visit!

NBzB6JahSI9lq5VbImQeaQ.text: Very good! Just got off the plane and was recommended here. My friend here in Phoenix recommended this restaurant to meet for Breakfast as they had good reviews on YELP. I must say She was correct. The menu was pleasantly different. There was a line you had to go through to order and as you went through you could see the Cooks preparing the different items and you could ask them what the item was. Excellent idea!! The food was great! We will be back!

twQzcKChSE7aGU5fS5saeQ.text: I did not end up eating here. I came on a Sunday late morning and my boyfriend and i spent 15 minutes waiting awkwardly in a corner of the restaurant for a table or seat of any kind to open up before ordering an entire breakfast. When I finally found a 2 top I was told bluntly (by someone who conveniently ignored us standing and wandering around inside and out) that I had to order before I could take a table. It was loud and crowded and although the food smelled great it wasn't worth feeling so unwelcome.

I-Q8v5cDdOTLHfgPImH-DA.text: Nice decor but seating is very intimate.  Professional & courteous staff.  The food had a nice taste but the portions were lacking.  We ordered the Tortilla Espanola & Pain Perdu.  The Tortilla Espanola was literally a sliver.  Not sure if this was just an odd piece or what but I was disappointed.  I'm ok with smaller portions but this really was stretching it especially for $9.  Same for the Pain Perdu.  We've seen pictures and had friends who we trust about food give this place great reviews but never mentioned lack luster portions & they are foodies.  We will give this place another try because the food was tasty & we saw other items that looked interesting being brought to other customers.

Qn2I0QB0ebT6b4YBihstgQ.text: Best breakfast ever! My husband and I only come here for breakfast. Everything is amazing especially the iced coffee! That is something special, it takes a week to brew one pot of it. Simply amazing!

piAW_VmTOtT1ba7dnJd_dg.text: It was pretty good. I had the B.M.OC,pork chop was good. That being said,waffle was soggy from too much syrup. The eggs were well,eggs. The donut thing was ok all in all it was ok I'll go back to try something else. Oh and the coffee was pretty good.

AzonExfL9ZqT4Jx3dcePpA.text: The Johnnycakes (corn and chile cakes with prickly pear syrup) were delicious and different. I loved this sweet and savory dish!

siaWMhA-eiZKHpV5Z-ZATQ.text: I really dig this place! There's plant of outdoor seating, the Mexican Benedict was delicious, the coffee is delicious and they have honey and almond milk sitting out. I like those subtle touches of class.

-lFrtgawfzBzFwLCpGESaw.text: Food was DELISH!!! Loved being able got kids eat in the patio and our puppy was with us while we were in town visiting from CA. Thank you!!

3uP-Y3QDK5Kmm62l49oUbg.text: Food was excellent, service was so personable and cashier woman so nice and they were just so great on top of everything, bmoc was great and so was the banana french toast. Coffee was strong and they don't deny that at all but well worth it with the food, no question I will be returning.

EQAFhNKcM3frIne1ikdHuA.text: Not only is it kinda hard to find seating, but the meat is very low quality.  The chorizo was undercooked and the sausage lacked much flavor.  Not sure how you can screw up bacon, but the bacon was sub-par and without crisp.  Potatoes undercooked to finish off my meal.

9UiJdmz_BEm7cpsD5WDfLA.text: Absolutely love this new place on the corner of 7th Avenue & McDowell!  We went with some friends for breakfast yesterday and had a great experience!  Reasonably priced and very fresh food...highly recommend the savory crepes - yummy!  There were at least 4 or 5 other items on the menu that I want to try, so I will definitely be back!

dv_kJqCTLaHWJo-JgaAOlw.text: We love this place! The food is always delicious and the coffee is some of the best in town! If you like iced coffee the Japanese cold drip is to die for. Vovomeena is a hidden gem and you have to try it!

oPLuEqA4mdKH6TwR83PUFg.text: I came here for breakfast last Sunday, and I will be back. The cold drip coffee was delicious and the vibe was cool here without a doubt. I ordered the bananas foster french toast- it might have been the best thing I've ever put in my mouth. I heard they close early so get there by noon.

T9sQLQvtyRC16VgbAJCKPw.text: Want great coffee  AND a delicious breakfast? I went with my family before an  AZ Science Center outing on a Sunday morning and we had a little 3yr old in tow! It's an order then sit down place which works pretty well unless there's a group like the 5 of us trying to make up our minds. Sorry everyone! I was tempted by many offerings but  but I got the BMOC which has a porkchop that was smoked and heaven "scent" on a waffle with eggs on top of that and a Portuguese donut - I shared this meal with the 3 year old because it is enormous! Hubby got the waffle, son in law got the chorizo egg special, daughter got a tortilla espanola --the meats are superb and come from Schreiner's - I tried the sausage and it had a little spicyness to it and was everything you hope for. It was hard to engage in a conversation because everyone was oohing and ahhin over their breakfast. We loved the flavor of the home fried potatoes too! The donut was light and not like True Malasada's but great for a regular donut. And the baby ate EVERYTHING! I also had a latte and my daughter a cappuccino. This is a great local place with an excellent combo of breakfast AND great coffee -- I don't recall Matt's Big Breakfast offering lattes do you? BONUS! -- we didn't have to wait an hour! This is a great little place -- try it -- you'll like it!

co2CpxVPS63vDvRCfyO45Q.text: I have heard great things about this place. My husband and daughter had the waffle and pancake, respectively. Both of them loved their meals. I tasted the pancake, and it was light, fluffy and delicious! I had the biscuits and gravy, which I did not enjoy. The biscuits were flat and dense, and I had a hard time cutting it with a fork. The gravy was okay, not bad, but not wonderful. I will definitely give this place another try, I'll just choose a different item next time.

C2YLL_Wb9GTDPbr2pm5cng.text: Had breakfast here the other Sunday morning and the food was amazing. Great flavors and a fantastic variety for carnivores. If you are in the mood for some comfort food and have a few calories to spare this place is great. We also had a little breakfast/dessert the banana bread french toast was really good. It was a little small and the coffee bar set up is kinda weird even still amongst all the good places to have breakfast these guys still stand out.

RpgmUmF_SFuGRBcO_gL8_w.text: Great food. Fun atmosphere. Friendly service. This is one of my new Sunday brunch favorites.

PH0ox0hXiae7J3B5fK2WYQ.text: Great coffee!  My ONLY complaint....why, oh why do you have to close at 1:30 pm?!  That is right when I'm wanting to start heading to a coffee shop to chill and work.  ugh!

MFwEPZtlWTec3utZrjWn_g.text: Great breakfast! I read the great reviews and I'm definitely glad I came here! I had the pancakes, potatoes and bacon. The meal was wonderful. The pancakes look thin, but they were so filling that I could only eat one! The meal is the type you think you could make at home, but it's waaaay better than anything I could make. It's simple with a twist. I'll be back and this time I'm going for the tortilla espanola!

VvcuFYtRs3JI6TgqoU5Dbw.text: Johnny Cakes w prickly pear syrup, damn good.

VWDwtbNYYx3fdJ6TYgzlzw.text: I went here based on a yelp review and enjoyed my experience.   First, the decor is very charming and modern. The place has great ambiance and the people that work there seemed genuinely nice.   Second, coffee was amazing! I'm a bit of a coffee snob and chose this place over Matt's Big Breakfast based solely on the rave coffee reviews. Best $2 I ever spent on a cup of joe. It's pour-over quality coffee reminiscent of Blue Bottle Coffee Co. in San Francisco.   Third, the food was pretty good. In our group of three we got the pancakes, potatoes and choice of meat, the savory crepes and the pain perdu.  The pancakes, potatoes and sausage my friend got were average. I tried her potatoes which were my favorite part of her meal.  The crepes were....interesting...but in a good way, like when you first try something and you're not sure you'll like it, so you keep eating, intrigued, and then you decide that this is really good though perhaps more like something you crave every once in a while than something you'd eat regularly....bit of stream of consciousness for you...the pain perdu was too much too sweet....it's a banana bread pudding topped with a sweet and salty, thick caramel sauce and fresh banana slices....you get two brownie-sized squares of it with a side of bacon....I hated that my crunchy bacon was covered in the caramel sauce....I enjoyed this meal because the bread is not sweet, but super sweetened by the caramel sauce...it's just too much for breakfast and would be better if they reduced the portion size of the bread pudding and added some eggs or potatoes....my tummy felt queezy after such a sweet meal...glad my friends shared their meals to portion mine out.   The menu's knid of limited, but I think it keeps the place original. I'd definitely recommend and maybe even return just to sit and sip their delicious coffee.

F6zz2z6qFqTab1fy371EGQ.text: Came for the first time and brought 4 friends visiting from out-of-town.  Seating can get a little hairy; order at a counter and get a number and find a table.  Since we were a bigger party, someone helped us grab a table after a few minutes of waiting to the side.  I had the Mexican Benedict, which was delicious but with the sopes and spuds, was a little too much carb for me.  My iced latte with almond milk was perfect!   My friends had the bangers and the tortilla Espanola which they enjoyed as well.  My vegan friend was also able to find some options and they helped my friend with her two-year-old with an egg option on the side.  The service was prompt, even considering how busy they were at the time.  We all enjoyed brunch and i will definitely be back!

M1norlHBteksrhTJlWUGeA.text: B.M.O.C is just amazing!!! If I could, I would just order a dozen portugese doughnut

o3sWIJLCoMHTFzi0BAqYPw.text: After an awesome lunch at Astor House, we took the recommendation from the owner to try out their new breakfast place, Vovomeena.  This is still new and has a few kinks to work out.  Overall, it's a great breakfast place.  The food is delicious and something different from your usual egg benedict and pancakes.  We got the boxty and grillades which was delicious.  It did take a while for us to get our food and the set up is a bit confusing.  It's counter service so you'll need to order first and then find a place to sit.  Also, if you order coffee, you need to go to the coffee counter to pick it up.  Once you get the hang of it, it's a pleasant brunch experience.  The Japanese coffee was good as well.

RiHR3TMpj5sZbTrCI1yYgw.text: Oh My Gosh this place was delicious! I was only in town for the weekend and a friend recommended this restaurant. I had the johnnycakes and I loved every bite! I drink coffee on occasion, but I had to have two cups that morning because the coffee was that yummy! All of the staff I spoke with were really nice and I can't wait to go back again!

YdHFwcyMhFjgcevgmWT5uQ.text: Awesome food. Many recommended the Mexican benne but I preferred the biscuits and gravy.

2biJzFjoDF_dAwF4duXKFw.text: Nice atmosphere. Great coffee. Interesting options for food. Had the Mexican Benedict. Very good, but could have used more hollandaise. Slightly on the hipster side.

Ct5P_7N9xu_BRgoyIk6mKw.text: Everything here was delicious. At first walking in, it was a bit confusing until we realized that it was a walk up counter ordering system but the food and the coffee was amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly as well. Can't wait to go back

UvN4Sb-7Qg_nwpgtN0_qSA.text: We were going to eat here for Mother's Day and we got in line because place was pretty full, it was 3 of us and a baby so while in line my mother already knew what she was going to order since I was going to pay after a minute or two in line so we seen an open table so we figured since we had the baby in her car seat and was hard to carry and wait in line she went to go take the table but apparently you can't get a table until after you order but that's wasn't the big deal because she would of moved the waiter (Jeffrey) came to the table and was really rude and loud and told my mom that she had to get out of the table because of there policy on getting tables before you order and also pointing with his fingers like my mom didn't understand what it meant to leave from the table. If the server would of told us in a nice way maybe we would of stayed but when you are waiting  in  a line with  a car seat they should of at least acknowledged that since it's open seating but the server rudely told u its first come first serve. Ended up walking out and also another couple with a kid left too. Ended up going to The Original Breakfast place on 32nd st and got treated way better!

jqeVsq999LZL9o_-AoiD-w.text: Happened upon this place after arriving in Phoenix for a long weekend. The only bad part of breakfast was that this place is so far from Chicago. The pain perdue was just sweet perfection. I usually don't like a whole plate of sweet breakfast food, but the caramel drizzle with the bacon was the perfect accompaniment to the French toast. I will absolutely stop back next time I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackstone scramble, pain perdue &amp; a side of potatoes- YUM!

8L-MCXdfQASvBnNSMI66jg.text: GET HERE NOW...NOW!!! Great food! It will look like there is no seating when you're in line on the weekend, but by the time you get your food it will be open TRUST ME. Try the Mexican benedict...life changing. Cinnamon rolls? Fogettaboutit!

VhUdK3ErnysAW3q5IDPlGg.text: The best part of my omelet and potatoes was the potatoes, and they weren't good. Was advertised as omelet with black beans, zucchini, et al. I didnt see more than 15 black beans maybe a flake of a zucchini rind. Wont be back. Omelet w cheese and 12 homefries. 10$

vlO-mBCZfrS7N0DZL7-RlQ.text: Heard about this place on Check Please.  The program is always positive, so you have to be aware that their recommendation might be oversold.  Although, it is not very classy and upscale place, the menu and coffee is really good.  Arrived later in the morning for good seating.  It is very popular.  I wonder why?   Their BMOC is a special dish; they were out when we ordered. But it gets rave reviews. Not to worry, there are many good choices on the menu.  Very frustrating when you want to order almost everything on the menu.  Their Japanese cold-brewed coffee is also a special attraction.  Nothing quite like it.  You order and find a seat.  They bring food to your table.  Parking is a little tight in that area.

9D786zlMJ918RIzXmiR-uA.text: Price - reasonable range Service - prompt and friendly  Atmosphere - parking kind of hard but has a nice outdoor area . Overall neat and hip Food - flavorful :) pretty decent overall.

1tAb86MkxHOrpeoFWtzHRA.text: I use to live in Downtown and loved going to Vovomeena,  Now I reside in Laveen, Arizona There is no place like Vovomeena down here. Vovomeena is just EXCELLENT! Love the Willcox Ave. Hopefully Vovomeena will open more locations throughout the valley.

QADhXpNlDuyrKvB3kkt0eQ.text: Love this place! So yummy and great menu. Tortilla Espanola and Mexican Benedict are both favorites. Japanese cold brew is awesome. Love the atmosphere.

up61AqYc1eKSrOFlICkVUQ.text: Highly recommend. Will definitely be back to try something else. Great value as well. Could charge a lot more for the quality of food.   The B.M.O.C. is a BAMF!!  Great coffee too.

tszqWzPw2aaCyrNJa85Dag.text: Our second time here. We just love the Vibe here and the food is very special.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bathia&#39;s breakfast
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doesn&#39;t this look yummy

Iv-gZvRaGMr58c_2c1XQjA.text: I must say this, I love the food here. Absolutely delicious food and have never been disappointed w the food quality. However, I am rating this place 3 stars because of one particularly rude staff member. Nothing ruins a good meal/experience more so than rude food servers.

OzZLvuZm2PC_nGoeoOPy9g.text: Awesome coffee. Amazing food (mexican benedict). Good music.   Though for a first-timer, like I was, the ordering process is a little different. It is a counter-order resturant but there are no "order here" signs which makes you feel kind of lost when you first walk in. But the staff is extremely helpful and always willing to point you in the right direction without making you feel like a dumbass.   I will definitely recommend to others and come back for more coffee!

RMZJLp1xRITBUHt17XROTA.text: What a cool surprise.  I tried the Banger Wrap and thought the smoked gouda was the perfect touch. My husband went with the biscuits and gravy. Who knew you could get such a tasty breakfast for around $20.  This is well worth the trip if you are looking for something off the beaten path.

zruLYmwigUEPyP8TEU_bhw.text: A bit hard to find the first time as it is nestled behind other businesses.  Drive around the block and park behind in the large common parking lot.  Although the inside of the building is narrow the tables is laid out perfectly and the decor is eclectic.  There is also a very large area in the back for sitting.  They ask you not to barney a table until you've ordered and believe it or not the system works.    Waiting in line to order you can see them preparing the food; yummy.  Small menu but choices I've not seen elsewhere. I got the tortilla espanola and the hubby got the mexican benedict.  Both were cooked well and were tasty.  Not earth shattering but good.  When they dropped our breakfasts they asked if we wanted condiments and it took him a full 5 minutes (while the breakfast cooled) before he came back with them.  I'd suggest they carry the items on their person - only complaint.

Lz9pQ4FZSaYNPCCm5OQA1g.text: I enjoyed this spot. First off you grab a menu and seat yourself then decide what you'd like to eat after which you head to the area where you order you food and drinks. Grab a number and they deliver your food to you. There is a coffee bar where you go to get your coffee. The coffee was good. My food came out fast and was fresh and hot. I ordered the pudding bread French toast (Pain Perdu), it was very good. Very inexpensive place to eat and conveniently located in central Phoenix. Enjoy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing Pain Perdu!!

O-lCvkoxw3gUHEVxen59zQ.text: Plain and simply: The biscuits and gravy were to die for. Well worth the quirky ordering system.

DEjqNKjeGiReDKpGLwlliQ.text: Came for breakfast while in Phoenix for work.  Like many others, I recommend the Mexican Benedict (add hot sauce to taste) along with the Cold Brew coffee. It's a casual spot with a pretty extensive breakfast menu.  Come hungry.  Oh and you order at the counter!

sRN3_HawA0Bl6O4LGbNWBg.text: The food was great, the coffee was delicious.  One coffee barista who was beyond rude, made this a horrible first and last experience at this restaurant. The rest of the staff is very pleasant.  Being told whatever because I wanted to ask my friend what she liked, and not given the option of a refund, when they gave me the wrong $10 jar of coffee to go, after spending $32 bucks for my breakfast and to go coffee, is why I will never go back to this place.  Mistakes happen, and I was understanding of that, but it was how the guy in the 80s glasses handled the situation or more so that he didn't.  To the girl in the pink hair and the register guy, thank you both for being polite and friendly.

PQIopyIozNbSoHOHN6gOVQ.text: Our first time here and it was absolutely delicious ! I had the Mexican Benedict, what a unique take on Eggs benedict ! My husband had the Banging Pocket and enjoyed it ! Don't forget to top off your plate with their Portuguese donut !

8PkpynNeOuOsFDraUZPqMQ.text: Vovomeena is our 'go to' spot when family is in town visiting (we brunch here as a family of 4 every month or so, but make the extra effort to bring visiting relatives here to show off the culinary delights Phoenix has to offer.)  A few key elements set Vovomeena as the bar for us: 1. quaint menu, quality ingredients, presentation {we've tried 75% of the breakfast menu- all excellent, but we keep coming back to the Pain Perdu & Mexican Eggs Benedict}; 2. friendly & familiar faces : the staff at Vovomeena stick around. It's nice to recognize faces behind the counter & in the kitchen. It doesn't have to be an "everybody knows your name" kind of place to feel just welcoming enough; 3. location & atmosphere. It's nestled in a perfect location just off I-10; to add, the outdoor seating is lovely & indoor decor & 'space' gives a great vibe even for family dining (we usually need 2 highchairs at our table).  Thank you, Vovomeena, for a consistent, thoughtful & enjoyable dining experience in the Valley!

z6YXrvBFkfz2PEFTBnAnbA.text: Vovomeena has become a fast favorite of mine... from their coffee to their original breakfast options. The earlier you show, the better, as options can run out towards the afternoon.   The pain perdu is an absolute must. Banana syrupy goodness! I can't break away from the original eggs-potatoes-bacon / sausage breakfast - it's so nice when a restaurant gets it right! (The jam..get the jam.)   Indoor / outdoor seating. Take a menu off the wall and order with the cashier near the kitchen.

AXdKUObAWlWnkTMZM4Jq-A.text: Loved this place.   Delicious food.  The set up was unique.   Great find during my trip

QwhvEymLFBnstBvtmW6T9g.text: This place is amazing (: Love what they done within a small space ! Everything in here looks modern! The food taste of the food is well worth the price you pay. In my opinion I think this food is well priced for the flavorful meal! I hope everything best for this companies success! Hope that they move in a more profitable area! Would love to see this place all around the Phoenix area! Oh and the girlfriend said your food is awesome! Will be back for more!

GmDkVrTRHfO-RHjbqQYAIw.text: Wow, I'm eating the BMOC right now and it is fantastic!   Who thought of this combo is a genius. A waffle with a big piece of something like smoked ham with Apple compote on top, two eggs on top of that, and local type of fried donut. Omg. I want to clean the plate...

Pjp45XBrilGNeXWh1ar13Q.text: Vovomeena is great for brunch. Coffee and orange juice is sooo good, I think the orange juice is even hand squeezed.

OP2YyCiLGvESbsowO3vfFQ.text: Cool little restaurant. Parking is tight but free which is nice. My husband loved his cold brew coffee and I had the refreshing passion fruit iced tea. The biscuits and gravy are hearty and filling, the tortilla was nice and light yet incredibly savory. Knocked a star after watching a cook rub his nose with a gloved hand and keep working. That's pretty hard to shake as you're already finished up.

Pd9MRXk87SiuC1Og0C9Kpw.text: Best breakfast in Downtown Phoenix and perhaps the World!!!! If you love someone bring them here.

PAHTfnjhLRNZ-R69ZLM6DA.text: If you are looking for a hearty breakfast on a Saturday morning because you are going to conquer a 2 hour hike or run, then "hell yes" - go to Vovomeena.    I decided to go with Yelp's recommendations of the BMOC.  This thing was insane!  A waffle, then a pork chop, two eggs, maple syrup and some kind of fruit, and just as a little "cherry on top" for your breakfast sundae, they give you a small donut hole with some powder.    It was quite tasty!  However, it was too much for me to take.  It would practically take two of me to finish it all. Luckily, I was set to hike Squaw Peak right after.  So I didn't feel too guilty getting down with that kind of breakfast.  It actually gave me the extra motivation and boost of energy I needed.   On a side note, the iced coffee was a little too strong for my blood.  I'm sure other coffee drinkers would love it.

N04Iaaehj_XVMDOKj2AX3w.text: The service is great! The sausage is excellent too!! If you're wheat/gluten intolerant or need gf then good luck. I had Johnnycakes since it was advertised as being made with corn: and wheat... grrr.    Walking into this chic locale was fun, and had enough different textures within to lure us in. We drove over 20 miles to specifically to eat here.  Coffee is excellent too and very unique: I love their variety of cold drips.   The big negative (or a positive spending on your perspective) is that this place is too NOISY! This is primarily why I am giving 3/5 stars. If it wasn't so stinking loud in here I would easily give 4-4.5 stars.

3JNK-h0vTwsAQJN1P9UFKw.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. My companion ordered some sort of a chorizo-heavy situation that was pretty tasty; I, however, went with the mexican benedict because I'm a sucker for poached eggs. Well, the eggs were poached pretty solid, and I discovered that chorizo is not a meat I want in my benedict, so I did not eat much of my dish (stole a lot of my friend's, though!).

TeEb5B6hDdLwYgfmPhMysw.text: It was a nice place but extremely overcrowded. Kind of a funky concept in that you have to wait to be seated but aren't actually waited on. The food was overpriced and our service was terrible.

vYVGQW3xECSth_m_d6mkAw.text: Great food,  great service, great atmosphere! Delicious!  Found this place on yelp and was so glad we ate their today.  Park on 7th ave behind the restaurant.

6H_mmJrfnEBoJ2DbAJRSQA.text: Loved my vanilla latte, and my husband and I  both loved everything we had for breakfast.  Small, unique spot with outdoor seating as well.  We'll be back!

R6bLglPO_B-krUj62GWcqQ.text: This is the best in indie breakfast places I've been to in the Valley.  Great food, cool vibe, great coffe drinks

DDvHXN2qO0y8pyVjkWCplg.text: This is tucked away and easy to miss but it should not be! We had such a great breakfast here the other day. I think I may have found by new favorite place for brunch. Definitely recommend!!

7hwYIwsXtsiWHcQ-cmC9iw.text: Absolutely delicious breakfast food, wide variety of food and beverages. I had the apple French toast with bacon which I couldn't have liked more.  The coffee and lattes were standard, not bad but not amazing.  The ambiance is nice, it is a unique trendy place

nwH0yYolAYU2HJXWOgzMJw.text: Everything I've eaten here is a mouth orgasm, so whatever you're pondering, just do it. The coffee is great and the man-staff is hunky.

nuO-e9ozzDsn9kj8IJKsPg.text: The kiddo, daddy and I went to this magical spot for breakfast mid morning on a Sunday. The place is cute, a little small, but has inside and outside seating. You order at the counter first, then wait for the manager to seat you. Between the three of us we ordered the Mexican eggs Benedict, pain perdu (French toast), kid's egg/bacon/pancake, fresh oj, and a Portuguese doughnut.   Let's start out with the reason I will come back... the Portuguese doughnut was one of the best doughnuts I've ever had! You'll find it on the bottom of the menu, "add a Portuguese doughnut to your order (duh!) 1.50". Well said guys! Get one!   Second on the list is the pain perdu which my hubby ordered. He would only share two bites and I was reluctantly understanding. I wouldn't have wanted to share it either! I was a little disappointed with the chorizo on my Benedict. It was overly greasy and a little spicy for me (just preference).   Worth a try friend!

wzjOpAcR0JIn7J8bOi6SFQ.text: Good but I don't like how you can't edit the menu to your own liking. I would have liked to order a side of eggs or like a short stack on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast was delicious but I don&#39;t think it was enough for the price. I was still hungry after but it was very good.

2uzRblMJVeRuyvkOj_qi9A.text: Awesome breakfast...I had the The Wilcox and everythi g was cooked to perfection. My husband had the biscuits and gravy and the gravy was very savory and the eggs were cooked just right. The porportions are huge, neither of us could finish. The staff was very attentive and friendly. We loved the atmosphere.

jB-_RaKLFoAmdCRE8KQJRg.text: Sorry folks, but the term "BRUNCH" always implies there are Mimosa's and Bloody Mary's involved. Otherwise it's just "BREAKFAST".

takDr27dXs5gk3A0C13GQg.text: ONE OF THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACES!  my girlfriend and I wanted to go somewhere new for breakfast and heard of Vovomeena. We are so happy that we discovered this place. Their waffles are amazing and also the shredded chicken burro things were outstanding!!!!!!!!!  EVERYONE NEEDS TO TRY THIS PLACE OUT!

rdnbDF3SWBqJNW4o5Yj2Aw.text: This place is awesome! Great food (I've had almost everything on the menu), great hot and cold brew coffee, and great atmosphere. Also, the staff are really friendly! Definitely my go-to breakfast/brunch place in central Phoenix.

t-53QxylWjfVQKsT2zFYrw.text: Vovomeena means Grandma Meena. And if this is how Grandma Meena always cooks, then I would kindly ask to be adopted, immediately.   We came here for brunch to take advantage of the beautiful patio weather. I had two eggs over easy, taters, buttermilk biscuit and sausage. He had .. get this... Banana bread pudding french toast with some kind of whiskey sauce?! Decadence to the extreme. The French toast was delicious, but you need to have a serious sweet tooth to be able to put the whole thing down.   Everything we ate had delicious flavor and looked great too, good portion size and all.   The style of service is very simple, you order and pay at the counter, they give you a numbered card and bring your food to wherever you choose to sit.   There is also a coffee bar where they have Japanese Cold Drip coffee! Exactly what we need in the sweltering Arizona summer.  Keep in mind that they close at 1:30.

dJEfE_tZAaraCoML9JtUuQ.text: Went here for brunh a few weeks ago and I've been contemplating on going back sometime soon! The food is delicious, I had the tortilla espanol. Not sure why they call it tortilla since it doesn't have any but either way, it was great. Perfect meal size for brunch. Nice music selectionn! Like I said before, I can't wait to go back!

s8gYBk8vL_XNMwxUFniDYA.text: I will admit that the main reason I went to Vovomeena was because I saw the words Portuguese donuts in other yelpers reviews. In Hawaii, there are these little donuts called malasadas but they are technically Portuguese donuts and they are amazing. So I was hoping to get something close at Vovomeena. I didn't but overall my experience was still good.  The boyfriend and I went early on a Saturday so it wasn't very busy. We looked around lost and confused for a moment until someone came up to us and told us the drill - order at counter and they bring it to your table. I went basic - eggs and bacon, boyfriend went for the French toast and of course we ordered two donuts.  The food came out pretty quickly and the portions were large. My food was good but nothing unbelievable. Boyfriend liked his French toast - it was very dense and heavy so if you're looking for something light, the French toast is not. (I know French toast is not usually a "light" item - I'm just sayin' this was exceptionally heavy.) As excited as we were about the donuts, we were kinda let down. They tasted more like funnel cake than donuts - greasy and heavy.   The staff was nice, the food was okay but I don't think we'll go out of our way to go here again.

Ik_BZXCt-6GpBXN_CW3IQQ.text: I love this place. Extremely creative menu and quality filling food. The atmosphere is comfortable, light, and community oriented. Bring your appetite! The staff is wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoying johhny cakes with friends!

G6XWAUEdyNG4qIvsWFI5Ww.text: Very good! I would definitely go back. They have a lot of different types of food for anyones taste buds. I had the Mexican Benedict and it was great. Spicy addition to the classic. Not a normal serve, you order and pay at the cashier and then they will bring your food. Interesting modern approach to brunch.

A2G7Z63XKI8itKmbV1StIQ.text: A couple of my friends wanted to take me out to breakfast today.  I wanted to try this place.  They're locally owned, and the menu looked good.  I got a combo of pancakes, bacon and potatoes.  It has a place name, which I don't remember.  Everything was so dry.  I HATE it when a restaurant parcels out the syrup in little containers.  Just put a pitcher of syrup on my table, please.  Extra syrup could not render the pancakes finish-able.  The potatoes were also likewise very dry.  I only finished the bacon.  I didn't order, since I was the birthday guest, but it looks like you order your food and coffee at separate counters.  Is that the case?  And if so, is that necessary?  Do I really want to stand in 2 lines for my breakfast?  No.  I don't even want to stand in one line.  Unless that line is at Matt's.  Around 11:00, the music got so loud I had trouble hearing my friends talking.  And there were a LOT of kids there, if you're into that thing.  Also, I have had TERRIBLE reflux all day.  And that's all I've eaten today.  Just saying.

C_826xS6uJm4jbdaJr7HrQ.text: Goodness on a plate with a side of love and sunshine. Our first time was amazing. There was a line out the door so we had plenty of time to select our entrees. I selected the BMOC and my husband ordered the biscuits and gravy. To drink I had the fresh orange juice and took a taste of my husbands cold pressed coffee flight. My BMOC was salty and savory and sweet and amazing. The flavor a really worked well together, it was a fabulous "cheat" meal. The biscuits and gravy were the best I ever tasted, ever! The biscuits were fluffy and yummy and the gravy needed no additional seasoning, we asked for Chalula hot sauce and decided it was fine without. Cannot wait to go back.

Egr_z0nWM7hHR6pMlKq3Sg.text: B.M.O.C Review  Creamy deliciousness in my mouth with a side of food coma. This thing was the bomb dot com. Be warned, it will end your day. Smoked pork chop topped with a waffle, two fried eggs and a Portuguese donut all smothered in apple maple syrup. I was full about 2/3 of the way through this madness but  finished like a champ. 3 cups of coffee later I was able to avoid the food coma but I was still stuffed from breakfast around 8pm that same day. Give it a go homey!

5VDXhZbOGDPRqJ86N6H05w.text: This is the best breakfast place EVER! The hubby had Mexican Benedict and I had the savory crepes. I would have to say hands down the food was delish and fresh brewed coffee was awesome. Thanks to our friends for introducing this restaurant to us.

1qRWUjXwMWPV_S-oiJwPZw.text: The awesome thing about this restaurant is the front of house staff. They are always friendly, attentive, and just fun to talk to. They make you feel at home.  The food is wonderful, and the decor is just as wonderful. The parking, however, is impossible after 10am. Go early.  The kitchen area is a little disorganized and disheveled, but the kitchen staff manages to crank out quality and good tasting dishes at a good pace.    I'll definitely be back. The food and service is superior. I'll just avert my eyes next time I'm standing towards the kitchen. OK I'm lying: I always look and cannot stop.

qirYPKF29A8EMTRP30XzwA.text: The BMOC is pretty big compared to the other entrees. It was a very interesting mixture of sweet and some salty. Quite unique.  The place is casual, hip and charming. Really nice atmosphere.

T63jnJ_ZeKhRZluaUrW2GA.text: I love breakfast and was really anticipating vovomeena.  But was quite disappointed. Service was rude. For example; I asked if there was an alternative to the meat sides..... The gals answers was. "You can not have it.".... Wow. Thanks.    Food was nothing to brag about.  Can't say that I feel the need to return or recommend this spot.

Q_PLjdW-xG-25MDbOuiZfQ.text: food was delicious and coffee was delicious!! line had about 15 people ahead of us and took almost 45 minutes to get to the front. I understand having a line on a Saturday morning for brunch, but having one cashier at the front who is doing everything very slowly makes no sense to me. super disappointing :(

mJmZHilTEJ-7uIy0jg-Gjg.text: Found this place on Yelp, so I had to add to the hype! Not only is the food one step above the rest the staff are beyond polite and accommodating. I can always tell a good business owner when they make a personal stop to your table. I had the biscuits and gravy and they are TO DIE FOR!!

c5C9OKHCJm3ejAvJ5EDu0Q.text: Got the boxty, a jar of coffee (refillable at 10% off), and the day's special lemon tart. The food came out super fast and it was so good. Pancake-sized boxty (2) with shredded apple and a sweet butter on top, paired with two thick-cut slices of bacon.  It's set up where you grab a menu off the wall and go down the line to order at the end. You can see the cooks working without a glass barrier as you stand in line - so don't sneeze.  If you order a jar of coffee at the food counter, the coffee counter further into the restaurant gets a ticket so you pick it up there. It's a plastic-lidded mason jar with a custom label and is filled from jugs in the fridge. It fills about 4 of the ice-filled tumblers/plastic to-go cups and it totally worth the $10. It's super smooth and tasty and not at all bitter. I barely had to put anything into it; I could definitely drink it black and I usually can't with coffee. The boxty was much larger than I expected and the potato vs. sweet apple flavour was distinct from each other and very complimentary, rather than one overpowering the other. The bacon was super tasty too.  The lemon tart was small and plain but still pretty good. I'm not sure what other offerings they have since it said it was the day's "special" offering. They also had cookies on the counter and a little cooler of bottled drinks and orange juice at the check out.  A filling breakfast with amazing coffee for just over $20! I will definitely be back!  PS. All the people writing reviews and complaining about lack of vegan choices - there are other restaurants that cater to your special, self-imposed diet. Never, ever expect people to cater to you. It's such a stupid reason to criticize a public place.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee

-mUC58WwsauBlgrKfDkKJA.text: Lucky to get in before the Easter (Sunday) crowd.   Amazing ambience delicious items. Very hard to decide on just one. There is a party going on in my mouth. Thank you Yelp for showing me this.

VXEURMontiMzxIdT1-RCBw.text: The creeps are light and fluffy and the Mexican Benedict were amazing. Not to mention the coffee is so good. The cold press coffee is so amazing will def be back

_jOfiQuoWMPfvY3wiOoQsw.text: Hidden gem!!! Best breakfast we have had in Phoenix. Everything made from scratch and you can see them make your food. Very reasonable prices too.

4xtbpWenLb_RpkyYfm10vQ.text: Great tasting cold brew but their espresso setup leaves a lot to be desired. Mexican Benedict had great flavor, not impressed with the sopes on this dish though. Decent breakfast but probably won't return.

elQy-hf6rvST-P5lzup-PA.text: You know you found a good place when you wanna come back like everyday and try everything on the menu and this place is just that. The restaurant is really small but still comfy, we were greeted the moment we walked in, and once we ordered and got seated our food arrived in less then 5 minutes it seemed. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and my boyfriend had the waffle eggs and sausage. Everything was delicious especially the potatoes! Such a cool place and I can't wait to go back to try more!

YN0SO9FLHm2hp810TxSuWQ.text: One of the other Yelpers mentioned this place was like the restaurant from the "Brunch Village" episode from Portlandia and they were absolutely right! Phoenix has its version of "Fisherman's Porch" and it does what it does well.  That being said, this place is not for everyone. If you are not gastro-venturous and willing to pay for being so, then this is probably not your scene.  I was actually happy to find that I literally beat the crowd Sat around 11am (there was absolutely no one in line when I placed my order and the second I was handed my number there was a line out the door..,?). They have an interesting service setup here, which again, only works for a place like this. It is quasi-counter service in that you order at the counter and are given a number and afterwards can choose your seat. They also have a coffeebar, where you see the japanese cold brew drips hourglassing above, where you can pick up your ordered beverages. Based on your number, your food is brought to your table.  I ordered the mexican benedict (warning, the sauce and chorizo do have a somewhat spicy kick to them) which was delicious. The potatoes in other reviews were mentioned as "mushy" but I did not find them to be so. They were not as crispy as they could have been, but definitely leaned towards the cooked rather than soft side. I also loved that they have a "coffee flight" of their japanese cold brews. The ones I sampled were the "straight", vanilla cocao, and an lemon jalapeno. The latter was the only one I did not care for. I could have had a full serving of the vanilla cocoa as the density of the coffee balanced out the sweetness of the flavoring and was just perfection!   I ended my meal with a portuguese donut, which is, imho, the lovechild of a beignet and indian fry bread, and I will say, their offspring was exquisitely delicious!  The space itself was great and I loved the rustic contempo decor. The patio seating area is a kind of shared space w/the entrance to the courtyard of the little shopping center they occupy. Parking is a little limted, but thankfully I didn't have any issues finding a space.  All in all, a fantastic experience and should I ever find myself in the downtown area (or short drive from Sky Harbor) again, I will make a detour.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice outdoor seating area
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The portugese donut!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The awesome interior

2PsRKv6_tEwIJG90-Xy6KA.text: Great brunch place and not as expensive as what you would find in New York! My recommendations are the Johnnycakes and the b.m.o.c.  Johnnycakes (Two corn and chile cakes, prickly pear maple syrup, sweet rice) - My favorite of what we ordered. The cakes tasted like thin crispy cornbread with whole corn kernels throughout the pancake. The syrup was on the flowery side. Add a side of potatoes and this was a perfect breakfast.  b. m. o. c. (Massive Smoked Pork Chop, waffle, 2 eggs, Portuguese donut) - The waffle itself was soggy, but the pork chop was juicy and massive as advertised. It was similar to ham and it combined well with apple compote. The donut tasted like a fried fritter. I recommend ordering this.  Pain Perdu (Banana bread pudding french toast, whiskey caramel) - The banana bread was too sweet and too soggy. The whiskey caramel added more unnecessary sweetness. Order this only if you have a huge sweet tooth. I loved the crispy side of potatoes though.   Biscuits and Gravy (Buttermilk Biscuit, Hector's White Sausage Gravy, Two Eggs - The sausage had a somewhat spicy kick. Biscuits were fluffy. Eat this dish while warm because the gravy becomes too thick and viscous.  Order at the cash register and they'll bring you the food to the table. To get drinks, order/retrieve them from the drinks counter. Overall, I enjoyed this place and if I lived here I would frequent this place often.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drinks Counter
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and Gravy
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Johnnycakes

JnWgPCa4z9Jh3DtBsvxLDw.text: The atmosphere was hip and the place was super busy, but we still managed to get in and out in like 22 minutes.  I had the biscuits and gravy and my brother-in-law had the Wilcox Ave. (the generic breakfast) both were delicious.  I am definitely trying this place again a d may rate higher if the service and quality persist.

AR0u_35mbXKY1-fVEufvvg.text: I was here for the first time for breakfast and order the only omelette on the menu and it's delicious! I was their with a friend and he order the Mexican egg Benedict he was very happy with it! Nice little place very cozy! I will definitely come back! They serve a yummy local coffee roc2!

CYs0XtbJ_xNnG7jRCCDuvQ.text: My buddy wanted to get breakfast on my side of town and wanted to give Vovomeena a go cause he had heard great things.  First I'll start with how hip this place is, very cool atmosphere.  You order at the counter and they run the food out to you.  The prices were adorable and the portions were decent size for the affordable price.  I ordered the Waffle, Bacon and Potatoes and at $8.95 it was priced accordingly.  It was yummy, real maple syrup would be a good addition vs. the corn syrup buttersworth/jemima one they served.    All in all this would be a nice place to catch breakfast/brunch if you're in the area.  Gonna be honest and say Matt's is still the king of breakfast in my neck of the woods, but Vovomeena is quite pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $8.95 for all of this seemed like a good deal

WyH31ba3cJyUzkaWjFQ6gQ.text: Fast paced service for how busy it was. Food was delicious and coffee great as always. It's not a huge place but it has a good lay out and overall style.

UecyTOtZrjw0Le7oXmjJ2Q.text: Delicious classic breakfast sandwich with a spicy kick of chipotle aoli. The Japanese cold brew is also delicious and very smooth. It is made on very unique system using gravity to drip water into a canister.

Ytl_dbUqDOJtrUsrIVYAiw.text: We honestly stumbled upon Vovomeena after a stop at another business down the block.  We turned up the alley and saw Vovomeena.  After a quick Yelp check, we decided to have breakfast.  Am I glad we did! We hate chain restaurants and this is any thing but!  We ordered the BMOC.. smoked pork chop over a waffle....Awesome! The other offerings are different and we look forward to returning. They also have a parking lot ..a plus.  It became ridiculously crowded at noon.  I recommend coming before that to avoid that problem.

huFDtaMm8miV9UdKw5wSHA.text: Johnnycakes ($8.50): Corn and chile cakes, prickly pear maple syrup, sweet rice, and sausage. Omgosh, this is soo good! It's like a pancake, but made with corn and chile. The flavor is amazing and I loved the texture (tender inside like a buttermilk pancake with a crispy exterior). The fresh strawberries and syrup was fantastic with it. The sweet rice was a cinnamon rice pudding that was good, but an odd addition to the cakes.  Mexican Benedict ($10.95): Poached eggs, chorizo, tomato, cilantro, hollandaise on sopes with spuds. I just love variations of the traditional benedict and this one really hit the mark for me. The sopes were wonderful and such a great alternative to the English muffin. Obviously, chorizo is always great and it worked really well here; also, its spice was toned down a bit by the hollandaise. The spuds were tasty, too.  You order and pay at the counter and then grab a table. The menu is fun; I definitely have my eye on other items for another visit, however, those Johnnycakes are a must again! Fantastic service.

-hQYHpulUGa-kuKmVVNRsg.text: It was my first time at Vovomeena yesterday for lunch and I must say that I will never come back again due to lack of customer service.  I was sitting outside enjoying my lunch, catching up with one of my girlfriends when the waiter came and took away the patio umbrellas and rudely stated that they were closing early because they ran out of ingredients. It was only 1 pm when this occurred, and the restaurant is usually closed at 2:30 pm on Sundays.   If your restaurant states that it is open for business until 2:30 pm, please do not kick out your customers who have already ordered, paid, and are in the middle of enjoying their meal before closing time..

_qYSJQYmf91FzN50t8STYQ.text: I have a thing for home grown , locally owned ..anything. I think it is important to support the community and its efforts, with that being said.. The third time isn't a charm.  First time was just ok- nothing to report.   Second time my corn cake thing was just gross batter used was from the previous day, seriously .  Third time - not amazing. The omelette was to be a veggie mix, and very few findings of the diced zucchini. The sausage was hard and over cooked. The potatoes were under cooked.  The end

lVbn6oeT7G0TRud-x40R_Q.text: This place was recommended by friends, so glad I decided to try it out. Good food, great atmosphere, I highly recommend it, stop in for delicious food!!

68MwvNYW5hsS_RTNgFDLlg.text: My friends and I needed to find a good restaurant on our way to Phoenix Comic Fest in May 2018. We decided to try this place, and we were amazed by the fresh food and excellent staff. We would recommend the pancakes and biscuits and gravy. Although, we were even impressed by the toast and jam with eggs, and the chorizo was just perfect. The coffee is the best we have tasted, and we ended up returning for breakfast for the following day of the fest. Next time I visit, I will bring my family and friends. I cannot wait to try other items on the menu. I highly recommend this restaurant.

uLHH-RNZPWs5ebGg6fbSGg.text: I went to this restaurant couple months ago and everything was great on a Saturday.This  time I went on a Monday  and it wasn't pleasant the jar where they have the creamer for the coffee  smelled really bad like rotten milk I did brought it to the waiter attentions the guy in the front look like he was having a really bad day it just made my whole experience not really good I think costumer services everything .

5P2G8SfPk0GR0cAtTY_JoA.text: So-so. Got the biscuits and gravy and my boyfriend got the Mexican eggs Benedict. They were both mediocre. Typical breakfast. The coffee (latte) wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great. Very mediocre in general... came here because of the high reviews... so I was expecting more.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hOPZYYci8dwwp3pq-VCkrw.text: 3 years later... I added the last star for amazing consistency over the years and I'm a little (just a little) less of snooty punk :p  This place has become a staple. Still just as good every time Service and quality off the charts Still doing the flight of cold brew, Mexican Benedict and Pain Perdu Winning combos...

2c5LMbytXAa9R9rZQfJc4Q.text: I came here for breakfast after a long night out. Staff was really nice and food was solid. I got the biscuits and gravy. Nothing to write home about but definitely solid. I don't remember what the other people I was with got but they seemed happy as well.  4/5. Would be back.

9S-lVLxMcaPmHvPl-gTLLQ.text: Vovomeena why were you so hard to find!!! Whether you're driving down McDowell or 7th avenue you won't see it. Maybe we just missed it, but I didn't see any sign whatsoever. The only one was right about their door, but you can't see it well from the street. We got lost and drove around and couldn't find it. I had to text my sister to see where it's at.   I ordered the banging pocket which I didn't think was very banging. Lol. It comes with sausage and eggs wrapped in a pita with a side of potatoes. It would've been nice with some onions or mushrooms or something. It just wasn't anything great.   There isn't a lot of seating at the restaurant. You probably have to come early to get a table or you'll end up sitting outside in the hot weather. They should really install misters. The service was really good but it was a far drive for mediocre food.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banging pocket

un6J01BHmTXAgUSEb69KTQ.text: We stumbled upon this place while searching for some breakfast/lunch places in Phoenix. This place was pretty busy upon entering. There were only a couple of tables open. The food was amazing. The biscuits and gravy were top notch. The biscuits were soft yet had a crispy texture, and the gravy was creamy and had delicious sausage pieces in it. The all-you-can-drink coffee was very good. It didn't taste like cheap drip coffee. It was bold and full-bodied and went very well with our food.   The environment was nice in that the doors were open to a nice patio area with outdoor seating. The only thing is that you can't sit where you want. You have to wait until after your order and then they find a table for you. A positive for this method is that you don't have to scramble to find an open table (like you do at In-N-Out!).   We will definitely return to try the other items on the menu. So many menu items that sounded so good. But they are a bit pricey for breakfast, so we can't return very often.

gfWYxM4udcK4iMRn_LIg4A.text: Seriously good breakfast/brunch place that isn't too pretentious. Cold brew flights and breakfast tacos are my jam. If you are flying in or out of Phoenix this is an easy stop. Yes, parking lot. Yes, gas station right at the corner.

ZYz7d-CW3OA7dnWHKXA56w.text: My sister and I decided to grab breakfast together today since I had taken the morning off work for our grandmother's burial. This place was bookmarked a while ago and it has 4.5 stars so we decided to give it a try.   The place was a bit hidden for us since we didn't see it from the street. Parking seems to be limited but we didn't have trouble getting a spot.   It's a quick place for breakfast/brunch. You order at the counter, get a number display and you grab a table. I went with the Savory Crepes - they were just okay. Nothing stood out and I wished I had ordered the orchard french toast that I was eyeballin on the menu. It wasn't that it was bad, it was just so plain. Maybe it was my sweet tooth that made me feel guilty.  My sister went with the banging pocket (I think that was what it was called). She said it was enjoyable but also was not impressed. She did enjoy the fresh squeezed orange juice and I managed to steal a few sips of it. Not a bad way to start a Friday after a funeral service. No complaints about the food and service was quick & friendly.

ABiy4XzcjiLuhi_CC4UmIw.text: The manager Kaj reached out and was authentically concerned. I do believe great customer service is what he strives to give his customers. When I have visited since, the service has also been great. Really great food as well.

NVF9d_1OJarTQrh4wA-uUA.text: Great service, cute little place, very good food. Mexican chorizo eggs were A+, tortilla espanola was good but not amazing. A little pricey for the type of food, but great quality overall, I would go back! FYI: Parking from 7th ave is a little tight, place offers another parking through their other east entrance.

4ThYBI2LOvf-RrAVRsmqVQ.text: Delicious mix of sweet and savory. I love sweets but my girlfriend is more of a savory person. The food here is a perfect combo of both. We got the johnnycakes (corn and chile pancakes) and pain perdu (bread pudding french toast), both were amazing. Everything was really soft and melt in your mouth type of food. And this is the first breakfast place I have ever seen serve rice pudding! Highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7PpUoExYlEbiAQz806mUoQ.text: Really good brunch spot. Interesting menu a great coffee bar and an awesome atmosphere. Give it a try, I know you'll enjoy the experience.

GsQ5Fboe3bZh8XRkpZCSVw.text: Fun place to visit and get GREAT breakfast. Yes, come early and be prepared to not know what the heck is going on or where to sit, but people guide you without much judgement! I had banana French toast and it was worth the calories; hubs had omelet he raved on AND the coffee passed our palates of "is it strong enough". Great vibe,great place.

VFxz0e0ZlEazLYyy0I5fUw.text: Ordered BMOC cause it said massive porkchop. Gotten the size of a baby's hand. They poured their special syrup on my own waffles without my consent and I might as well just eat oatmeal with syrup from how soggy it was. But either way, good experience. The staff were friendly. Thanks #teamvovo keep it up.

DJogXCPnj8nAAISPpYnK5g.text: Delicious biscuits and gravy! We also ordered a waffle to share that was pure heaven. The cold brew flavors are unique and perfect. I ordered a 16oz lemon jalapeno cold brew that was not too strong and also amazing. The atmosphere is cute and you can sit inside or out on the patio.

ZTBE2A64L-6fXDS7CqdYJw.text: This place was awesome!! All their dishes are so unique and their own! My favorite surprise was the fact that they use paper straws! The staff was superb and welcoming, great service and overall excellent experience at this place. Especially being from a different state and coming here, I was blown away by the cleanliness, thoroughness and satisfying experience. wno3onxhgkDgyqeQjDjxEg.text: Vovomeena was amazing. We had the Mexican eggs Benedict and the Spanish tortilla. Rarely have I had such perfectly poached eggs! The flavors were amazing. Our server was super friendly and attentive. The Japanese iced coffee was some of the best I've ever had. Go here!  You won't regret it.

TtGNxxkOLZ1P4hyflVHE4Q.text: The corner of 7st and McDowell is another hot spot for many stores and restaurants.They all shared the same parking lot. There are a few parking spaces in the back lot near the Easley's Fun House side.   As most popular brunch places, coming on a Sunday afternoon, this place was extremely packed. They have 2 entrances front and back. It can be confusing if you entered from the back since no sign or service directing you until you walked to the front seeing a long waiting line.   You place the order and paid at the counter then they bring the food to your table. You can watch them preparing the food while you order. It's an open kitchen. They do have outside seating area shared with other businesses.   I tried the special eggs Benedict on board and the Japanese cold brew. It was a basic hearty meal but nothing special. The Japanese cold brew was just ok. It didn't fully capture the coffee flavors that I am used to in a Japanese cold brew. Their Portuguese donut was decent but I felt overpriced ($1.50 for a really small piece).  Overall, it's great little place in a vibrant changing neighborhood.

J5Ycp8rSwYi0nxY1rez1Aw.text: I found this restaurant on Yelp and the menu looked delicious. I tried to phone in my order but there was no answer so I hopped in my rental car and google mapped the location.  First impression was that I lucked up on finding the place but  Vovomeena is such a cute little restaurant. It's family friendly with plenty of parking.  When I arrived the line was flowing out of the door (which explained why no one could answer the phone). A long line of happy people is always a good sign. I stood in line reading the menu for a few minutes but I already knew what I wanted to order. Once I made it in the door I noticed what I assumed was the manager running back and forth and being very welcoming to guests. In fact, it seemed that all the staff did equal work but the gentleman who stood out just seemed like the one who made sure everyone was happy.  So I stopped him and told him I wanted to order take out. He led me over to another section of the restaurant where I put my order before waiting a short while for my food. The service and food (orchard French toast, turkey sausage and hasbrowns) were great! I highly recommend this wonderful neighborhood jewel.

0gsm6aoSqSvhpIq-1PEYQA.text: This review is really overdue, been here so many times but never got the chance to actually get around to it. Kinda too busy enjoying their food. That being said, the B.M.O.C (in my opinion) is their best entree. That pork chop is amazing. Every time I come here I want to try something different but I always come back to it. All the food here is mostly on the heavy side so come with an empty stomach or share with someone. This mom & pop breakfast joint is one of the best I've been to, if you're near downtown Phoenix, try it. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iLpFX4-xGN6bischrAtAjw.text: Special of the day awesome. Will return food is amazing staff very friendly and fast service. Coffee is excellent No downside to this place. Worth the drive from. Scottsdale fo a wonderful breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NWBLQ6WI1btWfeIXp7_NeQ.text: We have become brunch lovers so it was exciting to see unique menu options at Vovomeena. The have a convenient setup so when patrons get there, they can get in line and order prior to being seated. While it's not the biggest restaurant, we were able to order & get seated immediately at one of the tables outside. Our food came out in just a short while.  I chose the 3 Sisters Omelette & my husband chose the Banging Pocket. It was nice that multiple menu options were served with your choice of bacon, sausage, or potatoes. When we were in line, we had the full view of the kitchen; I had seen them cooking up potatoes and they looked delicious so I got those as my side with the Omelette!  My husband loved the Banging Pocket which came with the potatoes. It was a pretty sizeable breakfast but he was able to eat the whole thing. The Omelette was tasty with the black beans, corn, zucchini, & cheese. The only thing I wasn't a huge fan of was the feta that was on top. It felt like there was too much & the strong flavor of the cheese overpowered the others flavors. The Banging Pocket came with a side of salsa which I actually think would've gone well with the omelette as well. I'd ask for that next time ... and no feta!  If I were looking for something different, I'd come back to Vovomeena. It probably wouldn't be my #1 choice but there are other options they offer which I'd like to try!

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banging Pocket.

ti7kJh9XfVrCiD7OAHANog.text: Lovely little breakfast spot that is tucked away around the left side of the building that houses Five Guys.  The staff was friendly and the food was quick. I loved their salsa!

h3tD8XVIpIB6lnRtwz__-A.text: Wow. I love this place for brunch. The Blackstone scramble is my favorite! Great flavors. Sometimes the table shares a cinnamon roll! I love their coffee sampler to order for the table. Such a unique breakfast spot for that location. There isn't anything really like it around. Great place to take family or friends in town!

C-e0mOSbaHB4gHFvznIlRA.text: This small cafe is super cute and was very busy when we went around 10 AM on a Sunday. I expected to have to wait a long time to order and get a table but surprisingly they were pretty quick about it. You enter the cafe and grab a menu to start, you get in line and order with the cashier and if you ordered coffee you will get it from the coffee bar. The barista was very quick and the cold brew was amazing. I added sweet Italian cream that was available as well as a little simple syrup. We waited in the line to be sat for maybe 3-4 minutes then the host sat us. The food came just as quickly, I ordered the egg sandwich without bacon as I am a vegetarian. It was very good!! The chipotle aioli really hit the spot. I would definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3EDM_S9o2cdLChdl4ZQTDQ.text: Vovomeena. A good.. ish place.  I say ish because my experience here was unique. It was good. And bad. And awkward.  We arrived later in the afternoon. I work in service so I won't go anywhere with less than 30 mins to close. Anyways. We arrived with around 40 mins to close and the man at the counter, I believe a manager? Or supervisor idk he had keys to lock up.  I have some diet restrictions and needed some walk thru the menu. He was pretty helpful. But idk I just got like an annoyed attitude like he would rather be anywhere else kinda vibe. Which is understandable I tots get it. No one really enjoys working, but fake it till you make it right brah?!  Anywho after that things were chill. I got my food. Pretty good. Fresh. Cooked well. Tasty. You can tell that someone is invested and cares about the quality of their establishment.  But it's not really something I'd write home to mah about. The decor on another hand is really cute and the colors compliment one another. I also really enjoyed their art on the wall. You could tell that it was original and probably made by a local artist. Paintings of facial portraits. The ocean. Some Picasso shit. It was cool to look at. My friend got the special. A burrito of some sorts. And it comes with fruit. It was fresh honeydew and it looked so good that I couldn't help but start to crave. They were closing up it was like 1:20 at this point so I walked up to the counter and asked for some fruit to go. The OG guy again helped out and started to offer to box up the rest of the melon when the chica stated "tengo hombre". OG immediately started to say that actually they were going to use the melon for a special tomorrow, or whatever BS he came up with on the spot   Now to give you a picture, I'm a white girl. Like a basic white bitch. A full on gringa. But I know some Spanish and I know that means "I'm hungry".  And I said "oh that's cool. She's  hungry, I understand I like fruit too" and walked back to my table. Bitch stole mi fruta  Then I went back to get a box for my leftovers and I heard him speaking to the server assistant dude telling him what happened and laughing   I mean it's a funny ass story. The dude was probably just over worked and tired; and the chica was just getting off of work and hungry. I get it.   But it was terrible customer service. Will not come back. And will not recommend.

RGbtvDAzWDOTuRJLvLcT6g.text: 2019 Update a year later.    I've been in a few times since my last update.    And I must say things have not gone well.   For the last year I've suggested this place to many especially for the biscuits and gravy.  I can no longer do that.    I ordered the biscuits and gravy with side order of bacon.   And it wasn't anything like it used to be.  Where was the white gravy with big chunks of sausage and big biscuit ?!  This time The gravy was sour with very small  pieces of sausage and was a brownish/yellowish color (the super yellow in the pic is egg yolk) I ordered bacon which was flacid no crispness at all.  This was nothing like I remembered.  It looked like a plate throw up.   See pic.  Which is funny because even though i only had a few bites but couldn't get 3 miles away before having to pull the car over and throw up.  I did mention the sourness to someone in the coffee area as I was leaving. He offered to get me a free meal ticket.   Which I declined, as I will no longer put my stomach through this.     For over $17 for biscuits and gravy 2 eggs , 2 slices of bacon and coffee the only redeeming factor was the coffee.  But definitely NOT worth the $17       Previous update: Manager asked us to come out and try it again.    This time was so much better, coffee was as great as ever. Food was great.  My dad loved his meal. People were so friendly.    I appreciate that they put the eggs on the side (instead of on pancakes). Without even being asked.  Now if they could just get more comfortable seating...dad (79 yrs old) (no padding on his butt) and I (with back issues) both had troubles getting up from the hard metal chairs.   But I'll just bring cushions next time. Lol

I_hG4xaoiL3ulTHKcKMD2w.text: Great breakfast place! Quaint setting, indoor and outdoor seating. Exquisite menu items that include standard breakfast food as well as some items that are more creative and interesting. Housemade cold brew coffee and good drip coffee are also offered. The staff went out of their way to assist with us and even gave us a sample cold brew as we waited for the rest of our party. The food was as good as the atmosphere - the Mexican Benedict will be my go to here from now on.

44wiKXzjFtKT22JX_UcSEA.text: Had the BMOC, the pork chop was awesome. Waffle was a little soft would ask for syrup on the side next time.

WLjwAeSRtLIH1Z56RqYQLA.text: So tasty! Went to Vovomeena for the first time on Valentine's day for breakfast and it was amazing. They had a special latte - the Thin Mint latte - and it was everything you'd think it would be and more. It even came with a thin mint on the side. The Pain Perdu banana bread french toast was pretty heavy and sweet, but was really delicious! u0HF4ph2kz-pZUxMQbi2WA.text: Wow, this place was amazing. I'm really glad that we decided to pick this place.   When you first come in, you order at the register. If you get a drink, you wait at the drink bar. To assist in finding a seat, a manager is there after you put in your order. I decided to get the classic egg sandwich and Japanese cold brew. I highly recommend the cold brew. It's so good and strong! The classic egg sandwich was amazing too. It's on an egg bun, my fave. The chipotle aioli goes so well with everything on that sandwich. The potatoes on the side were perfectly crispy. Everything was just amazing. The service was great and they kept checking to make sure everything was okay.  If I ever go back to Phoenix, I'd definitely go back here!

b-HxGxONhxMhRPMFyKJJxA.text: The banana nut muffins taste like Cap'n Crunch! Their muffins are baked with love. Soft, moist, fresh and flavorful.   3.5 Star review.  I've seen nothing but great reviews and recommendations for this breakfast joint.  It was quite busy the morning I came - looked like some business meetings even took place here. A wait was understood but the lines died out and it got to a point where we thought they forgot about us. When I went to check on my table's order, the guy at the counter let me know that it would be right out. And it did come to us within the next couple minutes. Everyone was super apologetic and a gentleman (perhaps a manager? Owner?) even came by and checked up on us, apologized, and gave us three muffins on the house. Such a kind and appreciated gesture - not to mention those muffins are fantastic! Might even be the best thing we had on the menu!   I ordered the classic egg sandwich. The bread was really soft and you can never go wrong with eggs and bacon. Overall I enjoyed my sandwich. I would order it again.   My boyfriend ordered the Wilcox Avenue which was just eggs, a choice of meat, and toast. Again, simple, he also enjoyed his food with some Tapatio.   My brother and his girlfriend on the other hand did not have too pleasant of a breakfast. He got the Blackstone Scramble, which he said was barely seasoned and had an overwhelming amount of bell peppers.. And she ordered the Mexican Benedict. She is a lover of all Benedict's. That is, until today. The chorizo was not very flavorful. Again, the meal was just pretty bland and the eggs were over poached. There was such high expectations as everyone raves over them but it did not deliver in the least bit.   It made sense why my boyfriend and I were happy with our meals because what we ordered doesn't require seasoning.   What really made me disappointed were the spuds that are served with every meal. Now, I don't know if it's a thing to just kind of boil potatoes and call it good but I was not a fan! The amount of time we waited I feel like they should've sat on the stove top a little longer to get at least a crisp if there's absolutely no flavors added. Not even copious amounts of pepper or ketchup could save those.  Aside from that - if I were around the area, I would probably stop in for a muffin and some tea or coffee.

a5oXhfFoLF_4C7Fzzc7LjQ.text: First, I never finish my food at a restaurant and say, "wow that was good." But here, that's immediately what I did. My husband and I ate here yesterday morning. We weren't in line very long and were seated within three minutes. Service was very fast and seating was available inside and a cute area outside. I had the classic egg sandwich with potatoes on the side and he had the Blackstone scramble with a flour tortilla on the side. I tasted the scramble and the tortilla, both tasted homemade and delicious. The egg sandwich exceeded expectations. I love Eggslut sandwiches, but the Vovomeena sandwich now holds first place for me. I will definitely be returning whenever we're in town again.  Tl;dr: service was fast, food tasted homemade and delicious.

v099ZX8KaEQo3TsFssrWLQ.text: Very good food and reasonable service, great ambiance, and solid coffee.

I really enjoyed him showing me my seat and checking on people has they ate. I highly recommend this place for breakfast/ brunch.
