7qB_lfBc9IpEP8izUkvs9Q.text: The best thing about this restaurant is the bathroom candle . Food sucks and the outdoor area is dirty and buggy.

W4DyYDOiAEJPDkRKOQtLBQ.text: I was a little surprised by the mediocrity of the food during my visit this morning considering how popular this place seems to be on Yelp. I ordered...  (man, I can't even remember, how's that for mediocre?) OH! It was the Orchard French Toast. It was French toast with shredded apple, which you perhaps could deduce from its name. I think I would have been decently pleased with myself had I made it at home, but for the price...? Not worth it. The significant other had Wilcox Avenue, which was eggs, potatoes and a biscuit. Again, all quite bland. I think the best thing we had to say about the meal was how crispy the outside of the potatoes were.  Upsides: Ambience was really cool. Service was decent. They let you help yourself to water. So, you know, not all bad.

qKGfsWBgamCzEH6L0k2aLg.text: Super quaint little breakfast brunch spot near downtown. Unique concept- order at the counter, then choose your own seat. We had the three sisters omelette, breakfast burrito and waffle - very fresh ingredients- the side of potatoes was amazing too. Very strong coffee as well. Hard to decipher how the system works if it's your first time, but they walk you through it.

kXCZmZecwfQpRrA6aD8bpg.text: I got the BMOC and it was really filling and delicious. The waffles were very tasty and the pork shoulder was tender and well-seasoned. My only complaint is that I got the eggs over-medium and they came a bit undercooked. The employees were very friendly and helpful.

rhQa7Z9dIvCL9ubWVm7kLw.text: I only tried two dishes here, but I felt like both were extremely heavy. In glancing through the menu, it seemed that most of the dishes bordered on the heavy, carb-full side of brunch. Not that there's anything wrong with that, and brunch food tends to be heavy in general, but I felt that Vovomeena definitely took that to a new extreme with the dishes I tried. They were very unbalanced, and I didn't feel like finishing the meal after a few bites because of how one-dimensional the flavors felt.   Vovomeena is located in a small plaza with a shared parking lot between a few restaurants. Parking can be insane during the lunchtime rush, but it's not usually too hard to find a spot. Tables felt somewhat sticky to me, and unfortunately there were quite a few flies hovering around (not that that's the restaurant's fault). The mechanism is order first at the counter, grab drinks as they're made at the counter, and then find self seating. Service at the counter was short, although the waiter manning the tables was nice and checked on us a few times.  Iced cold brew: This was a far cry from the fragrant, nutty cold brew coffee that the menu promised. I much prefer the Starbucks cold brew even, and this was very watered down and bland in comparison. The cup was also half ice, which I wasn't a fan of.  HMOC: waffle topped with pork loin and donut. This combination was very interesting, and I hadn't really had anything like it before. My main issue with this dish, as I've mentioned above, is how it was heavy upon heavy upon heavy. The waffle was sweet and syrupy, then on top the pork loin was salty and dense (it tasted more like ham so I was surprised), and finally there's a fried donut on top that was also very rich. I felt that there wasn't a component to alleviate some of the richness of the dish, so it was hard to enjoy after the first few bites. I actually preferred that the pork had been cured or marinated before, as the saltiness similar to ham could combat the sweetness of the waffle and donut a little.   Pain Perdu: I know this is a Yelp favorite, but it was really just banana bread smothered in syrup. There wasn't really anything that suggested french toast to me, and paying $10+ for two slices of banana bread soaked in syrup with half a sliced banana on top didn't feel worth it to me. The banana bread was also really, really sweet, which was then exacerbated by the syrup on top. The whole dish was so sweet that it made the banana taste bland.   I was lured in by the amazing reviews, but I don't know that I'd return for a second visit.

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. HMOC: waffle topped with pork loin and eggs with donut on the side.

0B9_0oA4jLcoG9MOLZNtlQ.text: Loved this place! The Benedict and breakfast burrito were delicious. Also highly recommend the Portuguese donut.

Xa20x17VloZSXOVF-hSnkg.text: Lovely place. Can't tell how busy the place is from outside but once you get in, you'll be amazed by the decors and vibe. Friendly staff and good service, and the food was uniquely flavored with a Mexican twist. Recommend the three sisters omelet with potatoes!  Ps they have a parking lot and patio seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

H7-ngdLQvKVQOCM9uLDQdg.text: I had a good experience here. The Mexican Benedict is great! It comes with potatoes. The service was also good. You go in, place the order, pay, get your coffee while the manager gets your table ready, and finally eat. The coffee was also good too.   I wish they had bigger portions here. Or at least a little bit more stuff in the menu to order on the side. Makes it seem like if you want anything more, you just have to get another meal. Overall good place and I will go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

fC02hSD4S7w8bsc4kMu6hA.text: First off, I spent a great deal of time trying to figure out just what in the hell Vovomeena is supposed to mean. To me, it sounds like the name of some badly designed budget-friendly economy car model from the 90s that was plagued with mechanical problems and ultimately had to be recalled due to safety issues. Unfortunately, I was wrong. It's actually named after the owner's grandmother, so that's that.  We've visited Vovomeena a couple of times, with a good two-year gap in-between both stops. The place has both indoor and outdoor seating and is going for the cafe-styled order at the counter approach. Be warned that if you're visiting later in the day, they will inevitably be out of something - which has happened to us on both occasions.   From what I've experienced, you're fine playing it safe with something like the Willcox Avenue, which consists of your traditional eggs, meat choice (bacon in our case), and a biscuit or toast - although it can be swapped out with a pancake if you wish. The plate also includes spuds, which are potato slices that are only very lightly cooked and served up in pretty small portions. However, everything is very good quality.  If you want to get a bit crazy, go with the B.M.O.C., which consists of a waffle that's topped with a pork chop, two eggs, and a Portuguese donut. The combination is something that people will either love or loathe, depending on how your brain is wired. Personally, I thought it was good, but a bit too heavy on the stomach for someone like myself. I'm glad I tried it, but I doubt I'd order it again.  Vovomeena seems to have its fair share of fans. When studying the menu, they clearly have a nice balance of both unique creations and traditional items that isn't overwhelming. Although I doubt I'd ever put it into regular rotation, it's worth visiting on those Sunday mornings when I'm in the mood to do some brunch experimentation.  Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. B.M.O.C
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wilcox Ave

IYuuTnb9nO9t5jLzeVjs4Q.text: What a great place tucked behind a parking lot on 7th Ave & McDowell.  As you walk in grab a menu and then place your order.    The menu is short and sweet.  The home fries are the real deal with huge chunks of of tomato and cilantro.  We were handed a number as I turned around I saw this cute coffee stand.  The coffee was unique, against the wall were glass cylinders that dripped coffee slowly into larger cylinders.  I was told this is the new wave of coffee making.  Okay, then I need a cup right now...  I coffee was good, not great but good.  Here comes the brunch.... my husband ordered the French toast... wow.... it was definitely delicious! I got the tortilla espinola. It was yummmy....  Vovomeena is a great breakfast/brunch place.  That's what they do and they do it well.....

Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla Espinoza
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drip, Drip, drip....coffee time

08VDvwBJced9gdy9OnjfXw.text: Great food and environment! Staff was great, my bf took me for the first time and we will be going back. The biscuits and gravy with an overeasy egg was delish!!

NX5f5D4OqkHmALwMfQ8rEw.text: We stopped by here for breakfast while staying in PHX. The food was excellent. The coffee was outstanding, we ordered a Togo jug of the cold brewed coffee for later in the day. Everything was beyond our expectations.

OM6U1UyrAsJYhGst1O00bQ.text: Mexican Benedict was delicious!! The orange juice is fresh! The place was clean and music was nice!

UpjGht6-8bRfiI2NTy-dDg.text: Always great food. Good service. Good coffee. I would go there more if it were a little easier on the wallet but their prices are not outlandish.

MHIYr2yjiKbsIRjqwxQkBw.text: Start with their Coffee is amazing! We are visiting the area from Ventura CA an love to eat breakfast in an outdoor environment. This place has outdoor seating which is great. Service, nothing short of amazing! We ordered the scramble and the tortilla. The scramble with the homemade flour tortilla was fantastic! The Spanish Tortilla was just okay. Since we have been to Barcelona and my best friend is a Spaniard, I have had some amazing Tortilla. This one was not close. Sorry, but outside of the so-so Tortilla, everything else was excellent!!!

zFHVw5hXC_GU_vyK02QhqA.text: I'm writing this review years after the fact. This popped up as a brunch place to try and wouldn't let me rate without writing something so this is what I remember of the experience which is why I never went back.   Saw this place advertised in the Sunday paper and decided to try it out. My boyfriend at the time and I went and the place was packed which is usually a good sign. However, given the size and arrangement of the restaurant it was very uncomfortable waiting on a line that seemed to be a bit all over the place and confusing to some newcomers such as ourselves. We waited on line for several minutes with the hope that the food should be awesome and worth the wait and hassle. I'm not looking at the menu but I think he got the Perdu something or other (one of there best dish items) and I had the biscuits and gravy. We were extremely underwhelmed. His dish was burnt and my dish tasted only like sage only. I would give the place one star after the long wait and the overly hyped food but decided to give it two because I don't remember the place being dirty.

2_EmxTTO8RH9jI3A3S__lg.text: Such a beautiful place. I feel like family when I walk in! Mexican Benedict-- ridiculously good. My girlfriend and I usually split that & the savory crepes. So delicious, & consistently executed!

sVM_7miLmat6BGmNzaHkbw.text: Food is fabulous!   The Portuguese Benedict was cooked perfectly, and the pain Perdue is like a banana bread smashed with a Cinnabon and topped with Carmel goodness.   Would give 5 stars but Coffee tasted burnt and the music isn't my thing. Could have been more loungey for the space.  Big band blaring just made people start talking louder during crescendos.  Amendment: after posting my review the manager contacted me to let me know he appreciated the constructive criticism. This is what small business owners should do. Listen, make yourself better through appreciating that your customers want to make you better. 5 stars in my book.

GQg4VEHZCAiz6-lgxks_iQ.text: The breakfast crepes are amazing! Same with the cold brew. It is possibly the best coffee I've tasted in my life (try it with Irish cream). Overall really great place.

AUsGUuhEsihs_F1qjn2uvg.text: So first off I wanted to state that I understand that certain restaurants don't want to allow any substitutions from their menu, but there's a difference between saying 'no substitutions' and 'we can't accommodate that". when i ordered the breakfast sandwich I asked if they could please do egg whites instead of the fried egg, the guy behind the counter just said 'no i can't accommodate that'. This was a Wednesday morning at around 9:30, there was no line of people, the place had about 4 customers that were sitting and was by no means busy. I asked the guy if they used real eggs, he replied yes, so i asked again why they couldn't just do egg whites, because I am allergic to the yolk. The guy just responded again "we can't accommodate that" I then asked. ok, well if that's the case, can you please at least make sure the egg is fried over hard so i can just cut out the yolk then? he replied that over hard is how the egg is prepared. I said, ok, then that should work. My boyfriend ordered his food as well, we paid and went outside to sit. When our food finally came out to us I was disappointed to see that they made the egg over medium and cut the sandwich in half spilling the yolk all over the sandwich. I looked at the guy that delivered the sandwich and said 'you guys cut the yolk all over the sandwich, i can't eat this'. He then just set down the plate and said "is there anything else you guys need?" and before we could say anything he just walked away. i at least was able to eat the few little over-cooked potatoes that came with the sandwich, other than that it was a waste of money. So once again i'd like to point out, I get that the world doesn't revolve around me and that me having an allergy to egg yolk isn't something that restaurants like this care about and need to attempt to help with, however, when you tell me that you are cooking something OVER HARD after you hear that I have an allergy, and you don't cook it that way and spill yolk all over it, it makes me feel like you actually went out of your way in order to punish me for my allergy. well at least the coffee was good.

QeY-2W3OPu5zqBbRNLOfNA.text: I like it here. The set up is kind of narrow, and it is not a big location/space. I have not encountered this place to be busy, it has just the right amount of "people flow" . Artsy feel to it!

7gRS8oJg9t0F_FjnaRA3iw.text: I'm stuck on the banana-bread pudding french toast with whisky caramel and a side of meat.."Pain Perdu!" bit.ly/1IezYOM Does this come as a surprise!? Others with whom I've dined have enjoyed their meals as well - and that BMOC is the BOMB. Love it when one of my favorite restaurants for dinner (Tuck Shop) turns out to be owned by the same folks as one of my favorite breakfast spots. I didn't realize that the owners were the same until my second visit to Vovo and it was then that I caught on. (Now I just have to try their other place, "The Astor House.") Vovomeena is counter-order, delivered to your table kind of breakfast place. The queue has always been at least seven to ten deep, but it moves quickly and the food pops out pretty quickly. The menu is unique, diverse and the portions are pretty reasonable for the price point and uniqueness of the dish. The service has always been chatty and memorable. I like it! The main downfall is that the seating can be somewhat cramped; always prefer the patio but it can easily become too cold or warm. Likewise, the parking lot is certifiably "for maniacs only" - it is very tight. There is limited street parking on Lynwood - residential street south of the parking lot. Speaking of this area and specifically the street just mentioned - part of the historic "Roosevelt District" and it's a niceafter-breakfast idea to take a stroll and to walk off that meal!

1hzE6YE9Ybd1pFIQiVkzzw.text: Really nice cafe for brunch. There's ample seating inside and outside the cafe. However, you have to go up to the counter yourself to order and pay. Everything on the menu looked delicious so it took me a while to pick what I wanted! The price isn't bad and the portion is pretty big. I wasn't able to finish my food haha

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X5xNzUJPd00XqwYwudrP0g.text: A trendy little coffee and brunch spot!  Good coffee in a cute little cafe setting.   Friendly staff. Jeff was super friendly and had a good sense of humor...  Plan on $10-$13 per person for food and $3-5 for your coffee.  The classic breakfast sandwich was really tasty! Good hot coffee Tasty iced coffee too!  Parking is tricky and you will get towed for parking at nearby businesses.

VnTAfTwqqKzFFR5EwSp-Kg.text: This is definitely a cool brunch spot. Very much worth a visit.  Quick and easy. Order at the register, take your number, grab a seat, and they'll bring your food to you.  I got the biscuits and gravy which were AMAZING. The gravy is seriously to die for. I could have their biscuits and gravy everyday! I had left overs and purposely saved it for the following morning just to savor the gravy. Yes. It. Is. Divine.  My cousin got the waffle with sausage and eggs. The waffle was also delicious!! She's also in loooove with their Japenese coffee!  As for the rest of the menu, there wasn't that much more that was screaming out to me. I knew biscuits and gravy was the right option, and it did not disappoint. We'll probably be back..... just for the biscuits and gravy. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. sooooooo goooooood
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits &amp; gravy - HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wRbq8z0QgLCrty-I7P4ydw.text: This is a perfectly fine spot for brunch. The food is good, but I think it's a bit overpriced, and the menu is really limited. I've never been wow-ed by what I've had there, but with every not-so-positive review, I always like to say that I might just not have tried the right thing.  Seriously though, the service and coffee are always good. We'd have to be pretty close for me to tell you I didn't want to eat there.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict for brunch! The poached eggs looked so good I didn&#39;t want to crack them.

wzI-L17baUwn1Z2YJdwd3w.text: I pass Vovoveema all the time; it was one of those brunch places that remained a mystery to me because they specialize in unconventional brunch dishes. For instance, their signature dish is a B.M.O.C. a huge pork chop with a waffle, eggs, and Portuguese donuts on the side! As curious as it sounded, we decided to save the extra pounds and try their Biscuits and Gravy as well as the Pain Perdu instead.  Both were delicious! The gravy tasted home-cooked and had all the components of comfort food. I thought it tasted something of a distant cousin to a chicken pot pie. The Pain Perdu was one of the largest most delicious French toast I've ever had. It was oozing of bananas, and I was surprised I kept eating it bite after bite!  Finally, we also ordered a coffee flight and had a chance to sample three iced coffees sourced locally in Phoenix. They were made using a Japanese cold-brewing method; I'd recommend trying it, because the taste does differ from cold brews, and if you're already at Vovoveema, why not? Come to Vovoveema if you'd like to take your taste buds on a different journey off the traditional brunch path.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced coffee flight!
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain perdu
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy

saPUq-c3tGe88LdyTTBBDQ.text: I came here on Sunday for brunch and I told my friend who was with me that we should go somewhere else so we don't have to wait in line! Turns out going to this restaurant was the best decision I made that day!   The staff was really friendly and I asked several questions about the menu and the waiter was really patient with me!   The cold brew that I ordered was bigger than I expected which is always a plus and I ordered the BMOC which has a good blend of hearty smoked pork and a sweet syrup so you get the best of both worlds!   I definitely can't wait to go back and explore more of the menu!

_NbdaYAaWEDaG1lE2KqXhw.text: Was in the area and decided to give this place a try. Parking was a bit of a pain as there is shared parking with other franchise food joints such as chipotle, Pokie and so forth. There isn't a waiter but a nice gentleman walks around making sure all is well. Basically, walk in, order your food and have a seat. They bring the food to your table which was nice. This is more of a cafe spot but very urban and comfortable feel to it. Very modern with some chic added if that makes any sense. Any-who. Perfect place for brunch date with some girlfriends or partner. Food was tasty as i ordered the Mexican Benedict because this is Sonoran dessert and why not order Mexican right. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict. Yummers!

UXmiGJ6sk3xqXOHpwAlxiw.text: The best breakfast I've had in a while. Everything was tasty, very delicious and great service. My favorite new spot since moving here.

92r-pqbnH4PBsDzwr3k97A.text: Found this place on Yelp. It was okay.  Pros: Decent food but nothing spectacular or memorable. Easy location to find but it's sort of tucked into this little 6 business center. Employees were nice.  Cons: There are no fountain drinks, that means $2.50 for 1 can of coke. It's one of those strange "order at the counter, we bring it to you" places. This leaves a ridiculously long line zig-zagging throughout the entire walkway and eating area of an already cramped dining room. Outdoor seating had only wobbly plastic tables and chairs which led to numerous spills of the coffee.  I won't be going again but if it's your first time and you love coffee, go during the week to avoid the insanely long line and wait time.

R-DRz7m_bmKEC-oQL5H20A.text: I want to like Vovomeena very much. Their food is mostly good, but there are a huge problem for a restaurant of this quality:  they use LIQUID EGG PRODUCT for their scrambled eggs and omelets. This is what McDonald's uses for their scrambled eggs. Liquid egg product has no place in a high quality establishment. They sacrifice quality for speed. The egg product is one example. The other is that their donuts are fried ahead of time and served cold. They have a cold, greasy taste. Where, if they were fried to order, they would be delicious. Vovomeena wants to be a high end establishment, but their process doesn't match up with that goal. Sometimes there are small sacrifices in speed that are so much worth any extra wait.

G0eq3ki3OkJ_HbLiQygP3g.text: Food and atmosphere was very good, Kaj the manager made us feel very welcome and my wife and I will definitely be coming back!

MYB2N_5s83pmf5ZnDkQ0NQ.text: Portions were small and the prices are pretty high for breakfast meals. The quality and taste are pretty good. Finding parking is a pain in the rear. A good place to take your out-of-town guests, but we will not return just for ourselves.

MArA5BOabAzjOc0laxG2Xg.text: Started watching this place when they opened as I am a fan of Tuck Shop.  Went here for the first time in January after I had seen them post their special on FB of their sausage gravy and biscuits.  Served with fried eggs on top, this single dish made me a loyal fan.  It is amazing as is the Japanese cold brew.  Husband ordered the BMOC which was good and kids had the pancakes - SO light and fluffy!!  The barristas at the coffee station were very nice and explained the process of the cold brew.  They took time to give me samples - great service for sure.

TNxHs1zArJjsPhpH2ggLMA.text: The only reason this place received 4 stars instead of 5 is because there are no substitutions. As someone that doesn't prefer to eat meat but loves eggs Benedict I was sad to hear they don't make the meals on site thus can't manipulate them.   But their coffee is amazing and the food is delicious!

T2QCBlOf6ZlCzpZEatmWqg.text: Shared a Mexican Benedict and a banana bread French toast. I was a little disappointed in the French toast. There were whole slices of banana in the bread that were dry in texture. The Benedict was wonderful and had a kick to it. It was served on top of a corn tortilla type muffin and really added to the flavor. The Devore and staff were wonderful. I would definitely go back and try more items off the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain perdu - banana bread French toast
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict

xJMThtCjHXfWWb--9GR2Cg.text: This is a great breakfast spot. Terrific omelettes and scrambles with unique flavor combinations and excellent meats, bacon,sausages etc...  vegetarian options as well, of course. The biscuits are excellent, and the Portuguese donuts are simply sublime.

HRQCqTswaQIm4m-U83XU6g.text: Strange set up but delicious food and great wait staff. Worth your time and money. When you walk in the door, you wait in line against a narrow walk way to be seated. The line goes quick but it's awkward.

w2u1u1XI9xjFuZPGieyKzA.text: I love the blending of savory and sweet things so I decided to order their B.M.O.C. It's an apple maple syrup topped waffle that comes with a  smoked pork chop ,  2 eggs any style (scramble this time since I was eating with my 1 year old) and a bonus Portuguese doughnut. I really liked how they smoked the pork chop, it was juicy almost like a ham, but not nearly as salty which I prefer. Normally I always get sunny side up/over easy since I love the ooey gooeyness of the egg yolk, but their scramble didn't disappoint. It was light and fluffy and not over cooked at all :). The doughnut was a little too sweet and oily for my liking and by the time I got to it I was already pretty full from the rest of the meal. Also one note, the place starts getting busy around 10:30 on Saturdays, we got there at 9:30 this time and no waits at all.

-n7P-VT-gozkrJCe9EGJbA.text: I may never eat Breakfast again, I think I am still full.  This place is owned by the same people who own Tuck Shop- Maybe my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  The place is smallish- but cool.  Tables can be hard to come by, but if 2 people are sitting at a 4 top, ask them nicely, and they will switch to your 2 top.  It is worth the wait, because the food and coffee are awesome.  I had the BMOC, it was perfection on a plate- sweet, smoky, salty, runny, savory.  It was also about 2000 calories, but it was worth every bite!  I also did not eat again for 10 hours.  I ordered just coffee, it was good stuff.  My girlfriend got a Caramel something or other- she really liked it.  I'll be back.

tiVVMTHTaelJbSTWSrxBMw.text: Yelping it up for a breakfast location on vacation and we were led to vovomeena by the reviews.  Wasn't quite sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. We visited on a Saturday morning around 10:30 a.m. And it was not too busy to be served quickly. You order at a counter and then select an open table and your food is brought to you. It's a small menu but with some great choices.  I tried the Mexican Benedict and really liked it. There is a corn tamale like base instead of an English muffin.  My husband got the blackstone scrambler and enjoyed that. He selected a multi grain toast that was amazing.  He also asked about recommended coffee and we tried the flight of cold brewed regular and flavored coffees which was unique and enjoyable.  I love the decor and the baristas were very helpful.   On a side note I really enjoyed my silverware. It was heavy duty and nice to hold.  :) Loved this place and wish we had one near home.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight of cold brewed coffee...

CsArastdiKB1hhz6UNF4fg.text: Love the atmosphere and location, small and cozy and the staff is extremely friendly. Awarded best in Phoenix for a reason! DO RECOMMEND FOR ANYBODY! Prices are excellent and the food quality is high and reminds me of home! Love this definitely coming back as much as I can.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican Benedict
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoying my banging pocket

RxrxdpG-3AtNSh22MuZoLA.text: If its a difficult task for you to figure out the ordering and seating arrangements at this fantastic breakfast spot, I suggest you never travel. A busy morning restaurant or cafes in a large metropolitan city will scramble your hungry brain even more than  a brunch outing at Vovomeena!  My favorite dishes are Mexican Benedict, Pain Perdu, and Wilcox Avenue. All require a large glass of Japanese cold brew, which is the best refreshing coffee drink on a weekend morning! I highly recommend. Skip the usual creamer as the taste is not bitter. Yum!

xzILX1_T17Pv14zvRaUZWg.text: I had a chance to sit down with the owner of this spot today.  I'm hoping that he'll be able to make some very minor modifications on the menu to account for the vegan population of downtown Phoenix.  Otherwise, I do believe that the owner cares about his businesses and the community.  Fingers crossed.   -- ORIGINAL Review:  Since the corner of McDowell and 7th Ave. is what I refer to as the place where chain restaurants go to die, it makes me happy that there's a local breakfast joint attempting to infiltrate the system.  The first time I ate here was a couple of weeks ago, early on a Sunday and it was delicious.  You walk up to the counter to order, get a number and then sit where you like.  It's small, but there's a nice outdoor patio which should be nice for the next couple of weeks.  Their coffee is amazing and they provide dairy alternatives for those of us who do not use cream in our coffee.    The first time I ordered the BMOC:  a waffle with apple/maple syrup, a smoked porkchop and eggs. (and a portuguese donut!)  Wowza.  Breakfast heaven. The second time I attempted to order the 3 Sisters Strata, but they hadn't received some order or something and it wasn't available, so I settled on the savory crepes.  Also delicious.  Their romesco sauce is delish.  HOWEVER - I can only give three stars.  My vegan friends are simply not able to eat here because whomever wrote the menu just doesn't provide easy alternatives and the second time I ate here my friend's pancakes showed up in 5 minutes while my fiance and I continued to wait an additional 30!  The manager was great about it and very professional, but his excuse about how pancakes are made faster than the rest is ridiculous - when there are orders that take longer, you simply make the longest item first and work your way up.    I'll probably be back, but I'm seriously hoping for some vegan alternatives on the menu and better time management.

S65PO6OCTV8dA1iGsaJB7g.text: I came here because of the high reviews and was thoroughly disappointed. I ordered biscuit and gravy and I was very surprised how salty it was-- I tolerate a lot of salt, and it was way beyond acceptable.  I also shared BMT? Which the ham was again unbelievably charred and salty. I looked for potatoes to go down with the rest of the salt and refilled water 4 times.  Waffles were okay, no better than most places I have been to.

sMZL-5VxICJTgmAiAUIZgA.text: Loved this place! Coffee was top notch and the food was quite good.  didn't even mind the lines-signaled to me that we'd enjoy our feast.  Only thing for me personally-I'm allergic to dairy and I had NO choices.  They had to adapt the one item that came close to safe.

Rbs--UJXf5FmVEwxJbvRsA.text: Cute lil coffee house vibe , Im not vegan but i dont eat pork , and the cook everything griddle style. On the plus side they did custom a egg scramble for me but ( on the negative) wouldn't do just egg whites .

gDx0vUJgROZ2XbEmUk8ssg.text: Vovomeena is located on the SE corner of 7th Ave and McDowell in the same center as how you roll sushi.  The place is very small and has a patio with a few tables as well.  The inside is modern and hipsterishly decorated.  You order at the counter and take a number and have a seat.  You can see the two cooks at the counter in the tiny kitchen preparing your food.  What was awkward was the barista is also the server.  So I found myself waiting for my drink while she was running around serving and bussing tables.  This place was packed so there is no reason they can't hire someone else to serve and bus tables.  Unless that person called out this is something that should be addressed.  I ordered the Mexican Benedict.  My dish was a pair of sopes with chorizo and poached eggs on top with hollandaise.  Along with country potatoes on the side.  The sope tasted store bought, the chorizo was okay but a bit greasy.  It also didn't taste homemade.  The eggs were both overcooked.  Poached eggs are by definition runny.  These egg yokes were rock solid.  The potatoes tasted good but were cold and needed lots of hot sauce.  My wife ordered the tortilla espanola with a green salad.  I literally had to laugh because the green salad was just plain arugula tossed with a vinagerette dressing.  The Spanish omelet was basically a slice of a fritatta that consisted of egg and potatos on top of a red salsa.  It was all very plain and simple but not in a way that showcased the ingredients.  The highlight of both our meals was definitely the bacon.  It was nicely smoked and tasted delicious.  If I had to guess it was bought from Schreiners  The meal was about 25 bucks with a tip.  I personally won't recommend this place and wouldn't drive across town to try it again.  I feel confident after the two meals I've tried there is not much else more to offer.  Very hip, very trendy, tad over priced, and poorly executed on several levels.  I will give them the benefit of the doubt and three stars but I would strongly suggest you temper your expectations.

iSzc4adF5kPWLMi9Vr0eIg.text: Amazing food and everyone was so nice that I created a Yelp account to write about how helpful everyone was.  I can't wait to come back.

5NSfSNneu4vpoj31y_v9oQ.text: It's been a while since my visit here but it still stands out as a sweet brunch spot. Walk up and order kind of place. There was a long line but it went quickly. My group had the bangers and mash, biscuits and gravy, omelette, and French toast. For whatever reason the toast came out cold and the staff was happy to fix it for us. He even comped it. Really good gesture. They featured coffee from somewhere in phoenix locally but I don't remember the name. Anyhow, I'm definitely hoping to try this place again.

NSMUFjgMPVmqiOH4TGl8sg.text: We finally checked out Vovomeena after multiple recommendations. Their brunch did not disappoint! The day we went they had the Chicken and Waffles special which was unreal. If you ever go and you see this special, you have to get it!

iWYx4l_tzwH2O5VwLxDIKQ.text: Great food, great coffee, great service. Had the Mexican Benedict. Highly recommended! Love this place.

nw0lUJ5fPiuR_oIHLHMawg.text: Well worth the wait!!! This place has the best breakfast around amazing coffee and great customer service. My friends and I were out for spring training baseball and came across this place. This will now be a must for future spring training trips. Thank you for the wonderful breakfast. See you again

_tDnrOFBTRxTNSNaOyeW3Q.text: I found breakfast here a mixed bag. My friend had an egg sandwich, which was really tasty, but I had the Mexican Benedict, which was pretty disappointing. The poached eggs had runny whites, the chorizo was a bit too spicy for a breakfast meal, and the hollandaise sauce was flavourless.  Having said that: it's a funky building, the coffee was good, and the staff were friendly.  I'm going to assume the Benedict just sucks.

4dSjzno8gwEEFdotT3LsOg.text: It's a pretty cool shop to come have breakfast, lunch and coffee. It's a bummer that they close so early though I would definitely like to come here later in the evenings or at night but the menu seems more fitted to the hours they have open. The atmosphere is chill though, you could bring a group of friends on relax.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee is bomb
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mexican benidict

Ck2WcUrwfPn54RDSWlqI6Q.text: I swing through Phoenix every few months and I've made it a priority to stop by here for breakfast whenever I can. I've never had a bad meal here and at this point I've tried a bunch of different things -- the Pain Perdue, the Johnnycakes, the Biscuits and Gravy -- and it's all phenomenal, with unique and tasty cold brew options that you just can't get anywhere else, like orange peel and ginger or peanut butter cup. And  it's adorable and the people here are always so sweet -- this is a really special place that's 100% worth checking out if you're in the area.

ohanINgAsvRv4isCt5lRyA.text: Uber'd my way here from a downtown hotel. Here for work and decided to spend my morning off at this joint. No wait and lots of seating on a weekday (around 10ish). Ordered the first scramble on the menu that includes fried pork shoulder. YUM. Strips of pork shoulder with red and green bell peppers, onions, etc. served with side of tortillas. Was originally going to get a cup of their special Mexican coffee but I saw they had tropical juices and decided on the blackberry tea. All in all delicious food, laid back and friendly atmosphere.

5kO2w-vWH-7N_JX3irhlBw.text: Me and my alleged better half met some of her friends here for brunch.  I was skeptical walking in as it looked like a very basic coffee shop but I guess I should never get tired of being wrong.  I had a scramble with pork shoulder and it was delicious.  The lady had an omelette that was tasty.  And how can I turn down a donut in any form?  I had the Portuguese donut which was like a beignet and just as awesome.  The staff was really friendly.  However, just be careful if you come during a busy hour, table space is limited.  And don't be that guy who comes in and plops down at a table before ordering.  They have rules about that.

_xQRxyBh68vqxR5BiRiCLQ.text: Great neighborhood joint for breakfast and coffee. Fluffy pancakes, delicious coffee, and fast friendly service! Highly recommended!

di08Pt1Gg3Ru_uguybB7rw.text: A little busy in the morning at all times, but once you taste they're unique twist on food it makes the wait seem like nothing. Definitely recommended especially when out on girls day or w/ friends!

zMbgOQF_fFOPXZsEPi9oLw.text: Great little breakfast place in Arizona, checked it out when i was there for the Cubs Spring Training.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My first ever yelp food picture

XMyk9quEi0EYig9-DwvttA.text: It's good but some options are either too bland or overly sweet - it just didn't do it for my taste buds

rIMQpalGS0UYet8W6_fBFg.text: I went here on a Sunday and it was super busy. There was a line out the door, but they were pretty quick.  The waiter and waitresses provided excellent service and they had a friendly staff. I like the fact that you can watch the chefs cook as we waited in line to make our order at the register.  This place is super cute and cozy with a laid back atmosphere. The food was freshly made and came out on a timely manner. I ordered the tortilla espanol with sausage, and it was fantastic. My boyfriend ordered the toast with strawberries, which was nice because it wasn't too sweet. Would definitely recommend if you're in this area!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast is served ! Yummy

QOXvePzLhixdHoT5Vp-9eA.text: Vovomeena is an incredible find in Phoenix!  From the decor, to the service, the amazing food options and delicious coffee, I always try to stop here when I am in the area.   After visiting a number of times, i have only tried two dishes because they are so very delicious!  The Tortilla Espinola & Mexican Benedict are both amazing....cooked to perfection and so flavorful.  And, their coffee is the BEST!  This is a must-try....it will not disappoint!

sw4XCzyrm9hsEfKBaqaeow.text: First, and most importantly, the food is fantastic. Biscuits and gravy is everything people raved about on other Yelp reviews. The flavor is great with just a hint of heat. We also tried the Wilcox plate: bacon, house potatoes, plain biscuits, and absolutely perfect eggs. Everything was prepared beautifully and served hot.   The staff was friendly and despite the fact it does look like a less than ideal location from outside, it's a great place once you're through the doors.   I visited with a friend and I'd recommend this location mostly for parties of 2, 4 at the most. There are only a few larger spaces available.   Side note: The first time we tried to eat here it was around 11 on a Saturday and the lines were crazy, both the line to order and the line that you then wait in for your table. We were there with three kids and it was immediately obvious that it would be a long wait before one of the handful of larger tables was available. We decided to leave because it clearly wasn't a great time for a family visit. (At which point we drove over to Luci's at The Orchard and it was a perfect day to sit outside and enjoy their patio along with our kids.)

UCIvSxYS9VFC5_WjLXNZbQ.text: Nice atmosphere and pleasant service. Had the biscuits and gravy and Mexican Benedict's. Both were tasty. Enjoyed a latte as well. Will be back.

mqjiaAL-RdVJVgak3vG7hA.text: Vovomeena is a dependable brunch spot in Phoenix with cute outdoor seating and a quick wait time. The biscuits and gravy was everything I wanted and more, with thick, creamy gravy, well-done eggs, and soft, layered biscuits. The savory crepe was nothing exceptional, but the pain perdu (banana bread pudding french toast) was delicious and nothing like any french toast I had every tried before. It came with sausage, rounding out the dish and adding a savory component. I will continue to come back here for the cold-brew coffee and to try their other dishes, particularly the BMOC and the Mexican Benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pain perdu
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy

1qWaQVrQTke3xOh7bXpOSw.text: First impressions were good! Excellent esthetics of the place.. Good vibes good music.. Costumer service was not the best. I'm sure they were just busy, but I felt little to no acknowledgment that I was there or a paying customer.   FOOD IS ON POINT.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yep. This is it

ZV7nK80T5eguhPv3Hmds_A.text: My fiance found this place for me. He knows I love to try new places to satisfy my food cravings. My friend from out of state came to visit and I decided to bring her here with me for my first time experience, since she's into coffee & food in general too!  We ordered the Mexican Benedict, B.M.O.C., a flight of coffee, and iced coffee. The food was everything that I expected it to be. The chorizo was very tasty, but wasn't right for my taste buds at that time. It was my first time have poached eggs and I loved it. The bmoc was great, the taste was just mouth watering.   We didn't realize we ordered so much coffee. The flight, iced coffee and iced latte! We definitely left with a coffee high.   This place was delightful. I will bring my fiance for brunch soon. Even though it's kind of pricey, the coffee is what I would come back for!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bmoc, Mexican Benedict, flight of coffee, iced latte and iced coffee!

NEkGQ8yqJGmPJXXT5smHYQ.text: Amazing place we first saw on Check Please.  Went here with my wife for a surprise pre-Valentine Day brunch.  We got a jug of the Morning Moonshine which gave us enough to take home and get a few more servings out of it.  If you like coffee, you must get.  My wife had the 3 Sisters omelet which she totally loved.  I had the Pain Perdu, which...I'm not even sure if I can describe right.  If you don't like sweet things, avoid.  But me, I'm all about it.  But it's literally Banana Bread Pudding as the bread for the French toast (I thought it'd just be a flavoring :) )  And we got the Portugese donuts because of course we did.  Highly recommend!

iGScxo4oSdLbjWTwyd1T5A.text: Found this spot looking breakfast on yelp. I am a coffee lover so the flight of coffee was appealing to me. Unfortunately they were out of infused coffee now that they are supplying a coffee shop. I did try their Japanese cold brewed and immediately fell in love. I tried the tortilla espanola and my friend got the breakfast pocket. Both were terrific especially the tortilla espanola! Highly recommended and definitely try the coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cold Brewed coffee is made in these
Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla espanola sooooo good

ZueJaLQi_S92JUD3QnulMw.text: Yummy biscuits and gravy at a reasonable price. Clean and cozy atmosphere and super friendly staff.

-RfPABhgXjwQWPRiM3nGsg.text: Meh.  Wanted to love this place but even with the cutester name Vovomeena is clearly not in the same foodie league as the far superior Matt's Big Breakfast.   Visited on a Sunday with my 15 year old daughter - located in a strip shopping complex downtown off McDowell. You enter from the back parking lot pavement. Cute inside but honestly nothing that special in terms of decor or ambiance. Unique? Not really.   Daughter ordered the "Pain Perdu" Banana Bread Pudding French Toast and I ordered the Tortilla Espanola.   The menu selection honestly left both of us in the dust - looks like the owners are trying way too hard to come up with foodie names and odd mixtures of flavors that make it feel quite limited.  The French Toast arrived and my daughter hated it - she described it as a wet, gloppy, overly sugary soggy mess and said it also tasted like there was meat inside the French Toast (yuck).   After a few bites she sent it back (happily accepted by the friendly staff btw) and got a plain waffle instead (she rated it as fair). She said the bacon was OK but nowhere near as good as Matt's BB. Oh well.   My Tortilla Espnola was decent - probably more potato than egg, a little dry - I've had better. I asked for a little olive oil to serve on top to moisten it a bit - server responded and said the kitchen didn't have olive oil, but "would I like some vegetable oil instead?"  A supposedly foodie place that doesn't have olive oil - anywhere? Good grief.   Ignore all the raves at this VERY mediocre spot. This is not and will not be the hot new spot downtown - not even close. LUX does a far better breakfast, so does Coronado Cafe or the reigning champ... Matt's Big Breakfast.   Work on the food and food choices here folks - you guys are trying way too hard.   Good food means simple pleasures prepared and served well. Won't be back.

8N59tTY7i62a3oU_wYPhmQ.text: Fantastic brunch.  It was busy but got a table in 5 min.  My waffle with pork chop was amazing, and my sons biscuit and gravy was the best he has ever tasted.

1b1V77xXuO5D3wAbbOtOSQ.text: Best breakfast I've had in a long time! We went on a Sunday morning around 11 am. You stand in line, order, then are seated by staff. The line went fast and food came pretty quick too, considering our mouths were watering just from seeing what others seated around us had ordered. I ordered the Wilcox Avenue which came with 2 eggs cooked to order (I got over medium and they were perfect), breakfast potatoes (well seasoned chunks and perfectly cooked with nice crispy bits), choice of toast or biscuit (GET THE BISCUIT!!!! SERIOUSLY!!! ), and choice of breakfast meat (I got bacon and it was thick cut and nicely cooked, not too crispy and not too flimsy). The biscuit was buttery, flakey, just melts in your mouth. Also comes with side of FRESH strawberry jam. I added a side of the homemade gravy to dip my biscuit in, which has nice chunks of shreiners sausage. Well seasoned. Creamy. So good. To say it was delicious is a huge understatement. My husband got the Blackstone scramble which came with sliced pork shoulder (think nicely smoked really good thick ham pieces), 2 eggs scrambled with onion, garlic, tomato and peppers. This was served with a delicious homemade mouth watering tortilla to wrap it all up in, breakfast burrito style if you desire. My 12 year old daughter got the 12 and under kids choice called the Primrose Hill with choice 3 items: pancake or waffle (she got the waffle which tasted so slightly sweet yummy vanilla malted butter-so so good), eggs, and bacon or sausage. She couldn't even finish half of the waffle it was so thick! We opted for waters which was self service by the coffee area which was also interesting. I would definitely return just for the biscuit and gravy. It was all so filling. I didn't get any pictures because we ate it so fast!

kP8ah0hkQ3-p2U3oBivXaw.text: We walked up to the patio not sure what we were supposed to do, but they had a guy watching out for such visitors and he came over to show us how the restaurant is set up.  So you order at the counter, take a number and they bring the food out to you - kind of like Panera or Paradise Bakery.  We tried the orchard french toast and biscuits and gravy.  Both were solid solid dishes!  At about $10 each, I think the french toast could have used another slice though.  The lemon bar was also very good, though my friend thought it was a bit too tart.  I enjoyed it though, seems like they included pulp which I liked.  The coffee was also delicious - hot not iced.  Yes, I am a fan, though it lost 1 star for portion size.

nuZdz7vuT49TBFNVxPu75Q.text: Went there for a brunch date yesterday. Service was  fast despite the long lines. I had the Johnnycakes and a chai latte. The johnnycakes were good. I found the syrup to be too sweet for me and the bacon was meh... I never say that about bacon, like ever.   My date had the Mexican Benedict and he enjoyed it.

Ho5o5VZdRl_gWSexE1UDLg.text: I had heard that this was a great breakfast spot and it did not disappoint. We went on a Friday morning and it wasn't busy at all and was easy to get a nice table outside for our entire group. You order at the counter and they then deliver your food to you. I had the biscuits and gravy and they were delicious. The biscuits were not my favorite, but they were good, and the gravy was wonderful! I also tried their Japanese Cold Brewed coffee which was very different, but really good. I will definitely be going back!

3piNhwKAqYqUgJGlWVV1Lg.text: Every single dish is perfect.  Our only problem is deciding which ones to get this time.  Enough said.

8W1ETBavmmslMbfAJ1SntA.text: Updated review, I went back per manager request for second try, food much much better, had a grand experience. Not a fan of of the order at the counter and still not a fan of the prepackaged orange juice in plastic cups and odd coffee flight in plastic jugs. Nonetheless the food and drink was spot on.  Great place, almost 5 stars, I'll start with cons then pros:  Cons: Order at bar, my personal preference this takes away ambiance. It causes you to rush your order, keeps you from ordering more, awkward if you are a visitor from Out of town. You can see into the kitchen which could be cool but this kitchen is not the prettiest, looks messy. The place is awkwardly run, folks running around all over, coffee bar has plastic jugs of brewed coffee, be cooler if the coffee was in glass dispensers or something classier. Dirty tables, I wouldn't care so much but if you are required to self seat you have to navigate them Coffee bar is messy, ugly glass fridge showing off messy storage Going back to kitchen which is in clear view, messy messy, bizarre, empty boxes, crap all over floor, food supplies etc. OJ is prepared and stored in plastic cups, I personally would Prefer to get my OJ in a glass. Food although good, seemed a bit messy when served, I saw into the kitchen as mentioned above and the chefs were sloppily throwing food onto a plate. I may be the exception but it was nothing like the Yelp pics. I had to carry a large coffee flight, my OJ, a number, my wallet, phone all around searching for a table  Pros: Food tasted good, I had the pork chop on a waffle, it was soaked to death in a syrup, I've been on a low carb diet so it was heaven but had I not I think it should be a tad drier. The chop was basically a ham steak, it was a bit acrid, over cooked on grill and sugars burnt. Coffee flight was good, unique flavor a Easy parking  Overall, a bit satisfied but more so disappointed, been trying to get here for years. I'm a very frequent patron of Tuck Shop, I believe they own or partnered with this place.  I'll return although with lower expectations.

5S6PAUr1wiSdA8-ZDSpkPw.text: I got the Mexican Benedict and ordered the eggs over medium. Lets just say my babe and I fought over the last bite and to her quote she did not remember her meal. Which she did not finish and my plate was clean! THANK YOU! And we will be back!

F5crDRKbYyUY9g9GQMUm1Q.text: This is closer to a 3.5 review but I can't quite nudge it up to a 4.  First off, the food is really good.  We had a Benedict and Johnny Cakes.  Both were tasty,a s was the coffee.  The menu was diverse and interesting and the food arrived quickly.  We were lucky enough to share a table  with some friendly people .  The place was packed, with people walking back and forth looking for seating.   Now for the stuff that needs improvement:  I am not a fan of the stand-in,-line, serve-yourself format in small spaces.  The coffee stand is awkwardly placed and, combined with the lack of seating, makes for a lot of unnecessary congestion.  I get the need to turn tables quickly but would like to be able to linger over a cup of coffee, especially at these prices.  I wish you well , Vovomeena, and know that you have a lot of fans.  I may try you again on a weekday but you're a little too claustrophobic and hectic for me on the weekends..

ZUXvOicEXApHl2UPv7g3Cw.text: I have been talking about trying this place for nearly two years. I am so happy to report that my personal hype was well rewarded!    I ordered the BMOC.. Oh.. My.. Goodness.. Yumm! I'm not a huge pork chop fan, but this one was cooked to perfection. The mixtures of the sweet and savory fulfilled all of my breakfast cravings. The sweet waffle, apple-maple syrup, and Portuguese doughnut paired perfectly with my poached eggs and pork chop.   The portion for the price was incredible. I definitely could not finish my meal, and I like to eat.   I also had the Japanese cold brewed coffee which was refreshing on a warm Phoenix morning.  I was surprised how strong the coffee was. Next time I will try the flight of flavors.   I will be back!!

EqskJeghkPnPSNK8kSsSQQ.text: I'm always amazed by the uniqueness of Phoenix and the restaurants that are hidden in little corners, just like Vovomeena. I love the mismatched chairs, the simple order at the counter set up and the various cold pour coffees they offer.      I went for a morning brunch with a group of friends on the past rainy Saturday morning. I was torn between every single thing on the menu because it all looked amazing, but wound up getting the 3 Sisters Omelette. I grabbed an O.J. from the little deli case (tasted fresh squeezed!) and a hot coffee. When I went over to the coffee counter and realized they do in house infused coffees I couldn't resist. I got the ginger infused coffee and my friend got the mint one..I was on cloud nine--and not just from all the caffeine!       We sat outside and got sprinkled on but it was perfect all around. Our food came quickly and my omelette was sensational. With black beans, corn, zucchini, mozzarella, feta and two sausages on the side it was a filling meal, but not over the top. The blend of zucchini and black beans with mozz were delicious, I couldn't get over how amazing one of my friends' Pain Perdu looked though. Whiskey caramel sauce? I mean c'mon. That's my next victim for sure.     The staff was friendly, but busy, and the decor is homey and old school vintage. You'll want to sit and relax for awhile while you people watch and sip your delicious drinks!

3_Nl8AOV3-G9C2k4KKnzMw.text: Delicious! Our first time, on our way to Veteran's parade! Gave us 1/2 off our total bill for my husband's service! Will fill in details later! Very impressed!

photos.caption: Photo of Vovomeena - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6W8VFDQFyIJGYMhlDsg5xQ.text: If you go to Vovomeena, go for the coffee. They have an amazing cold drip system that produces a wonderful iced coffee, and you can tell that the owners take a lot of pride in it. The food is interesting, but ask questions about what you're ordering. The menu descriptions are brief and you may be surprised at what you are actually served.

d054UISMBEwTmuX5qI_PuA.text: The tortilla espanola is the most delicious dish I have had! The arugula salad pairs perfectly with this Spanish quiche- like creation. The Johnny cakes and the sweet rice are phenomenal. The manager was very accommodating on busy Sunday morning, while the line is out the door! Everything here is on another level; the aesthetics, the Japanese cold-brew, and the open kitchen. I am proud have this local spot in our community.

9bw5VmXpujNCcC6lWmliGw.text: Normally this is a 5-star joint. I've had 5-6 wonderful and delicious meals here. But today was different. Today I ordered the sausage... I do not like their sausage. I'm told they get it from Schreiners, who are sausage kings around here. Others may like it. To me it was overpowering and textually displeasing.   I will return (and I'll order the bacon). The other meals I've had have been amazing. The staff is friendly. There is outdoor seating as well.

PZ4HWwEPpUDbVvDUCzQ32A.text: This is definitely a go-to when in Phx! The ambiance is great, I love the coffee bar they have. They have food for those that like to try new things and for those who just want good simple breakfast! The place is clean, refreshing, and the staff is friendly.
